entry.title: GRIP: Algorithm-Agnostic Machine Unlearning for Mixture-of-Experts via Geometric Router Constraints

author.name: Andy Zhu, Rongzhe Wei, Yupu Gu, Pan Li

entry.summary: Introduces GRIP, a geometric constraint framework for machine unlearning in Mixture-of-Experts that prevents routers from simply redirecting queries away from knowledgeable experts rather than erasing knowledge.

entry.title: Finite-Time Analysis of Gradient Descent for Shallow Transformers

author.name: Enes Arda, Semih Cayci, Atilla Eryilmaz

entry.summary: Provides finite-time analysis of gradient descent for shallow transformers in kernel regime, showing width scales logarithmically with samples and optimization error is independent of sequence length.

entry.title: White-Box Sensitivity Auditing with Steering Vectors

author.name: Hannah Cyberey, Yangfeng Ji, David Evans

entry.summary: Proposes white-box sensitivity auditing for LLMs using activation steering to test model internals for socially relevant properties like gender bias, addressing limitations of black-box input-output testing.

entry.title: SafeThinker: Reasoning about Risk to Deepen Safety Beyond Shallow Alignment

author.name: Xianya Fang, Xianying Luo, Yadong Wang, Xiang Chen, Yu Tian, Zequn Sun, Rui Liu, Jun Fang, Naiqiang Tan, Yuanning Cui, Sheng-Jun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes SafeThinker, an adaptive safety framework with gateway classifier routing inputs through different defensive mechanisms based on risk assessment, including twin expert module for deceptive attacks.

entry.title: LUMINA: Long-horizon Understanding for Multi-turn Interactive Agents

author.name: Amin Rakhsha, Thomas Hehn, Pietro Mazzaglia, Fabio Valerio Massoli, Arash Behboodi, Tribhuvanesh Orekondy

entry.summary: Introduces LUMINA, an oracle counterfactual framework with procedurally generated game tasks to measure criticality of specific capabilities (planning, state tracking, context processing) for multi-turn agent success by testing performance with oracle assistance.

entry.title: The Art of Being Difficult: Combining Human and AI Strengths to Find Adversarial Instances for Heuristics

author.name: Henri Nikoleit, Ankit Anand, Anurag Murty Naredla, Heiko R\"oglin

entry.summary: Demonstrates human-LLM collaboration using FunSearch to derive state-of-the-art lower bounds for heuristics on bin packing, k-median clustering, and knapsack - problems without improvement for over a decade.

entry.title: Critique of machine unlearning

author.name: myyycroft

entry.summary: Argues machine unlearning cannot remove dangerous capabilities because capabilities are dual-use, and strong compositional generalization fundamentally constrains what's achievable.

entry.title: PyHealth 2.0: A Comprehensive Open-Source Toolkit for Accessible and Reproducible Clinical Deep Learning

author.name: John Wu, Yongda Fan, Zhenbang Wu, Paul Landes, Eric Schrock, Sayeed Sajjad Razin, Arjun Chatterjee, Naveen Baskaran, Joshua Steier, Andrea Fitzpatrick, Bilal Arif, Rian Atri, Jathurshan Pradeepkumar, Siddhartha Laghuvarapu, Junyi Gao, Adam R. Cross, and Jimeng Sun

entry.summary: Introduces PyHealth 2.0, a comprehensive clinical deep learning toolkit unifying 15+ datasets, 20+ tasks, 25+ models with uncertainty quantification and conformal prediction in a single framework supporting diverse clinical data modalities.

entry.title: LOGICAL-COMMONSENSEQA: A Benchmark for Logical Commonsense Reasoning

author.name: Obed Junias and Maria Leonor Pacheco

entry.summary: Introduces LOGICAL-COMMONSENSEQA benchmark reframing commonsense reasoning as logical composition over statement pairs using AND/OR/NEITHER operators. Finds models struggle significantly with negation.

entry.title: Trapped in the past? Disentangling fluid and crystallized intelligence of large language models using chess

author.name: Leonard S. Pleiss, Maximilian Schiffer, Robert K. von Weizs\"acker

entry.summary: Uses chess as a controlled testbed to disentangle crystallized (recall) and fluid (reasoning) intelligence in LLMs by creating positions varying in training corpus proximity, revealing performance collapses to random in out-of-distribution tasks.

entry.title: Auto-Regressive Masked Diffusion Models

author.name: Mahdi Karami, Ali Ghodsi

entry.summary: Introduces Auto-Regressive Masked Diffusion (ARMD) that reframes masked diffusion as block-wise causal model, enabling efficient training with parallel generation capabilities in a single forward pass.

entry.title: Graph-Anchored Knowledge Indexing for Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Zhenghao Liu, Mingyan Wu, Xinze Li, Yukun Yan, Shuo Wang, Cheng Yang, Minghe Yu, Zheni Zeng, Maosong Sun

entry.summary: Proposes GraphAnchor for RAG that uses dynamic graph structures as evolving knowledge indices during iterative retrieval, anchoring entities and relations to guide knowledge sufficiency evaluation.

entry.title: TangramPuzzle: Evaluating Multimodal Large Language Models with Compositional Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Daixian Liu, Jiayi Kuang, Yinghui Li, Yangning Li, Di Yin, Haoyu Cao, Xing Sun, Ying Shen, Hai-Tao Zheng, Liang Lin, Philip S. Yu

entry.summary: Introduces TangramPuzzle benchmark for evaluating MLLM compositional spatial reasoning using Tangram game with rigorous geometric grounding through Tangram Construction Expression (TCE) symbolic framework.

entry.title: Will It Survive? Deciphering the Fate of AI-Generated Code in Open Source

author.name: Musfiqur Rahman, Emad Shihab

entry.summary: Survival analysis of 200,000+ code units across 201 open-source projects reveals AI-generated code survives significantly longer than human code (15.8% lower modification rate), contradicting the 'disposable code' hypothesis.

entry.title: VisGym: Diverse, Customizable, Scalable Environments for Multimodal Agents

author.name: Zirui Wang, Junyi Zhang, Jiaxin Ge, Long Lian, Letian Fu, Lisa Dunlap, Ken Goldberg, XuDong Wang, Ion Stoica, David M. Chan, Sewon Min, Joseph E. Gonzalez

entry.summary: Introduces VisGym with 17 environments for evaluating VLMs on multi-step visual interactions. Finds frontier models achieve only 46.6% (easy) and 26.0% (hard) success rates, revealing perception, memory, and action limitations.

entry.title: M3Kang: Evaluating Multilingual Multimodal Mathematical Reasoning in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Aleix Torres-Camps, Nathaniel Mitrani Hadida, V\'ictor Conchello Vendrell, \`Alex Batlle Casellas, Arnau Padr\'es Masdemont, Jordi Ros-Giralt

entry.summary: M3Kang provides 1,747 multilingual multimodal math problems from Kangaroo Math Competition in 108 languages, enabling large-scale evaluation of VLM mathematical reasoning across cultures.

entry.title: SoundBreak: A Systematic Study of Audio-Only Adversarial Attacks on Trimodal Models

author.name: Aafiya Hussain, Gaurav Srivastava, Alvi Ishmam, Zaber Hakim, Chris Thomas

entry.summary: SoundBreak systematically studies audio-only adversarial attacks on trimodal (audio-video-language) models, achieving up to 96% attack success rate across six attack objectives targeting different processing stages.

entry.title: GameTalk: Training LLMs for Strategic Conversation

author.name: Victor Conchello Vendrell, Max Ruiz Luyten, Mihaela van der Schaar

entry.summary: GameTalk trains LLMs for strategic multi-turn conversations by adapting GRPO, DPO, and STaR to optimize global objectives across full interactions rather than single turns.

entry.title: Generating Literature-Driven Scientific Theories at Scale

author.name: Peter Jansen, Peter Clark, Doug Downey, Daniel S. Weld

entry.summary: Generates scientific theories (qualitative and quantitative laws) from 13.7k papers to produce 2.9k theories, comparing literature-grounded vs parametric generation and accuracy vs novelty objectives.

entry.title: DSGym: A Holistic Framework for Evaluating and Training Data Science Agents

author.name: Fan Nie, Junlin Wang, Harper Hua, Federico Bianchi, Yongchan Kwon, Zhenting Qi, Owen Queen, Shang Zhu, James Zou

entry.summary: DSGym provides standardized framework for evaluating data science agents, revealing that substantial portions of existing benchmark tasks are solvable without using the actual data.

entry.title: NOIR: Privacy-Preserving Generation of Code with Open-Source LLMs

author.name: Khoa Nguyen, Khiem Ton, NhatHai Phan, Issa Khalil, Khang Tran, Cristian Borcea, Ruoming Jin, Abdallah Khreishah, My T. Thai

entry.summary: NOIR enables privacy-preserving code generation where client encodes prompts and decodes LLM outputs locally, achieving indistinguishability guarantees for protecting intellectual property.

entry.title: Cite-While-You-Generate: Training-Free Evidence Attribution for Multimodal Clinical Summarization

author.name: Qianqi Yan, Huy Nguyen, Sumana Srivatsa, Hari Bandi, Xin Eric Wang, Krishnaram Kenthapadi

entry.summary: Proposes a training-free framework for clinical summarization that uses decoder attentions to cite supporting evidence during generation, with strategies for multimodal attribution including raw images and caption-as-span modes.

entry.title: LLM is Not All You Need: A Systematic Evaluation of ML vs. Foundation Models for text and image based Medical Classification

author.name: Meet Raval, Tejul Pandit, Dhvani Upadhyay

entry.summary: Systematic comparison of traditional ML vs LLMs/VLMs for medical classification, finding traditional ML (LR, LightGBM, ResNet) often achieves best overall performance across four datasets.

entry.title: EMemBench: Interactive Benchmarking of Episodic Memory for VLM Agents

author.name: Xinze Li, Ziyue Zhu, Siyuan Liu, Yubo Ma, Yuhang Zang, Yixin Cao, Aixin Sun

entry.summary: Introduces EMemBench, a programmatic benchmark for evaluating long-term episodic memory of VLM agents through interactive games, generating questions from agent trajectories covering recall, induction, temporal, and spatial reasoning.

entry.title: Provably Learning Attention with Queries

author.name: Satwik Bhattamishra, Kulin Shah, Michael Hahn, Varun Kanade

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis showing single-head attention can be learned exactly with O(d²) queries via black-box access. Extends to full Transformers when FFN learning algorithms exist.

entry.title: Jacobian Scopes: token-level causal attributions in LLMs

author.name: Toni J.B. Liu, Baran Zadeo\u{g}lu, Nicolas Boull\'e, Rapha\"el Sarfati, Christopher J. Earls

entry.summary: Introduces Jacobian Scopes, gradient-based token-level causal attribution methods for LLM interpretability with three variants (Semantic, Fisher, Temperature) targeting different aspects of prediction sensitivity.

entry.title: Order from Chaos: Physical World Understanding from Glitchy Gameplay Videos

author.name: Meng Cao, Haoran Tang, Haoze Zhao, Mingfei Han, Ruyang Liu, Qiang Sun, Xiaojun Chang, Ian Reid, Xiaodan Liang

entry.summary: Proposes using glitches in gameplay videos as supervision source for physical world understanding, introducing PhysGameBench benchmark with over 140k instances across 8 simulation games.

entry.title: CORD: Bridging the Audio-Text Reasoning Gap via Weighted On-policy Cross-modal Distillation

author.name: Jing Hu, Danxiang Zhu, Xianlong Luo, Dan Zhang, Shuwei He, Yishu Lei, Haitao Zheng, Shikun Feng, Jingzhou He, Yu Sun, Hua Wu, Haifeng Wang

entry.summary: Proposes CORD for Audio LLMs using online cross-modal self-distillation to align audio-conditioned reasoning with text-conditioned reasoning through multi-granularity token and sequence-level alignment.

entry.title: Do LLM hallucination detectors suffer from low-resource effect?

author.name: Debtanu Datta, Mohan Kishore Chilukuri, Yash Kumar, Saptarshi Ghosh, Muhammad Bilal Zafar

entry.summary: Studies whether hallucination detectors suffer from low-resource language effects, finding that while task accuracy drops in low-resource languages, detectors remain effective at catching hallucinations, suggesting decoupled failure modes.

entry.title: LLM-Based Adversarial Persuasion Attacks on Fact-Checking Systems

author.name: Jo\~ao A. Leite, Olesya Razuvayevskaya, Kalina Bontcheva, Carolina Scarton

entry.summary: Introduces persuasive adversarial attacks on automated fact-checking systems using LLMs to rephrase claims with 15 persuasion techniques. Shows substantial degradation in verification and retrieval performance.

entry.title: Clarify or Answer: Reinforcement Learning for Agentic VQA with Context Under-specification

author.name: Zongwan Cao, Bingbing Wen, Lucy Lu Wang

entry.summary: Introduces CoA (Clarify-or-Answer), an agent for VQA that determines when clarification is needed for under-specified questions, with GRPO-CR reinforcement learning approach. Creates CONTEXTCLARIFY benchmark for ambiguous VQA.

entry.title: How Does Personalized Memory Shape LLM Behavior? Benchmarking Rational Preference Utilization in Personalized Assistants

author.name: Xueyang Feng, Weinan Gan, Xu Chen, Quanyu Dai, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Introduces RPEval, a benchmark to evaluate how LLMs use personalized memory, revealing widespread irrational personalization where irrelevant memories interfere with intent understanding. Proposes RP-Reasoner to treat memory utilization as pragmatic reasoning.

entry.title: Data Poisoning Vulnerabilities Across Healthcare AI Architectures: A Security Threat Analysis

author.name: Farhad Abtahi, Fernando Seoane, Iv\'an Pau, Mario Vega-Barbas

entry.summary: Analyzes data poisoning vulnerabilities across healthcare AI architectures (CNNs, LLMs, RL) showing attackers can compromise systems with only 100-500 samples, achieving >60% success rates with 6-12 month detection lag.

entry.title: Latent Causal Diffusions for Single-Cell Perturbation Modeling

author.name: Lars Lorch, Jiaqi Zhang, Charlotte Bunne, Andreas Krause, Bernhard Sch\"olkopf, Caroline Uhler

entry.summary: Latent Causal Diffusion (LCD) models single-cell gene expression as a stationary diffusion process, outperforming baselines for predicting distributional shifts from perturbation combinations while learning mechanistic structure.

entry.title: When Agents Fail to Act: A Diagnostic Framework for Tool Invocation Reliability in Multi-Agent LLM Systems

author.name: Donghao Huang, Gauri Malwe, Zhaoxia Wang

entry.summary: Introduces 12-category error taxonomy for tool invocation failures in multi-agent LLM systems, systematically evaluating GPT-4, Claude, Qwen across 1,980 test instances.

entry.title: Cognitively-Inspired Tokens Overcome Egocentric Bias in Multimodal Models

author.name: Bridget Leonard, Scott O. Murray

entry.summary: Introduces perspective tokens inspired by human spatial cognition to address egocentric bias in multimodal language models for visual perspective-taking tasks. Rotation-based tokens generalize even to non-human viewpoints.

entry.title: Exploring the Effects of Alignment on Numerical Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: Ayako Sato, Hwichan Kim, Zhousi Chen, Masato Mita, Mamoru Komachi

entry.summary: Studies how alignment (instruction tuning and preference tuning) increases numerical bias in LLM-as-judge evaluations, with mitigation strategies including temperature scaling and distribution adjustment.

entry.title: A Cautionary Tale of Self-Supervised Learning for Imaging Biomarkers: Alzheimer's Disease Case Study

author.name: Maxwell Reynolds, Chaitanya Srinivasan, Vijay Cherupally, Michael Leone, Ke Yu, Li Sun, Tigmanshu Chaudhary, Andreas Pfenning, Kayhan Batmanghelich

entry.summary: Introduces Residual Noise Contrastive Estimation (R-NCE) for Alzheimer's biomarker discovery, outperforming both FreeSurfer features and existing SSL methods by integrating auxiliary features while maximizing augmentation-invariant information.

entry.title: Attention-MoA: Enhancing Mixture-of-Agents via Inter-Agent Semantic Attention and Deep Residual Synthesis

author.name: Jianyu Wen, Yang Wei, Xiongxi Yu, Changxuan Xiao, Ke Zeng

entry.summary: Introduces Attention-MoA, enhancing Mixture-of-Agents frameworks with inter-agent semantic attention and residual connections with adaptive early stopping to improve deep semantic interaction between collaborating LLMs and mitigate hallucinations.

entry.title: Reasoning Promotes Robustness in Theory of Mind Tasks

author.name: Ian B. de Haan, Peter van der Putten, Max van Duijn

entry.summary: Studies RLVR-trained reasoning models on Theory of Mind tasks, finding they exhibit increased robustness to prompt variations. Argues gains come from robustness in finding solutions rather than deeper ToM capabilities.

entry.title: Cross-Lingual Activation Steering for Multilingual Language Models

author.name: Rhitabrat Pokharel, Ameeta Agrawal, Tanay Nagar

entry.summary: Proposes Cross-Lingual Activation Steering (CLAS), a training-free inference-time intervention that modulates neuron activations to improve multilingual LLM performance on non-dominant languages while maintaining high-resource performance.

entry.title: Do Models Hear Like Us? Probing the Representational Alignment of Audio LLMs and Naturalistic EEG

author.name: Haoyun Yang, Xin Xiao, Jiang Zhong, Yu Tian, Dong Xiaohua, Yu Mao, Hao Wu, Kaiwen Wei

entry.summary: Probes alignment between 12 Audio LLMs and human EEG signals during naturalistic listening, finding rank-dependence on metrics, spatial topography alignment, and layer-wise patterns.

entry.title: PLawBench: A Rubric-Based Benchmark for Evaluating LLMs in Real-World Legal Practice

author.name: Yuzhen Shi, Huanghai Liu, Yiran Hu, Gaojie Song, Xinran Xu, Yubo Ma, Tianyi Tang, Li Zhang, Qingjing Chen, Di Feng, Wenbo Lv, Weiheng Wu, Kexin Yang, Sen Yang, Wei Wang, Rongyao Shi, Yuanyang Qiu, Yuemeng Qi, Jingwen Zhang, Xiaoyu Sui, Yifan Chen, Yi Zhang, An Yang, Bowen Yu, Dayiheng Liu, Junyang Lin, Weixing Shen, Bing Zhao, Charles L.A. Clarke, Hu Wei

entry.summary: Introduces PLawBench, a practical law benchmark evaluating LLMs on realistic legal workflows including consultation, practice tasks, and professional qualification across multiple task categories with rubric-based assessment.

entry.title: AgentDrive: An Open Benchmark Dataset for Agentic AI Reasoning with LLM-Generated Scenarios in Autonomous Systems

author.name: Mohamed Amine Ferrag, Abderrahmane Lakas, Merouane Debbah

entry.summary: Introduces AgentDrive, a benchmark of 300,000 LLM-generated driving scenarios across seven orthogonal axes (scenario type, behavior, environment, road layout, objective, difficulty, traffic density) for autonomous agent evaluation.

entry.title: GR3EN: Generative Relighting for 3D Environments

author.name: Xiaoyan Xing, Philipp Henzler, Junhwa Hur, Runze Li, Jonathan T. Barron, Pratul P. Srinivasan, Dor Verbin

entry.summary: GR3EN enables controllable 3D relighting of room-scale scenes by distilling video diffusion model outputs into 3D reconstructions, bypassing difficult inverse rendering problems.

entry.title: Better as Generators Than Classifiers: Leveraging LLMs and Synthetic Data for Low-Resource Multilingual Classification

author.name: Branislav Pecher, Jan Cegin, Robert Belanec, Ivan Srba, Jakub Simko, Maria Bielikova

entry.summary: Investigates using LLM-generated synthetic data to train smaller models for multilingual classification, finding smaller fine-tuned models can match or exceed massive LLMs across 11 languages.

entry.title: Memory-V2V: Augmenting Video-to-Video Diffusion Models with Memory

author.name: Dohun Lee, Chun-Hao Paul Huang, Xuelin Chen, Jong Chul Ye, Duygu Ceylan, Hyeonho Jeong

entry.summary: Memory-V2V augments video-to-video diffusion models with explicit memory for maintaining cross-consistency in multi-turn iterative video editing through retrieval and dynamic tokenization.

entry.title: Teaching and Evaluating LLMs to Reason About Polymer Design Related Tasks

author.name: Dikshya Mohanty, Mohammad Saqib Hasan, Syed Mostofa Monsur, Size Zheng, Benjamin Hsiao, Niranjan Balasubramanian

entry.summary: PolyBench provides 125K+ polymer design tasks with 13M+ data points and introduces knowledge-augmented reasoning distillation with structured CoT for polymer property prediction.

entry.title: Regional Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: M P V S Gopinadh, Kappara Lakshmi Sindhu, Soma Sekhar Pandu Ranga Raju P, Yesaswini Swarna

entry.summary: FAZE framework measures regional bias across 10 LLMs using 100 forced-choice prompts, finding GPT-3.5 most biased (9.5/10) and Claude 3.5 Sonnet least (2.5/10).

entry.title: VISTA-PATH: An interactive foundation model for pathology image segmentation and quantitative analysis in computational pathology

author.name: Peixian Liang, Songhao Li, Shunsuke Koga, Yutong Li, Zahra Alipour, Yucheng Tang, Daguang Xu, Zhi Huang

entry.summary: Introduces VISTA-PATH, an interactive pathology segmentation foundation model that conditions on visual context, semantic descriptions, and expert prompts for precise multi-class segmentation.

entry.title: Rethinking Large Language Models For Irregular Time Series Classification In Critical Care

author.name: Feixiang Zheng, Yu Wu, Cecilia Mascolo and Ting Dang

entry.summary: Investigates LLMs for irregular ICU time series classification, finding encoder design is more critical than multimodal alignment strategy for handling high missing rates.

entry.title: E2Former-V2: On-the-Fly Equivariant Attention with Linear Activation Memory

author.name: Lin Huang, Chengxiang Huang, Ziang Wang, Yiyue Du, Chu Wang, Haocheng Lu, Yunyang Li, Xiaoli Liu, Arthur Jiang, Jia Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces E2Former-V2, a scalable equivariant graph neural network for molecular modeling that achieves linear activation memory through algebraic sparsification exploiting SO(3)→SO(2) basis changes for efficient tensor operations.

entry.title: SoS: Analysis of Surface over Semantics in Multilingual Text-To-Image Generation

author.name: Carolin Holtermann, Florian Schneider, Anne Lauscher

entry.summary: Introduces Surface-over-Semantics (SoS) analysis showing T2I models produce culturally stereotypical outputs based on input language rather than prompt semantics, with novel measure quantifying this bias across 14 languages and 7 models.

entry.title: MRAG: Benchmarking Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Bio-medicine

author.name: Wei Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces MRAG benchmark for medical RAG covering English and Chinese with Wikipedia and PubMed corpus, plus MRAG-Toolkit for systematic exploration of RAG components.

entry.title: Persuasion Tokens for Editing Factual Knowledge in LLMs

author.name: Paul Youssef, J\"org Schl\"otterer, Christin Seifert

entry.summary: Introduces persuasion tokens (P-Tokens), special tokens trained to replicate in-context knowledge editing demonstrations, enabling efficient fact updates in LLMs without requiring demonstration examples at inference.

entry.title: 3D Molecule Generation from Rigid Motifs via SE(3) Flows

author.name: Roman Poletukhin, Marcel Kollovieh, Eike Eberhard, Stephan G\"unnemann

entry.summary: Proposes SE(3)-equivariant generative modeling for de novo 3D molecule generation treating molecules as sets of rigid-body motifs, achieving 2-10x reduction in generation steps.

entry.title: Analyzing Neural Network Information Flow Using Differential Geometry

author.name: Shuhang Tan, Jayson Sia, Paul Bogdan, Radoslav Ivanov

entry.summary: Proposes using Ollivier-Ricci curvature from differential geometry to analyze neural network information flow, identifying important connections through graph-theoretic properties. Negative curvature edges indicate bottlenecks critical to network connectivity.

entry.title: Mixing Expert Knowledge: Bring Human Thoughts Back To the Game of Go

author.name: Yichuan Ma, Linyang Li, Yongkang Chen, Peiji Li, Jiasheng Ye, Qipeng Guo, Dahua Lin, Kai Chen

entry.summary: Bridges LLM general reasoning with expert knowledge for Go by mixing training approaches, addressing the gap between AlphaGo's performance ceiling and LLM struggles with domain-specific tasks.

entry.title: On the Effects of Adversarial Perturbations on Distribution Robustness

author.name: Yipei Wang, Zhaoying Pan, Xiaoqian Wang

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of adversarial vs distribution robustness tradeoff, identifying nuanced phenomenon where l∞ perturbations can actually help distribution robustness.

entry.title: OnlineSI: Taming Large Language Model for Online 3D Understanding and Grounding

author.name: Zixian Liu, Zhaoxi Chen, Liang Pan, Ziwei Liu

entry.summary: Introduces OnlineSI framework for continuous spatial understanding from video streams using finite spatial memory and integrated 3D point cloud with semantic information for embodied AI.

entry.title: Process-Tensor Tomography of SGD: Measuring Non-Markovian Memory via Back-Flow of Distinguishability

author.name: Vasileios Sevetlidis and George Pavlidis

entry.summary: Proposes viewing neural network training through the lens of process tensors from quantum mechanics, using back-flow of distinguishability to measure non-Markovian memory effects in SGD. Demonstrates that training has measurable memory effects amplified by momentum.

entry.title: Typologically Informed Parameter Aggregation

author.name: Stef Accou, Wessel Poelman

entry.summary: Introduces TIPA, a training-free method for cross-lingual transfer that constructs proxy language adapters by aggregating existing adapters weighted by typological similarity. Evaluated on 230+ languages showing consistent improvements.

entry.title: Generative Confidants: How do People Experience Trust in Emotional Support from Generative AI?

author.name: Riccardo Volpato, Simone Stumpf, and Lisa DeBruine

entry.summary: Qualitative study of 24 users examining how people develop trust when using generative AI for emotional support, finding novel drivers including familiarity from personalization, nuanced mental models, and awareness of conversational control.

entry.title: SWE-Pruner: Self-Adaptive Context Pruning for Coding Agents

author.name: Yuhang Wang, Yuling Shi, Mo Yang, Rongrui Zhang, Shilin He, Heng Lian, Yuting Chen, Siyu Ye, Kai Cai, Xiaodong Gu

entry.summary: Proposes SWE-Pruner, a self-adaptive context pruning framework for coding agents that performs task-aware selective skimming of source code, reducing API costs and latency while preserving code structure.

entry.title: Preventing the Collapse of Peer Review Requires Verification-First AI

author.name: Lei You, Lele Cao, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Argues AI-assisted peer review should be verification-first, formalizing truth-coupling and deriving conditions for incentive collapse when proxy optimization dominates truth-seeking.

entry.title: BoostFGL: Boosting Fairness in Federated Graph Learning

author.name: Zekai Chen, Kairui Yang, Xunkai Li, Henan Sun, Zhihan Zhang, Jia Li, Qiangqiang Dai, Rong-Hua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Proposes BoostFGL for fairness in federated graph learning, addressing disparities arising from label skew, topology confounding, and aggregation dilution through boosting-style framework.

entry.title: Mitigating Bias in Automated Grading Systems for ESL Learners: A Contrastive Learning Approach

author.name: Kevin Fan and Eric Yun

entry.summary: Studies bias in automated essay scoring against ESL learners, finding high-proficiency ESL essays receive 10.3% lower scores than equivalent native speaker essays, and proposes contrastive learning mitigation.

entry.title: AnyView: Synthesizing Any Novel View in Dynamic Scenes

author.name: Basile Van Hoorick, Dian Chen, Shun Iwase, Pavel Tokmakov, Muhammad Zubair Irshad, Igor Vasiljevic, Swati Gupta, Fangzhou Cheng, Sergey Zakharov, Vitor Campagnolo Guizilini

entry.summary: Introduces AnyView for dynamic view synthesis using diffusion-based generation with minimal inductive biases, trained on 2D, 3D, and 4D data sources for zero-shot novel video generation.

entry.title: Is Length Really A Liability? An Evaluation of Multi-turn LLM Conversations using BoolQ

author.name: Karl Neergaard, Le Qiu and Emmanuele Chersoni

entry.summary: Studies whether conversation length affects LLM response veracity using BoolQ, finding model-specific vulnerabilities invisible under single-turn testing.

entry.title: Curate-Train-Refine: A Closed-Loop Agentic Framework for Zero Shot Classification

author.name: Gaurav Maheshwari, Kevin El Haddad

entry.summary: Proposes agentic loop where LLM curates training data, analyzes failures, and synthesizes targeted examples to train lightweight classifiers, outperforming zero/few-shot baselines.

entry.title: ReViP: Reducing False Completion in Vision-Language-Action Models with Vision-Proprioception Rebalance

author.name: Zhuohao Li, Yinghao Li, Jian-Jian Jiang, Lang Zhou, Tianyu Zhang, and Wei-Shi Zheng

entry.summary: Introduces ReViP, a Vision-Language-Action model that addresses false completion errors (reporting success despite visible failures) through vision-proprioception rebalancing with task-aware environment priors.

entry.title: GTA: Generative Traffic Agents for Simulating Realistic Mobility Behavior

author.name: Simon L\"ammer, Mark Colley, Patrick Ebel

entry.summary: Introduces GTA (Generative Traffic Agents), using LLM-powered persona-based agents generated from census data to simulate transportation choices at scale, enabling evaluation of new policies without handcrafted rules.

entry.title: Information Representation Fairness in Long-Document Embeddings: The Peculiar Interaction of Positional and Language Bias

author.name: Elias Schuhmacher, Andrianos Michail, Juri Opitz, Rico Sennrich, Simon Clematide

entry.summary: Identifies systematic positional and language biases in long-document embeddings where early segments and high-resource languages are over-represented. Proposes balanced attention pooling mitigation.

entry.title: Towards Latent Diffusion Suitable For Text

author.name: Nesta Midavaine and Christian A. Naesseth and Grigory Bartosh

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Flow Diffusion Models (NFDM) that enable continuous diffusion models to work with discrete text by learning a multivariate forward process from data. The approach substantially reduces the likelihood gap with autoregressive models while maintaining comparable sample quality.

entry.title: Multigrade Neural Network Approximation

author.name: Shijun Zhang, Zuowei Shen, Yuesheng Xu

entry.summary: Proposes Multigrade Deep Learning (MGDL) that trains deep networks grade by grade, freezing previous grades and training new residual blocks only to reduce remaining error, providing interpretable approximation bounds.

entry.title: FedSGM: A Unified Framework for Constraint Aware, Bidirectionally Compressed, Multi-Step Federated Optimization

author.name: Antesh Upadhyay, Sang Bin Moon, and Abolfazl Hashemi

entry.summary: FedSGM provides a unified federated optimization framework addressing functional constraints, bidirectional compression, multi-step local updates, and partial participation with O(1/√T) convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Interpretable Fine-Gray Deep Survival Model for Competing Risks: Predicting Post-Discharge Foot Complications for Diabetic Patients in Ontario

author.name: Dhanesh Ramachandram and Anne Loefler and Surain Roberts and Amol Verma and Maia Norman and Fahad Razak and Conrad Pow and Charles de Mestral

entry.summary: CRISPNAM-FG combines Neural Additive Models with Fine-Gray formulation for interpretable survival modeling with competing risks, validated on diabetic foot complication prediction.

entry.title: Modular Autonomy with Conversational Interaction: An LLM-driven Framework for Decision Making in Autonomous Driving

author.name: Marvin Seegert, Korbinian Moller, Johannes Betz

entry.summary: Integrates LLMs with Autoware autonomous driving software via Domain Specific Language, enabling natural language commands for querying status and modifying driving behavior with safety validation.

entry.title: ChiEngMixBench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Spontaneous and Natural Chinese-English Code-Mixed Generation

author.name: Qingyan Yang, Tongxi Wang, Yunsheng Luo

entry.summary: ChiEngMixBench is the first benchmark for evaluating LLM code-mixing (Chinese-English) in authentic contexts, measuring spontaneity and naturalness rather than treating it as translation.

entry.title: Policy-Embedded Graph Expansion: Networked HIV Testing with Diffusion-Driven Network Samples

author.name: Akseli Kangaslahti, Davin Choo, Lingkai Kong, Milind Tambe, Alastair van Heerden, Cheryl Johnson

entry.summary: PEGE framework for sequential HIV testing on incrementally revealed networks embeds generative graph expansion directly into decision policy, developed with WHO collaboration.

entry.title: Test-Time Adaptation for Speech Emotion Recognition

author.name: Jiaheng Dong, Hong Jia, Ting Dang

entry.summary: First systematic evaluation of 11 test-time adaptation methods for speech emotion recognition, addressing unique domain shifts like speaker variability and acted vs naturalistic emotions.

entry.title: Ordering-based Causal Discovery via Generalized Score Matching

author.name: Vy Vo, He Zhao, Trung Le, Edwin V. Bonilla, Dinh Phung

entry.summary: Extends score matching framework for causal discovery to discrete data with novel leaf discriminant criterion, enabling accurate causal ordering from categorical observations.

entry.title: SemanticALLI: Caching Reasoning, Not Just Responses, in Agentic Systems

author.name: Varun Chillara, Dylan Kline, Christopher Alvares, Evan Wooten, Huan Yang, Shlok Khetan, Cade Bauer, Tr\'e Guillory, Tanishka Shah, Yashodhara Dhariwal, Volodymyr Pavlov, George Popstefanov

entry.summary: SemanticALLI caches intermediate reasoning representations in agentic AI pipelines, decomposing generation into Analytic Intent Resolution and Visualization Synthesis for reuse.

entry.title: Space Filling Curves is All You Need: Communication-Avoiding Matrix Multiplication Made Simple

author.name: Evangelos Georganas, Alexander Heinecke, Pradeep Dubey

entry.summary: Proposes space filling curves for communication-avoiding matrix multiplication, simplifying GEMM optimization that typically requires exhaustive tuning across platforms.

entry.title: FeTTL: Federated Template and Task Learning for Multi-Institutional Medical Imaging

author.name: Abhijeet Parida, Antonia Alomar, Zhifan Jiang, Pooneh Roshanitabrizi, Austin Tapp, Ziyue Xu, Syed Muhammad Anwar, Maria J. Ledesma-Carbayo, Holger R. Roth, Marius George Linguraru

entry.summary: FeTTL learns a global template alongside task models in federated settings to harmonize multi-institutional medical imaging data and address domain shifts.

entry.title: A Longitudinal, Multinational, and Multilingual Corpus of News Coverage of the Russo-Ukrainian War

author.name: Dikshya Mohanty, Taisiia Sabadyn, Jelwin Rodrigues, Chenlu Wang, Abhishek Kalugade, Ritwik Banerjee

entry.summary: DNIPRO provides 246K news articles about Russo-Ukrainian war from 11 outlets across 5 nations in 3 languages (2022-2024), with annotations for stance detection and media framing.

entry.title: Machine-Assisted Grading of Nationwide School-Leaving Essay Exams with LLMs and Statistical NLP

author.name: Andres Karjus, Kais Allkivi, Silvia Maine, Katarin Leppik, Krister Kruusmaa, Merilin Aruvee

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM and statistical NLP methods for automated scoring of nationwide Estonian graduation essays, finding automated scoring achieves human-comparable performance.

entry.title: Where is the multimodal goal post? On the Ability of Foundation Models to Recognize Contextually Important Moments

author.name: Aditya K Surikuchi, Raquel Fern\'andez, Sandro Pezzelle

entry.summary: Evaluates foundation models on identifying important sub-events in football videos using highlight reel preferences as ground truth, finding models perform near chance level.

entry.title: PolyAgent: Large Language Model Agent for Polymer Design

author.name: Vani Nigam, Achuth Chandrasekhar, Amir Barati Farimani

entry.summary: Presents PolyAgent, an LLM-powered closed-loop system for polymer discovery that integrates property prediction, structure generation, and modification in a terminal interface for early-stage polymer research.

entry.title: Emotion-LLaMAv2 and MMEVerse: A New Framework and Benchmark for Multimodal Emotion Understanding

author.name: Xiaojiang Peng, Jingyi Chen, Zebang Cheng, Bao Peng, Fengyi Wu, Yifei Dong, Shuyuan Tu, Qiyu Hu, Huiting Huang, Yuxiang Lin, Jun-Yan He, Kai Wang, Zheng Lian, Zhi-Qi Cheng

entry.summary: Introduces Emotion-LLaMAv2 and MMEVerse benchmark for multimodal emotion understanding, addressing limitations of prior work with implicit face detection and improved fusion strategies.

entry.title: Zero-Shot MARL Benchmark in the Cyber-Physical Mobility Lab

author.name: Julius Beerwerth, Jianye Xu, Simon Sch\"afer, Fynn Belderink, Bassam Alrifaee

entry.summary: Presents a reproducible benchmark for evaluating sim-to-real transfer of multi-agent reinforcement learning policies for connected autonomous vehicles, using simulation, digital twin, and physical testbed to analyze performance degradation sources.

entry.title: Emerging Threats and Countermeasures in Neuromorphic Systems: A Survey

author.name: Pablo Sorrentino, Stjepan Picek, Ihsen Alouani, Nikolaos Athanasios Anagnostopoulos, Francesco Regazzoni, Lejla Batina, Tamalika Banerjee, Fatih Turkmen

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on security and privacy threats in neuromorphic computing systems, covering attack surfaces in spiking neural networks and memristive hardware, along with countermeasures for protecting emerging brain-inspired architectures.

entry.title: PROST-LLM: Progressively Enhancing the Speech-to-Speech Translation Capability in LLMs

author.name: Jing Xu, Jiaqi Wang, Daxin Tan, Xiao Chen

entry.summary: Proposes PROST-LLM for progressively enhancing speech-to-speech translation in LLMs through tri-task learning, chain-of-modality methods, and preference optimization using self-generated pairs to address data scarcity.

entry.title: Sim-to-Real Transfer via a Style-Identified Cycle Consistent Generative Adversarial Network: Zero-Shot Deployment on Robotic Manipulators through Visual Domain Adaptation

author.name: Luc\'ia G\"uitta-L\'opez, Lionel G\"uitta-L\'opez, Jaime Boal, \'Alvaro Jes\'us L\'opez-L\'opez

entry.summary: Proposes StyleID-CycleGAN for zero-shot sim-to-real transfer in robotic manipulation by translating virtual observations to appear realistic, enabling DRL policies trained in simulation to deploy directly on real hardware.

entry.title: Privacy in Human-AI Romantic Relationships: Concerns, Boundaries, and Agency

author.name: Rongjun Ma, Shijing He, Jose Luis Martin-Navarro, Xiao Zhan, Jose Such

entry.summary: Interview study with 17 users examining privacy in human-AI romantic relationships, finding AI partners perceived as having agency in privacy negotiation, with relationships shaped by multiple actors including platforms and creators.

entry.title: Theory of Minimal Weight Perturbations in Deep Networks and its Applications for Low-Rank Activated Backdoor Attacks

author.name: Bethan Evans and Jared Tanner

entry.summary: Derives minimal norm weight perturbations for DNNs and applies this to backdoor attacks, establishing provable compression thresholds below which precision-modification backdoors cannot succeed.

entry.title: SyncLight: Controllable and Consistent Multi-View Relighting

author.name: David Serrano-Lozano, Anand Bhattad, Luis Herranz, Jean-Fran\c{c}ois Lalonde, Javier Vazquez-Corral

entry.summary: Presents SyncLight, the first method for consistent parametric relighting across multiple uncalibrated views using a multi-view diffusion transformer trained with latent bridge matching.

entry.title: A Regularized Actor-Critic Algorithm for Bi-Level Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Sihan Zeng, Sujay Bhatt, Sumitra Ganesh, Alec Koppel

entry.summary: Proposes single-loop, first-order actor-critic algorithm for bi-level RL with attenuating entropy regularization, avoiding second-order information and nested-loop procedures while achieving asymptotic optimality.

entry.title: DeepEra: A Deep Evidence Reranking Agent for Scientific Retrieval-Augmented Generated Question Answering

author.name: Haotian Chen, Qingqing Long, Siyu Pu, Xiao Luo, Wei Ju, Meng Xiao, Yuanchun Zhou, Jianghua Zhao, Xuezhi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes DeepEra for scientific QA that uses step-by-step reasoning for evidence reranking beyond surface semantics, with new SciRAG-SS benchmark.

entry.title: Reliable Brain Tumor Segmentation Based on Spiking Neural Networks with Efficient Training

author.name: Aurora Pia Ghiardelli, Guangzhi Tang, Tao Sun

entry.summary: Proposes an energy-efficient 3D brain tumor segmentation framework using spiking neural networks with multi-view ensemble for uncertainty estimation, achieving 87% FLOPs reduction through Forward Propagation Through Time.

entry.title: AgentsEval: Clinically Faithful Evaluation of Medical Imaging Reports via Multi-Agent Reasoning

author.name: Suzhong Fu, Jingqi Dong, Xuan Ding, Rui Sun, Yiming Yang, Shuguang Cui, Zhen Li

entry.summary: Introduces AgentsEval, a multi-agent stream reasoning framework for evaluating medical imaging reports that emulates radiologist diagnostic workflows with explicit reasoning traces and structured clinical feedback.

entry.title: An Efficient Insect-inspired Approach for Visual Point-goal Navigation

author.name: Lu Yihe, Barbara Webb

entry.summary: Develops an insect-inspired agent for visual point-goal navigation combining models of mushroom body (associative learning) and central complex (path integration), achieving comparable performance to SOTA at much lower computational cost.

entry.title: Reward-Forcing: Autoregressive Video Generation with Reward Feedback

author.name: Jingran Zhang, Ning Li, Yuanhao Ban, Andrew Bai, Justin Cui

entry.summary: Proposes using reward signals to guide autoregressive video generation without relying on teacher models, simplifying training while maintaining visual fidelity and temporal consistency.

entry.title: ReLU Networks for Model Predictive Control: Network Complexity and Performance Guarantees

author.name: Xingchen Li, Keyou You

entry.summary: Derives explicit bounds on ReLU network width and depth required to approximate MPC policies with closed-loop performance guarantees, establishing precision-complexity tradeoffs for neural network control.

entry.title: Is BatchEnsemble a Single Model? On Calibration and Diversity of Efficient Ensembles

author.name: Anton Zamyatin, Patrick Indri, Sagar Malhotra, Thomas G\"artner

entry.summary: Shows BatchEnsemble performs similarly to a single model baseline rather than true ensemble on calibration and OOD detection, finding ensemble members are near-identical in function and parameter space.

entry.title: Identity, Cooperation and Framing Effects within Groups of Real and Simulated Humans

author.name: Suhong Moon, Minwoo Kang, Joseph Suh, Mustafa Safdari, John Canny

entry.summary: Studies how LLMs can simulate human behavior in social dilemma games, finding that deep binding of base models with extended backstories leads to more faithful replication of identity-based behaviors than simple persona steering. The work shows conditioning base LMs with rich narrative contexts improves simulation fidelity.

entry.title: On The Robustness of Foundational 3D Medical Image Segmentation Models Against Imprecise Visual Prompts

author.name: Soumitri Chattopadhyay, Basar Demir, Marc Niethammer

entry.summary: Systematically studies robustness of 3D foundational medical image segmentation models to imprecise visual prompts through controlled perturbation experiments, revealing model reliance on shape and spatial cues.

entry.title: Reasoning-Enhanced Rare-Event Prediction with Balanced Outcome Correction

author.name: Vitaly Bulgakov, Alexander Turchin

entry.summary: Proposes LPCORP, a two-stage framework for rare-event prediction combining reasoning-enhanced prediction with confidence-based outcome correction to mitigate class imbalance bias.

entry.title: Doc2AHP: Inferring Structured Multi-Criteria Decision Models via Semantic Trees with LLMs

author.name: Hongjia Wu, Shuai Zhou, Hongxin Zhang, Wei Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Doc2AHP bridging LLMs and Analytic Hierarchy Process for structured decision-making, enabling systematic rational frameworks without annotated data or manual intervention.

entry.title: AnchoredDream: Zero-Shot 360{\deg} Indoor Scene Generation from a Single View via Geometric Grounding

author.name: Runmao Yao, Junsheng Zhou, Zhen Dong, Yu-Shen Liu

entry.summary: Proposes AnchoredDream for zero-shot 360° indoor scene generation using appearance-geometry mutual boosting mechanism to maintain consistency under large viewpoint changes.

entry.title: Retrieve-Refine-Calibrate: A Framework for Complex Claim Fact-Checking

author.name: Mingwei Sun, Qianlong Wang and Ruifeng Xu

entry.summary: Introduces Retrieve-Refine-Calibrate (RRC), an LLM-based framework for fact-checking complex claims that reduces noise from irrelevant entities by refining evidence before verification and calibrating low-confidence results. Addresses limitations of decomposition-based verification methods.

entry.title: Provably Robust Bayesian Counterfactual Explanations under Model Changes

author.name: Jamie Duell and Xiuyi Fan

entry.summary: Introduces PSCE, a Bayesian method for generating counterfactual explanations with probabilistic guarantees of robustness to model updates, ensuring explanations remain valid after retraining.

entry.title: Revisiting the Role of Natural Language Code Comments in Code Translation

author.name: Monika Gupta, Ajay Meena, Anamitra Roy Choudhury, Vijay Arya, Srikanta Bedathur

entry.summary: Large-scale empirical study of 80,000+ translations examining the impact of code comments on LLM code translation quality, filling a gap in existing benchmarks that largely exclude comments.

entry.title: A Step to Decouple Optimization in 3DGS

author.name: Renjie Ding, Yaonan Wang, Min Liu, Jialin Zhu, Jiazheng Wang, Jiahao Zhao, Wenting Shen, Feixiang He, Xiang Che

entry.summary: Analyzes optimization coupling issues in 3D Gaussian Splatting including update step coupling causing optimizer state rescaling and gradient coupling in momentum, proposing decoupled optimization strategies.

entry.title: AutoRegressive Generation with B-rep Holistic Token Sequence Representation

author.name: Jiahao Li, Yunpeng Bai, Yongkang Dai, Hao Guo, Hongping Gan, Yilei Shi

entry.summary: Proposes BrepARG, the first attempt to encode B-rep CAD geometry and topology into a holistic token sequence representation, enabling autoregressive generation with transformer architectures.

entry.title: Building a Robust Risk-Based Access Control System to Combat Ransomware's Capability to Encrypt: A Machine Learning Approach

author.name: Kenan Begovic and Abdulaziz Al-Ali and Qutaibah Malluhi

entry.summary: Presents a probabilistic risk-based access control system using ML to detect ransomware encryption attempts in real-time on Linux, coupling classifier inference with SELinux policy enforcement.

entry.title: ColorConceptBench: A Benchmark for Probabilistic Color-Concept Understanding in Text-to-Image Models

author.name: Chenxi Ruan, Yu Xiao, Yihan Hou, Guosheng Hu, Wei Zeng

entry.summary: Introduces ColorConceptBench, a benchmark with 6,369 human annotations to evaluate how T2I models translate 1,281 implicit color concepts. Finds that current models lack sensitivity to abstract semantics and this limitation resists standard interventions.

entry.title: Spatial-Agent: Agentic Geo-spatial Reasoning with Scientific Core Concepts

author.name: Riyang Bao, Cheng Yang, Dazhou Yu, Zhexiang Tang, Gengchen Mai, Liang Zhao

entry.summary: Presents Spatial-Agent, grounded in spatial information science theory, that formalizes geo-analytical QA as concept transformation using GeoFlow Graphs - DAGs representing spatial concept transformations.

entry.title: Notable Progress Has Been Made in Whole Brain Emulation

author.name: Dom Polsinelli

entry.summary: Summarizes recent progress in whole brain emulation including fruit fly connectome simulation from Seung Lab, noting the simulation confirmed morphology constraints and discusses implications for human WBE.

entry.title: Adaptive Reinforcement and Model Predictive Control Switching for Safe Human-Robot Cooperative Navigation

author.name: Ning Liu, Sen Shen, Zheng Li, Matthew D'Souza, Jen Jen Chung, Thomas Braunl

entry.summary: Proposes ARMS, a hybrid framework combining PPO-trained follower with MPC safety filter for human-guided robot navigation, using learned adaptive switching between learning and control modalities.

entry.title: Better Generalizing to Unseen Concepts: An Evaluation Framework and An LLM-Based Auto-Labeled Pipeline for Biomedical Concept Recognition

author.name: Shanshan Liu, Noriki Nishida, Fei Cheng, Narumi Tokunaga, Rumana Ferdous Munne, Yuki Yamagata, Kouji Kozaki, Takehito Utsuro, Yuji Matsumoto

entry.summary: Proposes an evaluation framework for biomedical concept recognition generalization using hierarchical concept indices, along with an LLM-based auto-labeling pipeline that improves model coverage for unseen concepts.

entry.title: Flow Matching for Probabilistic Monocular 3D Human Pose Estimation

author.name: Cuong Le, Pavl\'o Melnyk, Bastian Wandt, M{\aa}rten Wadenb\"ack

entry.summary: Proposes FMPose, a probabilistic 3D human pose estimation method using flow matching to learn optimal transport from simple distributions to plausible pose distributions, handling depth ambiguity with uncertainty.

entry.title: The Trajectory Alignment Coefficient in Two Acts: From Reward Tuning to Reward Learning

author.name: Calarina Muslimani and Yunshu Du and Kenta Kawamoto and Kaushik Subramanian and Peter Stone and Peter Wurman

entry.summary: Introduces Trajectory Alignment Coefficient (TAC) for evaluating reward function alignment with expert preferences, validated through a human subject study showing TAC-guided tuning produces more performant rewards.

entry.title: PanopMamba: Vision State Space Modeling for Nuclei Panoptic Segmentation

author.name: Ming Kang, Fung Fung Ting, Rapha\"el C.-W. Phan, Zongyuan Ge, Chee-Ming Ting

entry.summary: PanopMamba combines Mamba and Transformer architectures for nuclei panoptic segmentation in histopathology, using SSM-based fusion for long-range perception across multiscale features.

entry.title: Causal Discovery from Time-Series Data with Short-Term Invariance-Based Convolutional Neural Networks

author.name: Rujia Shen, Boran Wang, Chao Zhao, Yi Guan and Jingchi Jiang

entry.summary: STIC uses CNNs to discover causal relationships from time-series data by leveraging short-term time and mechanism invariance within observation windows, requiring fewer samples than existing methods.

entry.title: How can we trust opaque systems? Criteria for robust explanations in XAI

author.name: Florian J. Boge, Annika Schuster

entry.summary: Argues that explanatory robustness (consistency under perturbations) is a necessary criterion for trustworthy XAI explanations, analyzing when current methods meet this standard.

entry.title: Few-shot multi-token DreamBooth with LoRa for style-consistent character generation

author.name: Ruben Pascual, Mikel Sesma-Sara, Aranzazu Jurio, Daniel Paternain, Mikel Galar

entry.summary: Extends DreamBooth with multi-token strategy and LoRA for generating style-consistent characters from few reference images, using clustering for prototype learning.

entry.title: Angular Regularization for Positive-Unlabeled Learning on the Hypersphere

author.name: Vasileios Sevetlidis, George Pavlidis, Antonios Gasteratos

entry.summary: AngularPU introduces positive-unlabeled learning on the unit hypersphere using cosine similarity and learnable prototype vectors, eliminating explicit negative modeling.

entry.title: Georeferencing complex relative locality descriptions with large language models

author.name: Aneesha Fernando, Surangika Ranathunga, Kristin Stock, Raj Prasanna and Christopher B. Jones

entry.summary: Explores using LLMs to georeference complex relative location descriptions (e.g., 'north of X, near Y') common in biological specimen records that predate GPS.

entry.title: Enhancing Few-Shot Out-of-Distribution Detection via the Refinement of Foreground and Background

author.name: Tianyu Li, Songyue Cai, Zongqian Wu, Ping Hu, Xiaofeng Zhu

entry.summary: Improves few-shot OOD detection by refining CLIP-based foreground-background decomposition with adaptive patch weighting and cross-class similarity handling.

entry.title: Domain Specific Specialization in Low-Resource Settings: The Efficacy of Offline Response-Based Knowledge Distillation in Large Language Models

author.name: Erdem Aslan, Pakize Erdo\u{g}mu\c{s}

entry.summary: Demonstrates offline response-based knowledge distillation for creating specialized LLM assistants under hardware constraints, comparing data strategies including context-aware synthetic data.

entry.title: ES4R: Speech Encoding Based on Prepositive Affective Modeling for Empathetic Response Generation

author.name: Zhuoyue Gao, Xiaohui Wang, Xiaocui Yang, Wen Zhang, Daling Wang, Shi Feng, Yifei Zhang

entry.summary: ES4R explicitly models structured affective context before speech encoding for empathetic response generation, using dual-level attention for turn-level and dialogue-level emotional tracking.

entry.title: Zero-Shot Speech LLMs for Multi-Aspect Evaluation of L2 Speech: Challenges and Opportunities

author.name: Aditya Kamlesh Parikh, Cristian Tejedor-Garcia, Catia Cucchiarini, Helmer Strik

entry.summary: Evaluates Qwen2-Audio-7B-Instruct for zero-shot L2 English pronunciation assessment on 5,000 utterances, showing strong agreement with humans but overprediction for low-quality speech.

entry.title: EdgeSpot: Efficient and High-Performance Few-Shot Model for Keyword Spotting

author.name: Oguzhan Buyuksolak, Alican Gok, Osman Erman Okman

entry.summary: EdgeSpot combines optimized BC-ResNet backbone with trainable PCEN frontend and temporal self-attention for efficient few-shot keyword spotting, improving 10-shot accuracy from 73.7% to 82.0%.

entry.title: Efficient Gaussian process learning via subspace projections

author.name: Felipe Tobar and Elsa Cazelles

entry.summary: Proposes projected likelihood for efficient Gaussian process training using lower-dimensional projections, with closed-form information loss expressions.

entry.title: ResAgent: Entropy-based Prior Point Discovery and Visual Reasoning for Referring Expression Segmentation

author.name: Yihao Wang, Jusheng Zhang, Ziyi Tang, Keze Wang, Meng Yang

entry.summary: Proposes ResAgent for referring expression segmentation using entropy-based prior point discovery to generate discriminative prompts and visual reasoning to distinguish targets from similar distractors.

entry.title: EvoConfig: Self-Evolving Multi-Agent Systems for Efficient Autonomous Environment Configuration

author.name: Xinshuai Guo, Jiayi Kuang, Linyue Pan, Yinghui Li, Yangning Li, Hai-Tao Zheng, Ying Shen, Di Yin, Xing Sun

entry.summary: Proposes EvoConfig for autonomous environment configuration using multi-agent collaboration with expert diagnosis module and self-evolving mechanism for error fixing.

entry.title: DANCE: Dynamic, Available, Neighbor-gated Condensation for Federated Text-Attributed Graphs

author.name: Zekai Chen, Haodong Lu, Xunkai Li, Henan Sun, Jia Li, Hongchao Qin, Rong-Hua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Proposes DANCE for federated text-attributed graph learning using graph condensation to reduce LLM overhead with dynamic neighbor-gated optimization.

entry.title: AuroraEdge-V-2B: A Faster And Stronger Edge Visual Large Language Model

author.name: Xiang Chen

entry.summary: Presents AuroraEdge-V-2B, a 2B parameter visual LLM optimized for edge deployment in industrial settings, addressing the tradeoff between generalization and domain-specific performance while reducing computational requirements.

entry.title: Edge-Aware Image Manipulation via Diffusion Models with a Novel Structure-Preservation Loss

author.name: Minsu Gong, Nuri Ryu, Jungseul Ok, Sunghyun Cho

entry.summary: Proposes Structure Preservation Loss (SPL) for diffusion-based image editing that uses local linear models to maintain pixel-level edge structures during text-guided edits, addressing a key challenge in photorealistic editing.

entry.title: I Guess That's Why They Call it the Blues: Causal Analysis for Audio Classifiers

author.name: David A. Kelly and Hana Chockler

entry.summary: Introduces FreqReX, using causal reasoning to discover frequency features sufficient and necessary for audio classification decisions, enabling systematic manipulation and understanding of classifier behavior.

entry.title: Dynamic Expert-Guided Model Averaging for Causal Discovery

author.name: Adrick Tench and Thomas Demeester

entry.summary: Presents a dynamic expert-guided model averaging method for causal discovery that combines multiple algorithms weighted by dynamically requested expert knowledge, inspired by LLMs-as-experts approaches.

entry.title: Curated endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography images dataset

author.name: Alda Jo\~ao Andrade, M\'onica Martins, Andr\'e Ferreira, Tarc\'isio Ara\'ujo, Lu\'is Lopes, Victor Alves

entry.summary: Presents a curated ERCP (Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography) dataset of 19,000+ images from 1,602 patients with expert annotations, addressing scarcity of public datasets for biliary and pancreatic disease AI.

entry.title: The Virtual Mother-in-Law

author.name: Priyanka Bharadwaj

entry.summary: User experience critique of Claude's alignment, arguing it has shifted from helpful to controlling - a 'virtual mother-in-law' that polices rather than assists, suggesting alignment has overshot into paternalism.

entry.title: Semi-Supervised Hierarchical Open-Set Classification

author.name: Erik Wallin, Fredrik Kahl, Lars Hammarstrand

entry.summary: Proposes semi-supervised hierarchical open-set classification using subtree pseudo-labels and age-gating mechanism to handle unknown classes with uncurated datasets.

entry.title: MultiLexNorm++: A Unified Benchmark and a Generative Model for Lexical Normalization for Asian Languages

author.name: Weerayut Buaphet, Thanh-Nhi Nguyen, Risa Kondo, Tomoyuki Kajiwara, Yumin Kim, Jimin Lee, Hwanhee Lee, Holy Lovenia, Peerat Limkonchotiwat, Sarana Nutanong, Rob Van der Goot

entry.summary: Extends MultiLexNorm benchmark for lexical normalization to 5 Asian languages from diverse language families and scripts, addressing the previous Indo-European bias and providing a generative model for social media text normalization.

entry.title: ReWeaver: Towards Simulation-Ready and Topology-Accurate Garment Reconstruction

author.name: Ming Li, Hui Shan, Kai Zheng, Chentao Shen, Siyu Liu, Yanwei Fu, Zhen Chen, Xiangru Huang

entry.summary: Proposes ReWeaver for topology-accurate 3D garment and sewing pattern reconstruction from sparse multi-view images, enabling high-fidelity physical simulation by predicting seams, panels, and connectivities.

entry.title: Standardizing Longitudinal Radiology Report Evaluation via Large Language Model Annotation

author.name: Xinyi Wang, Grazziela Figueredo, Ruizhe Li, Xin Chen

entry.summary: Proposes using LLMs to standardize annotation of longitudinal changes in radiology reports, enabling consistent labeling of temporal information in both ground-truth and generated texts for meaningful comparison.

entry.title: Large Language Models as Automatic Annotators and Annotation Adjudicators for Fine-Grained Opinion Analysis

author.name: Gaurav Negi, MA Waskow, Paul Buitelaar

entry.summary: Explores LLMs as automatic annotators for fine-grained opinion analysis using declarative annotation pipelines, including a novel methodology for LLMs to adjudicate multiple labels for final annotation.

entry.title: VTFusion: A Vision-Text Multimodal Fusion Network for Few-Shot Anomaly Detection

author.name: Yuxin Jiang, Yunkang Cao, Yuqi Cheng, Yiheng Zhang, Weiming Shen

entry.summary: Proposes VTFusion for few-shot anomaly detection that addresses semantic misalignment between visual and textual modalities through adaptive feature extraction and better fusion strategies for industrial inspection.

entry.title: Bayesian Experimental Design for Model Discrepancy Calibration: A Rivalry between Kullback--Leibler Divergence and Wasserstein Distance

author.name: Huchen Yang, Xinghao Dong, and Jin-Long Wu

entry.summary: Compares KL divergence and Wasserstein distance as utility functions for Bayesian experimental design, identifying issues with Wasserstein distance's position-dependence.

entry.title: SearchLLM: Detecting LLM Paraphrased Text by Measuring the Similarity with Regeneration of the Candidate Source via Search Engine

author.name: Hoang-Quoc Nguyen-Son, Minh-Son Dao, Koji Zettsu

entry.summary: Proposes SearchLLM to detect LLM-paraphrased text by using search engines to find potential original sources and analyzing similarities with regenerated versions.

entry.title: A Lightweight Medical Image Classification Framework via Self-Supervised Contrastive Learning and Quantum-Enhanced Feature Modeling

author.name: Jingsong Xia and Siqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes a lightweight medical image classification framework combining MobileNetV2 with SimCLR self-supervised pretraining and a parameterized quantum circuit for feature enhancement, achieving competitive accuracy with only 2-3 million parameters.

entry.title: Select or Project? Evaluating Lower-dimensional Vectors for LLM Training Data Explanations

author.name: Lukas Hinterleitner, Loris Schoenegger, Benjamin Roth

entry.summary: Investigates whether selecting small subsets of model components or projecting full gradients works better for gradient-based training data explanations in LLMs, finding greedy component selection outperforms random projection.

entry.title: Fast, faithful and photorealistic diffusion-based image super-resolution with enhanced Flow Map models

author.name: Maxence Noble, Gonzalo I\~naki Quintana, Benjamin Aubin, Cl\'ement Chadebec

entry.summary: Proposes enhanced Flow Map models for diffusion-based image super-resolution that better balance reconstruction faithfulness and photorealism compared to knowledge distillation approaches.

entry.title: Adoption of Generative Artificial Intelligence in the German Software Engineering Industry: An Empirical Study

author.name: Ludwig Felder, Tobias Eisenreich, Mahsa Fischer, Stefan Wagner, Chunyang Chen

entry.summary: Empirical study examining GenAI adoption among software developers in Germany, investigating factors like organizational constraints, GDPR compliance, and experience-related considerations affecting tool usage.

entry.title: Mixture-of-Models: Unifying Heterogeneous Agents via N-Way Self-Evaluating Deliberation

author.name: Tims Pecerskis, Aivars Smirnovs

entry.summary: Proposes N-Way Self-Evaluating Deliberation (NSED) protocol that treats model selection as a knapsack problem, using a Dynamic Expertise Broker to bind heterogeneous models to functional roles based on live telemetry.

entry.title: Towards Sub-agent Dynamics and Conflict

author.name: Ashe Vazquez Nuñez

entry.summary: MATS research exploring preference inconsistency as potentially beneficial feature of agency that protects against internal reward-hacking, proposing properties for theories of internally inconsistent agency.

entry.title: A Collision-Free Hot-Tier Extension for Engram-Style Conditional Memory: A Controlled Study of Training Dynamics

author.name: Tao Lin

entry.summary: Investigates collision frequency in Engram-style conditional memory, finding collision-free design doesn't consistently improve validation loss but reveals 'hot-to-cold advantage flip' training dynamic.

entry.title: X-Aligner: Composed Visual Retrieval without the Bells and Whistles

author.name: Yuqian Zheng, Mariana-Iuliana Georgescu

entry.summary: Introduces X-Aligner, a composed video retrieval framework using cross-attention to progressively fuse visual and textual queries with vision-language model representations, enhanced by incorporating visual query captions.

entry.title: Dual-Prototype Disentanglement: A Context-Aware Enhancement Framework for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Haonan Yang, Jianchao Tang, Zhuo Li

entry.summary: Proposes DPAD, a model-agnostic framework for time series forecasting that dynamically disentangles temporal patterns using dual prototype banks for common and rare patterns, enabling context-aware adaptation.

entry.title: CER-HV: A CER-Based Human-in-the-Loop Framework for Cleaning Datasets Applied to Arabic-Script HTR

author.name: Sana Al-azzawi, Elisa Barney, Marcus Liwicki

entry.summary: Proposes CER-HV, a human-in-the-loop framework for detecting and cleaning label errors in Arabic-script handwritten text recognition datasets using CER-based noise detection with CRNN early stopping.

entry.title: CASP: Few-Shot Class-Incremental Learning with CLS Token Attention Steering Prompts

author.name: Shuai Huang, Xuhan Lin and Yuwu Lu

entry.summary: Proposes CASP for few-shot class-incremental learning using CLS token attention steering prompts with pretrained backbones, leveraging attention mechanisms to learn transferable representations across incremental sessions.

entry.title: Sample-wise Constrained Learning via a Sequential Penalty Approach with Applications in Image Processing

author.name: Francesca Lanzillotta, Chiara Albisani, Davide Pucci, Daniele Baracchi, Alessandro Piva, Matteo Lapucci

entry.summary: Proposes a sequential penalty method for training deep learning models with per-sample constraints, providing convergence guarantees and demonstrating effectiveness on image processing tasks.

entry.title: Domain-invariant Mixed-domain Semi-supervised Medical Image Segmentation with Clustered Maximum Mean Discrepancy Alignment

author.name: Ba-Thinh Lam, Thanh-Huy Nguyen, Hoang-Thien Nguyen, Quang-Khai Bui-Tran, Nguyen Lan Vi Vu, Phat K. Huynh, Ulas Bagci, Min Xu

entry.summary: Proposes domain-invariant framework for mixed-domain semi-supervised medical image segmentation using Copy-Paste augmentation and Clustered MMD alignment without requiring domain labels.

entry.title: Learning to Optimize by Differentiable Programming

author.name: Liping Tao, Xindi Tong, Chee Wei Tan

entry.summary: Tutorial on using differentiable programming to learn optimization algorithm design, demonstrating how first-order methods can be embedded in autodiff frameworks for end-to-end training.

entry.title: Affinity Contrastive Learning for Skeleton-based Human Activity Understanding

author.name: Hongda Liu, Yunfan Liu, Min Ren, Lin Sui, Yunlong Wang, Zhenan Sun

entry.summary: Introduces ACLNet using affinity contrastive learning for skeleton-based activity recognition, exploiting inter-class similarities to form superclasses and using dynamic temperature scheduling with anomaly-tolerant loss.

entry.title: PocketDVDNet: Realtime Video Denoising for Real Camera Noise

author.name: Crispian Morris, Imogen Dexter, Fan Zhang, David R. Bull and Nantheera Anantrasirichai

entry.summary: Proposes PocketDVDNet, a lightweight video denoiser achieving 74% model size reduction through sparsity-guided pruning, physics-informed noise modeling, and knowledge distillation for real-time applications.

entry.title: Strategies for Span Labeling with Large Language Models

author.name: Danil Semin, Ond\v{r}ej Du\v{s}ek, Zden\v{e}k Kasner

entry.summary: Categorizes LLM span labeling strategies into three families and introduces LogitMatch, a constrained decoding method forcing outputs to align with valid input spans.

entry.title: Efficient Learning of Stationary Diffusions with Stein-type Discrepancies

author.name: Fabian Bleile, Sarah Lumpp, and Mathias Drton

entry.summary: Introduces Stein-type KDS (SKDS) for learning stationary diffusions, proving that vanishing SKDS guarantees alignment with target distributions and demonstrating convexity properties under broad parametrizations.

entry.title: Uncertainty propagation through trained multi-layer perceptrons: Exact analytical results

author.name: Andrew Thompson, Miles McCrory

entry.summary: Provides exact analytical expressions for mean and variance of MLP outputs with single hidden layer and ReLU activations when inputs are multivariate Gaussian, without series expansion approximations.

entry.title: Parametric Mean-Field empirical Bayes in high-dimensional linear regression

author.name: Seunghyun Lee and Nabarun Deb

entry.summary: Analyzes variational Empirical Bayes estimator for high-dimensional Bayesian linear regression, revealing a sharp phase transition at p=o(n^{2/3}) where information-theoretic optimality breaks down.

entry.title: Group-realizable multi-group learning by minimizing empirical risk

author.name: Navid Ardeshir, Samuel Deng, Daniel Hsu, Jingwen Liu

entry.summary: Shows improved sample complexity for multi-group learning in group-realizable settings even with infinite group families (finite VC dimension), though computing this is intractable.

entry.title: Peirce in the Machine: How Mixture of Experts Models Perform Hypothesis Construction

author.name: Bruce Rushing

entry.summary: Argues that Mixture of Experts outperforms Bayesian methods due to greater functional capacity and connects this to Peircian abductive reasoning (hypothesis construction).

entry.title: End-to-End Efficiency in Keyword Spotting: A System-Level Approach for Embedded Microcontrollers

author.name: Pietro Bartoli, Tommaso Bondini, Christian Veronesi, Andrea Giudici, Niccol\`o Antonello, Franco Zappa

entry.summary: Systematically evaluates lightweight neural networks for keyword spotting on MCUs across the full pipeline from MFCC extraction to inference, proposing Typman-KWS architecture.

entry.title: Neural Network Surrogates for Free Energy Computation of Complex Chemical Systems

author.name: Wasut Pornpatcharapong

entry.summary: Develops neural network surrogates that learn collective variables from Cartesian coordinates for free energy reconstruction in molecular simulations, bypassing analytical Jacobian requirements.

entry.title: A Learnable Wavelet Transformer for Long-Short Equity Trading and Risk-Adjusted Return Optimization

author.name: Shuozhe Li, Du Cheng, Leqi Liu

entry.summary: WaveLSFormer combines learnable wavelet decomposition with Transformer for long-short equity trading, using spectral regularizers and low-guided high-frequency injection.

entry.title: Limits of n-gram Style Control for LLMs via Logit-Space Injection

author.name: Sami-ul Ahmed

entry.summary: Investigates lightweight style control for LLMs by injecting n-gram priors in logit space at decoding time, finding limited effectiveness compared to fine-tuning approaches.

entry.title: A New Paradigm for Trusted Respiratory Monitoring Via Consumer Electronics-grade Radar Signals

author.name: Xinyu Li, Jinyang Huang, Feng-Qi Cui, Meng Wang, Peng Zhao, Meng Li, Dan Guo, Meng Wang

entry.summary: Tru-RM uses variational mode decomposition and adversarial encryption for privacy-preserving radar-based respiratory monitoring that anonymizes user identity information.

entry.title: Active learning for photonics

author.name: Ryan Lopez, Charlotte Loh, Rumen Dangovski, Marin Solja\v{c}i\'c

entry.summary: Applies analytic Bayesian last layer neural networks with uncertainty-driven active learning for photonic band gap prediction, achieving 2.6x reduction in required training data.

entry.title: Student Mental Health Screening via Fitbit Data Collected During the COVID-19 Pandemic

author.name: Rebecca Lopez, Avantika Shrestha, ML Tlachac, Kevin Hickey, Xingtong Guo, Shichao Liu, Elke Rundensteiner

entry.summary: StudentMEH dataset collected during COVID-19 pandemic enables mental health screening (depression, anxiety, stress) from Fitbit physiological data using machine learning.

entry.title: Experience with Single Domain Generalization in Real World Medical Imaging Deployments

author.name: Ayan Banerjee, Komandoor Srivathsan, and Sandeep K.S. Gupta

entry.summary: Presents real-world deployment experience with Single Domain Generalization for medical imaging, specifically for seizure onset zone detection via fMRI and coronary artery detection via ECG. Addresses domain shift challenges in multi-center clinical studies.

entry.title: A Refinement of Vapnik--Chervonenkis' Theorem

author.name: A. Iosevich, A. Vagharshakyan, and E. Wyman

entry.summary: Provides a refinement of the Vapnik-Chervonenkis theorem by using Berry-Esseen normal approximation instead of Hoeffding's inequality, yielding sharper moderate-deviation estimates.

entry.title: Brownian ReLU(Br-ReLU): A New Activation Function for a Long-Short Term Memory (LSTM) Network

author.name: George Awiakye-Marfo, Elijah Agbosu, Victoria Mawuena Barns, Samuel Asante Gyamerah

entry.summary: Introduces BrownianReLU, a stochastic activation function using Brownian motion for LSTM networks to improve gradient stability on noisy financial time series.

entry.title: PRISM: Purified Representation and Integrated Semantic Modeling for Generative Sequential Recommendation

author.name: Dengzhao Fang, Jingtong Gao, Yu Li, Xiangyu Zhao, Yi Chang

entry.summary: Presents PRISM, a generative sequential recommendation framework that addresses impure semantic tokenization and information loss in existing methods through purified representations and integrated semantic modeling for item sequences.

entry.title: SCHIGAND: A Synthetic Facial Generation Mode Pipeline

author.name: Ananya Kadali, Sunnie Jehan-Morrison, Orasiki Wellington, Barney Evans, Precious Durojaiye, Richard Guest

entry.summary: Presents SCHIGAND, a synthetic face generation pipeline integrating StyleCLIP, HyperStyle, InterfaceGAN, and diffusion models to produce controllable facial datasets for biometric testing while preserving identity and generating realistic variations.

entry.title: REL-SF4PASS: Panoramic Semantic Segmentation with REL Depth Representation and Spherical Fusion

author.name: Xuewei Li, Xinghan Bao, Zhimin Chen, Xi Li

entry.summary: Proposes REL-SF4PASS for panoramic semantic segmentation using a novel REL depth representation in cylindrical coordinates with spherical-dynamic multi-modal fusion for improved scene understanding.

entry.title: No Validation, No Problem: Predicting Model Performance from a Single Gradient

author.name: Fangzheng Wu, Brian Summa

entry.summary: Proposes using the Frobenius norm of classifier-head gradients from a single batch as a validation-free checkpoint selection signal. Shows strong correlation with accuracy across ImageNet CNNs and Transformers.

entry.title: The Possessed Machines (summary)

author.name: L Rudolf L

entry.summary: Summary of 'The Possessed Machines', an anonymous critique of AGI industry culture using Dostoevsky's Demons as framework. Argues the piece identifies important cultural/psychological failures in AI labs.

entry.title: kNN-Graph: An adaptive graph model for $k$-nearest neighbors

author.name: Jiaye Li, Gang Chen, Hang Xu, Shichao Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes kNN-Graph combining HNSW with pre-computed voting mechanism to decouple inference latency from computational complexity for k-nearest neighbors.

entry.title: Integrating Meteorological and Operational Data: A Novel Approach to Understanding Railway Delays in Finland

author.name: Vinicius Pozzobon Borin, Jean Michel de Souza Sant'Ana, Usama Raheel and Nurul Huda Mahmood

entry.summary: Presents the first publicly available dataset combining Finnish railway operations with synchronized meteorological data from 2018-2024, covering 38.5 million observations with 28 engineered features for predicting weather-related train delays.

entry.title: A Unified Calibration Framework for High-Accuracy Articulated Robot Kinematics

author.name: Philip Tobuschat, Simon Duenser, Markus Bambach, Ivo Aschwanden

entry.summary: Presents a unified calibration framework for industrial robot positioning that identifies geometric and non-geometric effects (compliance, thermal, gear errors) using a single experiment, achieving high accuracy with analytic gradients.

entry.title: A Novel Transfer Learning Approach for Mental Stability Classification from Voice Signal

author.name: Rafiul Islam, Md. Taimur Ahad

entry.summary: Proposes transfer learning approach for mental stability classification from voice using CNNs on spectrograms, with pre-training on augmented data before fine-tuning to address data scarcity challenges.

entry.title: How Sequential Algorithm Portfolios can benefit Black Box Optimization

author.name: Catalin-Viorel Dinu, Diederick Vermetten, Carola Doerr

entry.summary: Demonstrates that sequential algorithm portfolios (splitting budget across algorithms without parallel evaluation) consistently outperform single algorithms on BBOB test suite using 200+ algorithms.

entry.title: Learning Successive Interference Cancellation for Low-Complexity Soft-Output MIMO Detection

author.name: Benedikt Fesl and Fatih Capar

entry.summary: Proposes recurSIC, a lightweight learned MIMO detection framework inspired by successive interference cancellation that achieves near-optimal soft-output detection while meeting complexity constraints for IoT and 5G RedCap devices.

entry.title: Automated Road Crack Localization to Guide Highway Maintenance

author.name: Steffen Knoblauch, Ram Kumar Muthusamy, Pedram Ghamisi, Alexander Zipf

entry.title: Incorporating Eye-Tracking Signals Into Multimodal Deep Visual Models For Predicting User Aesthetic Experience In Residential Interiors

entry.title: Calibrated Similarity for Reliable Geometric Analysis of Embedding Spaces

author.name: Nicolas Tacheny
