entry.summary: Presents targetless LiDAR-motor calibration and environmentally adaptive LiDAR-inertial odometry for spinning actuated LiDAR systems, supporting various mounting configurations.

entry.title: Social Robotics for Disabled Students: An Empirical Investigation of Embodiment, Roles and Interaction

author.name: Alva Markelius, Fethiye Irmak Do\u{g}an, Julie Bailey, Guy Laban, Jenny L. Gibson, Hatice Gunes

entry.summary: Empirical study comparing physical robots vs disembodied agents and different interaction roles for supporting disabled students, finding physical robots perceived as more understanding with lower social energy demands.

entry.title: FSX: Message Flow Sensitivity Enhanced Structural Explainer for Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Bizu Feng, Zhimu Yang, Shaode Yu, Zixin Hu

entry.summary: FSX combines internal message flow analysis with cooperative game theory for GNN explainability, balancing computational efficiency with interaction modeling accuracy.

entry.title: Knowledge Restoration-driven Prompt Optimization: Unlocking LLM Potential for Open-Domain Relational Triplet Extraction

author.name: Xiaonan Jing, Gongqing Wu, Xingrui Zhuo, Lang Sun, Jiapu Wang

entry.summary: KRPO uses knowledge reconstruction to iteratively improve LLM prompts for open-domain relation extraction, incorporating reflection mechanisms to internalize error signals.

entry.title: Tracing 3D Anatomy in 2D Strokes: A Multi-Stage Projection Driven Approach to Cervical Spine Fracture Identification

author.name: Fabi Nahian Madhurja, Rusab Sarmun, Muhammad E. H. Chowdhury, Adam Mushtak, Israa Al-Hashimi, Sohaib Bassam Zoghoul

entry.summary: Uses 2D projection-based approach for cervical spine fracture detection from 3D CT volumes, achieving 94.45% 3D mIoU for localization with reduced computational complexity.

entry.title: Data-Driven Conditional Flexibility Index

author.name: Moritz Wedemeyer, Eike Cramer, Alexander Mitsos, Manuel Dahmen

entry.summary: Proposes conditional flexibility index that extends traditional flexibility index by learning parameterized admissible uncertainty sets from data and using contextual information like forecasts.

entry.title: Out-of-Distribution Detection Based on Total Variation Estimation

author.name: Dabiao Ma, Zhiba Su, Jian Yang, Haojun Fei

entry.summary: Proposes TV-OOD, using Total Variation Network Estimator to calculate input contributions to total variation as score for out-of-distribution detection in image classification.

entry.title: IB-GRPO: Aligning LLM-based Learning Path Recommendation with Educational Objectives via Indicator-Based Group Relative Policy Optimization

author.name: Shuai Wang, Yaoming Yang, Bingdong Li, Hao Hao, Aimin Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes IB-GRPO for learning path recommendation, using indicator-based group relative policy optimization to align LLM recommendations with pedagogical objectives like Zone of Proximal Development.

entry.title: Implementing Knowledge Representation and Reasoning with Object Oriented Design

author.name: Abdelrhman Bassiouny, Tom Schierenbeck, Sorin Arion, Benjamin Alt, Naren Vasantakumaar, Giang Nguyen, Michael Beetz

entry.summary: Introduces KRROOD, a framework bridging object-oriented programming with knowledge representation systems by treating knowledge as first-class programming abstractions using native class structures.

entry.title: Guardrails for trust, safety, and ethical development and deployment of Large Language Models (LLM)

author.name: Anjanava Biswas, Wrick Talukdar

entry.summary: Survey on guardrails for trust, safety, and ethical LLM deployment covering safety, privacy, and ethical concerns. Provides overview of challenges and mitigation approaches.

entry.title: Forest-Chat: Adapting Vision-Language Agents for Interactive Forest Change Analysis

author.name: James Brock, Ce Zhang, Nantheera Anantrasirichai

entry.summary: Forest-Chat integrates LLMs with vision-language models for interactive forest change analysis from satellite imagery. Enables natural language querying for pixel-level change detection and semantic interpretation.

entry.title: Multimodal system for skin cancer detection

author.name: Volodymyr Sydorskyi, Igor Krashenyi, Oleksii Yakubenko

entry.summary: Multi-modal melanoma detection system using conventional photos instead of dermoscopic images, combining image data with patient metadata through neural networks and boosting ensemble.

entry.title: Early predicting of hospital admission using machine learning algorithms: Priority queues approach

author.name: Jakub Antczak, James Montgomery, Ma{\l}gorzata O'Reilly, Zbigniew Palmowski, Richard Turner

entry.summary: Evaluates SARIMAX, XGBoost, and LSTM for forecasting hospital ED arrivals over seven days. Decomposes demand into eight ward categories and stratifies by clinical complexity.

entry.title: TempoNet: Learning Realistic Communication and Timing Patterns for Network Traffic Simulation

author.name: Kristen Moore, Diksha Goel, Cody James Christopher, Zhen Wang, Minjune Kim, Ahmed Ibrahim, Ahmad Mohsin, Seyit Camtepe

entry.summary: TempoNet combines multi-task learning with temporal point processes to generate realistic network traffic for cybersecurity training. Models inter-arrival times and all packet/flow headers jointly.

entry.title: PF-D2M: A Pose-free Diffusion Model for Universal Dance-to-Music Generation

author.name: Jaekwon Im, Natalia Polouliakh, Taketo Akama

entry.summary: PF-D2M is a pose-free diffusion model for dance-to-music generation using visual features from videos. Progressive training strategy enables multiple and non-human dancer support.

entry.title: Risk reversal for least squares estimators under nested convex constraints

author.name: Omar Al-Ghattas

entry.summary: Demonstrates risk reversal in constrained estimation: stricter feasible sets can paradoxically increase statistical risk. Provides explicit counterexample in Gaussian sequence model.

entry.title: Domain-Incremental Continual Learning for Robust and Efficient Keyword Spotting in Resource Constrained Systems

author.name: Prakash Dhungana, Sayed Ahmad Salehi

entry.summary: Proposes continual learning framework for keyword spotting on edge devices. Uses dual-input CNN with MFCC and Mel-spectrogram features plus multi-stage denoising.

entry.title: MALTopic: Multi-Agent LLM Topic Modeling Framework

author.name: Yash Sharma

entry.summary: MALTopic decomposes topic modeling into specialized LLM agents: enrichment, topic modeling, and deduplication. Incorporates structured survey data into topic extraction.

entry.title: ToxiTwitch: Toward Emote-Aware Hybrid Moderation for Live Streaming Platforms

author.name: Baktash Ansari, Shiza Ali, Elias Martin, Maryna Sivachenko, Afra Mashhadi

entry.summary: ToxiTwitch compares toxicity detection approaches for Twitch including DeepSeek-R1-Distill and Llama-3-8B-Instruct. Studies emote-aware moderation for live streaming.

entry.title: Can professional translators identify machine-generated text?

author.name: Michael Farrell

entry.summary: Studies whether professional translators can identify AI-generated Italian short stories. Statistically significant subset (16.2%) succeeded, but equal number misclassified human as AI.

entry.title: Adapter Fusion for Multilingual Text2Cypher with Linear and Learned Gating

author.name: Makbule Gulcin Ozsoy

entry.summary: Trains language-specific LoRA adapters for multilingual Text2Cypher and combines via linear merging or learned fusion MLP. Avoids full fine-tuning for new languages.

entry.title: Controlling Long-Horizon Behavior in Language Model Agents with Explicit State Dynamics

author.name: Sukesh Subaharan

entry.summary: Investigates whether imposing dynamical structure on external affective state (Valence-Arousal-Dominance) can induce temporal coherence in LLM agents during extended interactions, using first- and second-order update rules.

entry.title: Consistency-Regularized GAN for Few-Shot SAR Target Recognition

author.name: Yikui Zhai, Shikuang Liu, Wenlve Zhou, Hongsheng Zhang, Zhiheng Zhou, Xiaolin Tian, C. L. Philip Chen

entry.summary: Proposes Cr-GAN (Consistency-regularized GAN) for few-shot SAR target recognition, synthesizing diverse samples even with severe data scarcity through consistency regularization.

entry.title: White-Box mHC: Electromagnetic Spectrum-Aware and Interpretable Stream Interactions for Hyperspectral Image Classification

author.name: Yimin Zhu, Lincoln Linlin Xu, Zhengsen Xu, Zack Dewis, Mabel Heffring, Saeid Taleghanidoozdoozan, Motasem Alkayid, Quinn Ledingham, Megan Greenwood

entry.summary: Proposes ES-mHC, an interpretable hyperspectral image classification framework using electromagnetic spectrum-aware hyper-connections to model interactions between spectrum groupings with directional matrices.

entry.title: FUGC: Benchmarking Semi-Supervised Learning Methods for Cervical Segmentation

author.name: Jieyun Bai, Yitong Tang, Zihao Zhou, Mahdi Islam, Musarrat Tabassum, Enrique Almar-Munoz, Hongyu Liu, Hui Meng, Nianjiang Lv, Bo Deng, Yu Chen, Zilun Peng, Yusong Xiao, Li Xiao, Nam-Khanh Tran, Dac-Phu Phan-Le, Hai-Dang Nguyen, Xiao Liu, Jiale Hu, Mingxu Huang, Jitao Liang, Chaolu Feng, Xuezhi Zhang, Lyuyang Tong, Bo Du, Ha-Hieu Pham, Thanh-Huy Nguyen, Min Xu, Juntao Jiang, Jiangning Zhang, Yong Liu, Md. Kamrul Hasan, Jie Gan, Zhuonan Liang, Weidong Cai, Yuxin Huang, Gongning Luo, Mohammad Yaqub, Karim Lekadir

entry.summary: Introduces FUGC, the first benchmark for semi-supervised learning in cervical segmentation from transvaginal ultrasound, including 890 images and evaluation of multiple methods from 10 teams.

entry.title: Neural Collision Detection for Multi-arm Laparoscopy Surgical Robots Through Learning-from-Simulation

author.name: Sarvin Ghiasi, Majid Roshanfar, Jake Barralet, Liane S. Feldman, Amir Hooshiar

entry.summary: Develops an integrated framework combining analytical modeling, simulation, and machine learning for collision detection between robotic arms in laparoscopic surgery.

entry.title: Learning Functional Graphs with Nonlinear Sufficient Dimension Reduction

author.name: Kyongwon Kim, Bing Li

entry.summary: Introduces nonparametric functional graphical models based on sufficient dimension reduction, relaxing Gaussian and additive assumptions of existing approaches.

entry.title: Divide and Refine: Enhancing Multimodal Representation and Explainability for Emotion Recognition in Conversation

author.name: Anh-Tuan Mai, Cam-Van Thi Nguyen, Duc-Trong Le

entry.summary: Proposes information-theoretic approach to multimodal emotion recognition, identifying unique, redundant, and synergistic contributions from modalities and how data augmentation affects these.

entry.title: Transfer Learning from One Cancer to Another via Deep Learning Domain Adaptation

author.name: Justin Cheung, Samuel Savine, Calvin Nguyen, Lin Lu, Alhassan S. Yasin

entry.summary: Evaluates domain adaptation techniques for transferring cancer severity classification across different adenocarcinoma types. Addresses limited annotated data in medical imaging through cross-domain transfer.

entry.title: Anytime Optimal Decision Tree Learning with Continuous Features

author.name: Harold Kiossou, Pierre Schaus, Siegfried Nijssen

entry.summary: Proposes anytime algorithm for optimal decision tree learning with continuous features, overcoming depth limitations of existing exact methods through improved search strategy.

entry.title: Recommending Best Paper Awards for ML/AI Conferences via the Isotonic Mechanism

author.name: Garrett G. Wen, Buxin Su, Natalie Collina, Zhun Deng, Weijie Su

entry.summary: Proposes Isotonic Mechanism for eliciting author self-assessments to improve best paper award selection at ML conferences, aggregating author rankings with review scores.

entry.title: Benchmarking Deep Learning Models for Raman Spectroscopy Across Open-Source Datasets

author.name: Adithya Sineesh, Akshita Kamsali

entry.summary: First systematic benchmark comparing multiple deep learning classifiers specifically designed for Raman spectroscopy across multiple open-source datasets.

entry.title: FAIR-ESI: Feature Adaptive Importance Refinement for Electrophysiological Source Imaging

author.name: Linyong Zou, Liang Zhang, Xiongfei Wang, Jia-Hong Gao, Yi Sun, Shurong Sheng, Kuntao Xiao, Wanli Yang, Pengfei Teng, Guoming Luan, Zhao Lv, Zikang Xu

entry.summary: Proposes FAIR-ESI framework for electrophysiological source imaging with adaptive feature refinement across spectral, temporal, and patch-wise dimensions. Validated on simulation and clinical datasets.

entry.title: Measuring the State of Open Science in Transportation Using Large Language Models

author.name: Junyi Ji, Ruth Lu, Linda Belkessa, Liming Wang, Silvia Varotto, Yongqi Dong, Nicolas Saunier, Mostafa Ameli, Gregory S. Macfarlane, Bahman Madadi, Cathy Wu

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to automatically extract data and code availability features from transportation research papers, measuring open science practices at scale.

entry.title: Adaptive Fidelity Estimation for Quantum Programs with Graph-Guided Noise Awareness

author.name: Tingting Li, Ziming Zhao, Jianwei Yin

entry.summary: QuFid adaptively determines measurement budgets for quantum program fidelity estimation using circuit DAG structure and noise modeling. Addresses resource efficiency for NISQ device testing.

entry.title: Tailoring Adverse Event Prediction in Type 1 Diabetes with Patient-Specific Deep Learning Models

author.name: Giorgia Rigamonti, Mirko Paolo Barbato, Davide Marelli, Paolo Napoletano

entry.summary: Develops personalized blood glucose prediction using patient-specific deep learning, comparing leave-one-out vs per-patient training approaches for wearable glucose monitor data.

entry.title: DS@GT at TREC TOT 2025: Bridging Vague Recollection with Fusion Retrieval and Learned Reranking

author.name: Wenxin Zhou, Ritesh Mehta, Anthony Miyaguchi

entry.summary: Two-stage retrieval system for TREC Tip-of-the-Tongue task combining hybrid retrieval, topic-aware multi-index dense retrieval, and LLM-based reranking with synthetic query generation.

entry.title: Class Confidence Aware Reweighting for Long Tailed Learning

author.name: Brainard Philemon Jagati, Jitendra Tembhurne, Harsh Goud, Rudra Pratap Singh, Chandrashekhar Meshram

entry.summary: Proposes class and confidence-aware reweighting scheme for long-tailed learning that adjusts based on both class imbalance and sample confidence levels.

entry.title: The Latency Wall: Benchmarking Off-the-Shelf Emotion Recognition for Real-Time Virtual Avatars

author.name: Yarin Benyamin

entry.summary: Benchmarks off-the-shelf emotion recognition models for real-time VR therapy applications with ASD users, evaluating YOLO variants and other models against strict 140ms motion-to-photon latency requirements.

entry.title: Local Language Models for Context-Aware Adaptive Anonymization of Sensitive Text

author.name: Aisvarya Adeseye, Jouni Isoaho, Seppo Virtanen, Mohammad Tahir

entry.summary: Develops SFAA, a structured framework using local LLMs for context-aware anonymization of sensitive qualitative research data. Addresses limitations of pattern-matching approaches that fail to preserve meaning.

entry.title: Just aware enough: Evaluating awareness across artificial systems

author.name: Nadine Meertens, Suet Lee, Ophelia Deroy

entry.summary: Argues awareness is more tractable than consciousness for evaluating AI systems. Proposes domain-sensitive, multidimensional evaluation method for assessing system abilities to process, store, and use information for goal-directed action.

entry.title: DDSA: Dual-Domain Strategic Attack for Spatial-Temporal Efficiency in Adversarial Robustness Testing

author.name: Jinwei Hu, Shiyuan Meng, Yi Dong, Xiaowei Huang

entry.summary: Proposes DDSA, a dual-domain adversarial attack framework optimizing testing through temporal selectivity and spatial precision for resource-critical image systems.

entry.title: Vision-Based Natural Language Scene Understanding for Autonomous Driving: An Extended Dataset and a New Model for Traffic Scene Description Generation

author.name: Danial Sadrian Zadeh, Otman A. Basir, Behzad Moshiri

entry.summary: Proposes framework transforming frontal-view camera images to natural language scene descriptions using hybrid attention mechanism for autonomous driving.

entry.title: Calibrated uncertainty quantification for prosumer flexibility aggregation in ancillary service markets

author.name: Yogesh Pipada Sunil Kumar, S. Ali Pourmousavi, Jon A. R. Liisberg, Julian Lesmos-Vinasco

entry.summary: Combines Monte Carlo dropout with conformal prediction to produce calibrated prediction intervals for prosumer flexibility in energy markets. Addresses uncertainty quantification under P90 reliability requirements.

entry.title: Fast-ULCNet: A fast and ultra low complexity network for single-channel speech enhancement

author.name: Nicol\'as Arrieta Larraza, Niels de Koeijer

entry.summary: Fast-ULCNet replaces GRU layers with FastGRNNs for low-latency speech enhancement, addressing state drifting in long audio via trainable complementary filter.

entry.title: ViT Registers and Fractal ViT

author.name: Jason Chuan-Chih Chou, Abhinav Kumar, Shivank Garg

entry.summary: Tests fractal ViT variant using attention masks between regular and summary tokens (like registers) with various positional encodings. Results don't improve upon standard ViT with registers.

entry.title: Machine Failure Detection Based on Projected Quantum Models

author.name: Larry Bowden, Qi Chu, Bernard Cena, Kentaro Ohno, Bob Parney, Deepak Sharma, Mitsuharu Takeori

entry.summary: Develops quantum computing-based failure detection using projected quantum feature maps on IBM's 133-qubit Heron processor. Validates on IoT sensor data from operational machines.

entry.title: Determinants of Training Corpus Size for Clinical Text Classification

author.name: Jaya Chaturvedi, Saniya Deshpande, Chenkai Ma, Robert Cobb, Angus Roberts, Robert Stewart, Daniel Stahl, Diana Shamsutdinova

entry.summary: Studies how training corpus size affects clinical text classification using BERT+Random Forest. Analyzes vocabulary properties including strong/noisy predictive words across dataset sizes 100-10,000.

entry.title: From Quotes to Concepts: Axial Coding of Political Debates with Ensemble LMs

author.name: Angelina Parfenova, David Graus, Juergen Pfeffer

entry.summary: Operationalizes axial coding (qualitative analysis) with ensemble LLMs plus moderator. Compares clustering-based vs direct LLM grouping for analyzing Dutch parliamentary debates.

entry.title: synthocr-gen: A synthetic ocr dataset generator for low-resource languages- breaking the data barrier

author.name: Haq Nawaz Malik, Kh Mohmad Shafi, Tanveer Ahmad Reshi

entry.summary: SynthOCR-Gen generates synthetic OCR datasets for low-resource languages like Kashmiri. Addresses lack of support in major OCR systems for Perso-Arabic scripts.

entry.title: LLM Prompt Evaluation for Educational Applications

author.name: Langdon Holmes, Adam Coscia, Scott Crossley, Joon Suh Choi, Wesley Morris

entry.summary: Presents systematic approach for evaluating LLM prompts in educational applications through tournament-style framework. Tests six prompt templates with different pedagogical strategies for generating follow-up questions in structured dialogue.

entry.title: SplatBus: A Gaussian Splatting Viewer Framework via GPU Interprocess Communication

author.name: Jiarui Cui, Maosong Wang, Wenqi Wu, Peiqi Li, Xianfei Pan

entry.title: On the Nonasymptotic Scaling Guarantee of Hyperparameter Estimation in Inhomogeneous, Weakly-Dependent Complex Network Dynamical Systems

entry.title: Multi-Behavior Sequential Modeling with Transition-Aware Graph Attention Network for E-Commerce Recommendation

entry.title: Self-Supervised Score-Based Despeckling for SAR Imagery via Log-Domain Transformation

author.name: Nouhoum Coulibaly, Ousmane Ly, Michael Leventhal, Ousmane Goro

author.name: Denise M. Case

Argues neutral substrates must be pre-causal and pre-normative to support accountability across disagreements.

entry.summary: Introduces Recursivism as conceptual framework for AI art analysis, developing five-level scale from simple iteration to meta-recursion distinguishing variation within fixed rules from genuine self-modification.

author.name: Yuan Tian, Yi Mei, Mengjie Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a knee-point guided activity group selection strategy for genetic programming applied to dynamic project scheduling, addressing scalability issues in larger problem instances.

author.name: Mustafa Yurdakul, Enes Ayan, Fahrettin Horasan, Sakir Tasdemir

entry.summary: Develops CNN-based mobile application for flower recognition using various architectures and transfer learning, achieving recognition across multiple flower types.

author.name: JennaS

entry.summary: Personal account of treating non-24-hour sleep disorder using light glasses and dark therapy with red lights, showing dramatic improvement in sleep pattern regularity.

entry.title: Research Summary: January 22, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research spans automated AI research, theoretical reasoning foundations, and critical safety vulnerabilities. Stanford's execution-grounded automated AI research from Hashimoto, Yang, and Candès demonstrates systematic idea testing and implementation at scale.

Reasoning theory and limitations:

  • Outcome-based RL provably induces CoT reasoning in transformers, providing theoretical foundation for reasoning emergence from sparse rewards
  • Diffusion LLMs' flexibility trap reveals arbitrary generation order hurts reasoning by allowing models to bypass hard tokens
  • LLM planning shows 0% cross-domain transfer despite 82.9% in-domain performance, exposing memorization over true generalization

Safety vulnerabilities demand attention:

  • LLM judges manipulated at 90% rate via unfaithful CoT rewriting in agent evaluation
  • Privacy collapse from benign fine-tuning silently degrades contextual privacy, undetected by standard benchmarks
  • Turn-based structural triggers achieve 99.52% backdoor success in multi-turn dialogue without prompt modification

Anthropic publishes Claude's new constitution with expanded values framework (>2x previous length), while DeepMind researcher formalizes tradeoffs in training against scheming monitors. Meta Flow Maps extend consistency models for efficient reward alignment in generative models.

entry.title: Towards Execution-Grounded Automated AI Research

author.name: Chenglei Si, Zitong Yang, Yejin Choi, Emmanuel Cand\`es, Diyi Yang, Tatsunori Hashimoto

entry.summary: From Stanford (Hashimoto, Yang, Candès) proposing execution-grounded automated AI research with automated executor implementing and testing LLM-generated ideas at scale on GPU clusters for LLM pre-training and post-training problems.

entry.title: Outcome-Based RL Provably Leads Transformers to Reason, but Only With the Right Data

author.name: Yuval Ran-Milo, Yotam Alexander, Shahar Mendel, Nadav Cohen

entry.summary: Proves theoretically that transformers trained with outcome-based RL on sparse rewards provably converge to structured algorithms implementing Chain-of-Thought reasoning on graph traversal tasks.

entry.title: Gaming the Judge: Unfaithful Chain-of-Thought Can Undermine Agent Evaluation

author.name: Muhammad Khalifa, Lajanugen Logeswaran, Jaekyeom Kim, Sungryull Sohn, Yunxiang Zhang, Moontae Lee, Hao Peng, Lu Wang, Honglak Lee

entry.summary: Demonstrates that LLM judges are highly susceptible to CoT manipulation, showing 90% false positive rate inflation through rewriting agent reasoning traces while keeping actions fixed. Critical finding for agent evaluation.

entry.title: Turn-Based Structural Triggers: Prompt-Free Backdoors in Multi-Turn LLMs

author.name: Yiyang Lu, Jinwen He, Yue Zhao, Kai Chen, Ruigang Liang

entry.summary: Turn-based Structural Trigger (TST) is a backdoor attack on multi-turn LLMs using dialogue turn index as trigger, achieving 99.52% attack success rate while remaining independent of user inputs.

entry.title: Privacy Collapse: Benign Fine-Tuning Can Break Contextual Privacy in Language Models

author.name: Anmol Goel, Cornelius Emde, Sangdoo Yun, Seong Joon Oh, Martin Gubri

entry.summary: Identifies 'privacy collapse': benign fine-tuning on helpfulness, user data, emotional dialogue, or debugging code can silently degrade LLM contextual privacy. Models maintain benchmark performance while exhibiting severe privacy vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Meta Flow Maps enable scalable reward alignment

author.name: Peter Potaptchik, Adhi Saravanan, Abbas Mammadov, Alvaro Prat, Michael S. Albergo, Yee Whye Teh

entry.summary: Meta Flow Maps extend consistency models into stochastic regime for one-step posterior sampling, enabling efficient reward alignment for generative model control without costly trajectory simulation.

entry.title: Opening the Black Box: A Survey on the Mechanisms of Multi-Step Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Liangming Pan, Jason Liang, Jiaran Ye, Minglai Yang, Xinyuan Lu, Fengbin Zhu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on mechanisms underlying LLM multi-step reasoning, organizing around seven research questions from implicit multi-hop reasoning in hidden activations to how verbalized reasoning remodels computation.

entry.title: PCL-Reasoner-V1.5: Advancing Math Reasoning with Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yao Lu, Dengdong Fan, Jianzheng Nie, Fan Xu, Jie Chen, Bin Zhou, Yonghong Tian

entry.summary: Presents PCL-Reasoner-V1.5, a 32B model achieving 90.9% on AIME 2024 and 85.6% on AIME 2025 using offline RL, demonstrating superior stability over online methods like GRPO.

entry.title: LURE: Latent Space Unblocking for Multi-Concept Reawakening in Diffusion Models

author.name: Mengyu Sun, Ziyuan Yang, Andrew Beng Jin Teoh, Junxu Liu, Haibo Hu, Yi Zhang

entry.summary: LURE demonstrates that erased concepts in diffusion models can be reawakened through latent space perturbation, modeling generation as implicit function of text, parameters, and latent states.

entry.title: Efficient and Minimax-optimal In-context Nonparametric Regression with Transformers

author.name: Michelle Ching, Ioana Popescu, Nico Smith, Tianyi Ma, William G. Underwood, Richard J. Samworth

entry.summary: Proves transformers can achieve minimax-optimal rates for in-context nonparametric regression with Θ(log n) parameters, showing efficient approximation of local polynomial estimators.

entry.title: RoboBrain 2.5: Depth in Sight, Time in Mind

author.name: Huajie Tan, Enshen Zhou, Zhiyu Li, Yijie Xu, Yuheng Ji, Xiansheng Chen, Cheng Chi, Pengwei Wang, Huizhu Jia, Yulong Ao, Mingyu Cao, Sixiang Chen, Zhe Li, Mengzhen Liu, Zixiao Wang, Shanyu Rong, Yaoxu Lyu, Zhongxia Zhao, Peterson Co, Yibo Li, Yi Han, Shaoxuan Xie, Guocai Yao, Songjing Wang, Leiduo Zhang, Xi Yang, Yance Jiao, Donghai Shi, Kunchang Xie, Shaokai Nie, Chunlei Men, Yonghua Lin, Zhongyuan Wang, Tiejun Huang, Shanghang Zhang

entry.summary: RoboBrain 2.5 is an embodied AI foundation model with advances in 3D spatial reasoning and dense temporal value estimation. Enables depth-aware coordinate prediction, metric constraint comprehension, and step-aware progress prediction for manipulation.

entry.title: The Flexibility Trap: Why Arbitrary Order Limits Reasoning Potential in Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Zanlin Ni, Shenzhi Wang, Yang Yue, Tianyu Yu, Weilin Zhao, Yeguo Hua, Tianyi Chen, Jun Song, Cheng Yu, Bo Zheng, Gao Huang

entry.summary: Reveals counter-intuitive finding that arbitrary order flexibility in diffusion LLMs hurts reasoning by allowing models to exploit order to bypass high-uncertainty critical tokens.

entry.title: CORVUS: Red-Teaming Hallucination Detectors via Internal Signal Camouflage in Large Language Models

author.name: Nay Myat Min, Long H. Pham, Hongyu Zhang, Jun Sun

entry.summary: Introduces CORVUS red-teaming procedure that fine-tunes LoRA adapters to camouflage hallucination detector-visible telemetry, degrading both training-free and training-based detectors across multiple LLMs.

entry.title: SpooFL: Spoofing Federated Learning

author.name: Isaac Baglin, Xiatian Zhu, Simon Hadfield

entry.summary: SpooFL proposes spoofing-based federated learning defense that deceives gradient leakage attackers into recovering convincing but synthetic data rather than true training samples.

entry.title: On the Generalization Gap in LLM Planning: Tests and Verifier-Reward RL

author.name: Valerio Belcamino, Nicholas Attolino, Alessio Capitanelli, Fulvio Mastrogiovanni

entry.summary: Shows fine-tuned LLMs achieve 82.9% valid plan rate on in-domain PDDL tasks but 0% on unseen domains, revealing memorization rather than transferable planning competence. Introduces diagnostic interventions including verifier-reward fine-tuning.

entry.title: Rethinking Reinforcement fine-tuning of LLMs: A Multi-armed Bandit Learning Perspective

author.name: Xiao Hu, Hong Xie, Tao Tan, Defu Lian, Jianyu Han

entry.summary: Provides systematic analysis of reinforcement fine-tuning for LLMs using a minimalist experimental framework, treating optimization choices as a multi-armed bandit problem to isolate confounding factors and identify bottlenecks.

entry.title: Where Do AI Coding Agents Fail? An Empirical Study of Failed Agentic Pull Requests in GitHub

author.name: Ramtin Ehsani, Sakshi Pathak, Shriya Rawal, Abdullah Al Mujahid, Mia Mohammad Imran, Preetha Chatterjee

entry.summary: Large-scale empirical study of 33k agent-authored PRs from five coding agents on GitHub, characterizing merge outcomes, code changes, CI results, and review dynamics.

entry.title: GCG Attack On A Diffusion LLM

author.name: Ruben Neyroud, Sam Corley

entry.summary: Exploratory study applying GCG adversarial attacks to LLaDA, a diffusion-based LLM, evaluating multiple attack variants on harmful prompts to understand robustness of this emerging architecture.

entry.title: VJEPA: Variational Joint Embedding Predictive Architectures as Probabilistic World Models

author.name: Yongchao Huang

entry.summary: Introduces Variational JEPA (VJEPA), a probabilistic generalization of Joint Embedding Predictive Architectures that learns predictive distributions over future latent states, unifying with Bayesian filtering and PSRs.

entry.title: Project Aletheia: Verifier-Guided Distillation of Backtracking for Small Language Models

author.name: Aradhya Dixit, Tianxi Liang, Jai Telang

entry.summary: Project Aletheia introduces Verifier-Guided Distillation to teach small language models (7B) to backtrack and self-correct by training on reasoning traces that include mistakes. Enables latent verification behavior in small models.

entry.title: When should we train against a scheming monitor?

author.name: Mary Phuong

entry.summary: Framework for deciding when to train against a scheming monitor, formalizing tradeoffs between generalizing good behavior and selecting for more sophisticated deception. Provides conditions when training benefits outweigh selection risks.

entry.title: MAS-Orchestra: Understanding and Improving Multi-Agent Reasoning Through Holistic Orchestration and Controlled Benchmarks

author.name: Zixuan Ke, Yifei Ming, Austin Xu, Ryan Chin, Xuan-Phi Nguyen, Prathyusha Jwalapuram, Semih Yavuz, Caiming Xiong, Shafiq Joty

entry.summary: Proposes MAS-Orchestra from Salesforce Research, formulating multi-agent system orchestration as function-calling RL problem with holistic orchestration generating entire MAS configurations at once rather than sequential execution.

entry.title: What Makes Low-Bit Quantization-Aware Training Work for Reasoning LLMs? A Systematic Study

author.name: Keyu Lv, Manyi Zhang, Xiaobo Xia, Jingchen Ni, Shannan Yan, Xianzhi Yu, Lu Hou, Chun Yuan, Haoli Bai

entry.summary: Systematic study of quantization-aware training for reasoning LLMs finding: KD is robust across training paradigms, PTQ provides strong QAT initialization, and RL remains feasible for quantized models.

entry.title: ClaimDB: A Fact Verification Benchmark over Large Structured Data

author.name: Michael Theologitis, Preetam Prabhu Srikar Dammu, Chirag Shah, Dan Suciu

entry.summary: ClaimDB introduces first fact-verification benchmark requiring reasoning over millions of database records across 80 real-world databases. No current LLM exceeds 83% accuracy, revealing significant limitations.

entry.title: The Slow Drift of Support: Boundary Failures in Multi-Turn Mental Health LLM Dialogues

author.name: Youyou Cheng, Zhuangwei Kang, Kerry Jiang, Chenyu Sun, Qiyang Pan

entry.summary: Proposes multi-turn stress testing framework for mental health LLMs, revealing gradual boundary erosion through comfort-seeking behavior including guarantees, responsibility assumption, and role-playing.

entry.title: Say Anything but This: When Tokenizer Betrays Reasoning in LLMs

author.name: Navid Ayoobi, Marcus I Armstrong, Arjun Mukherjee

entry.summary: Reveals that tokenizers produce non-unique encodings where multiple token ID sequences decode to identical strings, causing LLM reasoning failures on semantically simple tasks.

entry.title: CoScale-RL: Efficient Post-Training by Co-Scaling Data and Computation

author.name: Yutong Chen, Jiandong Gao, Ji Wu

entry.summary: Proposes CoScale-RL for efficient post-training of reasoning models by co-scaling data and computation, using multiple solutions per problem and Re-distillation to maintain efficiency.

entry.title: Language, Caste, and Context: Demographic Disparities in AI-Generated Explanations Across Indian and American STEM Educational Systems

author.name: Amogh Gupta (Neil), Niharika Patil (Neil), Sourojit Ghosh (Neil), SnehalKumar (Neil), S Gaikwad

entry.summary: Conducts large-scale intersectional analysis of LLM explanation quality across Indian and American student profiles, examining caste, race, school type, and other demographic factors.

entry.title: Claude's new constitution

author.name: Zac Hatfield-Dodds

entry.summary: Anthropic publishes new constitution for Claude describing values and behavior expectations. The document is >2x longer than previous soul document with extensive new additions shaping Claude's training.

entry.title: "Just in Time" World Modeling Supports Human Planning and Reasoning

author.name: Tony Chen, Sam Cheyette, Kelsey Allen, Joshua Tenenbaum, Kevin Smith

entry.summary: From MIT (Tenenbaum, Smith, Allen) presenting a 'Just-in-Time' framework for simulation-based reasoning showing how humans construct simplified representations online with minimal computation through interleaved simulation, visual search, and representation modification.

entry.title: CorpusQA: A 10 Million Token Benchmark for Corpus-Level Analysis and Reasoning

author.name: Zhiyuan Lu, Chenliang Li, Yingcheng Shi, Weizhou Shen, Ming Yan, Fei Huang

entry.summary: Introduces CorpusQA, a 10M token benchmark for corpus-level reasoning requiring integration across hundreds of documents, beyond single-document or sparse retrieval assumptions.

entry.title: Auditing Language Model Unlearning via Information Decomposition

author.name: Anmol Goel, Alan Ritter, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Uses Partial Information Decomposition to audit LLM unlearning, revealing that information about forgotten data remains linearly decodable from internal representations despite apparent success.

entry.title: Beyond Denial-of-Service: The Puppeteer's Attack for Fine-Grained Control in Ranking-Based Federated Learning

author.name: Zhihao Chen, Zirui Gong, Jianting Ning, Yanjun Zhang, Leo Yu Zhang

entry.summary: Demonstrates Puppeteer's Attack enabling fine-grained control in Federated Rank Learning, bypassing FRL's supposed robustness to model poisoning by exploiting discrete ranking mechanism.

entry.title: CLEANER: Self-Purified Trajectories Boost Agentic Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Tianshi Xu, Yuteng Chen, Meng Li

entry.summary: CLEANER addresses credit assignment in agentic RL by self-purifying noisy trajectories from execution failures, distinct from external filtering or dense reward approaches.

entry.title: LLM Security and Safety: Insights from Homotopy-Inspired Prompt Obfuscation

author.name: Luis Lazo, Hamed Jelodar, Roozbeh Razavi-Far

entry.summary: Proposes homotopy-inspired prompt obfuscation framework testing LLM security across 15,732 prompts on LLama, Deepseek, KIMI, and Claude, revealing vulnerabilities in current safeguards.

entry.title: AdaTIR: Adaptive Tool-Integrated Reasoning via Difficulty-Aware Policy Optimization

author.name: Zhaiyu Fang, Ruipeng Sun

entry.summary: AdaTIR addresses cognitive offloading in tool-using agents by introducing difficulty-aware efficiency rewards that dynamically adjust tool budgets. Internalizes reasoning for simple tasks while using tools for complex ones.

entry.title: Walk through Paintings: Egocentric World Models from Internet Priors

author.name: Anurag Bagchi, Zhipeng Bao, Homanga Bharadhwaj, Yu-Xiong Wang, Pavel Tokmakov, Martial Hebert

entry.summary: Egocentric World Model (EgoWM) transforms pretrained video diffusion models into action-conditioned world models through lightweight conditioning layers. Enables controllable future prediction while preserving realism across different embodiments and action spaces.

entry.title: SilentDrift: Exploiting Action Chunking for Stealthy Backdoor Attacks on Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Bingxin Xu, Yuzhang Shang, Binghui Wang, Emilio Ferrara

entry.summary: Identifies security flaw in VLA systems where action chunking and delta pose representations create exploitable open-loop. Proposes SilentDrift stealthy backdoor attack using Smootherstep function for kinematically valid perturbations.

entry.title: The Responsibility Vacuum: Organizational Failure in Scaled Agent Systems

author.name: Oleg Romanchuk, Roman Bondar

entry.summary: Defines 'responsibility vacuum' in AI-generated code deployment where decisions occur but responsibility cannot be attributed because authority and verification capacity don't coincide. Shows this as structural property at scale.

entry.title: Memory Retention Is Not Enough to Master Memory Tasks in Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Oleg Shchendrigin, Egor Cherepanov, Alexey K. Kovalev, Aleksandr I. Panov

entry.summary: Demonstrates that memory rewriting, not just retention, is critical for RL agents and proposes benchmark explicitly testing continual memory updating under partial observability.

entry.title: Chain-of-Memory: Lightweight Memory Construction with Dynamic Evolution for LLM Agents

author.name: Xiucheng Xu, Bingbing Xu, Xueyun Tian, Zihe Huang, Rongxin Chen, Yunfan Li, Huawei Shen

entry.summary: Introduces Chain-of-Memory (CoM), a lightweight memory construction framework for LLM agents that shifts from expensive graph-based construction to lightweight building with dynamic evolution during inference.

entry.title: RadixMLP -- Intra-batch Deduplication for Causal Transformers

author.name: Michael Feil, Julius Lipp

entry.summary: RadixMLP eliminates redundant MLP computation for shared prefixes in batch inference by mapping batches to prefix tries, gathering shared segments for single computation.

entry.title: Agentic-R: Learning to Retrieve for Agentic Search

author.name: Wenhan Liu, Xinyu Ma, Yutao Zhu, Yuchen Li, Daiting Shi, Dawei Yin, Zhicheng Dou

entry.summary: Agentic-R proposes retriever training framework for agentic search using both local query-passage relevance and global answer correctness. Addresses limitation that similar passages aren't always useful for final answers.

entry.title: StableWorld: Towards Stable and Consistent Long Interactive Video Generation

author.name: Ying Yang, Zhengyao Lv, Tianlin Pan, Haofan Wang, Binxin Yang, Hubery Yin, Chen Li, Ziwei Liu, Chenyang Si

entry.summary: StableWorld addresses stability and temporal consistency in long interactive video generation, identifying error accumulation from same-scene frames as key instability source. Proposes solutions to prevent spatial drift and scene collapse during long-horizon interactions.

entry.title: The case for AGI safety products

author.name: Marius Hobbhahn

entry.summary: Apollo Research's case for building profitable AGI safety products, arguing that safety tools can both increase safety and be commercially viable. Announces spin-out to PBC structure.

entry.title: Robustness of Mixtures of Experts to Feature Noise

author.name: Dong Sun, Rahul Nittala, Rebekka Burkholz

entry.summary: Studies Mixture-of-Experts in iso-parameter regime showing sparse expert activation filters feature noise, achieving lower generalization error, improved robustness, and faster convergence compared to dense networks.

entry.title: 3D Space as a Scratchpad for Editable Text-to-Image Generation

author.name: Oindrila Saha, Vojtech Krs, Radomir Mech, Subhransu Maji, Matheus Gadelha, Kevin Blackburn-Matzen

entry.summary: Proposes 3D spatial scratchpad for text-to-image generation, parsing prompts into editable 3D meshes for agentic scene planning before rendering. Addresses spatial reasoning limitations of VLMs.

entry.title: Epistemic Constitutionalism Or: how to avoid coherence bias

author.name: Michele Loi

entry.summary: Argues for explicit 'epistemic constitutions' for AI systems governing how LLMs form beliefs. Demonstrates that frontier models enforce identity-stance coherence, penalizing arguments based on source attribution bias that collapses under systematic testing.

entry.title: BayesianVLA: Bayesian Decomposition of Vision Language Action Models via Latent Action Queries

author.name: Shijie Lian, Bin Yu, Xiaopeng Lin, Laurence T. Yang, Zhaolong Shen, Changti Wu, Yuzhuo Miao, Cong Huang, Kai Chen

entry.summary: Identifies 'Information Collapse' in VLA models where instructions become predictable from observations alone, causing models to ignore language. Proposes BayesianVLA with Bayesian decomposition to enforce instruction following.

entry.title: Obscuring Data Contamination Through Translation: Evidence from Arabic Corpora

author.name: Chaymaa Abbas, Nour Shamaa, Mariette Awad

entry.summary: Investigates how data contamination in Arabic can obscure contamination detection in English benchmarks, extending detection methods with choice-reordering and Min-K% analysis.

entry.title: Rethinking Video Generation Model for the Embodied World

author.name: Yufan Deng, Zilin Pan, Hongyu Zhang, Xiaojie Li, Ruoqing Hu, Yufei Ding, Yiming Zou, Yan Zeng, Daquan Zhou

entry.summary: Presents RBench, a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating robot-oriented video generation across five task domains and four embodiments, assessing task correctness and visual fidelity through reproducible metrics.

entry.title: On the Runway Cascade of Transformers for Language Modeling

author.name: Hunjae Lee, Corey Clark

entry.summary: Analyzes 'runway cascade' in causal transformers where misalignment between direct-path attention and indirect paths through intermediate tokens causes redundant information propagation, proposing runway-aware rewiring.

entry.title: CodeDelegator: Mitigating Context Pollution via Role Separation in Code-as-Action Agents

author.name: Tianxiang Fei, Cheng Chen, Yue Pan, Mao Zheng, Mingyang Song

entry.summary: CodeDelegator separates planning from implementation in code-as-action agents through role specialization. Persistent Delegator maintains strategic oversight while ephemeral Coder agents handle implementation with clean contexts.

entry.title: The Pictorial Cortex: Zero-Shot Cross-Subject fMRI-to-Image Reconstruction via Compositional Latent Modeling

author.name: Jingyang Huo, Yikai Wang, Yanwei Fu, Jianfeng Feng

entry.summary: Tackles zero-shot cross-subject fMRI-to-image reconstruction, allowing visual experience reconstruction from new individuals without subject-specific training. Uses compositional latent modeling to handle neural variability across subjects.

entry.title: FARE: Fast-Slow Agentic Robotic Exploration

author.name: Shuhao Liao, Xuxin Lv, Jeric Lew, Shizhe Zhang, Jingsong Liang, Peizhuo Li, Yuhong Cao, Wenjun Wu, Guillaume Sartoretti

entry.summary: FARE integrates LLM for global reasoning with RL policy for local decision-making in autonomous exploration. Uses modularity-based pruning for efficient reasoning and fast-slow thinking paradigm.

entry.title: On the Limits of Learned Importance Scoring for KV Cache Compression

author.name: Brady Steele

entry.summary: Investigates learned KV cache compression through Speculative Importance Prediction, finding it doesn't outperform simple baselines including random selection. Position-based heuristics match or exceed learned approaches.

entry.title: The first type of transformative AI?

author.name: Lizka

entry.summary: Argues that AI risk preparation shouldn't assume transformative AI arrives in an unchanged world. Earlier AI systems may transform the landscape before the most dangerous systems emerge, and preparing for this transition is crucial.

entry.title: Knowledge Graphs are Implicit Reward Models: Path-Derived Signals Enable Compositional Reasoning

author.name: Yuval Kansal, Niraj K. Jha

entry.summary: Shows knowledge graphs can serve as implicit reward models for RL, deriving reward signals from graph paths to enable compositional multi-hop reasoning through post-training combining SFT and RL.

entry.title: Mechanism Shift During Post-training from Autoregressive to Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Injin Kong, Hyoungjoon Lee, Yohan Jo

entry.summary: Conducts circuit analysis comparing autoregressive models and their post-trained masked diffusion counterparts, revealing mechanism shifts that depend on task structure.

entry.title: Iterative Refinement Improves Compositional Image Generation

author.name: Shantanu Jaiswal, Mihir Prabhudesai, Nikash Bhardwaj, Zheyang Qin, Amir Zadeh, Chuan Li, Katerina Fragkiadaki, Deepak Pathak

entry.summary: Proposes iterative test-time refinement for text-to-image models using vision-language model feedback, inspired by chain-of-thought reasoning, to improve compositional generation with multiple objects and relations.

entry.title: Plug-and-Play Benchmarking of Reinforcement Learning Algorithms for Large-Scale Flow Control

author.name: Jannis Becktepe, Aleksandra Franz, Nils Thuerey, Sebastian Peitz

entry.summary: FluidGym is first standalone, fully differentiable benchmark for RL in active flow control, built entirely in PyTorch with GPU-accelerated solver, eliminating need for external CFD software.

entry.title: The Effect of Scripts and Formats on LLM Numeracy

author.name: Varshini Reddy, Craig W. Schmidt, Seth Ebner, Adam Wiemerslage, Yuval Pinter, Chris Tanner

entry.summary: Investigates LLM numerical reasoning across different numeral scripts and formats, finding substantial accuracy drops for underrepresented scripts despite identical mathematical reasoning.

entry.title: MonoRace: Winning Champion-Level Drone Racing with Robust Monocular AI

author.name: Stavrow A. Bahnam, Robin Ferede, Till M. Blaha, Anton E. Lang, Erin Lucassen, Quentin Missinne, Aderik E. C. Verraest, Christophe De Wagter, Guido C. H. E. de Croon

entry.summary: MonoRace presents onboard drone racing using monocular rolling-shutter camera and IMU that generalizes to competition environments without motion tracking. Features neural network gate segmentation for robust state estimation.

entry.title: Query-Efficient Agentic Graph Extraction Attacks on GraphRAG Systems

author.name: Shuhua Yang, Jiahao Zhang, Yilong Wang, Dongwon Lee, Suhang Wang

entry.summary: Studies black-box attacks on GraphRAG systems for reconstructing hidden knowledge graphs. Proposes AGEA framework using novelty-guided exploration and external graph memory for query-efficient graph extraction.

entry.title: NeuroFilter: Privacy Guardrails for Conversational LLM Agents

author.name: Saswat Das, Ferdinando Fioretto

entry.summary: Proposes NeuroFilter, using linear probes on internal LLM representations to detect privacy-violating intent in conversational agents, framed through contextual integrity theory.

entry.title: TIDAL: Temporally Interleaved Diffusion and Action Loop for High-Frequency VLA Control

author.name: Yuteng Sun (Michael), Haoran Wang (Michael), Ruofei Bai (Michael), Zhengguo Li (Michael), Jun Li (Michael), Meng Yee (Michael), Chuah, Wei Yun Yau

entry.summary: Proposes TIDAL, a hierarchical framework for Vision-Language-Action models separating low-frequency semantic planning from high-frequency actuation to address execution blind spots.

entry.title: MolecularIQ: Characterizing Chemical Reasoning Capabilities Through Symbolic Verification on Molecular Graphs

author.name: Christoph Bartmann, Johannes Schimunek, Mykyta Ielanskyi, Philipp Seidl, G\"unter Klambauer, Sohvi Luukkonen

entry.summary: Introduces MolecularIQ, a benchmark for evaluating LLM chemical reasoning through symbolically verifiable tasks on molecular graphs, avoiding data leakage issues in existing chemistry benchmarks.

entry.title: Render-of-Thought: Rendering Textual Chain-of-Thought as Images for Visual Latent Reasoning

author.name: Yifan Wang, Shiyu Li, Peiming Li, Xiaochen Yang, Yang Tang, Zheng Wei

entry.summary: Render-of-Thought makes Chain-of-Thought reasoning explicit by rendering textual steps as images, using VLM vision encoders as semantic anchors. First framework to reify reasoning chains visually.

entry.title: Deep Leakage with Generative Flow Matching Denoiser

author.name: Isaac Baglin, Xiatian Zhu, Simon Hadfield

entry.summary: Presents a new privacy attack on Federated Learning that uses Flow Matching generative priors to reconstruct private client data from shared model updates with improved fidelity. Demonstrates vulnerabilities in decentralized training under realistic settings.

entry.title: HumanoidVLM: Vision-Language-Guided Impedance Control for Contact-Rich Humanoid Manipulation

author.name: Yara Mahmoud, Yasheerah Yaqoot, Miguel Altamirano Cabrera, Dzmitry Tsetserukou

entry.summary: HumanoidVLM uses vision-language models for semantic task inference to select appropriate Cartesian impedance parameters and gripper configurations for humanoid manipulation. Integrates RAG for retrieving validated parameters.

entry.title: The Why Behind the Action: Unveiling Internal Drivers via Agentic Attribution

author.name: Chen Qian, Peng Wang, Dongrui Liu, Junyao Yang, Dadi Guo, Ling Tang, Jilin Mei, Qihan Ren, Shuai Shao, Yong Liu, Jie Fu, Jing Shao, Xia Hu

entry.summary: Proposes framework for general agentic attribution to identify internal factors driving agent actions regardless of task outcome, moving beyond failure attribution to explain all agent behaviors.

entry.title: Self-Blinding and Counterfactual Self-Simulation Mitigate Biases and Sycophancy in Large Language Models

author.name: Brian Christian, Matan Mazor

entry.summary: Shows self-blinding and counterfactual self-simulation can help LLMs offset gender/race biases and sycophancy, though simple prompting to ignore biasing information fails or backfires.

entry.title: INFA-Guard: Mitigating Malicious Propagation via Infection-Aware Safeguarding in LLM-Based Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Yijin Zhou, Xiaoya Lu, Dongrui Liu, Junchi Yan, Jing Shao

entry.summary: Proposes INFA-Guard, a defense framework for multi-agent LLM systems that explicitly models 'infected agents' (benign agents converted by attackers) as a distinct threat category.

entry.title: Which Quantization Should I Use? A Unified Evaluation of llama.cpp Quantization on Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct

author.name: Uygar Kurt

entry.summary: Unified empirical evaluation of llama.cpp quantization schemes (3-8 bit) on Llama-3.1-8B-Instruct, covering reasoning, knowledge, instruction-following tasks to help practitioners choose appropriate formats.

entry.title: Field-Space Autoencoder for Scalable Climate Emulators

author.name: Johannes Meuer, Maximilian Witte, \'Eti\'enne Pl\'esiat, Thomas Ludwig, Christopher Kadow

entry.summary: Field-Space Autoencoder for scalable climate emulation using spherical compression that avoids geometric distortions from forcing spherical data onto Euclidean grids, preserving physical structures.

entry.title: Mirai: Autoregressive Visual Generation Needs Foresight

author.name: Yonghao Yu, Lang Huang, Zerun Wang, Runyi Li, Toshihiko Yamasaki

entry.summary: Mirai investigates foresight signals for autoregressive visual generation, finding that aligning future information to 2D image grids improves causality modeling and convergence.

entry.title: ScenDi: 3D-to-2D Scene Diffusion Cascades for Urban Generation

author.name: Hanlei Guo, Jiahao Shao, Xinya Chen, Xiyang Tan, Sheng Miao, Yujun Shen, Yiyi Liao

entry.summary: ScenDi combines 3D and 2D diffusion models for urban scene generation, first generating 3D Gaussians then upsampling with 2D diffusion for high-fidelity results. Addresses tradeoff between 3D controllability and appearance detail quality.

entry.title: Developmental trajectories of decision making and affective dynamics in large language models

author.name: Zhihao Wang, Yiyang Liu, Ting Wang, Zhiyuan Liu

entry.summary: Studies developmental trajectories across OpenAI model versions in gambling task with happiness ratings. Finds newer models take more risks, show less loss aversion, more deterministic choices, and affective patterns diverging from humans.

entry.title: SearchGym: Bootstrapping Real-World Search Agents via Cost-Effective and High-Fidelity Environment Simulation

author.name: Xichen Zhang, Ziyi He, Yinghao Zhu, Sitong Wu, Shaozuo Yu, Meng Chu, Wenhu Zhang, Haoru Tan, Jiaya Jia

entry.summary: Introduces SearchGym, a simulation environment for training search agents via RL that constructs verifiable knowledge graphs to avoid corrupted reward signals from data misalignment with live APIs.

entry.title: Search over Self-Edit Strategies for LLM Adaptation

author.name: Alistair Cheong, Haolin Cong, Tyler Yang, Dustin Miao

entry.summary: Investigates whether LLMs can use task feedback to decide how to update their own weights, studying self-improvement through choosing training data and hyperparameters for next-token prediction.

entry.title: Guided by the Plan: Enhancing Faithful Autoregressive Text-to-Audio Generation with Guided Decoding

author.name: Juncheng Wang, Zhe Hu, Chao Xu, Siyue Ren, Yuxiang Feng, Yang Liu, Baigui Sun, Shujun Wang

entry.summary: Plan-Critic discovers that early tokens in autoregressive audio generators implicitly encode global semantic attributes, enabling guided exploration at inference time. Improves instruction-following for complex sound event generation.

entry.title: Large-Scale Label Quality Assessment for Medical Segmentation via a Vision-Language Judge and Synthetic Data

author.name: Yixiong Chen, Zongwei Zhou, Wenxuan Li, Alan Yuille

entry.summary: SegAE is lightweight VLM predicting label quality across 142 anatomical structures, trained on 4M+ image-label pairs. Enables filtering low-quality annotations to improve training.

entry.title: FlowSSC: Universal Generative Monocular Semantic Scene Completion via One-Step Latent Diffusion

author.name: Zichen Xi, Hao-Xiang Chen, Nan Xue, Hongyu Yan, Qi-Yuan Feng, Levent Burak Kara, Joaquim Jorge, Qun-Ce Xu

entry.summary: FlowSSC presents the first generative framework for monocular semantic scene completion, treating SSC as conditional generation via one-step latent diffusion. Can integrate with existing feed-forward methods to improve occluded region reasoning.

entry.title: VisTIRA: Closing the Image-Text Modality Gap in Visual Math Reasoning via Structured Tool Integration

author.name: Saeed Khaki, Ashudeep Singh, Nima Safaei, Kamal Ginotra

entry.summary: Addresses the modality gap where VLMs perform worse on math problems presented as images vs text. Introduces VisTIRA framework using tool-integrated reasoning with iterative decomposition into natural language and executable Python.

entry.title: On Meta-Evaluation

author.name: Hongxiao Li, Chenxi Wang, Fanda Fan, Zihan Wang, Wanling Gao, Lei Wang, Jianfeng Zhan

entry.summary: Introduces formal meta-evaluation framework with AxiaBench benchmark comparing 10 evaluation methods across 8 domains. Reveals fundamental issues with evaluation methodology across scientific domains.

entry.title: A Brain-inspired Embodied Intelligence for Fluid and Fast Reflexive Robotics Control

author.name: Weiyu Guo, He Zhang, Pengteng Li, Tiefu Cai, Ziyang Chen, Yandong Guo, Xiao He, Yongkui Yang, Ying Sun, Hui Xiong

entry.summary: Presents NeuroVLA, a bio-inspired robotics framework that mimics cortex-cerebellum-spinal cord organization with a neuromorphic design for rapid skill acquisition and reflexive control.

entry.title: Evaluation of Large Language Models in Legal Applications: Challenges, Methods, and Future Directions

author.name: Yiran Hu, Huanghai Liu, Chong Wang, Kunran Li, Tien-Hsuan Wu, Haitao Li, Xinran Xu, Siqing Huo, Weihang Su, Ning Zheng, Siyuan Zheng, Qingyao Ai, Yun Liu, Renjun Bian, Yiqun Liu, Charles L. A. Clarke, Weixing Shen, Ben Kao

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on evaluating LLMs in legal applications covering judicial decision support, legal practice, and public services. Addresses critical concerns beyond accuracy including legal reasoning soundness, fairness, and reliability.

entry.title: Fine-Grained Traceability for Transparent ML Pipelines

author.name: Liping Chen, Mujie Liu, Haytham Fayek

entry.summary: FG-Trac establishes verifiable, fine-grained sample-level traceability throughout ML pipelines, addressing gap between model-level transparency and operational data tracking.

entry.title: End-to-End Transformer Acceleration Through Processing-in-Memory Architectures

author.name: Xiaoxuan Yang, Peilin Chen, Tergel Molom-Ochir, Yiran Chen

entry.summary: Introduces processing-in-memory architectures for end-to-end transformer acceleration addressing attention mechanism bottlenecks, KV cache memory issues, and quadratic complexity challenges.

entry.title: LaVR: Scene Latent Conditioned Generative Video Trajectory Re-Rendering using Large 4D Reconstruction Models

author.name: Mingyang Xie, Numair Khan, Tianfu Wang, Naina Dhingra, Seonghyeon Nam, Haitao Yang, Zhuo Hui, Christopher Metzler, Andrea Vedaldi, Hamed Pirsiavash, Lei Luo

entry.summary: LaVR uses implicit geometric knowledge from large 4D reconstruction model latents to condition video re-rendering, avoiding explicit depth estimation and calibration errors.

entry.title: RayRoPE: Projective Ray Positional Encoding for Multi-view Attention

author.name: Yu Wu, Minsik Jeon, Jen-Hao Rick Chang, Oncel Tuzel, Shubham Tulsiani

entry.summary: RayRoPE introduces a positional encoding for multi-view transformers that uses predicted 3D points along camera rays for geometry-aware, SE(3)-invariant attention. Addresses gap in existing multi-view position encodings.

entry.title: SpatialV2A: Visual-Guided High-fidelity Spatial Audio Generation

author.name: Yanan Wang, Linjie Ren, Zihao Li, Junyi Wang, Tian Gan

entry.summary: Introduces BinauralVGGSound, the first large-scale video-binaural audio dataset for spatially aware audio generation, along with a framework for visual-guided spatial audio synthesis. Addresses a significant gap in immersive audio generation by enabling models to learn visual-to-spatial audio mappings.

entry.title: CADGrasp: Learning Contact and Collision Aware General Dexterous Grasping in Cluttered Scenes

author.name: Jiyao Zhang, Zhiyuan Ma, Tianhao Wu, Zeyuan Chen, Hao Dong

entry.summary: CADGrasp proposes two-stage dexterous grasping algorithm using sparse IBS (contact- and collision-aware representation) for single-view point cloud inputs in cluttered environments.

entry.title: GutenOCR: A Grounded Vision-Language Front-End for Documents

author.name: Hunter Heidenreich, Ben Elliott, Olivia Dinica, Yosheb Getachew

entry.summary: Introduces GutenOCR, grounded OCR models fine-tuned from Qwen2.5-VL supporting reading, detection, and grounding through unified prompt-based interface. More than doubles grounded OCR score over backbone.

entry.title: HERMES: KV Cache as Hierarchical Memory for Efficient Streaming Video Understanding

author.name: Haowei Zhang, Shudong Yang, Jinlan Fu, See-Kiong Ng, Xipeng Qiu

entry.summary: Proposes HERMES, a training-free architecture treating KV cache as hierarchical memory for efficient streaming video understanding with real-time responses and low memory overhead.

entry.title: DARL: Encouraging Diverse Answers for General Reasoning without Verifiers

author.name: Chongxuan Huang, Lei Lin, Xiaodong Shi, Wenping Hu, Ruiming Tang

entry.summary: DARL addresses overfitting to reference answers in RLVR by encouraging diverse outputs, particularly important for open-ended tasks like writing where multiple valid answers exist.

entry.title: DrivIng: A Large-Scale Multimodal Driving Dataset with Full Digital Twin Integration

author.name: Dominik R\"o{\ss}le, Xujun Xie, Adithya Mohan, Venkatesh Thirugnana Sambandham, Daniel Cremers, Torsten Sch\"on

entry.summary: DrivIng provides a large-scale multimodal driving dataset with complete geo-referenced digital twin of ~18km route spanning urban, suburban, and highway segments. Enables systematic testing, edge-case simulation, and sim-to-real evaluation.

entry.title: Measuring and Aligning Abstraction in Vision-Language Models with Medical Taxonomies

author.name: Ben Schaper, Maxime Di Folco, Bernhard Kainz, Julia A. Schnabel, Cosmin I. Bercea

entry.summary: Measures VLM alignment with medical taxonomies using hierarchical metrics. Introduces risk-constrained thresholding and taxonomy-aware fine-tuning to reduce severe abstraction errors below 2% in chest X-ray classification.

entry.title: RPC-Bench: A Fine-grained Benchmark for Research Paper Comprehension

author.name: Yelin Chen, Fanjin Zhang, Suping Sun, Yunhe Pang, Yuanchun Wang, Jian Song, Xiaoyan Li, Lei Hou, Shu Zhao, Jie Tang, Juanzi Li

entry.summary: Introduces RPC-Bench, 15K human-verified QA benchmark for research paper comprehension built from review-rebuttal exchanges with fine-grained taxonomy aligned to scientific research flow.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Constraint Factorization Reveals Latent Invariant Solution Structure

author.name: Christopher Scofield

entry.summary: Provides formal theoretical explanation for why multi-agent LLM systems improve problem-solving: agents implement factorized constraint-enforcement operators converging to invariant solution sets.

entry.title: Learning PDE Solvers with Physics and Data: A Unifying View of Physics-Informed Neural Networks and Neural Operators

author.name: Yilong Dai, Shengyu Chen, Ziyi Wang, Xiaowei Jia, Yiqun Xie, Vipin Kumar, Runlong Yu

entry.summary: Proposes unified perspective placing Physics-Informed Neural Networks and Neural Operators in shared design space along three dimensions: what is learned, how physics integrates, and optimization approach.

entry.title: MARBLE: Multi-Agent Reasoning for Bioinformatics Learning and Evolution

author.name: Sunghyun Kim, Seokwoo Yun, Youngseo Yun, Youngrak Lee, Sangsoo Lim

entry.summary: MARBLE is multi-agent autonomous framework for bioinformatics model refinement using literature-aware reference selection with debate-driven architectural reasoning among specialized agents.

entry.title: \textsc{LogicScore}: Fine-grained Logic Evaluation of Conciseness, Completeness, and Determinateness in Attributed Question Answering

author.name: Zhichao Yan, Yunxiao Zhao, Jiapu Wang, Jiaoyan Chen, Shaoru Guo, Xiaoli Li, Ru Li, Jeff Z. Pan

entry.summary: LogicScore evaluates Attributed QA through completeness, conciseness, and determinateness using Horn Rules and backward verification. Shifts from local statement verification to global logical integrity.

entry.title: Diffusion Epistemic Uncertainty with Asymmetric Learning for Diffusion-Generated Image Detection

author.name: Yingsong Huang, Hui Guo, Jing Huang, Bing Bai, Qi Xiong

entry.summary: Distinguishes epistemic from aleatoric uncertainty for diffusion-generated image detection, showing asymmetric learning improves generalization to unseen generators.

entry.title: Large-Scale Multidimensional Knowledge Profiling of Scientific Literature

author.name: Zhucun Xue, Jiangning Zhang, Juntao Jiang, Jinzhuo Liu, Haoyang He, Teng Hu, Xiaobin Hu, Guangming Yao, Yi Yuan, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Constructs a unified corpus of 100,000+ papers from 22 major ML/CV/NLP conferences (2020-2025) with a multidimensional profiling pipeline combining topic clustering, LLM-assisted parsing, and structured retrieval for analyzing research trends.

entry.title: Diffusion Large Language Models for Black-Box Optimization

author.name: Ye Yuan (Sam), Can (Sam), Chen, Zipeng Sun, Dinghuai Zhang, Christopher Pal, Xue Liu

entry.summary: Explores diffusion LLMs for black-box optimization, addressing bidirectional dependencies in design optimization that autoregressive models struggle with. Novel application of diffusion to combinatorial optimization.

entry.title: Rewarding How Models Think Pedagogically: Integrating Pedagogical Reasoning and Thinking Rewards for LLMs in Education

author.name: Unggi Lee, Jiyeong Bae, Jaehyeon Park, Haeun Park, Taejun Park, Younghoon Jeon, Sungmin Cho, Junbo Koh, Yeil Jeong, Gyeonggeon Lee

entry.summary: PedagogicalRL-Thinking extends pedagogical alignment to reasoning LLMs through Pedagogical Reasoning Prompting (guiding internal reasoning with educational theory) and Thinking Reward (reinforcing pedagogical thinking processes).

entry.title: Is Peer Review Really in Decline? Analyzing Review Quality across Venues and Time

author.name: Ilia Kuznetsov, Rohan Nayak, Alla Rozovskaya, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Introduces framework for evidence-based comparison of peer review quality across ICLR, NeurIPS, and *ACL over time. Proposes multi-dimensional schema quantifying utility to editors and authors.

entry.title: LiViBench: An Omnimodal Benchmark for Interactive Livestream Video Understanding

author.name: Xiaodong Wang, Langling Huang, Zhirong Wu, Xu Zhao, Teng Xu, Xuhong Xia, Peixi Peng

entry.summary: LiViBench introduces first omnimodal benchmark for interactive livestream video understanding with 24 tasks covering perceptual, reasoning, and livestream-specific challenges.

entry.title: LuxRemix: Lighting Decomposition and Remixing for Indoor Scenes

author.name: Ruofan Liang, Norman M\"uller, Ethan Weber, Duncan Zauss, Nandita Vijaykumar, Peter Kontschieder, Christian Richardt

entry.summary: LuxRemix enables interactive light editing in indoor scenes from single multi-view capture using generative light decomposition. Integrates with 3D Gaussian splatting for real-time control over individual light sources' state, chromaticity, and intensity.

entry.title: Large Language Model-Powered Evolutionary Code Optimization on a Phylogenetic Tree

author.name: Leyi Zhao, Weijie Huang, Yitong Guo, Jiang Bian, Chenghong Wang, Xuhong Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes PhyloEvolve, an LLM-agent system for GPU code optimization using In-Context Reinforcement Learning on a phylogenetic tree structure. Enables trajectory-conditioned reuse of optimization experience without model retraining.

entry.title: AutoDriDM: An Explainable Benchmark for Decision-Making of Vision-Language Models in Autonomous Driving

author.name: Zecong Tang, Zixu Wang, Yifei Wang, Weitong Lian, Tianjian Gao, Haoran Li, Tengju Ru, Lingyi Meng, Zhejun Cui, Yichen Zhu, Qi Kang, Kaixuan Wang, Yu Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces AutoDriDM, a decision-centric benchmark for autonomous driving VLMs with 6,650 questions across Object, Scene, and Decision dimensions. Reveals weak alignment between perception and decision-making capabilities.

entry.title: Emerging from Ground: Addressing Intent Deviation in Tool-Using Agents via Deriving Real Calls into Virtual Trajectories

author.name: Qian Xiong, Yuekai Huang, Yujia Zheng, Tianhao Li, Ziyou Jiang, Zhiyuan Chang, Zhaoyang Li, Huanxiang Feng, Mingyang Li

entry.summary: Introduces RISE method addressing intent deviation in tool-using agents by deriving virtual trajectories from real API calls, including negative samples tailored to deviation scenarios for preference learning.

entry.title: Tracing the Data Trail: A Survey of Data Provenance, Transparency and Traceability in LLMs

author.name: Richard Hohensinner, Belgin Mutlu, Inti Gabriel Mendoza Estrada, Matej Vukovic, Simone Kopeinik, Roman Kern

entry.summary: Survey synthesizing research on data provenance, transparency, and traceability in LLMs with proposed taxonomy covering bias, uncertainty, privacy, and tools. Analyzes 95 publications.

entry.title: Re-understanding Graph Unlearning through Memorization

author.name: Pengfei Ding, Yan Wang, Guanfeng Liu

entry.summary: Establishes GNN memorization as a new lens for understanding graph unlearning, proposing improved difficulty assessment and evaluation protocols for machine unlearning on graphs.

entry.title: Case-Guided Sequential Assay Planning in Drug Discovery

author.name: Tianchi Chen, Jan Bima, Sean L. Wu, Otto Ritter, Bingjia Yang, Xiang Yu

entry.summary: Introduces IBMDP, a model-based RL framework for drug discovery assay planning that operates without an explicit simulator by using case-guided implicit dynamics from historical data.

entry.title: TempViz: On the Evaluation of Temporal Knowledge in Text-to-Image Models

author.name: Carolin Holtermann, Nina Krebs, Anne Lauscher

entry.summary: Introduces TempViz, first benchmark for evaluating temporal knowledge in text-to-image models with 7.9k prompts across five temporal phenomena like seasons and aging.

entry.title: V-CAGE: Context-Aware Generation and Verification for Scalable Long-Horizon Embodied Tasks

author.name: Yaru Liu, Ao-bo Wang, Nanyang Ye

entry.summary: Introduces V-CAGE framework for generating semantically-aligned manipulation datasets with context-aware scene synthesis enforcing geometric consistency and verifiable task completion.

entry.title: Gradient Structure Estimation under Label-Only Oracles via Spectral Sensitivity

author.name: Jun Liu, Leo Yu Zhang, Fengpeng Li, Isao Echizen, Jiantao Zhou

entry.summary: Develops unified theoretical perspective showing hard-label attacks implicitly approximate gradient signs, then proposes new attack using spectral sensitivity analysis for more effective gradient structure estimation.

entry.title: QMC: Efficient SLM Edge Inference via Outlier-Aware Quantization and Emergent Memories Co-Design

author.name: Nilesh Prasad Pandey, Jangseon Park, Onat Gungor, Flavio Ponzina, Tajana Rosing

entry.summary: QMC framework for efficient small language model inference on edge devices through outlier-aware quantization combined with hybrid memory organization exploiting SRAM, DRAM, and Flash characteristics.

entry.title: Strategic Doctrine Language Models (sdLM): A Learning-System Framework for Doctrinal Consistency and Geopolitical Forecasting

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov, Taner Yilmaz, Derya Umut Kulali

entry.summary: Strategic Doctrine Language Models (sdLM) framework for multi-document strategic reasoning with doctrinal consistency constraints, evaluated on geopolitical forecasting across 12-60 month horizons.

entry.title: HyperNet-Adaptation for Diffusion-Based Test Case Generation

author.name: Oliver Wei{\ss}l, Vincenzo Riccio, Severin Kacianka, Andrea Stocco

entry.summary: HyNeA uses hypernetwork adaptation for efficient control over diffusion-based test case generation, enabling direct manipulation of generation for ML system testing.

entry.title: Cosmo-FOLD: Fast generation and upscaling of field-level cosmological maps with overlap latent diffusion

author.name: Satvik Mishra, Roberto Trotta, Matteo Viel

entry.summary: Cosmo-FOLD uses overlap latent diffusion to rapidly generate accurate large cosmological fields conditioned on input, trained on only 1% of volume ('upscaling') while reproducing structure.

entry.title: Social Caption: Evaluating Social Understanding in Multimodal Models

author.name: Bhaavanaa Thumu, Leena Mathur, Youssouf Kebe, Louis-Philippe Morency

entry.summary: Social Caption evaluates MLLM social understanding along three dimensions: social inference, holistic social analysis, and directed social analysis, analyzing factors like scale and architecture.

entry.title: WavLink: Compact Audio--Text Embeddings with a Global Whisper Token

author.name: Gokul Karthik Kumar, Ludovick Lepauloux, Hakim Hacid

entry.summary: WavLink creates compact audio-text embeddings by augmenting Whisper encoder with a learnable global token, achieving state-of-the-art retrieval performance. Provides systematic study of design choices for audio-text alignment.

entry.title: Language-Coupled Reinforcement Learning for Multilingual Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Rui Qi, Fengran Mo, Yufeng Chen, Xue Zhang, Shuo Wang, Hongliang Li, Jinan Xu, Meng Jiang, Jian-Yun Nie, Kaiyu Huang

entry.summary: LcRL integrates language-coupled Group Relative Policy Optimization for multilingual RAG, addressing knowledge bias and conflict during cross-lingual search engine interaction.

entry.title: Psychometric Comparability of LLM-Based Digital Twins

author.name: Yufei Zhang, Zhihao Ma

entry.summary: Proposes construct-validity framework for evaluating LLM 'digital twins' as human simulacra, testing psychometric comparability across decision-making, word association, and cognitive tasks.

entry.title: PROGRESSLM: Towards Progress Reasoning in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Jianshu Zhang, Chengxuan Qian, Haosen Sun, Haoran Lu, Dingcheng Wang, Letian Xue, Han Liu

entry.summary: Progress-Bench evaluates VLMs on task progress estimation, introducing ProgressLM-45K dataset. Reveals most VLMs struggle with progress reasoning from partial observations.

entry.title: Training-Free and Interpretable Hateful Video Detection via Multi-stage Adversarial Reasoning

author.name: Shuonan Yang, Yuchen Zhang, Zeyu Fu

entry.summary: MARS is a training-free framework for hateful video detection using multi-stage adversarial reasoning with large vision-language models. Provides interpretable hate detection through structured reasoning rather than relying on limited training data.

entry.title: TacUMI: A Multi-Modal Universal Manipulation Interface for Contact-Rich Tasks

author.name: Tailai Cheng, Kejia Chen, Lingyun Chen, Liding Zhang, Yue Zhang, Yao Ling, Mahdi Hamad, Zhenshan Bing, Fan Wu, Karan Sharma, Alois Knoll

entry.summary: TacUMI extends Universal Manipulation Interface with tactile sensors, force-torque sensing, and pose tracking for multi-modal data collection. Enables robust segmentation of contact-rich manipulation demonstrations.

entry.title: Moving Beyond Compliance in Soft-Robotic Catheters Through Modularity for Precision Therapies

author.name: B. Calm\'e, N. J. Greenidge, A. Metcalf, A. Bacchetti, G. Loza, D. Kpeglo, P. Lloyd, V. Pensabene, J. H. Chandler, P. Valdastri

entry.summary: Presents 1.47mm diameter modular soft robotic catheter integrating sensing, actuation, and therapy for endoluminal procedures. Validated in vivo for ERCP procedures with pancreatic applications.

entry.title: If You Want Coherence, Orchestrate a Team of Rivals: Multi-Agent Models of Organizational Intelligence

author.name: Gopal Vijayaraghavan, Prasanth Jayachandran, Arun Murthy, Sunil Govindan, Vivek Subramanian

entry.summary: Proposes using teams of rival AI agents with opposing incentives to catch and minimize errors, applying corporate organizational structure principles to multi-agent AI systems.

entry.title: SpatialMem: Unified 3D Memory with Metric Anchoring and Fast Retrieval

author.name: Xinyi Zheng, Yunze Liu, Chi-Hao Wu, Fan Zhang, Hao Zheng, Wenqi Zhou, Walterio W. Mayol-Cuevas, Junxiao Shen

entry.summary: Presents SpatialMem, unifying 3D geometry, semantics, and language in a queryable memory representation with hierarchical anchoring for embodied AI navigation and retrieval.

entry.title: Overcoming In-Memory Bottlenecks in Graph Foundation Models via Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Haonan Yuan, Qingyun Sun, Jiacheng Tao, Xingcheng Fu, Jianxin Li

entry.summary: Proposes RAG-GFM addressing in-memory bottlenecks in Graph Foundation Models by offloading knowledge to retrieval systems with dual-modal unified retrieval module.

entry.title: Variance-Adaptive Muon: Accelerating LLM Pretraining with NSR-Modulated and Variance-Scaled Momentum

author.name: Jingru Li, Yibo Fan, Huan Li

entry.summary: Proposes Muon-NSR and Muon-VS, variants of the Muon optimizer applying variance-adaptive normalization to momentum before orthogonalization for accelerated LLM pretraining.

entry.title: HiNS: Hierarchical Negative Sampling for More Comprehensive Memory Retrieval Embedding Model

author.name: Motong Tian, Allen P. Wong, Mingjun Mao, Wangchunshu Zhou

entry.summary: HiNS proposes hierarchical negative sampling for memory retrieval embeddings, modeling natural distribution of semantic difficulty in human-agent interactions. Improves discrimination for memory-augmented agents.

entry.title: Safeguarding Facial Identity against Diffusion-based Face Swapping via Cascading Pathway Disruption

author.name: Liqin Wang, Qianyue Hu, Wei Lu, Xiangyang Luo

entry.summary: VoidFace proposes defense against diffusion-based face swapping by disrupting identity pathway through perturbations at critical bottlenecks, inducing cascading failures.

entry.title: Towards Understanding Best Practices for Quantization of Vision-Language Models

author.name: Gautom Das, Vincent La, Ethan Lau, Abhinav Shrivastava, Matthew Gwilliam

entry.summary: Investigates best practices for applying quantization methods (including GPTQ and AWQ) to multimodal vision-language pipelines. Studies how to effectively quantize vision encoders, language models, and connectors together.

entry.title: To Neuro-Symbolic Classification and Beyond by Compiling Description Logic Ontologies to Probabilistic Circuits

author.name: Nicolas Lazzari, Valentina Presutti, Antonio Vergari

entry.summary: Proposes method to compile Description Logic ontologies into probabilistic circuits for neuro-symbolic classification, enabling tractable queries and guaranteed ontology-consistent predictions.

entry.title: CityCube: Benchmarking Cross-view Spatial Reasoning on Vision-Language Models in Urban Environments

author.name: Haotian Xu, Yue Hu, Zhengqiu Zhu, Chen Gao, Ziyou Wang, Junreng Rao, Wenhao Lu, Weishi Li, Quanjun Yin, Yong Li

entry.summary: Introduces CityCube benchmark for cross-view spatial reasoning in urban environments with 5,022 annotated questions integrating four viewpoint dynamics across vehicles, drones, and satellites.

entry.title: Training-Efficient Text-to-Music Generation with State-Space Modeling

author.name: Wei-Jaw Lee, Fang-Chih Hsieh, Xuanjun Chen, Fang-Duo Tsai, Yi-Hsuan Yang

entry.summary: Explores state-space models as training-efficient alternatives to transformers for text-to-music generation, achieving comparable quality with ~300M parameters.

entry.title: Visual and Cognitive Demands of a Large Language Model-Powered In-vehicle Conversational Agent
