author.name: Chris Monk, Allegra Ayala, Christine S. P. Yu, Gregory M. Fitch, Dara Gruber

entry.summary: Studies cognitive and visual demands of Gemini Live conversational agent during driving using Detection Response Task and eye-tracking, comparing against phone calls and navigation.

entry.title: Counterfactual Modeling with Fine-Tuned LLMs for Health Intervention Design and Sensor Data Augmentation

author.name: Shovito Barua Soumma, Asiful Arefeen, Stephanie M. Carpenter, Melanie Hingle, Hassan Ghasemzadeh

entry.summary: Evaluates counterfactual explanation generation using LLMs (GPT-4, BioMistral-7B, LLaMA-3.1-8B) for health interventions, finding fine-tuned LLaMA-3.1-8B excels at intervention quality and data augmentation.

entry.title: U-Harmony: Enhancing Joint Training for Segmentation Models with Universal Harmonization

author.name: Weiwei Ma, Xiaobing Yu, Peijie Qiu, Jin Yang, Pan Xiao, Xiaoqi Zhao, Xiaofeng Liu, Tomo Miyazaki, Shinichiro Omachi, Yongsong Huang

entry.summary: U-Harmony enables joint training of segmentation models across heterogeneous medical datasets through domain-gated head that normalizes then denormalizes feature distributions.

entry.title: RANDSMAPs: Random-Feature/multi-Scale Neural Decoders with Mass Preservation

author.name: Dimitrios G. Patsatzis, Alessandro Della Pia, Lucia Russo, Constantinos Siettos

entry.summary: RANDSMAPs are neural decoders for manifold learning that explicitly respect conservation laws, proving equivalence to RBF interpolation and establishing theoretical foundations.

entry.title: Can LLM Reasoning Be Trusted? A Comparative Study: Using Human Benchmarking on Statistical Tasks

author.name: Crish Nagarkar, Leonid Bogachev, Serge Sharoff

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM statistical reasoning capabilities through fine-tuning and benchmarking against human performance. Fine-tuned models achieve statistics-student-level performance with architecture-dependent gains.

entry.title: Metadata Conditioned Large Language Models for Localization

author.name: Anjishnu Mukherjee, Ziwei Zhu, Antonios Anastasopoulos

entry.summary: Studies metadata conditioning (URLs, country/continent tags) for LLM localization, training 31 models from scratch. Shows conditioning improves in-region performance without sacrificing cross-region generalization.

entry.title: Spatially Generalizable Mobile Manipulation via Adaptive Experience Selection and Dynamic Imagination

author.name: Ping Zhong, Liangbai Liu, Bolei Chen, Tao Wu, Jiazhi Xia, Chaoxu Mu, Jianxin Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Adaptive Experience Selection and model-based dynamic imagination for mobile manipulation, improving sample efficiency and spatial generalization through attention to critical experience fragments.

entry.title: CI4A: Semantic Component Interfaces for Agents Empowering Web Automation

author.name: Zhi Qiu, Jiazheng Sun, Chenxiao Xia, Jun Zheng, Xin Peng

entry.summary: Introduces CI4A, semantic component interfaces that abstract UI interaction logic into unified tool primitives for web automation agents, implemented in Ant Design framework.

entry.title: Beyond Affinity: A Benchmark of 1D, 2D, and 3D Methods Reveals Critical Trade-offs in Structure-Based Drug Design

author.name: Kangyu Zheng, Kai Zhang, Jiale Tan, Xuehan Chen, Yingzhou Lu, Zaixi Zhang, Lichao Sun, Marinka Zitnik, Tianfan Fu, Zhiding Liang

entry.summary: Benchmarks 15 structure-based drug design models across search-based, deep generative, and RL approaches, evaluating pharmaceutical properties and docking affinities to identify algorithmic trade-offs.

entry.title: Real-Time Wildfire Localization on the NASA Autonomous Modular Sensor using Deep Learning

author.name: Yajvan Ravan, Aref Malek, Chester Dolph, Nikhil Behari

entry.summary: Introduces human-annotated dataset from NASA AMS sensor with 12-channel aerial wildfire images (4000+ images from 20 missions) for real-time wildfire detection and localization.

entry.title: HELIOS: Hierarchical Graph Abstraction for Structure-Aware LLM Decompilation

author.name: Yonatan Gizachew Achamyeleh, Harsh Thomare, Mohammad Abdullah Al Faruque

entry.summary: Presents HELIOS, a framework that improves LLM-based binary decompilation by representing control flow graphs as hierarchical text, enabling structure-aware reasoning about program behavior.

entry.title: Beyond Error-Based Optimization: Experience-Driven Symbolic Regression with Goal-Conditioned Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jianwen Sun, Xinrui Li, Fuqing Li, Xiaoxuan Shen

entry.summary: Introduces EGRL-SR, using goal-conditioned reinforcement learning with historical experience to guide symbolic regression beyond error-based optimization.

entry.title: Interoperable Architecture for Digital Identity Delegation for AI Agents with Blockchain Integration

author.name: David Ricardo Saavedra

entry.summary: Proposes blockchain-integrated framework for AI agent digital identity delegation with Delegation Grants enabling bounded, auditable authority transfer across identity systems.

entry.title: Automated Rubrics for Reliable Evaluation of Medical Dialogue Systems

author.name: Yinzhu Chen, Abdine Maiga, Hossein A. Rahmani, Emine Yilmaz

entry.summary: Proposes retrieval-augmented multi-agent framework for automatically generating instance-specific evaluation rubrics for medical dialogue systems grounded in authoritative evidence.

entry.title: Stabilizing autoregressive forecasts in chaotic systems via multi-rate latent recurrence

author.name: Mrigank Dhingra, Omer San

entry.summary: MSR-HINE introduces hierarchical implicit forecaster with multi-rate recurrent modules for stabilizing long-horizon autoregressive forecasting of chaotic dynamical systems against error amplification.

entry.title: Statistical Learning Theory for Distributional Classification

author.name: Christian Fiedler

entry.summary: Contributes statistical learning theory for classification with distributional inputs in two-stage sampling, focusing on kernel mean embedding approaches with SVMs.

entry.title: ZENITH: Automated Gradient Norm Informed Stochastic Optimization

author.name: Dhrubo Saha

entry.summary: ZENITH optimizer adapts learning rate using temporal evolution of gradient norm, achieving higher accuracy in lower time across CNNs without manual tuning or hyperparameter overhead.

entry.title: Uncovering and Understanding FPR Manipulation Attack in Industrial IoT Networks

author.name: Mohammad Shamim Ahsan, Peng Liu

entry.summary: Uncovers FPR manipulation attack where adversaries cause benign packets to be misclassified as attacks in ML-based network intrusion detection, exploiting MQTT protocol knowledge in IoT networks.

entry.title: Multi-context principal component analysis

author.name: Kexin Wang, Salil Bhate, Jo\~ao M. Pereira, Joe Kileel, Matylda Figlerowicz, Anna Seigal

entry.summary: Multi-context PCA (MCPCA) extends classical PCA to decompose data into factors shared across subsets of contexts (e.g., different diseases, cell types). Applied to gene expression revealing cancer-type-specific variation axes.

entry.title: RSNA Large Language Model Benchmark Dataset for Chest Radiographs of Cardiothoracic Disease: Radiologist Evaluation and Validation Enhanced by AI Labels (REVEAL-CXR)

author.name: Yishu Wei, Adam E. Flanders, Errol Colak, John Mongan, Luciano M Prevedello, Po-Hao Chen, Henrique Min Ho Lee, Gilberto Szarf, Hamilton Shoji, Jason Sho, Katherine Andriole, Tessa Cook, Lisa C. Adams, Linda C. Chu, Maggie Chung, Geraldine Brusca-Augello, Djeven P. Deva, Navneet Singh, Felipe Sanchez Tijmes, Jeffrey B. Alpert, Elsie T. Nguyen, Drew A. Torigian, Kate Hanneman, Lauren K Groner, Alexander Phan, Ali Islam, Matias F. Callejas, Gustavo Borges da Silva Teles, Faisal Jamal, Maryam Vazirabad, Ali Tejani, Hari Trivedi, Paulo Kuriki, Rajesh Bhayana, Elana T. Benishay, Yi Lin, Yifan Peng, George Shih

entry.summary: REVEAL-CXR presents chest radiograph benchmark for multimodal LLMs using AI-assisted expert labeling. GPT-4o extracts findings mapped to 12 benchmark labels with radiologist validation.

entry.title: DeepMoLM: Leveraging Visual and Geometric Structural Information for Molecule-Text Modeling

author.name: Jing Lan, Hexiao Ding, Hongzhao Chen, Yufeng Jiang, Nga-Chun Ng, Gwing Kei Yip, Gerald W. Y. Cheng, Yunlin Mao, Jing Cai, Liang-ting Lin, Jung Sun Yoo

entry.summary: DeepMoLM proposes dual-view molecular language model grounding high-resolution molecular images in geometric invariants from 3D conformations. Uses Extended 3D Fingerprints for stereochemistry-aware encoding.

entry.title: Towards Holistic Modeling for Video Frame Interpolation with Auto-regressive Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Xinyu Peng, Han Li, Yuyang Huang, Ziyang Zheng, Yaoming Wang, Xin Chen, Wenrui Dai, Chenglin Li, Junni Zou, Hongkai Xiong

entry.summary: LDF-VFI proposes video-centric paradigm for video frame interpolation using auto-regressive diffusion transformer with skip-concatenate sampling for temporal coherence.

entry.title: BBoxMaskPose v2: Expanding Mutual Conditioning to 3D

author.name: Miroslav Purkrabek, Constantin Kolomiiets, Jiri Matas

entry.summary: BBoxMaskPose v2 achieves SOTA on crowded pose estimation, becoming first method to exceed 50 AP on OCHuman benchmark. Integrates probabilistic formulation, mask-conditioning, and extends to improve 3D pose estimation.

entry.title: UNCLE-Grasp: Uncertainty-Aware Grasping of Leaf-Occluded Strawberries

author.name: Malak Mansour, Ali Abouzeid, Zezhou Sun, Qinbo Sun, Dezhen Song, Abdalla Swikir

entry.summary: UNCLE-Grasp proposes uncertainty-aware grasping for partially occluded strawberries using Monte Carlo dropout for shape completion uncertainty and evaluating grasp feasibility across multiple hypotheses.

entry.title: Robust Machine Learning for Regulatory Sequence Modeling under Biological and Technical Distribution Shifts

author.name: Yiyao Yang

entry.summary: Studies robustness of deep learning models for regulatory genomics under biological and technical distribution shifts. Introduces benchmark combining mechanistic simulation with MPRA dataset analysis.

entry.title: Layer-adaptive Expert Pruning for Pre-Training of Mixture-of-Experts Large Language Models

author.name: YuanLab. ai, Shawn Wu, Jiangang Luo, Tong Yu, Darcy Chen, Sean Wang, Xudong Zhao, Louie Li, Claire Wang, Hunter He, Carol Wang, Allen Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Layer-Adaptive Expert Pruning (LAEP) for MoE LLM pre-training, selectively pruning underutilized experts and reorganizing across devices to improve training efficiency.

entry.title: How Worst-Case Are Adversarial Attacks? Linking Adversarial and Statistical Robustness

author.name: Giulio Rossolini

entry.summary: Introduces probabilistic metric linking adversarial and statistical robustness, parameterized by concentration factor interpolating between isotropic noise and adversarial direction.

entry.title: AQAScore: Evaluating Semantic Alignment in Text-to-Audio Generation via Audio Question Answering

author.name: Chun-Yi Kuan, Kai-Wei Chang, Hung-yi Lee

entry.summary: Introduces AQAScore, evaluating text-to-audio generation by computing probability of 'Yes' answer to targeted semantic verification questions using audio-aware LLMs.

entry.title: InstructTime++: Time Series Classification with Multimodal Language Modeling via Implicit Feature Enhancement

author.name: Mingyue Cheng, Xiaoyu Tao, Huajian Zhang, Qi Liu, Enhong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes InstructTime reformulating time series classification as multimodal generative task, treating sequences, text features, and instructions as multimodal inputs with textual label outputs.

entry.title: BREPS: Bounding-Box Robustness Evaluation of Promptable Segmentation

author.name: Andrey Moskalenko, Danil Kuznetsov, Irina Dudko, Anastasiia Iasakova, Nikita Boldyrev, Denis Shepelev, Andrei Spiridonov, Andrey Kuznetsov, Vlad Shakhuro

entry.summary: Conducts user study collecting real bounding box annotations to evaluate promptable segmentation robustness, finding significant gaps between synthetic prompts and human behavior.

entry.title: Improving Regret Approximation for Unsupervised Dynamic Environment Generation

author.name: Harry Mead, Bruno Lacerda, Jakob Foerster, Nick Hawes

entry.summary: DEGen enables denser reward signals for unsupervised environment design in RL by improving dynamic level generation, reducing credit assignment challenges as environment size grows.

entry.title: From Volumes to Slices: Computationally Efficient Contrastive Learning for Sequential Abdominal CT Analysis

author.name: Po-Kai Chiu, Hung-Hsuan Chen

entry.summary: 2D-VoCo adapts VoCo self-supervised framework from 3D volumes to 2D CT slices for efficient spatial-semantic feature learning, integrated into CNN-LSTM for multi-organ injury classification.

entry.title: Online Linear Programming with Replenishment

author.name: Yuze Chen, Yuan Zhou, Baichuan Mo, Jie Ying, Yufei Ruan, Zhou Ye

entry.summary: Studies online linear programming with gradual resource replenishment instead of upfront inventory, developing algorithms and regret bounds for bounded, i.i.d., and adversarial regimes.

entry.title: Learning and extrapolating scale-invariant processes

author.name: Anaclara Alvez-Canepa, Cyril Furtlehner, Fran\c{c}ois Landes

entry.summary: Studies ML regression of scale-free processes displaying power law behavior, investigating extrapolation capabilities for predicting rare large events like earthquakes using self-similar benchmarks.

entry.title: From Chaos to Clarity: Schema-Constrained AI for Auditable Biomedical Evidence Extraction from Full-Text PDFs

author.name: Pouria Mortezaagha, Joseph Shaw, Bowen Sun, Arya Rahgozar

entry.summary: Presents schema-constrained AI system for extracting structured biomedical evidence from full-text PDFs using typed schemas, controlled vocabularies, and evidence-gated decisions. Addresses OCR errors and auditability challenges.

entry.title: Robust Fake News Detection using Large Language Models under Adversarial Sentiment Attacks

author.name: Sahar Tahmasebi, Eric M\"uller-Budack, Ralph Ewerth

entry.summary: Studies adversarial robustness of fake news detection under LLM-generated sentiment manipulation attacks, revealing vulnerability of sentiment-based detection methods.

entry.title: LFS: Learnable Frame Selector for Event-Aware and Temporally Diverse Video Captioning

author.name: Lianying Chao, Linfeng Yin, Peiyu Ren, Yifan Jiang, Qiaoyu Ren, Dingcheng Shan, Jing-cheng Pang, Sijie Wu, Xubin Li, Kai Zhang

entry.summary: LFS (Learnable Frame Selector) selects temporally diverse and event-relevant frames for video captioning, using caption feedback to learn selection that optimizes downstream quality.

entry.title: Does medical specialization of VLMs enhance discriminative power?: A comprehensive investigation through feature distribution analysis

author.name: Keita Takeda, Tomoya Sakai

entry.summary: Investigates feature distributions of medical VLMs to understand impact of medical specialization on discriminative power across multiple imaging modalities.

entry.title: Probing Prompt Design for Socially Compliant Robot Navigation with Vision Language Models

author.name: Ling Xiao, Toshihiko Yamasaki

entry.summary: Studies prompt design for socially compliant robot navigation with small VLMs, exploring system guidance (action-focused vs reasoning-oriented) and motivational framing dimensions inspired by cognitive theories.

entry.title: Tokenomics: Quantifying Where Tokens Are Used in Agentic Software Engineering

author.name: Mohamad Salim, Jasmine Latendresse, SayedHassan Khatoonabadi, Emad Shihab

entry.summary: Analyzes token consumption patterns in ChatDev multi-agent framework using GPT-5 across 30 software development tasks, mapping consumption to distinct SDLC phases.

entry.title: Vision-Language Models on the Edge for Real-Time Robotic Perception

author.name: Sarat Ahmad, Maryam Hafeez, Syed Ali Raza Zaidi

entry.summary: Evaluates VLM deployment on edge for robotics using LLaMA-3.2-11B-Vision on ORAN/MEC infrastructure with WebRTC streaming, comparing edge versus cloud inference.

entry.title: Recommending Best Paper Awards for ML/AI Conferences via the Isotonic Mechanism

author.name: Garrett G. Wen, Buxin Su, Natalie Collina, Zhun Deng, Weijie Su

entry.summary: Proposes Isotonic Mechanism for author-assisted best paper award selection at ML/AI conferences, eliciting authors' submission rankings to adjust review scores.

entry.title: Relational Graph Modeling for Credit Default Prediction: Heterogeneous GNNs and Hybrid Ensemble Learning

author.name: Yvonne Yang, Eranki Vasistha

entry.summary: Constructs massive heterogeneous graph (31M nodes, 50M edges) integrating borrower attributes with transaction-level data, comparing heterogeneous GNNs against tabular baselines for credit default prediction.

entry.title: PodBench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Instruction-Aware Audio-Oriented Podcast Script Generation

author.name: Chenning Xu, Mao Zheng, Mingyu Zheng, Mingyang Song

entry.summary: PodBench provides 800-sample benchmark for podcast script generation with inputs up to 21K tokens and complex multi-speaker instructions. Reveals gap between constraint adherence and open-ended quality.

entry.title: Taxonomy-Aligned Risk Extraction from 10-K Filings with Autonomous Improvement Using LLMs

author.name: Rian Dolphin, Joe Dursun, Jarrett Blankenship, Katie Adams, Quinton Pike

entry.summary: Presents pipeline for extracting structured risk factors from 10-K filings with autonomous taxonomy maintenance using AI agent. Agent analyzes feedback to identify problematic categories and propose refinements.

entry.title: Anatomically Guided Latent Diffusion for Brain MRI Progression Modeling

author.name: Cheng Wan, Bahram Jafrasteh, Ehsan Adeli, Miaomiao Zhang, Qingyu Zhao

entry.summary: AG-LDM uses segmentation-guided latent diffusion for anatomically consistent brain MRI progression modeling, simplifying training while enforcing anatomical constraints.

entry.title: Reconstruction-Anchored Diffusion Model for Text-to-Motion Generation

author.name: Yifei Liu, Changxing Ding, Ling Guo, Huaiguang Jiang, Qiong Cao

entry.summary: RAM (Reconstruction-Anchored Diffusion Model) addresses text-to-motion generation's representational gap by co-training motion reconstruction branch as intermediate supervision.

entry.title: Graph-Based Adaptive Planning for Coordinated Dual-Arm Robotic Disassembly of Electronic Devices (eGRAP)

author.name: Adip Ranjan Das, Maria Koskinopoulou

entry.summary: eGRAP integrates vision, dynamic planning, and dual-arm execution for autonomous e-waste disassembly. Uses directed graph for part dependencies with topological ordering for parallel arm coordination.

entry.title: The Plausibility Trap: Using Probabilistic Engines for Deterministic Tasks

author.name: Ivan Carrera, Daniel Maldonado-Ruiz

entry.summary: Defines 'Plausibility Trap' where users deploy expensive LLMs for simple deterministic tasks like OCR. Quantifies ~6.5x latency penalty and introduces framework for tool selection between deterministic and probabilistic approaches.

entry.title: DeepInflation: an AI agent for research and model discovery of inflation

author.name: Ze-Yu Peng, Hao-Shi Yuan, Qi Lai, Jun-Qian Jiang, Gen Ye, Jun Zhang, Yun-Song Piao

entry.summary: Presents DeepInflation, AI agent for inflationary cosmology using multi-agent architecture with LLMs, symbolic regression, and RAG to discover viable inflationary potentials consistent with observations.

entry.title: Agentic AI Meets Edge Computing in Autonomous UAV Swarms

author.name: Thuan Minh Nguyen, Vu Tuan Truong, Long Bao Le

entry.summary: Investigates LLM-based agentic AI integration with edge computing for UAV swarms, discussing standalone, edge-enabled, and edge-cloud hybrid architectures for scalable autonomous drone coordination.

entry.title: Optimality of Staircase Mechanisms for Vector Queries under Differential Privacy

author.name: James Melbourne, Mario Diaz, Shahab Asoodeh

entry.summary: Proves that staircase mechanisms are optimal for additive differential privacy across any dimension, norm, and cost function using convex rearrangement theory. This settles a fundamental question in privacy mechanism design.

entry.title: Scaling Ambiguity: Augmenting Human Annotation in Speech Emotion Recognition with Audio-Language Models

author.name: Wenda Zhang, Hongyu Jin, Siyi Wang, Zhiqiang Wei, Ting Dang

entry.summary: Explores using large audio-language models to generate synthetic annotations for ambiguous emotion recognition, augmenting sparse human labels to improve ground-truth distribution reliability.

entry.title: RECAP: Resistance Capture in Text-based Mental Health Counseling with Large Language Models

author.name: Anqi Li, Yuqian Chen, Yu Lu, Zhaoming Chen, Yuan Xie, Zhenzhong Lan

entry.summary: Proposes RECAP framework for detecting client resistance in mental health counseling, with 13 fine-grained resistance behaviors and 23,930 annotated utterances.

entry.title: Differential Privacy Image Generation with Reconstruction Loss and Noise Injection Using an Error Feedback SGD

author.name: Qiwei Ma, Jun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes differential privacy image generation using Error Feedback SGD with reconstruction loss and noise injection, achieving higher quality under same privacy budget.

entry.title: Benchmarking Large Language Models for ABAP Code Generation: An Empirical Study on Iterative Improvement by Compiler Feedback

author.name: Stephan Wallraven, Tim K\"ohne, Hartmut Westenberger, Andreas Moser

entry.summary: Benchmarks LLM performance on ABAP code generation with 180 tasks, finding significant differences between models and that compiler feedback enables iterative improvement.

entry.title: Quality or Quantity? Error-Informed Selective Online Learning with Gaussian Processes in Multi-Agent Systems: Extended Version

author.name: Zewen Yang, Xiaobing Dai, Jiajun Cheng, Yulong Huang, Peng Shi

entry.summary: Presents distributed error-informed Gaussian process framework for multi-agent systems that selectively chooses higher-quality neighboring models rather than indiscriminately including all, prioritizing quality over quantity.

entry.title: Log anomaly detection via Meta Learning and Prototypical Networks for Cross domain generalization

author.name: Krishna Sharma, Vivek Yelleti

entry.summary: End-to-end meta-learning framework for cross-domain log anomaly detection combining Drain3 parsing with dynamic drift-based labeling and prototypical networks for domain adaptation.

entry.title: Adaptive Exponential Integration for Stable Gaussian Mixture Black-Box Variational Inference

author.name: Baojun Che, Yifan Chen, Daniel Zhengyu Huang, Xinying Mao, Weijie Wang

entry.summary: Develops stable framework for black-box variational inference combining affine-invariant preconditioning, exponential integrators preserving covariance positive-definiteness, and adaptive time stepping.

entry.title: DeepFedNAS: A Unified Framework for Principled, Hardware-Aware, and Predictor-Free Federated Neural Architecture Search

author.name: Bostan Khan, Masoud Daneshtalab

entry.summary: DeepFedNAS introduces principled two-phase federated neural architecture search with Pareto-optimal supernet training, eliminating need for accuracy predictors.

entry.title: GNN-based Path-aware multi-view Circuit Learning for Technology Mapping

author.name: Wentao Jiang, Jingxin Wang, Zhang Hu, Zhengyuan Shi, Chengyu Ma, Qiang Xu, Weikang Qian, Zhufei Chu

entry.summary: GPA framework learns circuit delay predictions by fusing three views: AIG-based functional encoding, post-mapping technology, and critical timing paths for technology mapping.

entry.title: Large Data Limits of Laplace Learning for Gaussian Measure Data in Infinite Dimensions

author.name: Zhengang Zhong, Yury Korolev, Matthew Thorpe

entry.summary: Analyzes Laplace learning semi-supervised method in infinite-dimensional setting with Gaussian measure data, proving convergence from graph to continuum without finite-dimensional assumptions.

entry.title: ExoMiner++ 2.0: Vetting TESS Full-Frame Image Transit Signals

author.name: Miguel J. S. Martinho, Hamed Valizadegan, Jon M. Jenkins, Douglas A. Caldwell, Joseph D. Twicken, Ben Tofflemire, Marziye Jafariyazani

entry.summary: ExoMiner++ 2.0 adapts exoplanet detection framework to TESS Full-Frame Images, performing large-scale planet classification and creating uniform vetting catalog across sectors.

entry.title: SmartOracle -- An Agentic Approach to Mitigate Noise in Differential Oracles

author.name: Srinath Srinivasan, Tim Menzies, Marcelo D'Amorim

entry.summary: SmartOracle uses LLM-based agentic systems to automate differential fuzzing oracle construction for JavaScript interpreters, replacing expensive manual triage workflows. The multi-agent approach synthesizes evidence from terminal runs and specification queries.

entry.title: Comparative Study of Large Language Models on Chinese Film Script Continuation: An Empirical Analysis Based on GPT-5.2 and Qwen-Max

author.name: Yuxuan Cao, Zida Yang, Ye Wang

entry.summary: Constructs first Chinese film script continuation benchmark comparing GPT-5.2 and Qwen-Max across 53 classic films. Finds Qwen-Max achieves slightly higher textual metrics but GPT-5.2 dominates structural alignment.

entry.title: Gaussian Based Adaptive Multi-Modal 3D Semantic Occupancy Prediction

author.name: A. Enes Doruk

entry.summary: Proposes Gaussian-based adaptive camera-LiDAR fusion for 3D semantic occupancy prediction in autonomous vehicles, using memory-efficient 3D Gaussian representation.

entry.title: Learning Consistent Taxonomic Classification through Hierarchical Reasoning

author.name: Zhenghong Li, Kecheng Zheng, Haibin Ling

entry.summary: VL-Taxon proposes two-stage hierarchy-based reasoning framework for taxonomic classification in VLMs, improving both leaf-level accuracy and hierarchical consistency.

entry.title: ReinPath: A Multimodal Reinforcement Learning Approach for Pathology

author.name: Kangcheng Zhou, Jun Jiang, Qing Zhang, Shuang Zheng, Qingli Li, Shugong Xu

entry.summary: ReinPath applies multimodal RL with semantic reward strategy to pathology VQA, constructing dataset requiring reasoning for cancer type detection.

entry.title: POTR: Post-Training 3DGS Compression

author.name: Bert Ramlot, Martijn Courteaux, Peter Lambert, Glenn Van Wallendael

entry.summary: POTR proposes post-training 3DGS compression using novel pruning that calculates individual splat removal effects simultaneously, achieving 2-4x fewer splats.

entry.title: Pb4U-GNet: Resolution-Adaptive Garment Simulation via Propagation-before-Update Graph Network

author.name: Aoran Liu, Kun Hu, Clinton Ansun Mo, Qiuxia Wu, Wenxiong Kang, Zhiyong Wang

entry.title: Unsupervised Deformable Image Registration with Local-Global Attention and Image Decomposition

author.name: Zhengyong Huang, Xingwen Sun, Xuting Chang, Ning Jiang, Yao Wang, Jianfei Sun, Hongbin Han, Yao Sui

entry.summary: LGANet++ proposes unsupervised deformable image registration using novel local-global attention mechanism with feature interaction and fusion. Addresses challenges in registering regions with high anatomical variability.

entry.title: UniCon: A Unified System for Efficient Robot Learning Transfers

author.name: Yunfeng Lin, Li Xu, Yong Yu, Jiangmiao Pang, Weinan Zhang

entry.summary: UniCon is a lightweight framework for deploying learning-based controllers across heterogeneous robots, standardizing states, control flow, and enabling plug-and-play deployment with efficient batched data flow.

entry.title: Risk Estimation for Automated Driving

author.name: Leon Tolksdorf, Arturo Tejada, Jonas Bauernfeind, Christian Birkner, Nathan van de Wouw

entry.summary: Presents risk estimation framework for automated driving characterizing uncertainty on state estimates of other road participants and collision severity. Useful for motion planning through risk constraints.

entry.title: Federated Transformer-GNN for Privacy-Preserving Brain Tumor Localization with Modality-Level Explainability

author.name: Andrea Protani, Riccardo Taiello, Marc Molina Van Den Bosch, Luigi Serio

entry.summary: Presents federated learning framework for brain tumor localization using Transformer-GNN hybrid on CERN's CAFEIN platform with modality-level explainability through attention.

entry.title: Graph Recognition via Subgraph Prediction

author.name: Andr\'e Eberhard, Gerhard Neumann, Pascal Friederich

entry.summary: GraSP proposes a unified method for visual graph recognition by predicting subgraphs from images, applicable across different visual relationship extraction contexts. Aims for broader applicability than specialized solutions.

entry.title: Business Logic-Driven Text-to-SQL Data Synthesis for Business Intelligence

author.name: Jinhui Liu, Ximeng Zhang, Yanbo Ai, Zhou Yu

entry.summary: Proposes Business Logic-Driven Data Synthesis for generating realistic Text-to-SQL evaluation data grounded in business personas, scenarios, and workflows. Introduces reasoning complexity control strategy.

entry.title: Scribble-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation with Dynamic Teacher Switching and Hierarchical Consistency

author.name: Thanh-Huy Nguyen, Hoang-Loc Cao, Dat T. Chung, Mai-Anh Vu, Thanh-Minh Nguyen, Minh Le, Phat K. Huynh, Ulas Bagci

entry.summary: SDT-Net proposes dual-teacher framework for scribble-supervised medical segmentation with Dynamic Teacher Switching to adaptively select reliable teachers.

entry.title: UBATrack: Spatio-Temporal State Space Model for General Multi-Modal Tracking

author.name: Qihua Liang, Liang Chen, Yaozong Zheng, Jian Nong, Zhiyi Mo, Bineng Zhong

entry.summary: UBATrack uses spatio-temporal Mamba for general multi-modal tracking (RGB-Thermal, RGB-Depth, RGB-Event), capturing long-sequence dependencies efficiently.

entry.title: Erosion Attack for Adversarial Training to Enhance Semantic Segmentation Robustness

author.name: Yufei Song, Ziqi Zhou, Menghao Deng, Yifan Hu, Shengshan Hu, Minghui Li, Leo Yu Zhang

entry.summary: EroSeg-AT proposes vulnerability-aware adversarial training for semantic segmentation, propagating perturbations from low-confidence to high-confidence pixels.

entry.title: How to Build AI Agents by Augmenting LLMs with Codified Human Expert Domain Knowledge? A Software Engineering Framework

author.name: Choro Ulan uulu, Mikhail Kulyabin, Iris Fuhrmann, Jan Joosten, Nuno Miguel Martins Pacheco, Filippos Petridis, Rebecca Johnson, Jan Bosch, Helena Holmstr\"om Olsson

entry.summary: Proposes software engineering framework for building AI agents by augmenting LLMs with codified human domain knowledge, demonstrated in simulation data visualization use case.

entry.title: DiSPA: Differential Substructure-Pathway Attention for Drug Response Prediction

author.name: Yewon Han, Sunghyun Kim, Eunyi Jeong, Sungkyung Lee, Seokwoo Yun, Sangsoo Lim

entry.summary: Proposes DiSPA framework for drug response prediction that disentangles structure-driven and context-driven mechanisms through bidirectional conditional attention between drug substructures and cellular pathways.

entry.title: XD-MAP: Cross-Modal Domain Adaptation using Semantic Parametric Mapping

author.name: Frank Bieder, Hendrik K\"onigshof, Haohao Hu, Fabian Immel, Yinzhe Shen, Jan-Hendrik Pauls, Christoph Stiller

entry.summary: Proposes XD-MAP for cross-modal domain adaptation from image to LiDAR using semantic parametric maps, leveraging camera detections to create pseudo labels for LiDAR models.

entry.title: When Text-as-Vision Meets Semantic IDs in Generative Recommendation: An Empirical Study

author.name: Shutong Qiao, Wei Yuan, Tong Chen, Xiangyu Zhao, Quoc Viet Hung Nguyen, Hongzhi Yin

entry.summary: Studies how text encoders struggle with attribute-centric item descriptions in generative recommendation, proposing text-as-vision approach to improve semantic ID learning.

entry.title: An Agentic Operationalization of DISARM for FIMI Investigation on Social Media

author.name: Kevin Tseng, Juan Carlos Toledano, Bart De Clerck, Yuliia Dukach, Phil Tinn

entry.summary: Proposes agentic operationalization of DISARM framework for investigating foreign information manipulation on social media using AI agents for threat characterization.

entry.title: Feasibility Preservation under Monotone Retrieval Truncation

author.name: Sean Plummer

entry.summary: Studies retrieval as feasibility problem under truncation, proving monotone truncation suffices for finite witnessability and characterizing finite detectability for query classes.

entry.title: engGNN: A Dual-Graph Neural Network for Omics-Based Disease Classification and Feature Selection

author.name: Tiantian Yang, Yuxuan Wang, Zhenwei Zhou, Ching-Ti Liu

entry.summary: Proposes engGNN, a dual-graph GNN framework jointly leveraging external biological knowledge graphs and data-driven graphs for omics-based disease classification and feature selection.

entry.title: Efficient Imputation for Patch-based Missing Single-cell Data via Cluster-regularized Optimal Transport

author.name: Yuyu Liu, Jiannan Yang, Ziyang Yu, Weishen Pan, Fei Wang, Tengfei Ma

entry.summary: CROT uses optimal transport with cluster regularization for imputing large patches of missing data in single-cell sequencing, achieving superior accuracy with reduced runtime.

entry.title: Communication-Efficient Multi-Modal Edge Inference via Uncertainty-Aware Distributed Learning

author.name: Hang Zhao, Hongru Li, Dongfang Xu, Shenghui Song, Khaled B. Letaief

entry.summary: Three-stage communication-aware distributed learning framework for multi-modal edge inference with uncertainty-aware mechanisms for robustness under varying channels and noisy inputs.

entry.title: Mixture-of-Experts Models in Vision: Routing, Optimization, and Generalization

author.name: Adam Rokah, Daniel Veress, Caleb Caulk, Sourav Sharan

entry.summary: Studies MoE behavior in image classification comparing dense, SoftMoE, and SparseMoE heads on CIFAR10, analyzing expert utilization, generalization, and Hessian-based sharpness metrics.

entry.title: Finite-Sample Inference for Sparsely Permuted Linear Regression

author.name: Hirofumi Ota, Masaaki Imaizumi

entry.summary: Develops finite-sample inference framework for permuted linear regression using localization step to reduce permutation space, then repro samples method for statistical inference.

entry.title: Supporting Humans in Evaluating AI Summaries of Legal Depositions

author.name: Naghmeh Farzi, Laura Dietz, Dave D. Lewis

entry.summary: Develops nugget-based approach to help legal professionals evaluate LLM deposition summaries, supporting determination of missing information and factual accuracy assessment.

entry.title: PAS-Mamba: Phase-Amplitude-Spatial State Space Model for MRI Reconstruction

author.name: Xiaoyan Kui, Zijie Fan, Zexin Ji, Qinsong Li, Hao Xu, Weixin Si, Haodong Xu, Beiji Zou

entry.summary: PAS-Mamba separates phase and amplitude in frequency domain for MRI reconstruction using state space models, preventing interference between structural and intensity information learning.

entry.title: LookBench: A Live and Holistic Open Benchmark for Fashion Image Retrieval

author.name: Chao Gao, Siqiao Xue, Yimin Peng, Jiwen Fu, Tingyi Gu, Shanshan Li, Fan Zhou

entry.summary: LookBench presents live, holistic fashion image retrieval benchmark with time-stamped product images and AI-generated fashion, enabling contamination-aware evaluation.

entry.title: UniRoute: Unified Routing Mixture-of-Experts for Modality-Adaptive Remote Sensing Change Detection

author.name: Qingling Shu, Sibao Chen, Wei Lu, Zhihui You, Chengzhuang Liu

entry.summary: UniRoute proposes unified MoE routing for remote sensing change detection across homogeneous and heterogeneous modalities, adapting to different input types.

entry.title: APPLE: Attribute-Preserving Pseudo-Labeling for Diffusion-Based Face Swapping

author.name: Jiwon Kang, Yeji Choi, JoungBin Lee, Wooseok Jang, Jinhyeok Choi, Taekeun Kang, Yongjae Park, Myungin Kim, Seungryong Kim

entry.summary: APPLE proposes a diffusion-based teacher-student framework for face swapping that preserves target attributes like pose, expression, and lighting. Addresses lack of ground truth through pseudo-labeling approach.

entry.title: On-the-fly hand-eye calibration for the da Vinci surgical robot

author.name: Zejian Cui, Ferdinando Rodriguez y Baena

entry.summary: Proposes on-the-fly hand-eye calibration for da Vinci surgical robot addressing pose estimation errors from cable-driven encoder readings. Works on monocular images without pre-training.

entry.title: GAT-NeRF: Geometry-Aware-Transformer Enhanced Neural Radiance Fields for High-Fidelity 4D Facial Avatars

author.name: Zhe Chang, Haodong Jin, Ying Sun, Yan Song, Hui Yu

entry.summary: Proposes GAT-NeRF combining transformers with NeRF for high-fidelity 4D facial avatar reconstruction from monocular video, capturing dynamic wrinkles and textures.

entry.title: Incentive-Tuning: Understanding and Designing Incentives for Empirical Human-AI Decision-Making Studies

author.name: Simran Kaur, Sara Salimzadeh, Ujwal Gadiraju

entry.summary: Systematic review of incentive design in human-AI decision-making studies, examining how crowdsourcing incentives affect participant behavior and study validity.

entry.title: SOSControl: Enhancing Human Motion Generation through Saliency-Aware Symbolic Orientation and Timing Control

author.name: Ho Yin Au, Junkun Jiang, Jie Chen

entry.summary: SOSControl introduces Salient Orientation Symbolic script for specifying body part orientations and motion timing in text-to-motion generation. Includes automatic extraction pipeline from motion data.

entry.title: Enhancing Text-to-Image Generation via End-Edge Collaborative Hybrid Super-Resolution

author.name: Chongbin Yi, Yuxin Liang, Ziqi Zhou, Peng Yang

entry.summary: Proposes end-edge collaborative super-resolution for text-to-image generation, balancing lightweight learning-based and diffusion-based SR methods for efficient high-resolution output.

entry.title: LocBAM: Advancing 3D Patch-Based Image Segmentation by Integrating Location Contex

author.name: Donnate Hooft, Stefan M. Fischer, Cosmin Bercea, Jan C. Peeken, Julia A. Schnabel

entry.summary: LocBAM proposes attention mechanism incorporating location context for patch-based 3D medical image segmentation, improving performance when anatomical context matters.

entry.title: DARA: Few-shot Budget Allocation in Online Advertising via In-Context Decision Making with RL-Finetuned LLMs

author.name: Mingxuan Song, Yusen Huo, Bohan Zhou, Shenglin Yin, Zhen Xiao, Jieyi Long, Zhilin Zhang, Chuan Yu

entry.summary: Introduces DARA for few-shot budget allocation in online advertising using GRPO-Adaptive post-training strategy to enhance LLM numerical precision for bidding optimization.

entry.title: DDSA: Dual-Domain Strategic Attack for Spatial-Temporal Efficiency in Adversarial Robustness Testing

author.name: Jinwei Hu, Shiyuan Meng, Yi Dong, Xiaowei Huang

entry.summary: Proposes DDSA framework for resource-efficient adversarial robustness testing with temporal selectivity and spatial precision, introducing scenario-aware trigger function for identifying critical frames.

entry.title: GPU-accelerated simulated annealing based on p-bits with real-world device-variability modeling

author.name: Naoya Onizawa, Takahiro Hanyu

entry.title: Report for NSF Workshop on AI for Electronic Design Automation

author.name: Deming Chen (Celine), Vijay Ganesh (Celine), Weikai Li (Celine), Yingyan (Celine), Lin, Yong Liu, Subhasish Mitra, David Z. Pan, Ruchir Puri, Jason Cong, Yizhou Sun

entry.summary: NSF Workshop report on AI for Electronic Design Automation covering AI applications across physical synthesis, high-level synthesis, verification, and infrastructure, with recommendations for future research.

entry.title: Communication-Efficient Federated Risk Difference Estimation for Time-to-Event Clinical Outcomes

author.name: Ziwen Wang, Siqi Li, Marcus Eng Hock Ong, Nan Liu

entry.summary: Proposes FedRD, a server-independent federated learning framework for survival analysis that requires minimal communication rounds while preserving privacy in medical research.

entry.title: Transfer Learning from One Cancer to Another via Deep Learning Domain Adaptation

author.name: Justin Cheung, Samuel Savine, Calvin Nguyen, Lin Lu, Alhassan S. Yasin

entry.summary: Evaluates domain adaptation techniques for transferring cancer classification knowledge between adenocarcinoma types, addressing morphological similarities across organs.

entry.title: Anytime Optimal Decision Tree Learning with Continuous Features

author.name: Harold Kiossou, Pierre Schaus, Siegfried Nijssen

entry.summary: Proposes anytime algorithm for optimal decision tree learning with continuous features, addressing scalability limitations of existing exact methods beyond depth 3-4.

entry.title: Knowledge Restoration-driven Prompt Optimization: Unlocking LLM Potential for Open-Domain Relational Triplet Extraction

author.name: Xiaonan Jing, Gongqing Wu, Xingrui Zhuo, Lang Sun, Jiapu Wang

entry.summary: Proposes KRPO framework helping LLMs continuously improve open-domain relation extraction through reflection mechanisms that internalize erroneous signals.

entry.title: Many Experiments, Few Repetitions, Unpaired Data, and Sparse Effects: Is Causal Inference Possible?

author.name: Felix Schur, Niklas Pfister, Peng Ding, Sach Mukherjee, Jonas Peters

entry.summary: Proposes GMM-type estimator with cross-fold sample splitting for causal effect estimation under hidden confounding with many environments but few observations per environment.

entry.title: Hierarchical Contextual Uplift Bandits for Catalog Personalization

author.name: Anupam Agrawal, Rajesh Mohanty, Shamik Bhattacharjee, Abhimanyu Mittal

entry.summary: Proposes hierarchical contextual uplift bandit framework for fantasy sports personalization that dynamically adjusts contextual granularity and integrates uplift modeling, validated on Dream11 platform.

entry.title: RefProtoFL: Communication-Efficient Federated Learning via External-Referenced Prototype Alignment

author.name: Hongyue Wu, Hangyu Li, Guodong Fan, Haoran Zhu, Shizhan Chen, Zhiyong Feng

entry.summary: RefProtoFL integrates external-referenced prototype alignment for representation consistency with adaptive probabilistic update dropping for communication-efficient federated learning.

entry.title: Multimodal Rumor Detection Enhanced by External Evidence and Forgery Features

author.name: Han Li, Hua Sun

entry.summary: Multimodal rumor detection model using external evidence and forgery features to address deep semantic mismatch rumors that superficially align images and texts.

entry.title: LoRAP: Low-Rank Aggregation Prompting for Quantized Graph Neural Networks Training

author.name: Chenyu Liu, Haige Li, Luca Rossi

entry.summary: LoRAP applies low-rank aggregation prompting to improve quantization-aware training for GNNs, addressing limitation that prompting node features alone only partially optimizes quantized aggregation.

entry.title: TRSVR: An Adaptive Stochastic Trust-Region Method with Variance Reduction

author.name: Yuchen Fang, Xinshou Zheng, Javad Lavaei

entry.summary: TRSVR combines stochastic trust-region method with SVRG for nonconvex optimization, achieving complexity bounds matching SVRG while allowing stochastic radius updates.

entry.title: MTFlow: Time-Conditioned Flow Matching for Microtubule Segmentation in Noisy Microscopy Images

author.name: Sidi Mohamed Sid El Moctar, Achraf Ait Laydi, Yousef El Mourabit, H\'el\`ene Bouvrais

entry.summary: MTFlow uses time-conditioned flow matching for microtubule segmentation in noisy microscopy, learning vector fields for iterative trajectory-based mask refinement.

entry.title: Large Language Models for Large-Scale, Rigorous Qualitative Analysis in Applied Health Services Research

author.name: Sasha Ronaghi, Emma-Louise Aveling, Maria Levis, Rachel Lauren Ross, Emily Alsentzer, Sara Singer

entry.summary: Develops a task-agnostic framework for integrating LLMs into qualitative health research, demonstrating on diabetes care interviews across FQHCs. Shows practical human-LLM collaboration for synthesis and coding.

entry.title: READ-Net: Clarifying Emotional Ambiguity via Adaptive Feature Recalibration for Audio-Visual Depression Detection

author.name: Chenglizhao Chen, Boze Li, Mengke Song, Dehao Feng, Xinyu Liu, Shanchen Pang, Jufeng Yang, Hui Yu

entry.summary: READ-Net addresses 'Emotional Ambiguity' in depression detection, distinguishing transient emotional expressions from stable depressive symptoms through adaptive feature recalibration.

entry.title: M2I2HA: A Multi-modal Object Detection Method Based on Intra- and Inter-Modal Hypergraph Attention

author.name: Xiaofan Yang, Yubin Liu, Wei Pan, Guoqing Chu, Junming Zhang, Jie Zhao, Zhuoqi Man, Xuanming Cao

entry.summary: M2I2HA uses hypergraph attention for multi-modal object detection, capturing higher-order relationships both within and across RGB-thermal/depth modalities.

entry.title: Unified Multi-Dataset Training for TBPS

author.name: Nilanjana Chatterjee, Sidharatha Garg, A V Subramanyam, Brejesh Lall

entry.summary: Proposes unified multi-dataset training for text-based person search, showing naive joint training is suboptimal and developing solutions for dataset-specific adaptation.

entry.title: Enhancing Few-Shot Out-of-Distribution Detection via the Refinement of Foreground and Background

author.name: Tianyu Li, Songyue Cai, Zongqian Wu, Ping Hu, Xiaofeng Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes a plug-and-play framework for CLIP-based few-shot out-of-distribution detection that refines foreground and background decomposition. Addresses limitations in existing uniform suppression strategies for background patches.

entry.title: ExPrIS: Knowledge-Level Expectations as Priors for Object Interpretation from Sensor Data

author.name: Marian Renz, Martin G\"unther, Felix Igelbrink, Oscar Lima, Martin Atzmueller

entry.title: IntelliSA: An Intelligent Static Analyzer for IaC Security Smell Detection Using Symbolic Rules and Neural Inference

author.name: Qiyue Mei, Michael Fu

entry.title: FSX: Message Flow Sensitivity Enhanced Structural Explainer for Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Bizu Feng, Zhimu Yang, Shaode Yu, Zixin Hu

entry.summary: Proposes FSX, combining gradient-based message flow analysis with game-theoretic approaches for GNN explainability while maintaining computational efficiency.

entry.title: CAG-Avatar: Cross-Attention Guided Gaussian Avatars for High-Fidelity Head Reconstruction

author.name: Zhe Chang, Haodong Jin, Yan Song, Hui Yu

entry.title: A full process algebraic representation of Ant Colony Optimization

author.name: Maria Garcia, Natalia Lopez, Ismael Rodriguez

entry.summary: Presents PA²CO, a process algebra capable of formally specifying parallelized Ant Colony Optimization algorithms in full detail, including fine-grained and coarse-grained parallel implementations.

entry.title: Towards Bound Consistency for the No-Overlap Constraint Using MDDs

author.name: Amaury Guichard, Laurent Michel, H\'el\`ene Verhaeghe, Pierre Schaus

entry.summary: Derives first bound-consistent algorithm for the no-overlap constraint by building on MDD representations, enabling tighter filtering than existing polynomial-time techniques.

entry.title: Recursivism: An Artistic Paradigm for Self-Transforming Art in the Age of AI

author.name: Florentin Koch

entry.summary: Introduces Recursivism as conceptual framework for self-transforming art in AI era, developing five-level analytical scale from simple iteration to meta-recursion where systems can modify their own generative processes.

entry.title: Bangla Music Genre Classification Using Bidirectional LSTMS

author.name: Muntakimur Rahaman, Md Mahmudul Hoque, Md Mehedi Hassain

entry.summary: Introduces a Bangla music genre classification dataset with 10 genres and applies bidirectional LSTMs for audio classification. Addresses an underexplored low-resource language domain.

entry.title: AI Risks Slip Out of Mind

author.name: MarkelKori

entry.summary: Personal reflection on how AI risks slip from attention when not actively studying the field, and how ordinary life distracts from existential concerns.

entry.title: Scalable Knee-Point Guided Activity Group Selection in Multi-Tree Genetic Programming for Dynamic Multi-Mode Project Scheduling

author.name: Yuan Tian, Yi Mei, Mengjie Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes scalable knee-point guided activity group selection for multi-tree genetic programming in dynamic project scheduling. Addresses scalability issues in activity group selection strategy.

entry.title: Finding Yourself in Others

author.name: 1a3orn

entry.summary: Philosophical/narrative piece exploring identity formation through relationships and how we understand ourselves through others' perceptions of us.

entry.title: Updating in the Opposite Direction from Evidence

author.name: Dom Polsinelli

entry.summary: Short epistemology post noting that comparisons claiming similarity or difference may actually be evidence of the opposite, as speakers may be trying to bridge or create distance.

entry.title: Kredit Grant

author.name: kiankyars

entry.summary: Grant offering $5,710 in OpenAI/Anthropic API credits with application deadline January 31, 2026.

entry.title: Research Summary: January 21, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research reveals critical challenges to conventional training wisdom and exposes multiple safety vulnerabilities across deployed systems.

Training Paradigm Reassessment:

  • Base models consistently outperform instruction-tuned variants on math and domain-shifted benchmarks, challenging fundamental training assumptions
  • RLVR improves task performance but produces extremely overconfident models; SFT yields better calibration even under distribution shift

Safety & Security Vulnerabilities:

  • Action Rebinding allows zero-permission apps to hijack multimodal GUI agents by exploiting visual attention
  • Safeguarded frontier models can elicit harmful capabilities in open-source models through three-stage attacks
  • Sockpuppetting jailbreaks LLMs with one line of code achieving up to 100% ASR
  • AI-generated data contamination in medical imaging creates feedback loops eroding diagnostic reliability

Reasoning Model Insights:

  • Thinking Traps account for 89% of reasoning failures in long CoT—models elaborate incorrect early commitments
  • First systematic cost-accuracy comparison shows multi-agent reasoning often underperforms single-model CoT
  • Large-scale study of 2.1M preprints finds LLM adoption increases paper volume but decreases citations and originality

Architecture Innovation: Threshold Differential Attention eliminates attention sinks while achieving ultra-sparsity and improved long-context robustness.

entry.title: Do Instruction-Tuned Models Always Perform Better Than Base Models? Evidence from Math and Domain-Shifted Benchmarks

author.name: Prateek Munjal, Clement Christophe, Ronnie Rajan, Praveenkumar Kanithi

entry.summary: Investigates whether instruction-tuned models always outperform base models, finding that base models consistently outperform instruction-tuned variants in zero-shot CoT settings on GSM8K (drops up to 32.67% for Llama3-70B). Instruction tuning appears to induce pattern matching rather than genuine reasoning improvement.

entry.title: Balancing Classification and Calibration Performance in Decision-Making LLMs via Calibration Aware Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Duygu Nur Yaldiz, Evangelia Spiliopoulou, Zheng Qi, Siddharth Varia, Srikanth Doss, Nikolaos Pappas

entry.summary: Systematic study showing RLVR improves task performance but produces extremely overconfident models, while SFT yields better calibration even under distribution shift. Proposes calibration-aware RL approach to balance classification and calibration.

entry.title: CausalSpatial: A Benchmark for Object-Centric Causal Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Wenxin Ma, Chenlong Wang, Ruisheng Yuan, Hao Chen, Nanru Dai, S. Kevin Zhou, Yijun Yang, Alan Yuille, Jieneng Chen

entry.summary: Introduces CausalSpatial benchmark evaluating whether MLLMs can anticipate consequences of object motions across collision, compatibility, occlusion and trajectory tasks. Reveals severe gap: humans score 84% while GPT-5 achieves only 54%, exposing over-reliance on textual reasoning.

entry.title: Zero-Permission Manipulation: Can We Trust Large Multimodal Model Powered GUI Agents?

author.name: Yi Qian, Kunwei Qian, Xingbang He, Ligeng Chen, Jikang Zhang, Tiantai Zhang, Haiyang Wei, Linzhang Wang, Hao Wu, Bing Mao

entry.summary: Discovers 'Action Rebinding' - a critical security vulnerability in multimodal GUI agents where zero-permission apps can hijack agent actions by exploiting the gap between observation and action execution. Demonstrates that Visual Atomicity assumption is invalid on Android.

entry.title: Eliciting Harmful Capabilities by Fine-Tuning On Safeguarded Outputs

author.name: Jackson Kaunismaa, Avery Griffin, John Hughes, Christina Q. Knight, Mrinank Sharma, Erik Jones

entry.summary: Demonstrates that safeguarded frontier models can be used to elicit harmful capabilities in open-source models through three-stage elicitation attacks using adjacent-domain prompts that bypass safeguards.

entry.title: APEX-Agents

author.name: Bertie Vidgen, Austin Mann, Abby Fennelly, John Wright Stanly, Lucas Rothman, Marco Burstein, Julien Benchek, David Ostrofsky, Anirudh Ravichandran, Debnil Sur, Neel Venugopal, Alannah Hsia, Isaac Robinson, Calix Huang, Olivia Varones, Daniyal Khan, Michael Haines, Zach Richards, Chirag Mahapatra, Brendan Foody, Osvald Nitski

entry.summary: APEX-Agents benchmarks AI agents on professional tasks from investment banking, consulting, and law with 480 long-horizon cross-application tasks. Gemini 3 Flash achieves 24%, followed by GPT-5.2 and Claude Opus 4.5.

entry.title: A Comprehensive Evaluation of LLM Reasoning: From Single-Model to Multi-Agent Paradigms

author.name: Yapeng Li, Jiakuo Yu, Zhixin Liu, Xinnan Liu, Jing Yu, Songze Li, Tonghua Su

entry.summary: Comprehensive unified evaluation of LLM reasoning paradigms from single-model to multi-agent systems, characterizing performance across benchmarks and analyzing cost-accuracy trade-offs. Probes role-specific capability demands in MAS.

entry.title: Human detectors are surprisingly powerful reward models

author.name: Kumar Ashutosh, XuDong Wang, Xi Yin, Kristen Grauman, Adam Polyak, Ishan Misra, Rohit Girdhar

entry.summary: Proposes HuDA, a surprisingly simple reward model using human detection confidence and temporal prompt alignment to improve human motion in generated videos. Off-the-shelf models outperform specialized methods without training.

entry.title: AI-generated data contamination erodes pathological variability and diagnostic reliability

author.name: Hongyu He, Shaowen Xiang, Ye Zhang, Yingtao Zhu, Jin Zhang, Hao Deng, Emily Alsentzer, Qingyu Chen, Kun-Hsing Yu, Andrew Marmenshall, Tingting Chen, Srinivas Anumasa, Daniel Ebner, Dean Ho, Kee Yuan Ngiam, Ching-Yu Cheng, Dianbo Liu

entry.summary: Demonstrates that AI-generated data contamination in medical AI creates feedback loop causing erosion of pathological variability and diagnostic reliability, with models converging toward generic phenotypes regardless of architecture.

entry.title: Threshold Differential Attention for Sink-Free, Ultra-Sparse, and Non-Dispersive Language Modeling

author.name: Xingyue Huang, Xueying Ding, Mingxuan Ju, Yozen Liu, Neil Shah, Tong Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes Threshold Differential Attention (TDA), a sink-free attention mechanism achieving ultra-sparsity and improved robustness at longer sequence lengths. Uses row-wise extreme-value thresholding with length-dependent gating without computational overhead of projection methods.

entry.title: Dissecting Linear Recurrent Models: How Different Gating Strategies Drive Selectivity and Generalization

author.name: Younes Bouhadjar, Maxime Fabre, Felix Schmidt, Emre Neftci

entry.summary: Proposes refined taxonomy of linear recurrent models (Mamba-like architectures) and introduces SelectivBench, lightweight benchmarks revealing how different gating strategies drive selectivity and generalization. Enables systematic comparison without resource-intensive experiments.

entry.title: The Side Effects of Being Smart: Safety Risks in MLLMs' Multi-Image Reasoning

author.name: Renmiao Chen, Yida Lu, Shiyao Cui, Xuan Ouyang, Victor Shea-Jay Huang, Shumin Zhang, Chengwei Pan, Han Qiu, Minlie Huang

entry.summary: MIR-SafetyBench is the first benchmark focused on multi-image reasoning safety in MLLMs (2,676 instances, 9 image relations). Reveals troubling trend: models with better multi-image reasoning are MORE vulnerable to safety exploits.

entry.title: Thinking Traps in Long Chain-of-Thought: A Measurable Study and Trap-Aware Adaptive Restart

author.name: Kang Chen, Fan Yu, Junjie Nian, Shihan Zhao, Zhuoka Feng, Zijun Yao, Heng Wang, Minshen Yu, Yixin Cao

entry.summary: Identifies 'Thinking Traps' in long CoT - prefix-dominant deadlocks where models elaborate incorrect early commitments. 89% of failures show this pattern. TAAR framework predicts trap locations and triggers adaptive restarts.

entry.title: The Geometry of Thought: How Scale Restructures Reasoning In Large Language Models

author.name: Samuel Cyrenius Anderson

entry.summary: Analyzes 25,000+ CoT trajectories across Law, Science, Code, Math at 8B and 70B scales. Discovers domain-specific phase transitions: Legal reasoning 'crystallizes', Scientific stays 'liquid', Code forms discrete 'lattice'.

entry.title: Terminal-Bench: Benchmarking Agents on Hard, Realistic Tasks in Command Line Interfaces

author.name: Mike A. Merrill, Alexander G. Shaw, Nicholas Carlini, Boxuan Li, Harsh Raj, Ivan Bercovich, Lin Shi, Jeong Yeon Shin, Thomas Walshe, E. Kelly Buchanan, Junhong Shen, Guanghao Ye, Haowei Lin, Jason Poulos, Maoyu Wang, Marianna Nezhurina, Jenia Jitsev, Di Lu, Orfeas Menis Mastromichalakis, Zhiwei Xu, Zizhao Chen, Yue Liu, Robert Zhang, Leon Liangyu Chen, Anurag Kashyap, Jan-Lucas Uslu, Jeffrey Li, Jianbo Wu, Minghao Yan, Song Bian, Vedang Sharma, Ke Sun, Steven Dillmann, Akshay Anand, Andrew Lanpouthakoun, Bardia Koopah, Changran Hu, Etash Guha, Gabriel H. S. Dreiman, Jiacheng Zhu, Karl Krauth, Li Zhong, Niklas Muennighoff, Robert Amanfu, Shangyin Tan, Shreyas Pimpalgaonkar, Tushar Aggarwal, Xiangning Lin, Xin Lan, Xuandong Zhao, Yiqing Liang, Yuanli Wang, Zilong Wang, Changzhi Zhou, David Heineman, Hange Liu, Harsh Trivedi, John Yang, Junhong Lin, Manish Shetty, Michael Yang, Nabil Omi, Negin Raoof, Shanda Li, Terry Yue Zhuo, Wuwei Lin, Yiwei Dai, Yuxin Wang, Wenhao Chai, Shang Zhou, Dariush Wahdany, Ziyu She, Jiaming Hu, Zhikang Dong, Yuxuan Zhu, Sasha Cui, Ahson Saiyed, Arinbj\"orn Kolbeinsson, Jesse Hu, Christopher Michael Rytting, Ryan Marten, Yixin Wang, Alex Dimakis, Andy Konwinski, Ludwig Schmidt

entry.summary: Terminal-Bench 2.0 is a curated benchmark of 89 hard terminal tasks with unique environments and comprehensive tests. Frontier models and agents score less than 65%, identifying areas for improvement.

entry.title: Knowing When to Abstain: Medical LLMs Under Clinical Uncertainty

author.name: Sravanthi Machcha, Sushrita Yerra, Sahil Gupta, Aishwarya Sahoo, Sharmin Sultana, Hong Yu, Zonghai Yao

entry.summary: Introduces MedAbstain, a benchmark for evaluating when medical LLMs should abstain from answering using conformal prediction and adversarial perturbations. Reveals that even high-accuracy models fail to appropriately abstain when uncertain.

entry.title: Scientific production in the era of Large Language Models

author.name: Keigo Kusumegi, Xinyu Yang, Paul Ginsparg, Mathijs de Vaan, Toby Stuart, Yian Yin

entry.summary: Large-scale analysis of LLM impact on scientific production using 2.1M preprints and 246M document accesses. Finds 23.7-89.3% increase in paper production but reversed relationship between linguistic complexity and paper quality.

entry.title: Pro-AI Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: Benaya Trabelsi, Jonathan Shaki, Sarit Kraus

entry.summary: This study investigates whether LLMs display systematic preferential bias in favor of AI itself. Across three experiments, researchers find consistent pro-AI bias: LLMs disproportionately recommend AI options and overestimate AI job salaries by 10 percentage points.

entry.title: Towards Spectroscopy: Susceptibility Clusters in Language Models

author.name: Andrew Gordon, Garrett Baker, George Wang, William Snell, Stan van Wingerden, Daniel Murfet

entry.summary: Applies spectroscopy principles to neural networks - perturbing data distribution and measuring model response via susceptibilities. Shows tokens that follow contexts 'for similar reasons' cluster in susceptibility space. Develops methodology on Pythia-14M.

entry.title: Sockpuppetting: Jailbreaking LLMs Without Optimization Through Output Prefix Injection

author.name: Asen Dotsinski, Panagiotis Eustratiadis

entry.summary: Introduces 'sockpuppetting', a simple jailbreaking method requiring only one line of code that inserts acceptance sequence at output start. Achieves up to 80% higher ASR than GCG on Qwen3-8B without optimization.

entry.title: Locate, Steer, and Improve: A Practical Survey of Actionable Mechanistic Interpretability in Large Language Models

author.name: Hengyuan Zhang, Zhihao Zhang, Mingyang Wang, Zunhai Su, Yiwei Wang, Qianli Wang, Shuzhou Yuan, Ercong Nie, Xufeng Duan, Qibo Xue, Zeping Yu, Chenming Shang, Xiao Liang, Jing Xiong, Hui Shen, Chaofan Tao, Zhengwu Liu, Senjie Jin, Zhiheng Xi, Dongdong Zhang, Sophia Ananiadou, Tao Gui, Ruobing Xie, Hayden Kwok-Hay So, Hinrich Sch\"utze, Xuanjing Huang, Qi Zhang, Ngai Wong

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of actionable mechanistic interpretability organized around 'Locate, Steer, and Improve' framework, bridging observation and intervention for alignment, capability, and efficiency.

entry.title: HALT: Hallucination Assessment via Latent Testing

author.name: Rohan Bhatnagar, Youran Sun, Chi Andrew Zhang, Yixin Wen, Haizhao Yang

entry.summary: HALT proposes lightweight residual probes that read hallucination risk from intermediate hidden states during question processing, enabling near-instantaneous risk estimation with effectively zero added latency. Based on hypothesis that epistemic signals are attenuated in final decoding.

entry.title: Linear Mechanisms for Spatiotemporal Reasoning in Vision Language Models

author.name: Raphi Kang, Hongqiao Chen, Georgia Gkioxari, Pietro Perona

entry.summary: Discovers that VLMs encode object locations by linearly binding 'Spatial IDs' to textual activations and perform spatial reasoning via language tokens. Demonstrates causal role through interventions.

entry.title: ChartVerse: Scaling Chart Reasoning via Reliable Programmatic Synthesis from Scratch

author.name: Zheng Liu, Honglin Lin, Chonghan Qin, Xiaoyang Wang, Xin Gao, Yu Li, Mengzhang Cai, Yun Zhu, Zhanping Zhong, Qizhi Pei, Zhuoshi Pan, Xiaoran Shang, Bin Cui, Conghui He, Wentao Zhang, Lijun Wu

entry.summary: Proposes ChartVerse framework for synthesizing complex charts and reliable reasoning data using Rollout Posterior Entropy metric for complexity-aware generation and multi-stage verification pipeline to eliminate hallucinations.

entry.title: Revisiting Multi-Task Visual Representation Learning

author.name: Shangzhe Di, Zhonghua Zhai, Weidi Xie

entry.summary: Introduces MTV, multi-task visual pretraining framework jointly optimizing vision-language contrastive, self-supervised, and dense spatial objectives. Uses expert models for pseudo-labels to eliminate manual annotation need.

entry.title: Patterning: The Dual of Interpretability

author.name: George Wang, Daniel Murfet

entry.summary: Introduces 'patterning' as the dual of interpretability: given desired generalization, determine what training data produces it. Uses susceptibilities to identify data interventions that steer models toward target internal configurations.

entry.title: AfroScope: A Framework for Studying the Linguistic Landscape of Africa

author.name: Sang Yun Kwon, AbdelRahim Elmadany, Muhammad Abdul-Mageed

entry.summary: AfroScope introduces LID framework covering 713 African languages with hierarchical classification using mixture-of-experts for distinguishing confusable varieties.

entry.title: Scaling Test-time Inference for Visual Grounding

author.name: Guanqi Zhan, Changye Li, Zhijian Liu, Yao Lu, Yi Wu, Song Han, Ligeng Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces EGM method for visual grounding that scales test-time computation through additional token generation. Shows small VLMs can match larger ones by scaling inference, bridging language understanding gap.

entry.title: Correcting and Quantifying Systematic Errors in 3D Box Annotations for Autonomous Driving

author.name: Alexandre Justo Miro (Traton Group R&D, M\"alardalen University), Ludvig af Klinteberg (M\"alardalen University), Bogdan Timus (Traton Group R&D), Aron Asefaw (KTH Royal Institute of Technology), Ajinkya Khoche (Traton Group R&D, KTH Royal Institute of Technology), Thomas Gustafsson (Traton Group R&D), Sina Sharif Mansouri (Traton Group R&D), Masoud Daneshtalab (M\"alardalen University)

entry.summary: First work to discover systematic annotation errors in widely-used autonomous driving datasets caused by dynamic object timestamp misalignment. Proposes offline estimation method to correct annotations following physical constraints.

entry.title: Teaching Large Reasoning Models Effective Reflection

author.name: Hanbin Wang, Jingwei Song, Jinpeng Li, Qi Zhu, Fei Mi, Ganqu Cui, Yasheng Wang, Lifeng Shang

entry.summary: Identifies superficial reflection problem in Large Reasoning Models and proposes Self-Critique Fine-Tuning (SCFT) using only self-generated critiques filtered through rejection sampling.

entry.title: Real-Time Deadlines Reveal Temporal Awareness Failures in LLM Strategic Dialogues

author.name: Neil K. R. Sehgal, Sharath Chandra Guntuku, Lyle Ungar

entry.summary: Tests LLM temporal awareness in negotiations with real-time deadlines. GPT-5.1 shows 32% vs 4% deal closure with/without time updates. Demonstrates fundamental temporal awareness failures.

entry.title: AgenticRed: Optimizing Agentic Systems for Automated Red-teaming

author.name: Jiayi Yuan, Jonathan N\"other, Natasha Jaques, Goran Radanovi\'c

entry.summary: AgenticRed automates red-teaming system design using LLM in-context learning to iteratively evolve attacking systems without human intervention. Treats red-teaming as system design problem.

entry.title: Speculative Decoding: Performance or Illusion?

author.name: Xiaoxuan Liu, Jiaxiang Yu, Jongseok Park, Ion Stoica, Alvin Cheung

entry.summary: First systematic study of speculative decoding on production vLLM system, covering multiple SD variants across diverse workloads and quantifying theoretical upper bounds on speedup.

entry.title: AI-exhibited Personality Traits Can Shape Human Self-concept through Conversations

author.name: Jingshu Li, Tianqi Song, Nattapat Boonprakong, Zicheng Zhu, Yitian Yang, Yi-Chieh Lee

entry.summary: Demonstrates that conversational AI personality traits measurably shift users' self-concepts to align with the AI's traits, with longer conversations producing greater alignment and increased homogeneity across users.

entry.title: Q-learning with Adjoint Matching

author.name: Qiyang Li, Sergey Levine

entry.summary: QAM proposes Q-learning with Adjoint Matching for efficient optimization of diffusion/flow-matching policies in continuous-action RL, avoiding unstable backpropagation through multi-step denoising.

entry.title: Behavior Knowledge Merge in Reinforced Agentic Models

author.name: Xiangchi Yuan, Dachuan Shi, Chunhui Zhang, Zheyuan Liu, Shenglong Yao, Soroush Vosoughi, Wenke Lee

entry.summary: Addresses model merging for RL-trained agentic models, finding that SFT-designed merging methods fail because RL induces sparse, heterogeneous task vectors. Proposes behavior knowledge merge approach for combining multiple RL-trained agents.

entry.title: The Bitter Lesson of Diffusion Language Models for Agentic Workflows: A Comprehensive Reality Check

author.name: Qingyu Lu, Liang Ding, Kanjian Zhang, Jinxia Zhang, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Comprehensive evaluation showing diffusion-based LLMs (LLaDA, Dream) fail as agentic backbones for both embodied and tool-calling tasks, despite efficiency advantages.

entry.title: Think3D: Thinking with Space for Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Zaibin Zhang, Yuhan Wu, Lianjie Jia, Yifan Wang, Zhongbo Zhang, Yijiang Li, Binghao Ran, Fuxi Zhang, Zhuohan Sun, Zhenfei Yin, Lijun Wang, Huchuan Lu

entry.summary: Introduces Think3D, a framework enabling VLM agents to reason in 3D space by leveraging reconstruction models for point clouds and camera poses, with camera-based operations and view switching for interactive 3D chain-of-thought.

entry.title: Soft Tail-dropping for Adaptive Visual Tokenization

author.name: Zeyuan Chen, Kai Zhang, Zhuowen Tu, Yuanjun Xiong

entry.summary: Presents STAT, a 1D discrete visual tokenizer that adaptively chooses output token count based on image complexity. Produces length-adaptive tokens naturally compatible with causal autoregressive models.

entry.title: ReWorld: Multi-Dimensional Reward Modeling for Embodied World Models

author.name: Baorui Peng, Wenyao Zhang, Liang Xu, Zekun Qi, Jiazhao Zhang, Hongsi Liu, Wenjun Zeng, Xin Jin

entry.summary: Introduces ReWorld employing RL to align video-based embodied world models with physical realism, task completion, embodiment plausibility and visual quality using hierarchical reward model trained on 235K video preference dataset.

entry.title: Agentic Reasoning for Large Language Models

author.name: Tianxin Wei, Ting-Wei Li, Zhining Liu, Xuying Ning, Ze Yang, Jiaru Zou, Zhichen Zeng, Ruizhong Qiu, Xiao Lin, Dongqi Fu, Zihao Li, Mengting Ai, Duo Zhou, Wenxuan Bao, Yunzhe Li, Gaotang Li, Cheng Qian, Yu Wang, Xiangru Tang, Yin Xiao, Liri Fang, Hui Liu, Xianfeng Tang, Yuji Zhang, Chi Wang, Jiaxuan You, Heng Ji, Hanghang Tong, Jingrui He

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey organizing agentic reasoning along three dimensions: foundational capabilities, self-evolution, and social reasoning. Covers planning, tool use, multi-agent interaction.

entry.title: AI for Proactive Mental Health: A Multi-Institutional, Longitudinal, Randomized Controlled Trial

author.name: Julie Y. A. Cachia, Xuan Zhao, John Hunter, Delancey Wu, Eta Lin, Julian De Freitas

entry.summary: Reports on the first multi-institutional, longitudinal RCT of a generative AI mental health app (Flourish) with 486 undergraduate students over six weeks, evaluating effects on well-being outcomes.

entry.title: Your Privacy Depends on Others: Collusion Vulnerabilities in Individual Differential Privacy

author.name: Johannes Kaiser, Alexander Ziller, Eleni Triantafillou, Daniel R\"uckert, Georgios Kaissis

entry.summary: Reveals vulnerability in individual differential privacy where one user's privacy risk depends on other users' privacy choices, demonstrating collusion can inflate privacy risks beyond formal guarantees.

entry.title: OP-Bench: Benchmarking Over-Personalization for Memory-Augmented Personalized Conversational Agents

author.name: Yulin Hu, Zimo Long, Jiahe Guo, Xingyu Sui, Xing Fu, Weixiang Zhao, Yanyan Zhao, Bing Qin

entry.summary: OP-Bench formalizes and benchmarks 'over-personalization' in memory-augmented conversational agents, categorizing it into Irrelevance, Repetition, and Sycophancy. The benchmark contains 1,700 verified instances testing whether agents inappropriately overuse personal information.

entry.title: Distribution-Centric Policy Optimization Dominates Exploration-Exploitation Trade-off

author.name: Zhaochun Li, Chen Wang, Jionghao Bai, Shisheng Cui, Ge Lan, Zhou Zhao, Yue Wang

entry.summary: Proposes distribution-centric perspective for RL in LLMs, addressing GRPO's tendency toward exploitation (monotonic entropy decrease, sample convergence). First framework where exploration is guided by target distribution rather than sample-centric heuristics.

entry.title: Alexandria: A Multi-Domain Dialectal Arabic Machine Translation Dataset for Culturally Inclusive and Linguistically Diverse LLMs

author.name: Abdellah El Mekki, Samar M. Magdy, Houdaifa Atou, Ruwa AbuHweidi, Baraah Qawasmeh, Omer Nacar, Thikra Al-hibiri, Razan Saadie, Hamzah Alsayadi, Nadia Ghezaiel Hammouda, Alshima Alkhazimi, Aya Hamod, Al-Yas Al-Ghafri, Wesam El-Sayed, Asila Al sharji, Mohamad Ballout, Anas Belfathi, Karim Ghaddar, Serry Sibaee, Alaa Aoun, Areej Asiri, Lina Abureesh, Ahlam Bashiti, Majdal Yousef, Abdulaziz Hafiz, Yehdih Mohamed, Emira Hamedtou, Brakehe Brahim, Rahaf Alhamouri, Youssef Nafea, Aya El Aatar, Walid Al-Dhabyani, Emhemed Hamed, Sara Shatnawi, Fakhraddin Alwajih, Khalid Elkhidir, Ashwag Alasmari, Abdurrahman Gerrio, Omar Alshahri, AbdelRahim A. Elmadany, Ismail Berrada, Amir Azad Adli Alkathiri, Fadi A Zaraket, Mustafa Jarrar, Yahya Mohamed El Hadj, Hassan Alhuzali, Muhammad Abdul-Mageed

entry.summary: Alexandria is a large-scale dialectal Arabic MT dataset covering 13 countries and 11 domains, with city-of-origin metadata for fine-grained dialect modeling.

entry.title: Which Reasoning Trajectories Teach Students to Reason Better? A Simple Metric of Informative Alignment

author.name: Yuming Yang, Mingyoung Lai, Wanxu Zhao, Xiaoran Fan, Zhiheng Xi, Mingqi Wu, Chiyue Huang, Jun Zhao, Haijun Lv, Jian Tong, Yunhua Zhou, Yicheng Zou, Qipeng Guo, Tao Gui, Qi Zhang, Xuanjing Huang

entry.summary: Proposes Rank-Surprisal Ratio (RSR), a metric for selecting which reasoning trajectories best teach student LLMs, balancing alignment with informativeness. Addresses finding that stronger teacher trajectories don't necessarily yield better students.

entry.title: MMDeepResearch-Bench: A Benchmark for Multimodal Deep Research Agents

author.name: Peizhou Huang, Zixuan Zhong, Zhongwei Wan, Donghao Zhou, Samiul Alam, Xin Wang, Zexin Li, Zhihao Dou, Li Zhu, Jing Xiong, Chaofan Tao, Yan Xu, Dimitrios Dimitriadis, Tuo Zhang, Mi Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces MMDeepResearch-Bench, a benchmark of 140 expert-crafted tasks across 21 domains for evaluating multimodal deep research agents on citation-grounded report generation with image-text bundles.

entry.title: Finally Outshining the Random Baseline: A Simple and Effective Solution for Active Learning in 3D Biomedical Imaging

author.name: Carsten T. L\"uth, Jeremias Traub, Kim-Celine Kahl, Till J. Bungert, Lukas Klein, Lars Kr\"amer, Paul F. J\"ager, Klaus Maier-Hein, Fabian Isensee

entry.summary: Introduces ClaSP PE, a simple active learning strategy combining class-stratified querying with power noising that finally outperforms random baselines for 3D biomedical segmentation. Addresses class imbalance and early redundancy.

entry.title: Dynamic Differential Linear Attention: Enhancing Linear Diffusion Transformer for High-Quality Image Generation

author.name: Boyuan Cao, Xingbo Yao, Chenhui Wang, Jiaxin Ye, Yujie Wei, Hongming Shan

entry.summary: Introduces Dynamic Differential Linear Attention (DyDiLA) for linear diffusion transformers, addressing oversmoothing issue that degrades generation quality. Improves effectiveness of efficient LiT models.

entry.title: Sparse ActionGen: Accelerating Diffusion Policy with Real-time Pruning

author.name: Kangye Ji, Yuan Meng, Zhou Jianbo, Ye Li, Hanyun Cui, Zhi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Sparse ActionGen for accelerating diffusion policy in robotics using rollout-adaptive prune-then-reuse mechanism that adapts to dynamics of robot-environment interactions, enabling real-time visuomotor control.

entry.title: Being-H0.5: Scaling Human-Centric Robot Learning for Cross-Embodiment Generalization

author.name: Hao Luo, Ye Wang, Wanpeng Zhang, Sipeng Zheng, Ziheng Xi, Chaoyi Xu, Haiweng Xu, Haoqi Yuan, Chi Zhang, Yiqing Wang, Yicheng Feng, Zongqing Lu

entry.summary: Being-H0.5 is a foundational VLA model for cross-embodiment generalization using human-centric learning paradigm. Introduces UniHand-2.0 with 35,000+ hours across 30 robotic embodiments and Unified Action Space for heterogeneous robots.

entry.title: ToolPRMBench: Evaluating and Advancing Process Reward Models for Tool-using Agents

author.name: Dawei Li, Yuguang Yao, Zhen Tan, Huan Liu, Ruocheng Guo

entry.summary: ToolPRMBench is a large-scale benchmark for evaluating process reward models in tool-using agents, converting agent trajectories into step-level test cases with correct and incorrect actions.

entry.title: Failure Modes in Multi-Hop QA: The Weakest Link Law and the Recognition Bottleneck

author.name: Meiru Zhang, Zaiqiao Meng, Nigel Collier

entry.summary: Establishes 'Weakest Link Law' - multi-hop reasoning collapses to performance of least visible evidence. Uses MFAI probe to disentangle recognition vs synthesis failures. Recognition is the bottleneck.

entry.title: MirrorGuard: Toward Secure Computer-Use Agents via Simulation-to-Real Reasoning Correction

author.name: Wenqi Zhang, Yulin Shen, Changyue Jiang, Jiarun Dai, Geng Hong, Xudong Pan

entry.summary: MirrorGuard uses simulation-based training to improve computer-use agent security in real world. Proposes neural-symbolic simulation to reduce training cost at scale.

entry.title: Finding RELIEF: Shaping Reasoning Behavior without Reasoning Supervision via Belief Engineering

author.name: Chak Tou Leong, Dingwei Chen, Heming Xia, Qingyu Yin, Sunbowen Lee, Jian Wang, Wenjie Li

entry.summary: Introduces RELIEF (Reasoning Belief Engineering), a method that shapes Large Reasoning Model behavior by manipulating latent reasoning beliefs discovered through logit probing, without requiring reasoning supervision or expensive fine-tuning.

entry.title: Hierarchical Sparse Circuit Extraction from Billion-Parameter Language Models through Scalable Attribution Graph Decomposition

author.name: Mohammed Mudassir Uddin, Shahnawaz Alam, Mohammed Kaif Pasha

entry.summary: Proposes HAGD (Hierarchical Attribution Graph Decomposition) reducing circuit discovery complexity from O(2^n) to O(n^2 log n) for billion-parameter models using multi-resolution abstraction and differentiable search.

entry.title: Autoregressive Models Rival Diffusion Models at ANY-ORDER Generation

author.name: Tianqi Du, Lizhe Fang, Weijie Yang, Chenheng Zhang, Zeming Wei, Yifei Wang, Yisen Wang

entry.summary: Proposes A3 (Any-order Any-subset Autoregressive), a framework extending AR models to arbitrary token groups and generation orders. Demonstrates autoregressive models can match diffusion models for flexible generation while preserving probabilistic semantics.

entry.title: InT: Self-Proposed Interventions Enable Credit Assignment in LLM Reasoning

author.name: Matthew Y. R. Yang, Hao Bai, Ian Wu, Gene Yang, Amrith Setlur, Aviral Kumar
