entry.summary: Intervention Training (InT) addresses credit assignment in LLM reasoning by having models self-propose counterfactual interventions to identify which reasoning steps caused errors or successes.

entry.title: EMoE: Eigenbasis-Guided Routing for Mixture-of-Experts

author.name: Anzhe Cheng, Shukai Duan, Shixuan Li, Chenzhong Yin, Mingxi Cheng, Shahin Nazarian, Paul Thompson, Paul Bogdan

entry.summary: Introduces Eigen-Mixture-of-Experts (EMoE), addressing both load imbalance ('rich get richer') and expert homogeneity problems in MoE architectures through eigenbasis-guided routing, avoiding auxiliary loss trade-offs.

entry.title: Faithfulness vs. Safety: Evaluating LLM Behavior Under Counterfactual Medical Evidence

author.name: Kaijie Mo, Siddhartha Venkatayogi, Chantal Shaib, Ramez Kouzy, Wei Xu, Byron C. Wallace, Junyi Jessy Li

entry.summary: Constructs MedCounterFact benchmark with counterfactual medical evidence to test LLM faithfulness vs safety tradeoffs. Tests how models behave when context contradicts priors or safety protocols.

entry.title: UbuntuGuard: A Culturally-Grounded Policy Benchmark for Equitable AI Safety in African Languages

author.name: Tassallah Abdullahi, Macton Mgonzo, Mardiyyah Oduwole, Paul Okewunmi, Abraham Owodunni, Ritambhara Singh, Carsten Eickhoff

entry.summary: UbuntuGuard is the first African policy-based AI safety benchmark, built from adversarial queries by 155 domain experts across 8 African languages to address Western-centric safety limitations.

entry.title: Zero-Shot Embedding Drift Detection: A Lightweight Defense Against Prompt Injections in LLMs

author.name: Anirudh Sekar, Mrinal Agarwal, Rachel Sharma, Akitsugu Tanaka, Jasmine Zhang, Arjun Damerla, Kevin Zhu

entry.summary: ZEDD proposes zero-shot embedding drift detection for prompt injection defense by quantifying semantic shifts in embedding space between system prompts and user inputs, without requiring model-specific training.

entry.title: DiffFace-Edit: A Diffusion-Based Facial Dataset for Forgery-Semantic Driven Deepfake Detection Analysis

author.name: Feng Ding, Wenhui Yi, Xinan He, Mengyao Xiao, Jianfeng Xu, Jianqiang Du

entry.summary: Introduces DiffFace-Edit dataset with over 2 million AI-generated fake images featuring fine-grained regional manipulations across 8 facial regions. Studies detector-evasive samples from splice attacks between real and manipulated images.

entry.title: Implicit Neural Representation Facilitates Unified Universal Vision Encoding

author.name: Matthew Gwilliam, Xiao Wang, Xuefeng Hu, Zhenheng Yang

entry.summary: Proposes unified model learning representations useful for both recognition and generation using implicit neural representation as hyper-network. First-of-its-kind unifying both directions.

entry.title: Concept Attractors in LLMs and their Applications

author.name: Sotirios Panagiotis Chytas, Vikas Singh

entry.summary: Shows that LLMs map semantically related prompts to concept-specific attractors, and develops training-free methods for translation, hallucination reduction, guardrailing, and synthetic data generation.

entry.title: Simulated Annealing Enhances Theory-of-Mind Reasoning in Autoregressive Language Models

author.name: Xucong Hu, Jian-Qiao Zhu

entry.summary: Shows Theory of Mind capability can be recovered from base LLMs without weight updates using simulated annealing/MCMC sampling to optimize for global coherence over local plausibility.

entry.title: A Scalable Entity-Based Framework for Auditing Bias in LLMs

author.name: Akram Elbouanani, Aboubacar Tuo, Adrian Popescu

entry.summary: Presents the largest bias audit to date (1.9 billion data points) using named entities as probes across multiple entity types, tasks, languages, and models. Reveals systematic biases including penalization of right-wing politicians.

entry.title: Simulated Ignorance Fails: A Systematic Study of LLM Behaviors on Forecasting Problems Before Model Knowledge Cutoff

author.name: Zehan Li, Yuxuan Wang, Ali El Lahib, Ying-Jieh Xia, Xinyu Pi

entry.summary: First systematic test showing Simulated Ignorance fails to approximate True Ignorance for LLM forecasting. Finds 52% performance gap, with chain-of-thought and date obfuscation also failing.

entry.title: MetaToolAgent: Towards Generalizable Tool Usage in LLMs through Meta-Learning

author.name: Zheng Fang, Wolfgang Mayer, Zeyu Zhang, Jian Wang, Hong-Yu Zhang, Wanli Li, Zaiwen Feng

entry.summary: Proposes MetaToolAgent (MTA), a meta-learning approach for generalizable tool usage in LLMs. Introduces comprehensive dataset with 155 tools across 7 domains and 9,377 QA pairs to address generalization to novel tools.

entry.title: Adversarial News and Lost Profits: Manipulating Headlines in LLM-Driven Algorithmic Trading

author.name: Advije Rizvani, Giovanni Apruzzese, Pavel Laskov

entry.summary: Quantifies monetary risk from adversarial news headlines that manipulate LLM-driven algorithmic trading systems. Demonstrates how invisible malicious content in headlines can mislead LLMs into poor trading decisions.

entry.title: Towards Robust Process Reward Modeling via Noise-aware Learning

author.name: Bin Xie, Bingbing Xu, Xueyun Tian, Yilin Chen, Huawei Shen

entry.summary: Identifies that Monte Carlo Estimation for process reward models produces policy-dependent, noisy labels. Proposes two-stage framework with noise filtering and noise-aware training.

entry.title: Understanding Multilingualism in Mixture-of-Experts LLMs: Routing Mechanism, Expert Specialization, and Layerwise Steering

author.name: Yuxin Chen, Zhengzhou Cai, Xiangtian Ji, Weixiang Zhao, An Zhang, Xiang Wang, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Analyzes MoE routing behavior across languages, finding routing aligns with linguistic families, high-resource languages use shared experts, and low-resource depend on language-exclusive experts.

entry.title: A one-step generation model with a Single-Layer Transformer: Layer number re-distillation of FreeFlow

author.name: Haonan Wei, Linyuan Wang, Nuolin Sun, Zhizhong Zheng, Lei Li, Bin Yan

entry.summary: Proposes Single-Layer Transformer (SLT) by distilling 28-layer FreeFlow into single shared DiT block, viewing the architecture as Euler discretization for ODE along depth axis. Achieves one-step image generation.

entry.title: A Generalist Foundation Model for Total-body PET/CT Enables Diagnostic Reporting and System-wide Metabolic Profiling

author.name: Wei Chen, Liang Wu, Shuyi Lu, Yuanyuan Sun, Wenkai Bi, Zilong Yuan, Yaoyao He, Feng Wang, Junchi Ma, Shuyong Liu, Zhaoping Cheng, Xiaoyan Hu, Jianfeng Qiu

entry.summary: Introduces SDF-HOLO, a multimodal foundation model for total-body PET/CT pre-trained on 10,000+ patients with dual-stream encoders and cross-modal interaction for system-wide metabolic profiling.

entry.title: Weather-R1: Logically Consistent Reinforcement Fine-Tuning for Multimodal Reasoning in Meteorology

author.name: Kaiyu Wu, Pucheng Han, Hualong Zhang, Naigeng Wu, Keze Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Weather-R1, first reasoning VLM with logical faithfulness for meteorology, proposing Logically Consistent RFT (LoCo-RFT) to resolve self-contradictory reasoning where model reasoning contradicts final answers.

entry.title: LightOnOCR: A 1B End-to-End Multilingual Vision-Language Model for State-of-the-Art OCR

author.name: Said Taghadouini, Adrien Cavaill\`es, Baptiste Aubertin

entry.summary: Presents LightOnOCR-2-1B, a 1B-parameter end-to-end multilingual OCR model achieving SOTA on OlmOCR-Bench while being 9x smaller than prior best models. Introduces image localization via bounding box prediction.

entry.title: MIMIC-RD: Can LLMs differentially diagnose rare diseases in real-world clinical settings?

author.name: Zilal Eiz AlDin, John Wu, Jeffrey Paul Fung, Jennifer King, Mya Watts, Lauren ONeill, Adam Richard Cross, Jimeng Sun

entry.summary: Introduces MIMIC-RD, a rare disease differential diagnosis benchmark using real clinical data from MIMIC rather than idealized case studies. Addresses the critical limitation that many rare diseases lack ICD code mappings to databases like Orphanet.

entry.title: Imandra CodeLogician: Neuro-Symbolic Reasoning for Precise Analysis of Software Logic

author.name: Hongyu Lin, Samer Abdallah, Makar Valentinov, Paul Brennan, Elijah Kagan, Christoph M. Wintersteiger, Denis Ignatovich, Grant Passmore

entry.summary: CodeLogician is a neurosymbolic agent integrating LLMs with ImandraX industrial reasoning engine for precise software logic analysis. Unlike prior work, uses LLMs to construct formal models rather than just validate outputs.

entry.title: Process In-Context Learning: Enhancing Mathematical Reasoning via Dynamic Demonstration Insertion

author.name: Ang Gao, Changshuo Zhang, Xiao Zhang, Deyang Li, Minjun Zhao, Fangchao Liu, Xinyu Zhang

entry.summary: Process In-Context Learning (PICL) dynamically inserts demonstrations during generation to address confusion points in multi-step reasoning, rather than using fixed pre-selected examples.

entry.title: ARC: Active and Reflection-driven Context Management for Long-Horizon Information Seeking Agents

author.name: Yilun Yao, Shan Huang, Elsie Dai, Zhewen Tan, Zhenyu Duan, Shousheng Jia, Yanbing Jiang, Tong Yang

entry.summary: ARC addresses 'context rot' in long-horizon agents by treating context as dynamic reasoning state rather than static artifact. First framework to systematically formulate context management as active, reflection-driven process.

entry.title: Rethinking the AI Scientist: Interactive Multi-Agent Workflows for Scientific Discovery

author.name: Lukas Weidener, Marko Brki\'c, Mihailo Jovanovi\'c, Ritvik Singh, Chiara Baccin, Emre Ulgac, Alex Dobrin, Aakaash Meduri

entry.summary: Deep Research is a multi-agent system for interactive scientific investigation with minute-level turnaround, featuring specialized agents for planning, analysis, literature search, and novelty detection.

entry.title: Neurosymbolic LoRA: Why and When to Tune Weights vs. Rewrite Prompts

author.name: Kevin Wang, Neel P. Bhatt, Cong Liu, Junbo Li, Runjin Chen, Yihan Xi, Timothy Barclay, Alvaro Velasquez, Ufuk Topcu, Zhangyang Wang

entry.summary: Neurosymbolic LoRA framework dynamically combines parameter updates (LoRA) with prompt rewriting (TextGrad) based on whether task needs factual reconstruction or style/alignment control.

entry.title: MagicGUI-RMS: A Multi-Agent Reward Model System for Self-Evolving GUI Agents via Automated Feedback Reflux

author.name: Zecheng Li, Zhihui Cao, Wenke Huang, Yudong Zhang, Keying Qi, Rui Wang, Zeyu Zheng, Jian Zhao, Hao Zhu, Hengxin Wu, Yuran Wang, Guitao Fan, Guokun Wu, Yicong Liu, Zhilin Gao, Haikun Xu, He Yang, Minqi Xiang, Xingyu Liu, Zuojian Wang

entry.summary: MagicGUI-RMS is multi-agent reward model system for GUI agents providing adaptive trajectory evaluation, corrective feedback, and self-evolving learning. Combines domain-specific and general-purpose reward models.

entry.title: Prompt Injection Mitigation with Agentic AI, Nested Learning, and AI Sustainability via Semantic Caching

author.name: Diego Gosmar, Deborah A. Dahl

entry.summary: Extends prompt injection defense with semantic similarity caching and observability score to create TIVS-O metric. Uses nested learning architecture across 301 synthetic injection prompts.

entry.title: Graph Neural Networks are Heuristics

author.name: Yimeng Min, Carla P. Gomes

entry.summary: Shows single training trajectory can transform GNN into unsupervised heuristic for combinatorial optimization (TSP). Global structural constraints as inductive bias enable direct solution generation.

entry.title: Reasoning or Fluency? Dissecting Probabilistic Confidence in Best-of-N Selection

author.name: Hojin Kim, Jaehyung Kim

entry.summary: Challenges the assumption that probabilistic confidence metrics in Best-of-N selection capture reasoning quality. Shows that perturbing inter-step causal dependencies only marginally degrades selection accuracy, suggesting confidence reflects fluency rather than reasoning.

entry.title: Activation Sensitivity as a Unifying Principle for Post-Training Quantization

author.name: Bruce Changlong Xu

entry.summary: Presents unified theoretical framework for post-training quantization through activation sensitivity, formalizing why AWQ and GPTQ work and providing rigorous foundation for PTQ design.

entry.title: DevBench: A Realistic, Developer-Informed Benchmark for Code Generation Models

author.name: Pareesa Ameneh Golnari, Adarsh Kumarappan, Wen Wen, Xiaoyu Liu, Gabriel Ryan, Yuting Sun, Shengyu Fu, Elsie Nallipogu

entry.summary: DevBench is a telemetry-driven benchmark with 1,800 code completion instances across six languages derived from real developer workflows, emphasizing ecological validity and avoiding data contamination.

entry.title: $\texttt{MemoryRewardBench}$: Benchmarking Reward Models for Long-Term Memory Management in Large Language Models

author.name: Zecheng Tang, Baibei Ji, Ruoxi Sun, Haitian Wang, WangJie You, Zhang Yijun, Wenpeng Zhu, Ji Qi, Juntao Li, Min Zhang

entry.summary: MemoryRewardBench is first benchmark systematically studying reward models' ability to evaluate long-term memory management in LLMs across 10 settings with varying context lengths.

entry.title: Orthogonalized Policy Optimization:Decoupling Sampling Geometry from Optimization Geometry in RLHF

author.name: Wang Zixian

entry.summary: Shows that PPO, DPO, and IPO alignment methods implicitly conflate sampling geometry and optimization geometry. Proposes orthogonalized formulation separating these choices using alpha-divergence sampling and Bregman-divergence penalties.

entry.title: Insider Knowledge: How Much Can RAG Systems Gain from Evaluation Secrets?

author.name: Laura Dietz, Bryan Li, Eugene Yang, Dawn Lawrie, William Walden, James Mayfield

entry.summary: Investigates risk of circular evaluation in RAG systems using nugget-based LLM judges. Shows near-perfect scores can be achieved by optimizing for LLM judge without substantive improvement, highlighting evaluation gaming risk.

entry.title: Self-Improvement as Coherence Optimization: A Theoretical Account

author.name: Tianyi Qiu, Ahmed Hani Ismail, Zhonghao He, Shi Feng

entry.summary: Provides theoretical account showing self-improvement methods (debate, bootstrap, coherence maximization) are special cases of coherence optimization, equivalent to description-length regularization.

entry.title: Lost in the Prompt Order: Revealing the Limitations of Causal Attention in Language Models

author.name: Hyunjong Ok, Jaeho Lee

entry.summary: Investigates prompt order sensitivity in LLMs, finding placing context before questions outperforms reverse order by 14%+ due to causal attention preventing option tokens from attending to context.

entry.title: Verifying Local Robustness of Pruned Safety-Critical Networks

author.name: Minh Le, Phuong Cao

entry.summary: Investigates impact of pruning on formal local robustness certificates using α,β-CROWN verifier on ResNet4 models, including NASA JPL Mars Frost datasets. Finds non-linear relationship where heavy pruning (70-90%) can improve verifiability.

entry.title: Jet-RL: Enabling On-Policy FP8 Reinforcement Learning with Unified Training and Rollout Precision Flow

author.name: Haocheng Xi, Charlie Ruan, Peiyuan Liao, Yujun Lin, Han Cai, Yilong Zhao, Shuo Yang, Kurt Keutzer, Song Han, Ligeng Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces Jet-RL, the first comprehensive study of FP8 RL training for LLMs, demonstrating that mixed BF16-training + FP8-rollout strategies suffer from training instability and accuracy collapse, proposing a unified precision flow solution.

entry.title: TrojanPraise: Jailbreak LLMs via Benign Fine-Tuning

author.name: Zhixin Xie, Xurui Song, Jun Luo

entry.summary: Proposes TrojanPraise, a novel jailbreak attack that exploits benign, filter-approved fine-tuning data by teaching models to associate crafted words with harmless connotations, then using those words to praise harmful concepts.

entry.title: Race, Ethnicity and Their Implication on Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: Shiyue Hu, Ruizhe Li, Yanjun Gao

entry.summary: Presents a mechanistic study of how race and ethnicity are represented internally within LLMs using probing, neuron-level attribution, and targeted interventions. Goes beyond documenting outcome disparities to understand the underlying mechanisms, using toxicity and clinical tasks as test cases.

entry.title: Trust Me, I'm an Expert: Decoding and Steering Authority Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: Priyanka Mary Mammen, Emil Joswin, Shankar Venkitachalam

entry.summary: Investigates authority bias in LLMs across math, legal, and medical reasoning tasks. Finds models increasingly susceptible to incorrect endorsements as source expertise increases, with higher confidence in wrong answers.

entry.title: Beyond Tokens: Concept-Level Training Objectives for LLMs

author.name: Laya Iyer, Pranav Somani, Alice Guo, Dan Jurafsky, Chen Shani

entry.summary: Proposes shift from token-level to concept-level training objectives for LLMs, addressing fundamental limitation that NTP penalizes valid semantic alternatives (e.g., 'mom' vs 'mother').

entry.title: To Copy or Not to Copy: Copying Is Easier to Induce Than Recall

author.name: Mehrdad Farahani, Franziska Penzkofer, Richard Johansson

entry.summary: Mechanistic study extracting an 'arbitration vector' that controls whether LLMs copy from context or recall from parametric memory. Shows copying behavior is easier to induce than recall through activation interventions.

entry.title: Graph Reasoning Paradigm: Structured and Symbolic Reasoning with Topology-Aware Reinforcement Learning for Large Language Models

author.name: Runxuan Liu, Xianhao Ou, Xinyan Ma, Jiyuan Wang, Jiafeng Liang, Jiaqi Li, Tao He, Zheng Chu, Rongchuan Mu, Zekun Wang, Baoxin Wang, Dayong Wu, Ming Liu, Shijin Wang, Guoping Hu, Bing Qin

entry.summary: Graph Reasoning Paradigm realizes structured and symbolic reasoning through graph representations with step-level cognitive labels, using topology-aware reinforcement learning.

entry.title: BACH-V: Bridging Abstract and Concrete Human-Values in Large Language Models

author.name: Junyu Zhang, Yipeng Kang, Jiong Guo, Jiayu Zhan, Junqi Wang

entry.summary: BACH-V framework decomposes value understanding into Abstract-Abstract, Abstract-Concrete, and Concrete-Concrete capacities. Probing and steering experiments reveal LLMs handle abstraction differently across values.

entry.title: A Systematic Analysis of Chunking Strategies for Reliable Question Answering

author.name: Sofia Bennani, Charles Moslonka

entry.summary: Systematic evaluation of RAG chunking strategies using SPLADE retrieval and Mistral-8B. Key findings: overlap provides no benefit and increases cost, sentence chunking matches semantic chunking up to 5k tokens, and a 'context cliff' degrades quality beyond 2.5k tokens.

entry.title: FRoM-W1: Towards General Humanoid Whole-Body Control with Language Instructions

author.name: Peng Li, Zihan Zhuang, Yangfan Gao, Yi Dong, Sixian Li, Changhao Jiang, Shihan Dou, Zhiheng Xi, Enyu Zhou, Jixuan Huang, Hui Li, Jingjing Gong, Xingjun Ma, Tao Gui, Zuxuan Wu, Qi Zhang, Xuanjing Huang, Yu-Gang Jiang, Xipeng Qiu

entry.summary: FRoM-W1 is an open-source framework for language-driven humanoid whole-body control, using H-GPT trained on human motion data to generate behaviors from natural language, with sim-to-real transfer.

entry.title: LegacyAvatars: Volumetric Face Avatars For Traditional Graphics Pipelines

author.name: Safa C. Medin, Gengyan Li, Ziqian Bai, Ruofei Du, Leonhard Helminger, Yinda Zhang, Stephan J. Garbin, Philip L. Davidson, Gregory W. Wornell, Thabo Beeler, Abhimitra Meka

entry.summary: Introduces a novel representation for rendering photorealistic 3D face avatars compatible with traditional graphics pipelines. Extracts explicit layered meshes with appearance textures from radiance fields for efficient streaming and classical rendering.

entry.title: S2DiT: Sandwich Diffusion Transformer for Mobile Streaming Video Generation

author.name: Lin Zhao, Yushu Wu, Aleksei Lebedev, Dishani Lahiri, Meng Dong, Arpit Sahni, Michael Vasilkovsky, Hao Chen, Ju Hu, Aliaksandr Siarohin, Sergey Tulyakov, Yanzhi Wang, Anil Kag, Yanyu Li

entry.summary: Introduces S2DiT for efficient mobile streaming video generation using novel attention mechanisms (LinConv Hybrid Attention, Stride Self-Attention) and sandwich architecture found via budget-aware search, with 2-in-1 distillation.

entry.title: Reasoning or Pattern Matching? Probing Large Vision-Language Models with Visual Puzzles

author.name: Maria Lymperaiou, Vasileios Karampinis, Giorgos Filandrianos, Angelos Vlachos, Chrysoula Zerva, Athanasios Voulodimos

entry.summary: Survey providing unified perspective on visual puzzle reasoning for LVLM evaluation, organizing benchmarks by reasoning mechanisms (inductive, analogical, algorithmic, deductive, geometric/spatial) and linking puzzle design to cognitive capabilities.

entry.title: VTONGuard: Automatic Detection and Authentication of AI-Generated Virtual Try-On Content

author.name: Shengyi Wu, Yan Hong, Shengyao Chen, Zheng Wang, Xianbing Sun, Jiahui Zhan, Jun Lan, Jianfu Zhang

entry.summary: Presents VTONGuard benchmark with over 775,000 real and synthetic virtual try-on images for detecting AI-generated content. Covers diverse conditions and provides systematic detection paradigm evaluation.

entry.title: TwinBrainVLA: Unleashing the Potential of Generalist VLMs for Embodied Tasks via Asymmetric Mixture-of-Transformers

author.name: Bin Yu, Shijie Lian, Xiaopeng Lin, Yuliang Wei, Zhaolong Shen, Changti Wu, Yuzhuo Miao, Xinming Wang, Bailing Wang, Cong Huang, Kai Chen

entry.summary: Introduces TwinBrainVLA, a novel VLA architecture with asymmetric mixture-of-transformers: a frozen 'Left Brain' for general semantic reasoning and trainable 'Right Brain' for embodied proprioception. Addresses catastrophic forgetting in robotic VLMs.

entry.title: So Long Sucker: AI Deception, "Alliance Banks," and Institutional Lying

author.name: fernando yt

entry.summary: Tests four frontier models (Gemini 3 Flash, GPT-OSS, Kimi K2, Qwen3) in So Long Sucker game designed to require betrayal. Finds complexity reversal where Gemini dominates in complex games, and documents 'alliance bank' deception strategy.

entry.title: GRADE: Replacing Policy Gradients with Backpropagation for LLM Alignment

author.name: Lukas Abrie Nel

entry.summary: Introduces GRADE, a method replacing high-variance policy gradients in RLHF with direct backpropagation through Gumbel-Softmax relaxation for LLM alignment.

entry.title: Less Is More -- Until It Breaks: Security Pitfalls of Vision Token Compression in Large Vision-Language Models

author.name: Xiaomei Zhang, Zhaoxi Zhang, Leo Yu Zhang, Yanjun Zhang, Guanhong Tao, Shirui Pan

entry.summary: Reveals that visual token compression substantially degrades LVLM robustness, creating state-specific vulnerabilities that only manifest when compression is enabled.

entry.title: How Well Do LLMs Predict Human Behavior? A Measure of their Pretrained Knowledge

author.name: Wayne Gao, Sukjin Han, Annie Liang

entry.summary: Proposes 'equivalent sample size' - a novel metric measuring how much task-specific training data would be needed to match an LLM's predictive accuracy for human behavior prediction. Provides statistical inference theory for cross-validated prediction error.

entry.title: On the Evidentiary Limits of Membership Inference for Copyright Auditing

author.name: Murat Bilgehan Ertan, Emirhan B\"oge, Min Chen, Kaleel Mahmood, Marten van Dijk

entry.summary: Demonstrates evidentiary limits of membership inference attacks for copyright auditing, introducing SAGE paraphrasing framework that rewrites training data to evade MIAs while preserving semantics.

entry.title: Why Does the LLM Stop Computing: An Empirical Study of User-Reported Failures in Open-Source LLMs

author.name: Guangba Yu, Zirui Wang, Yujie Huang, Renyi Zhong, Yuedong Zhong, Yilun Wang, Michael R. Lyu

entry.summary: First large-scale empirical study of 705 real-world failures from DeepSeek, Llama, and Qwen ecosystems. Shows reliability bottleneck shifts from model defects to deployment stack fragility.

entry.title: Can Deep Research Agents Find and Organize? Evaluating the Synthesis Gap with Expert Taxonomies

author.name: Ming Zhang, Jiabao Zhuang, Wenqing Jing, Ziyu Kong, Jingyi Deng, Yujiong Shen, Kexin Tan, Yuhang Zhao, Ning Luo, Renzhe Zheng, Jiahui Lin, Mingqi Wu, Long Ma, Yi Zou, Shihan Dou, Tao Gui, Qi Zhang, Xuanjing Huang

entry.summary: TaxoBench evaluates deep research agents on their ability to retrieve essential papers and organize them into coherent knowledge structures, using 72 highly-cited CS surveys with 3,815 citations as ground truth.

entry.title: CommunityBench: Benchmarking Community-Level Alignment across Diverse Groups and Tasks

author.name: Jiayu Lin, Zhongyu Wei

entry.summary: CommunityBench is the first large-scale benchmark for community-level alignment, proposing a middle ground between universal values and individual personalization.

entry.title: Environment-Aware Code Generation: How far are We?

author.name: Tongtong Wu, Rongyi Chen, Wenjie Du, Suyu Ma, Guilin Qi, Zhenchang Xing, Shahram Khadivi, Ramesh Periyathambi, Gholamreza Haffari

entry.summary: VersiBCB benchmark for Environment-Aware Code Generation that tests LLM code generation under arbitrary software configurations with multi-package, execution-verified, and deprecation-aware evaluation.

entry.title: DisasterVQA: A Visual Question Answering Benchmark Dataset for Disaster Scenes

author.name: Aisha Al-Mohannadi, Ayisha Firoz, Yin Yang, Muhammad Imran, Ferda Ofli

entry.summary: Introduces DisasterVQA benchmark with 1,395 images and 4,405 expert-curated QA pairs for crisis contexts spanning floods, wildfires, earthquakes. Grounded in humanitarian frameworks (FEMA ESF, OCHA MIRA).

entry.title: POLARIS: Typed Planning and Governed Execution for Agentic AI in Back-Office Automation

author.name: Zahra Moslemi, Keerthi Koneru, Yen-Ting Lee, Sheethal Kumar, Ramesh Radhakrishnan

entry.summary: POLARIS treats enterprise automation as typed plan synthesis over DAGs with validator-gated execution. Planner proposes type-checked plans, rubric-guided module selects compliant ones, guardrails block side effects.

entry.title: LIBRA: Language Model Informed Bandit Recourse Algorithm for Personalized Treatment Planning

author.name: Junyu Cao, Ruijiang Gao, Esmaeil Keyvanshokooh, Jianhao Ma

entry.summary: LIBRA combines algorithmic recourse with contextual bandits and LLMs for sequential treatment decisions. Provides warm-start guarantees from LLM priors, theoretical regret bounds, and graceful degradation.

entry.title: Learn Like Humans: Use Meta-cognitive Reflection for Efficient Self-Improvement

author.name: Xinmeng Hou, Peiliang Gong, Bohao Qu, Wuqi Wang, Qing Guo, Yang Liu

entry.summary: MARS achieves efficient LLM self-evolution in single recurrence cycle using metacognitive reflection inspired by educational psychology. Combines principle-based and procedural reflection.

entry.title: Kernel-Based Learning of Safety Barriers

author.name: Oliver Sch\"on, Zhengang Zhong, Sadegh Soudjani

entry.summary: Data-driven approach for safety verification of black-box stochastic systems using control barrier certificates learned from trajectories via conditional mean embeddings in kernel space.

entry.title: DriveSafe: A Hierarchical Risk Taxonomy for Safety-Critical LLM-Based Driving Assistants

author.name: Abhishek Kumar, Riya Tapwal, Carsten Maple

entry.summary: DriveSafe is a four-level hierarchical taxonomy with 129 fine-grained risk categories for LLM-based driving assistants, spanning technical, legal, societal, and ethical dimensions.

entry.title: MARO: Learning Stronger Reasoning from Social Interaction

author.name: Yin Cai, Zhouhong Gu, Juntao Zhang, Ping Chen

entry.summary: MARO enables LLMs to learn stronger reasoning through multi-agent social interactions, decomposing outcomes into specific behaviors and using a relative value function for credit assignment.

entry.title: MedConsultBench: A Full-Cycle, Fine-Grained, Process-Aware Benchmark for Medical Consultation Agents

author.name: Chuhan Qiao, Jianghua Huang, Daxing Zhao, Ziding Liu, Yanjun Shen, Bing Cheng, Wei Lin, Kai Wu

entry.summary: MedConsultBench evaluates complete online consultation cycle from history taking through follow-up using Atomic Information Units (AIUs) for fine-grained process-aware assessment.

entry.title: Actionable Interpretability Must Be Defined in Terms of Symmetries

author.name: Pietro Barbiero, Mateo Espinosa Zarlenga, Francesco Giannini, Alberto Termine, Filippo Bonchi, Mateja Jamnik, Giuseppe Marra

entry.summary: Argues interpretability must be defined in terms of symmetries to be actionable. Hypothesizes four symmetries suffice to motivate interpretability properties and characterize interpretable model class.

entry.title: Improving the Safety and Trustworthiness of Medical AI via Multi-Agent Evaluation Loops

author.name: Zainab Ghafoor, Md Shafiqul Islam, Koushik Howlader, Md Rasel Khondokar, Tanusree Bhattacharjee, Sayantan Chakraborty, Adrito Roy, Ushashi Bhattacharjee, Tirtho Roy

entry.summary: Multi-agent framework using DeepSeek R1 and Med-PaLM with LLaMA 3.1 and Phi-4 evaluators, assessed against AMA ethics principles and five-tier safety protocol across 900 clinical queries.

entry.title: Hidden in Plain Text: Measuring LLM Deception Quality Against Human Baselines Using Social Deduction Games

author.name: Christopher Kao, Vanshika Vats, James Davis

entry.summary: Studies LLM deception capabilities in the social deduction game Mafia using multi-agent simulations with GPT-4o. Develops a Mafia Detector to analyze deceptive behavior and compare LLM deception quality against human baselines.

entry.title: PLA-Serve: A Prefill-Length-Aware LLM Serving System

author.name: Jianshu She, Zonghang Li, Hongchao Du, Shangyu Wu, Wenhao Zheng, Eric Xing, Zhengzhong Liu, Huaxiu Yao, Jason Xue, Qirong Ho

entry.summary: Introduces PLA-Serve, an LLM serving system that disaggregates requests by prompt length, using length-aware smart batching and dual-queue design to reduce TTFT latency.

entry.title: ATOD: An Evaluation Framework and Benchmark for Agentic Task-Oriented Dialogue System

author.name: Yifei Zhang, Hooshang Nayyeri, Rinat Khaziev, Emine Yilmaz, Gokhan Tur, Dilek Hakkani-T\"ur, Hari Thadakamalla

entry.summary: ATOD benchmark and synthetic dialogue generation pipeline for evaluating agentic task-oriented dialogue systems on multi-goal coordination, dependency management, memory, adaptability and proactive execution.

entry.title: VISPA: Pluralistic Alignment via Automatic Value Selection and Activation

author.name: Shenyan Zheng, Jiayou Zhong, Anudeex Shetty, Heng Ji, Preslav Nakov, Usman Naseem

entry.summary: Introduces VISPA, a training-free pluralistic alignment framework enabling direct control over value expression in LLMs through dynamic value selection and internal activation steering.

entry.title: CooperBench: Why Coding Agents Cannot be Your Teammates Yet

author.name: Arpandeep Khatua, Hao Zhu, Peter Tran, Arya Prabhudesai, Frederic Sadrieh, Johann K. Lieberwirth, Xinkai Yu, Yicheng Fu, Michael J. Ryan, Jiaxin Pei, Diyi Yang

entry.summary: Introduces CooperBench with 600+ collaborative coding tasks to test agent coordination capabilities. Shows state-of-the-art coding agents consistently choose sub-optimal conflict resolutions prioritizing their own features.

entry.title: When Wording Steers the Evaluation: Framing Bias in LLM judges

author.name: Yerin Hwang, Dongryeol Lee, Taegwan Kang, Minwoo Lee, Kyomin Jung

entry.summary: Investigates framing bias in LLM judges across 14 models and four evaluation tasks. Shows symmetric prompt constructions (predicate-positive vs negative) induce significant judgment discrepancies.

entry.title: NeuroShield: A Neuro-Symbolic Framework for Adversarial Robustness

author.name: Ali Shafiee Sarvestani, Jason Schmidt, Arman Roohi

entry.summary: Introduces NeuroShield, a neuro-symbolic framework encoding domain knowledge as logical constraints over appearance attributes for improved adversarial robustness and explainability. Evaluated on GTSRB with standard perturbation budgets.

entry.title: Rethinking the Value of Multi-Agent Workflow: A Strong Single Agent Baseline

author.name: Jiawei Xu, Arief Koesdwiady, Sisong Bei, Yan Han, Baixiang Huang, Dakuo Wang, Yutong Chen, Zheshen Wang, Peihao Wang, Pan Li, Ying Ding

entry.summary: Challenges the value of homogeneous multi-agent systems by demonstrating that a single LLM agent through multi-turn conversations can match the performance of multi-agent workflows across seven benchmarks spanning coding, math, and reasoning.

entry.title: Probe and Skip: Self-Predictive Token Skipping for Efficient Long-Context LLM Inference

author.name: Zimeng Wu, Donghao Wang, Chaozhe Jin, Jiaxin Chen, Yunhong Wang

entry.summary: Proposes SPTS (Self-Predictive Token Skipping), a training-free framework for efficient long-context LLM inference using Partial Attention Probing and targeted layer skipping strategies.

entry.title: CTPD: Cross Tokenizer Preference Distillation

author.name: Truong Nguyen, Phi Van Dat, Ngan Nguyen, Linh Ngo Van, Trung Le, Thanh Hong Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes CTPD (Cross-Tokenizer Preference Distillation), first unified framework for transferring human-aligned behavior between models with different tokenizers. Introduces Aligned Span Projection for token mapping.

entry.title: BioPulse-QA: A Dynamic Biomedical Question-Answering Benchmark for Evaluating Factuality, Robustness, and Bias in Large Language Models

author.name: Kriti Bhattarai, Vipina K. Keloth, Donald Wright, Andrew Loza, Yang Ren, Hua Xu

entry.summary: BioPulse-QA is a dynamic biomedical QA benchmark using newly published literature to avoid data contamination, while also evaluating robustness to linguistic variation and demographic bias.

entry.title: Gated Differentiable Working Memory for Long-Context Language Modeling

author.name: Lingrui Mei, Shenghua Liu, Yiwei Wang, Yuyao Ge, Baolong Bi, Jiayu Yao, Jun Wan, Ziling Yin, Jiafeng Guo, Xueqi Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes gated differentiable working memory for long-context transformers, treating test-time adaptation as budget-constrained memory consolidation with selective write policies.

entry.title: AgentEHR: Advancing Autonomous Clinical Decision-Making via Retrospective Summarization

author.name: Yusheng Liao, Chuan Xuan, Yutong Cai, Lina Yang, Zhe Chen, Yanfeng Wang, Yu Wang

entry.summary: AgentEHR benchmark challenges LLM agents to navigate raw, high-noise EHR databases for diagnosis and treatment planning. Introduces retrospective summarization to address information loss.

entry.title: Advances and Frontiers of LLM-based Issue Resolution in Software Engineering: A Comprehensive Survey

author.name: Caihua Li, Lianghong Guo, Yanlin Wang, Daya Guo, Wei Tao, Zhenyu Shan, Mingwei Liu, Jiachi Chen, Haoyu Song, Duyu Tang, Hongyu Zhang, Zibin Zheng

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of LLM-based issue resolution in software engineering, covering SWE-bench benchmarks, data construction pipelines, training-free frameworks, fine-tuning, and reinforcement learning approaches for autonomous coding agents.

entry.title: Compress to Focus: Efficient Coordinate Compression for Policy Optimization in Multi-Turn GUI Agents

author.name: Yurun Song, Jiong Yin, Rongjunchen Zhang, Ian G. Harris

entry.summary: CCPO addresses context inflation in multi-turn GUI agents via Coordinate-Aware Spatial Compression that aggregates coordinates across rollouts to focus on target-relevant regions during policy optimization.

entry.title: NeuralFur: Animal Fur Reconstruction From Multi-View Images

author.name: Vanessa Sklyarova, Berna Kabadayi, Anastasios Yiannakidis, Giorgio Becherini, Michael J. Black, Justus Thies

entry.summary: Presents NeuralFur, the first multi-view method for high-fidelity 3D fur reconstruction using strand-based representation, leveraging vision language models to retrieve realistic fur length and structure information.

entry.title: GaussExplorer: 3D Gaussian Splatting for Embodied Exploration and Reasoning

author.name: Kim Yu-Ji, Dahye Lee, Kim Jun-Seong, GeonU Kim, Nam Hyeon-Woo, Yongjin Kwon, Yu-Chiang Frank Wang, Jaesung Choe, Tae-Hyun Oh

entry.summary: Presents GaussExplorer for embodied exploration and reasoning using 3DGS with VLMs, enabling question-driven exploration by identifying relevant pre-captured images and supporting complex compositional queries.

entry.title: Diffusion Representations for Fine-Grained Image Classification: A Marine Plankton Case Study

author.name: A. Nieto Juscafresa, \'A. Mazcu\~n\'an Herreros, J. Sullivan

entry.summary: Demonstrates that frozen diffusion model features enable strong fine-grained recognition by probing intermediate denoising features, evaluated on real-world plankton monitoring. Shows diffusion models capture both low and high-level structure without labels.

entry.title: GIC-DLC: Differentiable Logic Circuits for Hardware-Friendly Grayscale Image Compression

author.name: Till Aczel, David F. Jenny, Simon B\"uhrer, Andreas Plesner, Antonio Di Maio, Roger Wattenhofer

entry.summary: Proposes GIC-DLC, hardware-aware image codec training lookup tables combining neural network flexibility with Boolean operation efficiency. Outperforms traditional codecs while enabling energy-efficient deployment.

entry.title: Numina-Lean-Agent: An Open and General Agentic Reasoning System for Formal Mathematics

author.name: Junqi Liu, Zihao Zhou, Zekai Zhu, Marco Dos Santos, Weikun He, Jiawei Liu, Ran Wang, Yunzhou Xie, Junqiao Zhao, Qiufeng Wang, Lihong Zhi, Jia Li, Wenda Li

entry.summary: Proposes using general coding agents as formal math reasoners in Lean, leveraging Model Context Protocol (MCP) for flexible tool integration. Demonstrates that performance improves simply by upgrading base models without training.

entry.title: Aesthetics as Structural Harm: Algorithmic Lookism Across Text-to-Image Generation and Classification

author.name: Miriam Doh, Aditya Gulati, Corina Canali, Nuria Oliver

entry.summary: Examines algorithmic lookism in Stable Diffusion text-to-image generation, demonstrating systematic associations between facial attractiveness and positive attributes, and revealing gender classification bias.

entry.title: Aletheia: What Makes RLVR For Code Verifiers Tick?

author.name: Vatsal Venkatkrishna, Indraneil Paul, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Aletheia is controlled testbed for evaluating code verifiers trained via RLVR, enabling execution-grounded evaluation of verifier robustness with open-sourced framework.

entry.title: Teaching LLMs to Learn Tool Trialing and Execution through Environment Interaction

author.name: Xingjie Gao, Pengcheng Huang, Zhenghao Liu, Yukun Yan, Shuo Wang, Zulong Chen, Chen Qian, Ge Yu, Yu Gu

entry.summary: Proposes ToolMaster, a framework shifting from imitating tool-calling trajectories to actively learning tool usage through environment interaction using trial-and-execution paradigm.

entry.title: System-Mediated Attention Imbalances Make Vision-Language Models Say Yes

author.name: Tsan Tsai Chan, Varsha Suresh, Anisha Saha, Michael Hahn, Vera Demberg

entry.summary: Identifies that VLM hallucination 'yes-bias' stems from functionally redundant system weights that reduce attention to image and text inputs. Proposes attention redistribution as mitigation.

entry.title: OpenExempt: A Diagnostic Benchmark for Legal Reasoning and a Framework for Creating Custom Benchmarks on Demand

author.name: Sergio Servantez, Sarah B. Lawsky, Rajiv Jain, Daniel W. Linna Jr., Kristian Hammond

entry.summary: OpenExempt uses expert-crafted symbolic representations of U.S. Bankruptcy Code to dynamically generate legal reasoning tasks, enabling diagnostic evaluation of specific failure modes.

entry.title: OpenLearnLM Benchmark: A Unified Framework for Evaluating Knowledge, Skill, and Attitude in Educational Large Language Models

author.name: Unggi Lee, Sookbun Lee, Heungsoo Choi, Jinseo Lee, Haeun Park, Younghoon Jeon, Sungmin Cho, Minju Kang, Junbo Koh, Jiyeong Bae, Minwoo Nam, Juyeon Eun, Yeonji Jung, Yeil Jeong

entry.summary: OpenLearnLM Benchmark evaluates educational LLMs across Knowledge, Skills, and Attitude dimensions derived from learning sciences, with 124K+ items including Bloom's taxonomy grading.

entry.title: From Completion to Editing: Unlocking Context-Aware Code Infilling via Search-and-Replace Instruction Tuning

author.name: Jiajun Zhang, Zeyu Cui, Jiaxi Yang, Lei Zhang, Yuheng Jing, Zeyao Ma, Tianyi Bai, Zilei Wang, Qiang Liu, Liang Wang, Binyuan Hui, Junyang Lin

entry.summary: Search-and-Replace Infilling (SRI) extends code completion to editing by internalizing verification-and-editing in single-pass inference, enabling Chat LLMs to perform context-aware infilling with explicit search grounding.

entry.title: OCCAM: Class-Agnostic, Training-Free, Prior-Free and Multi-Class Object Counting

author.name: Michail Spanakis, Iason Oikonomidis, Antonis Argyros

entry.summary: Presents OCCAM, the first training-free class-agnostic counting approach operating without visual exemplars or text prompts. Handles multi-class counting across arbitrary object classes in single images.

entry.title: IIR-VLM: In-Context Instance-level Recognition for Large Vision-Language Models

author.name: Liang Shi, Wei Li, Kevin M Beussman, Lin Chen, Yun Fu

entry.summary: Proposes IIR-VLM for in-context instance-level recognition in VLMs, addressing dramatic underperformance compared to domain-specific models on tasks like person re-identification.

entry.title: Dynamical Systems Analysis Reveals Functional Regimes in Large Language Models

author.name: Hassan Ugail, Newton Howard

entry.summary: Adapts neuroscience concepts of temporal integration and metastability to analyze LLM internal dynamics during text generation. Evaluates composite dynamical metrics in GPT-2-medium across structured reasoning, repetition, and noise conditions.

entry.title: AEMA: Verifiable Evaluation Framework for Trustworthy and Controlled Agentic LLM Systems

author.name: YenTing Lee, Keerthi Koneru, Zahra Moslemi, Sheethal Kumar, Ramesh Radhakrishnan

entry.summary: AEMA is a process-aware, auditable framework for evaluating LLM-based multi-agent systems. Plans, executes, and aggregates multi-step evaluations with human oversight, achieving better stability than single LLM-as-Judge.

entry.title: Partial Reasoning in Language Models: Search and Refinement Guided by Uncertainty

author.name: Murilo da Luz, Bruno Brand\~ao, Luana Martins, Gustavo Oliveira, Bryan de Oliveira, Luckeciano Melo, Telma Soares

entry.summary: PREGU monitors output entropy during generation and halts when uncertainty is high, then performs localized latent space search using Soft Reasoning to refine partial reasoning.

entry.title: Are LLMs Smarter Than Chimpanzees? An Evaluation on Perspective Taking and Knowledge State Estimation

author.name: Dingyi Yang, Junqi Zhao, Xue Li, Ce Li, Boyang Li

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM ability to track knowledge states - detecting when characters know things they shouldn't and predicting actions based on character vs. objective knowledge. Most SOTA LLMs achieve near-random performance.

entry.title: MemeLens: Multilingual Multitask VLMs for Memes

author.name: Ali Ezzat Shahroor, Mohamed Bayan Kmainasi, Abul Hasnat, Dimitar Dimitrov, Giovanni Da San Martino, Preslav Nakov, Firoj Alam

entry.summary: MemeLens consolidates 38 meme datasets into unified multilingual multitask VLM for meme understanding, mapping labels into 20-task taxonomy covering harm, targets, figurative intent, and affect.

entry.title: Agentic Artificial Intelligence (AI): Architectures, Taxonomies, and Evaluation of Large Language Model Agents

author.name: Arunkumar V, Gangadharan G. R., Rajkumar Buyya

entry.summary: Survey proposing unified taxonomy for agentic AI systems, breaking agents into perception, cognition, and action components. Covers architectures from single-loop to hierarchical multi-agent.

entry.title: SL-CBM: Enhancing Concept Bottleneck Models with Semantic Locality for Better Interpretability

author.name: Hanwei Zhang, Luo Cheng, Rui Wen, Yang Zhang, Lijun Zhang, Holger Hermanns

entry.summary: SL-CBM extends Concept Bottleneck Models with semantic locality, enforcing spatial alignment between concepts and meaningful image regions through spatially coherent saliency maps.

entry.title: SCULPT: Constraint-Guided Pruned MCTS that Carves Efficient Paths for Mathematical Reasoning

author.name: Qitong Fang (Jilin Jianzhu University), Haotian Li (Jilin Jianzhu University), Xu Wang (Jilin Jianzhu University)

entry.summary: SCULPT integrates domain-aware constraint checking (dimensional consistency, type compatibility, magnitude sanity) into MCTS selection, expansion, simulation, and backpropagation for math reasoning.

entry.title: CURE-Med: Curriculum-Informed Reinforcement Learning for Multilingual Medical Reasoning

author.name: Eric Onyame, Akash Ghosh, Subhadip Baidya, Sriparna Saha, Xiuying Chen, Chirag Agarwal

entry.summary: CURE-Med combines curriculum learning, code-switching-aware SFT, and Group Relative Policy Optimization for multilingual medical reasoning across 13 languages including Amharic, Yoruba, and Swahili.

entry.title: Context and Transcripts Improve Detection of Deepfake Audios of Public Figures

author.name: Chongyang Gao, Marco Postiglione, Julian Baldwin, Natalia Denisenko, Isabel Gortner, Luke Fosdick, Chiara Pulice, Sarit Kraus, V. S. Subrahmanian

entry.summary: CADD architecture uses context and transcripts to improve audio deepfake detection. Creates JDD dataset of 255 public deepfakes from 70+ journalists. Shows context significantly improves detection.

entry.title: Reasoning is a Modality

author.name: Zhiguang Liu, Yi Shang

entry.summary: Argues that reasoning should be treated as a distinct modality separate from observable behavior in AI systems. Tests this hypothesis on the ARC benchmark, proposing that AI systems need persistent mental states rather than just behavior prediction.

entry.title: Context Discipline and Performance Correlation: Analyzing LLM Performance and Quality Degradation Under Varying Context Lengths

author.name: Ahilan Ayyachamy Nadar Ponnusamy, Karthic Chandran, M Maruf Hossain

entry.summary: Investigates the tradeoff between context length and LLM performance, identifying non-linear degradation tied to KV cache growth and behavioral anomalies in MoE architectures under varying context scales.

entry.title: Size is Not the Solution: Deformable Convolutions for Effective Physics Aware Deep Learning

author.name: Jack T. Beerman, Shobhan Roy, H. S. Udaykumar, Stephen S. Baek

entry.summary: Introduces D-PARC (deformable physics-aware recurrent convolutions) for scientific ML, inspired by Hybrid Lagrangian-Eulerian methods, achieving superior performance to larger architectures on physics problems.

entry.title: LIME-LLM: Probing Models with Fluent Counterfactuals, Not Broken Text

author.name: George Mihaila, Suleyman Olcay Polat, Poli Nemkova, Himanshu Sharma, Namratha V. Urs, Mark V. Albert

entry.summary: LIME-LLM replaces random token masking in LIME with LLM-generated hypothesis-driven controlled perturbations, producing semantically valid counterfactuals for more faithful local explanations.

entry.title: R$^2$PO: Decoupling Training Trajectories from Inference Responses for LLM Reasoning

author.name: Jingchu Wang, Bingbing Xu, Yige Yuan, Bin Xie, Xiaoqian Sun, Huawei Shen

entry.summary: R²PO introduces Residual Rollout-Head to decouple training trajectories from inference responses in LLM reasoning RL, enabling controlled trajectory diversification while keeping inference stable.

entry.title: AgenTRIM: Tool Risk Mitigation for Agentic AI

author.name: Roy Betser, Shamik Bose, Amit Giloni, Chiara Picardi, Sindhu Padakandla, Roman Vainshtein

entry.summary: Introduces AgenTRIM, a framework for detecting and mitigating tool-driven agency risks in AI agents without altering internal reasoning. Addresses excessive and insufficient agency through offline reconstruction and online verification.

entry.title: Beyond Single-shot Writing: Deep Research Agents are Unreliable at Multi-turn Report Revision

author.name: Bingsen Chen, Boyan Li, Ping Nie, Yuyu Zhang, Xi Ye, Chen Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces Mr Dre, an evaluation suite for multi-turn report revision by Deep Research Agents. Reveals critical limitation that DRAs can address feedback but inadvertently break previously correct content.

entry.title: ButterflyMoE: Sub-Linear Ternary Experts via Structured Butterfly Orbits

author.name: Aryan Karmore

entry.summary: Proposes ButterflyMoE achieving sub-linear memory scaling for MoE by treating experts as geometric rotations of shared ternary prototype. Achieves O(d² + N·d log d) memory.

entry.title: HardSecBench: Benchmarking the Security Awareness of LLMs for Hardware Code Generation

author.name: Qirui Chen, Jingxian Shuai, Shuangwu Chen, Shenghao Ye, Zijian Wen, Xufei Su, Jie Jin, Jiangming Li, Jun Chen, Xiaobin Tan, Jian Yang

entry.summary: HardSecBench benchmarks security awareness of LLMs for hardware code generation with 924 tasks spanning Verilog RTL and firmware C, covering 76 Common Weakness Enumerations relevant to hardware security.

entry.title: Top 10 Open Challenges Steering the Future of Diffusion Language Model and Its Variants

author.name: Yunhe Wang, Kai Han, Huiling Zhen, Yuchuan Tian, Hanting Chen, Yongbing Huang, Yufei Cui, Yingte Shu, Shan Gao, Ismail Elezi, Roy Vaughan Miles, Songcen Xu, Feng Wen, Chao Xu, Sinan Zeng, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Identifies ten fundamental challenges for Diffusion Language Models spanning architecture, training, and deployment, arguing DLMs offer transformative alternative to autoregressive models.

entry.title: FastAV: Efficient Token Pruning for Audio-Visual Large Language Model Inference

author.name: Chaeyoung Jung, Youngjoon Jang, Seungwoo Lee, Joon Son Chung

entry.summary: Presents FastAV, first token pruning framework for audio-visual LLMs. Uses attention weights to identify important tokens across stages, applying two-stage pruning (global in intermediate layers, fine in later layers).

entry.title: Enhancing Model Context Protocol (MCP) with Context-Aware Server Collaboration

author.name: Meenakshi Amulya Jayanti, X. Y. Han

entry.summary: Extends Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP) with a Shared Context Store (SCS) design enabling context-aware collaboration between servers, reducing redundancy and enabling knowledge transfer in multi-agent workflows.

entry.title: Objective Matters: Fine-Tuning Objectives Shape Safety, Robustness, and Persona Drift

author.name: Daniel Vennemeyer, Punya Syon Pandey, Phan Anh Duong, Michael Umeokoli, Samuel Ratnam

entry.summary: Presents controlled comparison of six fine-tuning objectives (SFT, DPO, CFT, Inoculation Prompting, ORPO, KL-regularized) showing that objective choice induces systematic, scale-dependent shifts along the safety-capability frontier.

entry.title: SWE-Tester: Training Open-Source LLMs for Issue Reproduction in Real-World Repositories

author.name: Aditya Bharat Soni, Rajat Ghosh, Vaishnavi Bhargava, Valerie Chen, Debojyoti Dutta

entry.summary: Proposes SWE-Tester pipeline for training open-source LLMs to generate issue reproduction tests from natural language descriptions. Curates 41K training instances from 2K+ repositories.

entry.title: Entropic Context Shaping: Information-Theoretic Filtering for Context-Aware LLM Agents

author.name: Hyunjun Kim

entry.summary: Introduces Entropic Context Shaping (ECS), an information-theoretic framework measuring context utility via answer distribution shift. Captures pragmatic utility rather than lexical similarity for LLM agent context engineering.

entry.title: Advances in LLM Reasoning Enable Flexibility in Clinical Problem-Solving

author.name: Kie Shidara, Preethi Prem, Jonathan Kim, Anna Podlasek, Feng Liu, Ahmed Alaa, Danilo Bernardo

entry.summary: Evaluates reasoning LLMs from OpenAI, Grok, Gemini, Claude, DeepSeek on mARC adversarial medical benchmark. Finds strong reasoning models achieve human-level performance avoiding Einstellung traps.

entry.title: Preserving Fairness and Safety in Quantized LLMs Through Critical Weight Protection

author.name: Muhammad Alif Al Hakim, Alfan Farizki Wicaksono, Fajri Koto

entry.summary: Studies how quantization degrades fairness and safety in LLMs across multiple languages, finding dynamic quantization is more stable than static methods. Proposes critical weight protection to preserve fairness during compression.

entry.title: Adversarial Alignment: Ensuring Value Consistency in Large Language Models for Sensitive Domains

author.name: Yuan Gao, Zhigang Liu, Xinyu Yao, Bo Chen, Xiaobing Zhao

entry.summary: Adversarial alignment framework uses attacker-actor-critic training to enhance LLM value consistency in sensitive domains (race, politics). Trains VC-LLM model.

entry.title: Reducing Tokenization Premiums for Low-Resource Languages

author.name: Geoffrey Churchill, Steven Skiena

entry.summary: Analyzes tokenization premiums for low-resource languages across 10 LMs and proposes post-hoc vocabulary additions to reduce costs, achieving significant reductions.

entry.title: FutureOmni: Evaluating Future Forecasting from Omni-Modal Context for Multimodal LLMs

author.name: Qian Chen, Jinlan Fu, Changsong Li, See-Kiong Ng, Xipeng Qiu

entry.summary: FutureOmni is the first benchmark for omni-modal future forecasting from audio-visual context, with 919 videos and 1034 QA pairs requiring cross-modal causal reasoning.

entry.title: RM-Distiller: Exploiting Generative LLM for Reward Model Distillation

author.name: Hongli Zhou, Hui Huang, Wei Liu, Chenglong Wang, Xingyuan Bu, Lvyuan Han, Fuhai Song, Muyun Yang, Wenhao Jiang, Hailong Cao, Tiejun Zhao

entry.summary: RM-Distiller exploits teacher LLM capabilities (refinement, scoring, ranking) for reward model distillation, moving beyond simple binary annotation.

entry.title: The Language You Ask In: Language-Conditioned Ideological Divergence in LLM Analysis of Contested Political Documents

author.name: Oleg Smirnov

entry.summary: Demonstrates that LLM-generated political analyses of the same Ukrainian document vary substantially based on prompt language (Russian vs Ukrainian), with Russian prompts producing outputs echoing Russian state narratives.

entry.title: Beyond Accuracy: Evaluating Grounded Visual Evidence in Thinking with Images

author.name: Xuchen Li, Xuzhao Li, Renjie Pi, Shiyu Hu, Jian Zhao, Jiahui Gao

entry.summary: ViEBench benchmark evaluates whether VLMs genuinely use visual evidence for reasoning (200 images with expert-annotated evidence), categorizing tasks by perception and reasoning difficulty.

entry.title: Large-scale EM Benchmark for Multi-Organelle Instance Segmentation in the Wild

author.name: Yanrui Lu, Danyang Chen, Haowen Xiao, Jiarui Zhu, Fukang Ge, Binqian Zou, Jiali Guan, Jiayin Liang, Yuting Wang, Ziqian Guan, Xiangcheng Bao, Jinhao Bi, Lin Gu, Jun He, Yingying Zhu

entry.summary: Develops a large-scale benchmark of 100,000+ 2D EM images across multiple cell types and five organelle classes for multi-organelle instance segmentation, with connectivity-aware label propagation algorithm.

entry.title: Proxy Robustness in Vision Language Models is Effortlessly Transferable

author.name: Xiaowei Fu, Fuxiang Huang, Lei Zhang

entry.summary: Reveals that vanilla CLIP exhibits intrinsic adversarial robustness against attacks from different-architecture CLIPs, defines this as 'proxy adversarial robustness', and proposes efficient distillation-based defense.

entry.title: Enginuity: Building an Open Multi-Domain Dataset of Complex Engineering Diagrams

author.name: Ethan Seefried, Prahitha Movva, Naga Harshita Marupaka, Tilak Kasturi, Tirthankar Ghosal

entry.summary: Introduces Enginuity, the first open large-scale multi-domain engineering diagram dataset with structural annotations for automated diagram parsing. Targets enabling AI systems to understand visual-structural knowledge in engineering contexts.

entry.title: Towards Visually Explaining Statistical Tests with Applications in Biomedical Imaging

author.name: Masoumeh Javanbakhat, Piotr Komorowski, Dilyara Bareeva, Wei-Chang Lai, Wojciech Samek, Christoph Lippert

entry.summary: Proposes explainable deep statistical testing framework augmenting two-sample tests with sample-level and feature-level explanations, revealing which samples and image regions drive significant group differences in biomedical analysis.

entry.title: Motion 3-to-4: 3D Motion Reconstruction for 4D Synthesis

author.name: Hongyuan Chen, Xingyu Chen, Youjia Zhang, Zexiang Xu, Anpei Chen

entry.summary: Presents Motion 3-to-4 for 4D synthesis from monocular video decomposing into static 3D shape generation and motion reconstruction using compact motion latent representation.

entry.title: Breaking Coordinate Overfitting: Geometry-Aware WiFi Sensing for Cross-Layout 3D Pose Estimation

author.name: Songming Jia, Yan Lu, Bin Liu, Xiang Zhang, Peng Zhao, Xinmeng Tang, Yelin Wei, Jinyang Huang, Huan Yan, Zhi Liu

entry.summary: Introduces PerceptAlign for WiFi-based cross-layout 3D pose estimation, discovering coordinate overfitting problem where models memorize transceiver layouts instead of learning activity representations.

entry.title: Diffusion-Guided Backdoor Attacks in Real-World Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Tairan Huang, Qingqing Ye, Yulin Jin, Jiawei Lian, Yi Wang, Haibo Hu

entry.summary: Studies backdoor attacks on RL policies in physical robotic systems, finding that safety constraints attenuate conventional attacks. Proposes DGBA using diffusion models to generate printable visual triggers that evade safety pipelines.

entry.title: MATTERIX: toward a digital twin for robotics-assisted chemistry laboratory automation

author.name: Kourosh Darvish, Arjun Sohal, Abhijoy Mandal, Hatem Fakhruldeen, Nikola Radulov, Zhengxue Zhou, Satheeshkumar Veeramani, Joshua Choi, Sijie Han, Brayden Zhang, Jeeyeoun Chae, Alex Wright, Yijie Wang, Hossein Darvish, Yuchi Zhao, Gary Tom, Han Hao, Miroslav Bogdanovic, Gabriella Pizzuto, Andrew I. Cooper, Al\'an Aspuru-Guzik, Florian Shkurti, Animesh Garg

entry.summary: MATTERIX is GPU-accelerated robotic simulation framework for chemistry lab digital twins, simulating manipulation, fluid dynamics, device functions, heat transfer, and basic reactions. From Cooper and Aspuru-Guzik labs.

entry.title: Understanding Mental States to Guide Social Influence in Multi-Person Group Dialogue

author.name: Zhichao Liang, Satoshi Nakamura

entry.summary: Introduces SocialMindChange, a benchmark that moves Theory of Mind evaluation from passive tracking to active social influence, requiring models to generate dialogue that shifts other characters' mental states toward goals.

entry.title: EPD-Serve: A Flexible Multimodal EPD Disaggregation Inference Serving System On Ascend

author.name: Fan Bai, Pai Peng, Zhengzhi Tang, Zhe Wang, Gong Chen, Xiang Lu, Yinuo Li, Huan Lin, Weizhe Lin, Yaoyuan Wang, Xiaosong Li

entry.summary: Proposes EPD-Serve, a stage-level disaggregated inference system for multimodal models separating Encode, Prefill, and Decode stages for flexible co-location on heterogeneous hardware.

entry.title: Serverless AI Security: Attack Surface Analysis and Runtime Protection Mechanisms for FaaS-Based Machine Learning

author.name: Chetan Pathade, Vinod Dhimam, Sheheryar Ahmad, Ilsa Lareb

entry.summary: First comprehensive security analysis of ML workloads in serverless FaaS environments, characterizing attack surface across five categories and proposing runtime protection mechanisms.

entry.title: Translation as a Scalable Proxy for Multilingual Evaluation

author.name: Sheriff Issaka, Erick Rosas Gonzalez, Lieqi Liu, Evans Kofi Agyei, Lucas Bandarkar, Nanyun Peng, David Ifeoluwa Adelani, Francisco Guzm\'an, Saadia Gabriel

entry.summary: Demonstrates that translation quality correlates strongly with broader multilingual capabilities, suggesting translation can serve as scalable proxy for evaluating LLMs on the 98% of languages lacking benchmarks.

entry.title: Speculative Sampling with Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Chenan Wang, Daniel H. Shi, Haipeng Chen

entry.summary: Re-SpS introduces first RL-based framework for speculative sampling, dynamically adjusting draft tree hyperparameters in real-time based on context-aware policies.

entry.title: Explanation Multiplicity in SHAP: Characterization and Assessment

author.name: Hyunseung Hwang, Seungeun Lee, Lucas Rosenblatt, Julia Stoyanovich, Steven Euijong Whang

entry.summary: Characterizes 'explanation multiplicity' in SHAP where multiple valid but substantively different explanations exist for the same decision. Develops methodology to disentangle sources from model training vs explanation pipeline.

entry.title: A model of errors in transformers

author.name: Suvrat Raju, Praneeth Netrapalli

entry.summary: Develops a theoretical two-parameter model of LLM errors on deterministic tasks like arithmetic, arguing errors arise from accumulated attention mechanism noise crossing thresholds.

entry.title: TimeART: Towards Agentic Time Series Reasoning via Tool-Augmentation

author.name: Xingjian Wu, Junkai Lu, Zhengyu Li, Xiangfei Qiu, Jilin Hu, Chenjuan Guo, Christian S. Jensen, Bin Yang

entry.summary: Introduces TimeART, an agentic framework combining analytical tools with LLM reasoning for time series question answering. Includes TimeToolBench with 100k expert trajectories for teaching strategic tool use.

entry.title: Knowledge Graph-Assisted LLM Post-Training for Enhanced Legal Reasoning

author.name: Dezhao Song, Guglielmo Bonifazi, Frank Schilder, Jonathan Richard Schwarz

entry.summary: Proposes knowledge graph-assisted LLM post-training for legal reasoning using IRAC framework. Constructs 12K case KG to improve legal reasoning through structured training.

entry.title: Do Clinical Question Answering Systems Really Need Specialised Medical Fine Tuning?

author.name: Sushant Kumar Ray, Gautam Siddharth Kashyap, Sahil Tripathi, Nipun Joshi, Vijay Govindarajan, Rafiq Ali, Jiechao Gao, Usman Naseem

entry.summary: Challenges the 'specialization fallacy' that medical LLMs need domain-specific fine-tuning. MEDASSESS-X framework shows general LLMs with proper alignment can match specialized models.

entry.title: Unlearning in LLMs: Methods, Evaluation, and Open Challenges

author.name: Tyler Lizzo, Larry Heck

entry.summary: Survey of LLM unlearning methods, categorizing approaches into data-centric, parameter-centric, architecture-centric, and hybrid strategies with evaluation ecosystem overview.

entry.title: Activation-Space Anchored Access Control for Multi-Class Permission Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Zhaopeng Zhang, Pengcheng Sun, Lan Zhang, Chen Tang, Jiewei Lai, Yunhao Wang, Hui Jin

entry.summary: AAAC discovers geometric regularity in activations for different permission scopes and uses activation anchors for training-free multi-class access control in LLM knowledge bases.

entry.title: Chain-of-Thought Compression Should Not Be Blind: V-Skip for Efficient Multimodal Reasoning via Dual-Path Anchoring

author.name: Dongxu Zhang, Yiding Sun, Cheng Tan, Wenbiao Yan, Ning Yang, Jihua Zhu, Hiajun Zhang

entry.summary: V-Skip addresses 'Visual Amnesia' in Chain-of-Thought compression for multimodal LLMs, where linguistically redundant tokens containing visual information are erroneously pruned. Uses dual-path gating with visual-anchored information bottleneck.

entry.title: Optical Linear Systems Framework for Event Sensing and Computational Neuromorphic Imaging

author.name: Nimrod Kruger, Nicholas Owen Ralph, Gregory Cohen, Paul Hurley

entry.summary: Presents physics-grounded framework mapping event camera streams to intensity estimates within dynamic linear systems model with time-varying PSF. Enables inverse filtering directly from event data using frequency-domain Wiener deconvolution.

entry.title: VERIDAH: Solving Enumeration Anomaly Aware Vertebra Labeling across Imaging Sequences

author.name: Hendrik M\"oller, Hanna Schoen, Robert Graf, Matan Atad, Nathan Molinier, Anjany Sekuboyina, Bettina K. Budai, Fabian Bamberg, Steffen Ringhof, Christopher Schlett, Tobias Pischon, Thoralf Niendorf, Josua A. Decker, Marc-Andr\'e Weber, Bjoern Menze, Daniel Rueckert, Jan S. Kirschke

entry.summary: Introduces VERIDAH for automatic vertebra labeling handling enumeration anomalies (11 or 13 thoracic vertebrae). First deep learning method addressing this clinically relevant variation affecting ~15% of population.

entry.title: OmniTransfer: All-in-one Framework for Spatio-temporal Video Transfer

author.name: Pengze Zhang, Yanze Wu, Mengtian Li, Xu Bai, Songtao Zhao, Fulong Ye, Chong Mou, Xinghui Li, Zhuowei Chen, Qian He, Mingyuan Gao

entry.summary: Proposes OmniTransfer, unified framework for spatio-temporal video transfer leveraging multi-view information across frames and temporal cues. Introduces Task-aware Positional Bias for unifying various video transfer tasks.

entry.title: AI Co-Scientist for Knowledge Synthesis in Medical Contexts: A Proof of Concept

author.name: Arya Rahgozar, Pouria Mortezaagha

entry.summary: AI co-scientist platform for medical knowledge synthesis using PICOS formalization, combining relational storage, vector retrieval, and Neo4j knowledge graphs. Evaluated on dementia-sport and non-communicable disease corpora.

entry.title: Survival is the Only Reward: Sustainable Self-Training Through Environment-Mediated Selection

author.name: Jennifer Dodgson, Alfath Daryl Alhajir, Michael Joedhitya, Akira Rafhael Janson Pattirane, Surender Suresh Kumar, Joseph Lim, C. H. Peh, Adith Ramdas, Steven Zhang Zhexu

entry.summary: Proposes self-training architecture where learning is mediated by environmental viability rather than reward functions. Only behaviors whose effects persist and preserve future interaction are propagated.

entry.title: Psych\=eChat: An Empathic Framework Focused on Emotion Shift Tracking and Safety Risk Analysis in Psychological Counseling

author.name: Zhentao Xia, Yongqi Fan, Yuxiang Chu, Yichao Yin, Liangliang Chen, Tong Ruan, Weiyan Zhang

entry.summary: PsychēChat integrates emotion shift tracking and safety risk analysis for psychological counseling, using role-playing to synthesize dialogues with emotion management and safety modules.

entry.title: VIRO: Robust and Efficient Neuro-Symbolic Reasoning with Verification for Referring Expression Comprehension

author.name: Hyejin Park, Junhyuk Kwon, Suha Kwak, Jungseul Ok

entry.summary: VIRO addresses cascading errors in neuro-symbolic referring expression comprehension by introducing verification to prevent high-confidence false positives when no target is present.

entry.title: Responsible AI for General-Purpose Systems: Overview, Challenges, and A Path Forward

author.name: Gourab K Patro, Himanshi Agrawal, Himanshu Gharat, Supriya Panigrahi, Nim Sherpa, Vishal Vaddina, Dagnachew Birru

entry.summary: Reviews risks of general-purpose AI systems across eight RAI principles (fairness, privacy, explainability, robustness, safety, truthfulness, governance, sustainability), comparing to traditional task-specific systems.

entry.title: Toward Efficient Agents: Memory, Tool learning, and Planning

author.name: Xiaofang Yang, Lijun Li, Heng Zhou, Tong Zhu, Xiaoye Qu, Yuchen Fan, Qianshan Wei, Rui Ye, Li Kang, Yiran Qin, Zhiqiang Kou, Daizong Liu, Qi Li, Ning Ding, Siheng Chen, Jing Shao

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on LLM agent efficiency covering memory, tool learning, and planning components. Reviews approaches for reducing latency, token usage, and computational steps in agentic systems.

entry.title: Predicting When to Trust Vision-Language Models for Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Muhammad Imran, Yugyung Lee

entry.summary: Proposes vision-based confidence estimation for predicting when to trust VLM spatial reasoning through geometric verification using object detection, achieving better trust calibration than text-based approaches.

entry.title: Double-Calibration: Towards Trustworthy LLMs via Calibrating Knowledge and Reasoning Confidence

author.name: Yuyin Lu, Ziran Liang, Yanghui Rao, Wenqi Fan, Fu Lee Wang, Qing Li

entry.summary: DoublyCal framework addresses LLM hallucination by augmenting with Knowledge Graphs while providing calibrated confidence scores for both retrieved evidence and final predictions.

entry.title: Powerful Training-Free Membership Inference Against Autoregressive Language Models

author.name: David Ili\'c, David Stanojevi\'c, Kostadin Cvejoski

entry.summary: EZ-MIA membership inference attack exploits error positions where models predict incorrectly but show elevated probability for training examples, introducing Error Zone score.

entry.title: Incentivizing In-depth Reasoning over Long Contexts with Process Advantage Shaping

author.name: Miao Peng, Weizhou Shen, Nuo Chen, Chenliang Li, Ming Yan, Jia Li

entry.summary: Identifies 'almost-there' phenomenon in long-context RL training where mostly-correct trajectories fail at final steps. Proposes process advantage shaping to address lack of high reasoning density and indiscriminate penalization of partial solutions.

entry.title: Beyond Memorization: Testing LLM Reasoning on Unseen Theory of Computation Tasks

author.name: Shlok Shelat, Jay Raval, Souvik Roy, Manas Gaur

entry.summary: Introduces benchmark for DFA construction from regular languages to test LLM symbolic reasoning. Shows 84-90% accuracy on seen tasks but 30-64% drops on unseen problems with hand-crafted or Arden's theorem-generated instances.

entry.title: Kakugo: Distillation of Low-Resource Languages into Small Language Models

author.name: Peter Devine, Mardhiyah Sanni, Farid Adilazuarda, Julieta Gil Loizaga, Barry Haddow

entry.summary: Kakugo presents a cost-effective pipeline (<$50/language) for training Small Language Models for 54 low-resource languages using synthetic data generation and translation from large teacher models.

entry.title: CooperLLM: Cloud-Edge-End Cooperative Federated Fine-tuning for LLMs via ZOO-based Gradient Correction

author.name: He Sun, Jinrui Zhou, Li Li, Mingjun Xiao

entry.summary: Proposes CooperLLM for federated LLM fine-tuning combining zeroth-order optimization on mobile devices with cloud-guided gradient rectification. Addresses memory constraints while enabling privacy-preserving personalization.

entry.title: Tears or Cheers? Benchmarking LLMs via Culturally Elicited Distinct Affective Responses

author.name: Chongyuan Dai, Yaling Shen, Jinpeng Hu, Zihan Gao, Jia Li, Yishun Jiang, Yaxiong Wang, Liu Liu, Zongyuan Ge

entry.summary: CEDAR is a multimodal benchmark for culturally elicited affective responses, testing whether LLMs can capture how different cultures interpret emotional stimuli.

entry.title: OI-Bench: An Option Injection Benchmark for Evaluating LLM Susceptibility to Directive Interference

author.name: Yow-Fu Liou, Yu-Chien Tang, Yu-Hsiang Liu, An-Zi Yen

entry.summary: OI-Bench tests LLM susceptibility to directive interference by injecting misleading options into MCQA. 3000 questions across 16 directive types reveal systematic vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Habibi: Laying the Open-Source Foundation of Unified-Dialectal Arabic Speech Synthesis

author.name: Yushen Chen, Junzhe Liu, Yujie Tu, Zhikang Niu, Yuzhe Liang, Kai Yu, Chunyu Qiang, Chen Zhang, Xie Chen

entry.summary: Habibi provides unified TTS models for Arabic dialects using curriculum learning on open-source ASR corpora. Outperforms leading commercial service in quality.

entry.title: From Tags to Trees: Structuring Fine-Grained Knowledge for Controllable Data Selection in LLM Instruction Tuning

author.name: Zihan Niu, Wenping Hu, Junmin Chen, Xiyue Wang, Tong Xu, Ruiming Tang

entry.summary: TAGS uses knowledge trees built from fine-grained tags to enable joint control of quality, diversity, and targeted knowledge coverage for instruction tuning data selection.

entry.title: AgenticPruner: MAC-Constrained Neural Network Compression via LLM-Driven Strategy Search

author.name: Shahrzad Esmat, Mahdi Banisharif, Ali Jannesari

entry.summary: AgenticPruner uses LLM agents (Claude 3.5 Sonnet) to achieve MAC-constrained neural network pruning through iterative strategy learning with profiling, orchestration, and analysis agents.

entry.title: ICo3D: An Interactive Conversational 3D Virtual Human

author.name: Richard Shaw, Youngkyoon Jang, Athanasios Papaioannou, Arthur Moreau, Helisa Dhamo, Zhensong Zhang, Eduardo P\'erez-Pellitero

entry.summary: Presents ICo3D for creating interactive conversational 3D virtual humans by combining animatable 3D face and body models with LLMs, featuring audio-driven face animation with SWinGS++ improvements.

entry.title: FastGHA: Generalized Few-Shot 3D Gaussian Head Avatars with Real-Time Animation

author.name: Xinya Ji, Sebastian Weiss, Manuel Kansy, Jacek Naruniec, Xun Cao, Barbara Solenthaler, Derek Bradley

entry.summary: Proposes FastGHA for generating high-quality Gaussian head avatars from few input images with real-time animation capability. Feed-forward method using DINOv3 and Stable Diffusion features.

entry.title: Vision Also You Need: Navigating Out-of-Distribution Detection with Multimodal Large Language Model

author.name: Haoran Xu, Yanlin Liu, Zizhao Tong, Jiaze Li, Kexue Fu, Yuyang Zhang, Longxiang Gao, Shuaiguang Li, Xingyu Li, Yanran Xu, Changwei Wang

entry.summary: Proposes MM-OOD pipeline leveraging MLLM multimodal reasoning and multi-round conversations for out-of-distribution detection, addressing over-reliance on text space in existing CLIP-based methods.

entry.title: FourierPET: Deep Fourier-based Unrolled Network for Low-count PET Reconstruction

author.name: Zheng Zhang, Hao Tang, Yingying Hu, Zhanli Hu, Jing Qin

entry.summary: Proposes FourierPET revealing degradations in low-count PET are spectrally separable: Poisson noise causes high-frequency phase perturbations while attenuation errors affect low-frequency amplitude. Designs frequency-specific unrolled network.

entry.title: Reasoning Stabilization Point: A Training-Time Signal for Stable Evidence and Shortcut Reliance

author.name: Sahil Rajesh Dhayalkar

entry.summary: Proposes tracking token-level attributions across fine-tuning epochs to identify when model reasoning stabilizes. Introduces 'Reasoning Stabilization Point' (RSP) as earliest epoch where attribution drift remains low.

entry.title: Foundations of Global Consistency Checking with Noisy LLM Oracles

author.name: Paul He, Elke Kirschbaum, Shiva Kasiviswanathan

entry.summary: Formalizes the problem of verifying global consistency across natural-language facts using noisy LLM oracles. Proves exponential worst-case complexity and proposes practical divide-and-conquer algorithms with polynomial query complexity.

entry.title: DeepEvidence: Empowering Biomedical Discovery with Deep Knowledge Graph Research

author.name: Zifeng Wang, Zheng Chen, Ziwei Yang, Xuan Wang, Qiao Jin, Yifan Peng, Zhiyong Lu, Jimeng Sun

entry.summary: Introduces DeepEvidence, an AI-agent framework for deep research across heterogeneous biomedical knowledge graphs, incorporating specialized KG tooling and coordinated exploration strategies.

entry.title: MATEX: Multi-scale Attention and Text-guided Explainability of Medical Vision-Language Models

author.name: Muhammad Imran, Chi Lee, Yugyung Lee

entry.summary: Introduces MATEX, a multi-scale attention explainability framework for medical VLMs combining attention rollout, text-guided spatial priors, and layer consistency for clinically meaningful attributions.

entry.title: Cleansing the Artificial Mind: A Self-Reflective Detoxification Framework for Large Language Models

author.name: Kaituo Zhang, Zhimeng Jiang, Na Zou

entry.summary: Self-reflective detoxification framework enabling LLMs to detect and correct toxic content using internal mechanisms without external modules, human intervention, or labeled data.

entry.title: PAIR-SAFE: A Paired-Agent Approach for Runtime Auditing and Refining AI-Mediated Mental Health Support

author.name: Jiwon Kim, Violeta J. Rodriguez, Dong Whi Yoo, Eshwar Chandrasekharan, Koustuv Saha

entry.summary: Introduces PAIR-SAFE, a paired-agent framework for auditing mental health AI responses using the clinically validated MITI-4 framework, with a Judge agent providing structured ALLOW/REVISE decisions.

entry.title: From 100,000+ images to winning the first brain MRI foundation model challenges: Sharing lessons and models

author.name: Pedro M. Gordaliza, Jaume Banus, Beno\^it G\'erin, Maxence Wynen, Nataliia Molchanova, Jonas Richiardi, Meritxell Bach Cuadra

entry.summary: Reports winning solution for MICCAI 2025 brain MRI foundation model challenges using U-Net CNN with anatomical priors. Models trained 10-100x faster and were 10x smaller than transformer competitors.

entry.title: HeteroCache: A Dynamic Retrieval Approach to Heterogeneous KV Cache Compression for Long-Context LLM Inference

author.name: Zhiyuan Shi, Qibo Qiu, Feng Xue, Zhonglin Jiang, Li Yu, Jian Jiang, Xiaofei He, Wenxiao Wang

entry.summary: Proposes HeteroCache, a training-free dynamic KV cache compression framework addressing attention drift in long-context LLMs. Exploits temporal heterogeneity and spatial redundancy.

entry.title: XCR-Bench: A Multi-Task Benchmark for Evaluating Cultural Reasoning in LLMs

author.name: Mohsinul Kabir, Tasnim Ahmed, Md Mezbaur Rahman, Shaoxiong Ji, Hassan Alhuzali, Sophia Ananiadou

entry.summary: XCR-Bench introduces a cross-cultural reasoning benchmark with 4.9k parallel sentences and 1,098 Culture-Specific Items spanning three reasoning tasks for evaluating LLM cultural competence.

entry.title: On the Relation of State Space Models and Hidden Markov Models

author.name: Aydin Ghojogh, M. Hadi Sepanj, Benyamin Ghojogh

entry.summary: Presents unified systematic comparison of Hidden Markov Models, linear Gaussian state space models, and modern neural sequence models (S4, Mamba). Clarifies relationships and differences in assumptions, inference, and training.

entry.title: FG-OrIU: Towards Better Forgetting via Feature-Gradient Orthogonality for Incremental Unlearning

author.name: Qian Feng, JiaHang Tu, Mintong Kang, Hanbin Zhao, Chao Zhang, Hui Qian

entry.summary: Proposes FG-OrIU for incremental unlearning with orthogonal constraints on both features and gradients, achieving 'deep forgetting' where effects are irreversible. First framework unifying both levels of constraints.

entry.title: AI Agents Need Memory Control Over More Context

author.name: Fouad Bousetouane

entry.summary: Introduces Agent Cognitive Compressor (ACC) framework for managing AI agent memory in long multi-turn workflows, addressing constraint drift, error accumulation, and memory-induced behavior degradation.

entry.title: RAPID-Serve: Resource-efficient and Accelerated P/D Intra-GPU Disaggregation
