author.name: Amna Masood, Pratishtha Gaur, Nuwan Jayasena

entry.summary: Proposes RAPID-Serve for concurrent prefill and decode execution on the same GPU to meet latency SLOs while maintaining high throughput, addressing limitations of both hybrid batching and disaggregated serving approaches.

entry.title: RM -RF: Reward Model for Run-Free Unit Test Evaluation

author.name: Elena Bruches, Daniil Grebenkin, Mikhail Klementev, Vadim Alperovich, Roman Derunets, Dari Baturova, Georgy Mkrtchyan, Oleg Sedukhin, Ivan Bondarenko, Nikolay Bushkov, Stanislav Moiseev

entry.summary: Presents RM-RF, a lightweight reward model that predicts test execution outcomes (compilation, coverage, mutation kills) without actually running tests. Enables faster evaluation of auto-generated unit tests across Java, Python, Go.

entry.title: LR-DWM: Efficient Watermarking for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Ofek Raban, Ethan Fetaya, Gal Chechik

entry.summary: LR-DWM introduces efficient watermarking for Diffusion Language Models, addressing the challenge that existing AR-focused watermarking methods don't work for iterative denoising generation.

entry.title: ChartAttack: Testing the Vulnerability of LLMs to Malicious Prompting in Chart Generation

author.name: Jesus-German Ortiz-Barajas, Jonathan Tonglet, Vivek Gupta, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: ChartAttack framework evaluates how MLLMs can be misused to generate misleading charts at scale by injecting misleaders into chart designs.

entry.title: Medical Triage as Pairwise Ranking: A Benchmark for Urgency in Patient Portal Messages

author.name: Joseph Gatto, Parker Seegmiller, Timothy Burdick, Philip Resnik, Roshnik Rahat, Sarah DeLozier, Sarah M. Preum

entry.summary: PMR-Bench introduces medical triage as pairwise ranking, training LLMs to choose which patient portal message is more medically urgent. Novel task formulation with 1569 messages.

entry.title: HyperWalker: Dynamic Hypergraph-Based Deep Diagnosis for Multi-Hop Clinical Modeling across EHR and X-Ray in Medical VLMs

author.name: Yuezhe Yang, Hao Wang, Yige Peng, Jinman Kim, Lei Bi

entry.summary: HyperWalker uses dynamic hypergraph construction for multi-hop clinical reasoning across EHR and X-ray data, enabling cross-patient example retrieval for diagnosis.

entry.title: S^2F-Net:A Robust Spatial-Spectral Fusion Framework for Cross-Model AIGC Detection

author.name: Xiangyu Hu, Yicheng Hong, Hongchuang Zheng, Wenjun Zeng, Bingyao Liu

entry.summary: Introduces S²F-Net for detecting AI-generated content by leveraging spatial-spectral fusion, focusing on frequency-domain fingerprints left by upsampling operations in generative models for cross-model generalization.

entry.title: PhaseMark: A Post-hoc, Optimization-Free Watermarking of AI-generated Images in the Latent Frequency Domain

author.name: Sung Ju Lee, Nam Ik Cho

entry.summary: Introduces PhaseMark, a single-shot watermarking method for AI-generated images that directly modulates phase in VAE latent frequency domain, achieving 1000x speedup over optimization-based methods.

entry.title: Spherical Geometry Diffusion: Generating High-quality 3D Face Geometry via Sphere-anchored Representations

author.name: Junyi Zhang, Yiming Wang, Yunhong Lu, Qichao Wang, Wenzhe Qian, Xiaoyin Xu, David Gu, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Spherical Geometry Diffusion for text-to-3D face generation by constraining vertex distribution onto a topological sphere. Novel sphere-anchored representation guarantees regular point distribution for robust mesh connectivity reconstruction.

entry.title: DExTeR: Weakly Semi-Supervised Object Detection with Class and Instance Experts for Medical Imaging

author.name: Adrien Meyer, Didier Mutter, Nicolas Padoy

entry.summary: Proposes DExTeR for weakly semi-supervised medical object detection using point annotations, introducing class and instance expert mechanisms to handle overlapping anatomy and variable object sizes.

entry.title: VENI: Variational Encoder for Natural Illumination

author.name: Paul Walker, James A. D. Gardner, Andreea Ardelean, William A. P. Smith, Bernhard Egger

entry.summary: Proposes VENI, rotation-equivariant VAE for natural illumination using novel Vector Neuron Vision Transformer. Models illumination on sphere without 2D projections, preserving SO(2)-equivariance.

entry.title: OpenNavMap: Structure-Free Topometric Mapping via Large-Scale Collaborative Localization

author.name: Jianhao Jiao, Changkun Liu, Jingwen Yu, Boyi Liu, Qianyi Zhang, Yue Wang, Dimitrios Kanoulas

entry.summary: Proposes OpenNavMap, structure-free topometric system for large-scale visual navigation using 3D geometric foundation models for on-demand reconstruction, avoiding traditional structure-based maintenance costs.

entry.title: No instrumental convergence without AI psychology

author.name: TurnTrout

entry.summary: TurnTrout argues that claims about instrumental convergence being independent of AI psychology are incorrect - predicting AI behavior necessarily requires assumptions about how AI selects plans.

entry.title: Risk-Aware Human-in-the-Loop Framework with Adaptive Intrusion Response for Autonomous Vehicles

author.name: Dawood Wasif, Terrence J. Moore, Seunghyun Yoon, Hyuk Lim, Dan Dongseong Kim, Frederica F. Nelson, Jin-Hee Cho

entry.summary: RAIL framework fuses curvature actuation integrity, time-to-collision, and observation-shift consistency into an Intrusion Risk Score for autonomous vehicles. Uses contextual bandits to arbitrate between safety shields.

entry.title: Are LLMs Ready for TOON? Benchmarking Structural Correctness-Sustainability Trade-offs in Novel Structured Output Formats

author.name: Elio Masciari, Vincenzo Moscato, Enea Vincenzo Napolitano, Gian Marco Orlando, Marco Perillo, Diego Russo

entry.summary: Introduces sustainability-aware evaluation for LLM structured outputs measuring token usage, generation time, and carbon emissions. Proposes GCS_env score and evaluates novel TOON format.

entry.title: Improving Large Molecular Language Model via Relation-aware Multimodal Collaboration

author.name: Jinyoung Park, Minseong Bae, Jeehye Na, Hyunwoo J. Kim

entry.summary: CoLLaMo is a molecular language model with multi-level modality-collaborative projector integrating 1D sequences, 2D graphs, and 3D conformations to reduce hallucination and improve robustness.

entry.title: Docs2Synth: A Synthetic Data Trained Retriever Framework for Scanned Visually Rich Documents Understanding

author.name: Yihao Ding, Qiang Sun, Puzhen Wu, Sirui Li, Siwen Luo, Wei Liu

entry.summary: Docs2Synth enables retrieval-guided inference for scanned documents in regulated domains using synthetic supervision, addressing lack of annotations and hallucination in MLLMs.

entry.title: STEP-LLM: Generating CAD STEP Models from Natural Language with Large Language Models

author.name: Xiangyu Shi, Junyang Ding, Xu Zhao, Sinong Zhan, Payal Mohapatra, Daniel Quispe, Kojo Welbeck, Jian Cao, Wei Chen, Ping Guo, Qi Zhu

entry.summary: STEP-LLM generates CAD STEP files directly from natural language, addressing the challenge of auto-regressive generation for graph-structured, cross-referenced formats used in manufacturing.

entry.title: Vision Language Models for Optimization-Driven Intent Processing in Autonomous Networks

author.name: Tasnim Ahmed, Yifan Zhu, Salimur Choudhury

entry.summary: IntentOpt benchmark tests whether VLMs can process annotated network diagrams into optimization code for traffic engineering and resource allocation, with 85 prompts across 50 object pairs.

entry.title: Explicit Cognitive Allocation: A Principle for Governed and Auditable Inference in Large Language Models

author.name: H\'ector Manuel Manzanilla-Granados, Zaira Navarrete-Cazales, Miriam Pescador-Rojas, Tonahtiu Ram\'irez-Romero

entry.summary: Proposes Explicit Cognitive Allocation principle separating epistemic functions (framing, exploration, retrieval, methodology, explanation) in AI-assisted inference. Instantiated in Cognitive Architecture.

entry.title: Towards Efficient and Robust Linguistic Emotion Diagnosis for Mental Health via Multi-Agent Instruction Refinement

author.name: Jian Zhang, Zhangqi Wang, Zhiyuan Wang, Weiping Fu, Yu He, Haiping Zhu, Qika Lin, Jun Liu

entry.summary: Multi-agent instruction refinement for linguistic emotion diagnosis in mental health contexts. Addresses emotional comorbidity and inefficient exploration of clinical cues.

entry.title: Autonomous Knowledge Graph Exploration with Adaptive Breadth-Depth Retrieval

author.name: Joaqu\'in Polonuer (Department of Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, USA, Departamento de Computaci\'on, FCEyN, Universidad de Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires, Argentina), Lucas Vittor (Department of Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, USA), I\~naki Arango (Department of Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, USA), Ayush Noori (Department of Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, USA, Department of Engineering Science, University of Oxford, Oxford, UK), David A. Clifton (Department of Engineering Science, University of Oxford, Oxford, UK, Oxford Suzhou Centre for Advanced Research, University of Oxford, Suzhou, Jiangsu, China), Luciano Del Corro (ELIAS Lab, Departamento de Ingenier\'ia, Universidad de San Andr\'es, Victoria, Argentina, Lumina Labs, Buenos Aires, Argentina), Marinka Zitnik (Department of Biomedical Informatics, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, USA, Kempner Institute for the Study of Natural and Artificial Intelligence, Allston, MA, USA, Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, Cambridge, MA, USA, Harvard Data Science Initiative, Cambridge, MA, USA)

entry.summary: Introduces ARK, an agentic knowledge graph retriever that gives LLMs control over breadth-depth tradeoffs using global lexical search and neighborhood exploration tools. From Harvard/Oxford researchers.

entry.title: Mixture-of-Experts as Soft Clustering: A Dual Jacobian-PCA Spectral Geometry Perspective

author.name: Feilong Liu

entry.summary: Interprets MoE architectures through geometric lens as soft partitioning, using Jacobian-PCA spectral analysis to characterize local function geometry under different routing strategies.

entry.title: WISP: Waste- and Interference-Suppressed Distributed Speculative LLM Serving at the Edge via Dynamic Drafting and SLO-Aware Batching

author.name: Xiangchen Li, Jiakun Fan, Qingyuan Wang, Dimitrios Spatharakis, Saeid Ghafouri, Hans Vandierendonck, Deepu John, Bo Ji, Ali R. Butt, Dimitrios S. Nikolopoulos

entry.summary: Introduces WISP for distributed speculative LLM serving, combining dynamic draft length adjustment with SLO-aware batching to optimize edge-cloud inference.

entry.title: Human-Human-AI Triadic Programming: Uncovering the Role of AI Agent and the Value of Human Partner in Collaborative Learning

author.name: Taufiq Daryanto, Xiaohan Ding, Kaike Ping, Lance T. Wilhelm, Yan Chen, Chris Brown, Eugenia H. Rho

entry.summary: Within-subjects study of human-human-AI triadic programming shows AI as additional collaborator enhances collaborative learning and social presence compared to dyadic human-AI baseline.

entry.title: Multimodal Generative Engine Optimization: Rank Manipulation for Vision-Language Model Rankers

author.name: Yixuan Du, Chenxiao Yu, Haoyan Xu, Ziyi Wang, Yue Zhao, Xiyang Hu

entry.summary: MGEO adversarial framework demonstrates VLM-based product search vulnerability through joint optimization of imperceptible image perturbations and textual suffixes for rank manipulation.

entry.title: Beyond the Dirac Delta: Mitigating Diversity Collapse in Reinforcement Fine-Tuning for Versatile Image Generation

author.name: Jinmei Liu, Haoru Li, Zhenhong Sun, Chaofeng Chen, Yatao Bian, Bo Wang, Daoyi Dong, Chunlin Chen, Zhi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes DRIFT, a framework addressing diversity collapse in reinforcement learning fine-tuning of diffusion models. Systematically incentivizes output diversity while maintaining task alignment during on-policy fine-tuning.

entry.title: SciCoQA: Quality Assurance for Scientific Paper--Code Alignment

author.name: Tim Baumg\"artner, Iryna Gurevych

entry.summary: Presents SciCoQA, a dataset for detecting discrepancies between scientific papers and codebases using GitHub issues, reproducibility papers, and synthetic generation. Covers diverse computational science domains.

entry.title: AI Skills Improve Job Prospects: Causal Evidence from a Hiring Experiment

author.name: Fabian Stephany, Ole Teutloff, Angelo Leone

entry.summary: Experimental study with 1,700 recruiters showing AI skills significantly increase interview invitation rates and can offset disadvantages like older age or lower education across three occupations.

entry.title: Preconditioning Benefits of Spectral Orthogonalization in Muon

author.name: Jianhao Ma, Yu Huang, Yuejie Chi, Yuxin Chen

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of Muon optimizer's spectral orthogonalization through matrix factorization and linear transformer case studies. Proves condition-number-independent convergence.

entry.title: MASCOT: Towards Multi-Agent Socio-Collaborative Companion Systems

author.name: Yiyang Wang, Yiqiao Jin, Alex Cabral, Josiah Hester

entry.summary: MASCOT introduces a multi-agent framework for socio-collaborative companions addressing persona collapse and social sycophancy through bi-level optimization with persona-aware and collaborative optimization.

entry.title: Extreme Value Policy Optimization for Safe Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Shiqing Gao, Yihang Zhou, Shuai Shao, Haoyu Luo, Yiheng Bing, Jiaxin Ding, Luoyi Fu, Xinbing Wang

entry.summary: EVO leverages Extreme Value Theory for safe RL, modeling and exploiting extreme reward and cost samples to explicitly capture tail distribution risks and reduce constraint violations.

entry.title: PaperGuide: Making Small Language-Model Paper-Reading Agents More Efficient

author.name: Zijian Wang, Tiancheng Huang, Hanqi Li, Da Ma, Lu Chen, Kai Yu

entry.summary: Proposes PaperCompass framework for small language model paper-reading agents, separating high-level planning from fine-grained execution. Mitigates excessive low-yield exploration in existing approaches.

entry.title: Evaluating Contextually Mediated Factual Recall in Multilingual Large Language Models

author.name: Yihong Liu, Bingyu Xiong, Hinrich Sch\"utze

entry.summary: Studies contextually mediated factual recall where target entities are introduced indirectly rather than explicitly named. Finds LLMs struggle with referential mediation across languages.

entry.title: Agentic Conversational Search with Contextualized Reasoning via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Fengran Mo, Yifan Gao, Sha Li, Hansi Zeng, Xin Liu, Zhaoxuan Tan, Xian Li, Jianshu Chen, Dakuo Wang, Meng Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes agentic conversational search with RL-based reasoning for dynamic query reformulation and action optimization in multi-turn dialogues.

entry.title: Anonpsy: A Graph-Based Framework for Structure-Preserving De-identification of Psychiatric Narratives

author.name: Kyung Ho Lim, Byung-Hoon Kim

entry.summary: Anonpsy reformulates psychiatric narrative de-identification as graph-guided semantic rewriting, preserving clinical structure while modifying identifying context.

entry.title: Dimension-First Evaluation of Speech-to-Speech Models with Structured Acoustic Cues

author.name: Arjun Chandra, Kevin Miller, Venkatesh Ravichandran, Constantinos Papayiannis, Venkatesh Saligrama

entry.summary: TRACE framework enables LLM judges to evaluate speech-to-speech systems by reasoning over structured audio cues, separating content, voice quality, and paralinguistics dimensions.

entry.title: Privacy-Preserving Federated Learning with Verifiable Fairness Guarantees

author.name: Mohammed Himayath Ali, Mohammed Aqib Abdullah, Syed Muneer Hussin, Mohammed Mudassir Uddin, Shahnawaz Alam

entry.summary: CryptoFair-FL combines homomorphic encryption with secure multi-party computation to enable privacy-preserving verification of demographic parity and equalized odds in federated learning without revealing protected attributes.

entry.title: Evaluating Self-Correcting Vision Agents Through Quantitative and Qualitative Metrics

author.name: Aradhya Dixit

entry.summary: Diagnostic micro-benchmark for Vision-Language Agents that decouples Task Success Rate from Correction Success Rate, finding initial competence doesn't predict repair ability and correction saturates after 3 retries.

entry.title: DAOS: A Multimodal In-cabin Behavior Monitoring with Driver Action-Object Synergy Dataset

author.name: Yiming Li, Chen Cai, Tianyi Liu, Dan Lin, Wenqian Wang, Wenfei Liang, Bingbing Li, Kim-Hui Yap

entry.summary: DAOS dataset with 9,787 video clips annotated with 36 driver actions and 15 object classes (2.5M+ object instances) to enable action-object synergy understanding for driver monitoring.

entry.title: VILTA: A VLM-in-the-Loop Adversary for Enhancing Driving Policy Robustness

author.name: Qimao Chen, Fang Li, Shaoqing Xu, Zhiyi Lai, Zixun Xie, Yuechen Luo, Shengyin Jiang, Hanbing Li, Long Chen, Bing Wang, Yi Zhang, Zhi-Xin Yang

entry.summary: Proposes VILTA, using VLMs in-the-loop to directly generate hazardous trajectories for adversarial scenario generation in autonomous driving, addressing the long-tail problem of rare critical scenarios.

entry.title: SGW-GAN: Sliced Gromov-Wasserstein Guided GANs for Retinal Fundus Image Enhancement

author.name: Yujian Xiong, Xuanzhao Dong, Wenhui Zhu, Xin Li, Oana Dumitrascu, Yalin Wang

entry.summary: Proposes SGW-GAN using Sliced Gromov-Wasserstein discrepancy for retinal fundus image enhancement, preserving intra-class geometric structure that standard GAN/diffusion methods distort. Addresses clinical downstream task degradation.

entry.title: VIAFormer: Voxel-Image Alignment Transformer for High-Fidelity Voxel Refinement

author.name: Tiancheng Fang, Bowen Pan, Lingxi Chen, Jiangjing Lyu, Chengfei Lyu, Chaoyue Niu, Fan Wu

entry.summary: Proposes VIAFormer for multi-view conditioned voxel refinement using Image Index for 3D spatial grounding, Correctional Flow objective, and Hybrid Stream Transformer. Corrects artifacts from vision foundation models.

entry.title: PREGEN: Uncovering Latent Thoughts in Composed Video Retrieval

author.name: Gabriele Serussi, David Vainshtein, Jonathan Kouchly, Dotan Di Castro, Chaim Baskin

entry.summary: Introduces PREGEN for composed video retrieval pairing frozen VLM with lightweight encoder, extracting hidden states without fine-tuning. Eliminates expensive caption generation while achieving efficient retrieval.

entry.title: STEC: A Reference-Free Spatio-Temporal Entropy Coverage Metric for Evaluating Sampled Video Frames

author.name: Shih-Yao Lin

entry.summary: Proposes STEC, a reference-free metric for evaluating video frame sampling quality based on spatio-temporal entropy coverage. Measures whether sampled frames capture informative, representative content.

entry.title: One-Shot Refiner: Boosting Feed-forward Novel View Synthesis via One-Step Diffusion

author.name: Yitong Dong, Qi Zhang, Minchao Jiang, Zhiqiang Wu, Qingnan Fan, Ying Feng, Huaqi Zhang, Hujun Bao, Guofeng Zhang

entry.summary: Presents One-Shot Refiner framework for high-fidelity novel view synthesis from sparse images, combining Dual-Domain Detail Perception Module for high-resolution handling with one-step diffusion refinement.

entry.title: DARC: Decoupled Asymmetric Reasoning Curriculum for LLM Evolution

author.name: Shengda Fan, Xuyan Ye, Yankai Lin

entry.summary: Proposes DARC, a two-stage framework for LLM self-evolution that addresses optimization instability in self-play by decoupling questioner training (difficulty-calibrated synthesis) from solver training (asymmetric curriculum learning).

entry.title: Chatsparent: An Interactive System for Detecting and Mitigating Cognitive Fatigue in LLMs

author.name: Riju Marwah, Vishal Pallagani, Ritvik Garimella, Amit Sheth

entry.summary: Introduces Chatsparent, an interactive system that detects cognitive fatigue in LLMs through token-level signals including attention decay, embedding drift, and entropy collapse, providing real-time visualization.

entry.title: Distill-then-Replace: Efficient Task-Specific Hybrid Attention Model Construction

author.name: Xiaojie Xia, Huigang Zhang, Chaoliang Zhong, Jun Sun, Yusuke Oishi

entry.summary: Proposes Distill-then-Replace for efficient hybrid attention construction, transferring pretrained weights to linear attention via distillation and learning optimal attention type placement.

entry.title: LSTM-MAS: A Long Short-Term Memory Inspired Multi-Agent System for Long-Context Understanding

author.name: Yichen Jiang, Peng Ye, Jiakang Yuan, Chongjun Tu, Lei Bai, Tao Chen

entry.summary: LSTM-MAS is a multi-agent system inspired by LSTM architecture, emulating hierarchical information flow and gated memory mechanisms for long-context understanding in LLMs.

entry.title: AQUA-Bench: Beyond Finding Answers to Knowing When There Are None in Audio Question Answering

author.name: Chun-Yi Kuan, Hung-yi Lee

entry.summary: AQUA-Bench evaluates audio LLMs on unanswerable questions across three scenarios: absent answers, incompatible answer sets, and incompatible audio-question pairs.

entry.title: From Prefix Cache to Fusion RAG Cache: Accelerating LLM Inference in Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Jiahao Wang, Weiyu Xie, Mingxing Zhang, Boxing Zhang, Jianwei Dong, Yuening Zhu, Chen Lin, Jinqi Tang, Yaochen Han, Zhiyuan Ai, Xianglin Chen, Yongwei Wu, Congfeng Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes FusionRAG optimizing RAG inference by reusing precomputed KV cache of chunks while preserving cross-chunk contextual information that existing methods lose.

entry.title: Labels or Preferences? Budget-Constrained Learning with Human Judgments over AI-Generated Outputs

author.name: Zihan Dong, Ruijia Wu, Linjun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes PCAL (Preference-Calibrated Active Learning) for optimal budget allocation between ground-truth labels and pairwise preferences. Uses semi-parametric inference with asymptotic optimality guarantees.

entry.title: "The Whole Is Greater Than the Sum of Its Parts": A Compatibility-Aware Multi-Teacher CoT Distillation Framework

author.name: Jin Cui, Jiaqi Guo, Jiepeng Zhou, Ruixuan Yang, Jiayi Lu, Jiajun Xu, Jiangcheng Song, Boran Zhao, Pengju Ren

entry.summary: COMA introduces a compatibility-aware multi-teacher CoT distillation framework that addresses teacher-student incompatibility and passive supervision issues when distilling reasoning from diverse LLM teachers.

entry.title: ELSA: Efficient LLM-Centric Split Aggregation for Privacy-Aware Hierarchical Federated Learning over Resource-Constrained Edge Networks

author.name: Xiaohong Yang, Tong Xie, Minghui Liwang, Chikai Shang, Yang Lu, Zhenzhen Jiao, Liqun Fu, Seyyedali Hosseinalipour

entry.summary: Proposes ELSA integrating split learning with hierarchical federated learning for LLM fine-tuning at edge. Includes task-agnostic client clustering, trust scoring, and latency-aware assignment.

entry.title: Optimizing User Profiles via Contextual Bandits for Retrieval-Augmented LLM Personalization

author.name: Linfeng Du, Ye Yuan, Zichen Zhao, Fuyuan Lyu, Emiliano Penaloza, Xiuying Chen, Zipeng Sun, Jikun Kang, Laurent Charlin, Xue Liu, Haolun Wu

entry.summary: PURPLE uses contextual bandits to optimize which user history records to include for RAG personalization, arguing semantic relevance is an unreliable proxy for utility. Treats profile selection as exploration-exploitation problem.

entry.title: Multimodal Multi-Agent Empowered Legal Judgment Prediction

author.name: Zhaolu Kang, Junhao Gong, Qingxi Chen, Hao Zhang, Jiaxin Liu, Rong Fu, Zhiyuan Feng, Yuan Wang, Simon Fong, Kaiyue Zhou

entry.summary: JurisMMA is a multi-agent framework for legal judgment prediction using multimodal data. Introduces JurisMM dataset with 100k+ Chinese judicial records including video-text data.

entry.title: A BERTology View of LLM Orchestrations: Token- and Layer-Selective Probes for Efficient Single-Pass Classification

author.name: Gonzalo Ariel Meyoyan, Luciano Del Corro

entry.summary: Proposes training lightweight probes on LLM hidden states for single-pass classification, reusing computation from generation. Two-stage aggregator over token-layer tensor.

entry.title: PRiSM: Benchmarking Phone Realization in Speech Models

author.name: Shikhar Bharadwaj, Chin-Jou Li, Yoonjae Kim, Kwanghee Choi, Eunjung Yeo, Ryan Soh-Eun Shim, Hanyu Zhou, Brendon Boldt, Karen Rosero Jacome, Kalvin Chang, Darsh Agrawal, Keer Xu, Chao-Han Huck Yang, Jian Zhu, Shinji Watanabe, David R. Mortensen

entry.summary: PRiSM is the first open-source phone recognition benchmark with intrinsic and extrinsic evaluation across clinical, educational, and multilingual settings.

entry.title: KG-ViP: Bridging Knowledge Grounding and Visual Perception in Multi-modal LLMs for Visual Question Answering

author.name: Zhiyang Li, Ao Ke, Yukun Cao, Xike Xie

entry.summary: KG-ViP unifies scene graphs (visual details) and commonsense graphs (external knowledge) to address both knowledge hallucination and insufficient visual perception in VQA through retrieval-and-fusion pipeline.

entry.title: A Unified Masked Jigsaw Puzzle Framework for Vision and Language Models

author.name: Weixin Ye, Wei Wang, Yahui Liu, Yue Song, Bin Ren, Wei Bi, Rita Cucchiara, Nicu Sebe

entry.summary: Masked Jigsaw Puzzle (MJP) framework defends against gradient attacks in federated learning by shuffling tokens and masking position embeddings to protect Transformers.

entry.title: GO-MLVTON: Garment Occlusion-Aware Multi-Layer Virtual Try-On with Diffusion Models

author.name: Yang Yu, Yunze Deng, Yige Zhang, Yanjie Xiao, Youkun Ou, Wenhao Hu, Mingchao Li, Bin Feng, Wenyu Liu, Dandan Zheng, Jingdong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes GO-MLVTON, the first multi-layer virtual try-on method addressing realistic occlusion relationships between inner and outer garments using Garment Occlusion Learning module and StableDiffusion-based morphing.

entry.title: Facial Spatiotemporal Graphs: Leveraging the 3D Facial Surface for Remote Physiological Measurement

author.name: Sam Cantrill, David Ahmedt-Aristizabal, Lars Petersson, Hanna Suominen, Mohammad Ali Armin

entry.summary: Introduces Facial Spatiotemporal Graph representation encoding facial color and structure using 3D mesh sequences for remote photoplethysmography. MeshPhys achieves SOTA performance in heart rate estimation.

entry.title: FantasyVLN: Unified Multimodal Chain-of-Thought Reasoning for Vision-Language Navigation

author.name: Jing Zuo, Lingzhou Mu, Fan Jiang, Chengcheng Ma, Mu Xu, Yonggang Qi

entry.summary: Proposes FantasyVLN for vision-language navigation using unified multimodal chain-of-thought reasoning, addressing limitations of purely textual CoTs lacking spatial grounding and multimodal CoTs causing token inflation.

entry.title: Data-Consistent Learning of Inverse Problems

author.name: Markus Haltmeier, Gyeongha Hwang

entry.summary: Presents theoretical framework for data-consistent learning of inverse problems, showing null-space networks with classical regularization define convergent regularization methods preserving theoretical reliability.

entry.title: MyGram: Modality-aware Graph Transformer with Global Distribution for Multi-modal Entity Alignment

author.name: Zhifei Li, Ziyue Qin, Xiangyu Luo, Xiaoju Hou, Yue Zhao, Miao Zhang, Zhifang Huang, Kui Xiao, Bing Yang

entry.summary: MyGram uses modality-aware graph transformer with Gram Loss for multi-modal entity alignment. Captures deep structural contextual information within modalities for fine-grained fusion.

entry.title: UniMo: Unified Motion Generation and Understanding with Chain of Thought

author.name: Guocun Wang, Kenkun Liu, Jing Lin, Guorui Song, Jian Li, Xiaoguang Han

entry.summary: UniMo integrates motion-language with chain-of-thought reasoning via SFT, then uses Group Relative Policy Optimization to improve alignment. Addresses cumulative error problems in next-token prediction for motion.

entry.title: FutureX-Pro: Extending Future Prediction to High-Value Vertical Domains

author.name: Jiashuo Liu, Siyuan Chen, Zaiyuan Wang, Zhiyuan Zeng, Jiacheng Guo, Liang Hu, Lingyue Yin, Suozhi Huang, Wenxin Hao, Yang Yang, Zerui Cheng, Zixin Yao, Lingyue Yin, Haoxin Liu, Jiayi Cheng, Yuzhen Li, Zezhong Ma, Bingjie Wang, Bingsen Qiu, Xiao Liu, Zeyang Zhang, Zijian Liu, Jinpeng Wang, Mingren Yin, Tianci He, Yali Liao, Yixiao Tian, Zhenwei Zhu, Anqi Dai, Ge Zhang, Jingkai Liu, Kaiyuan Zhang, Wenlong Wu, Xiang Gao, Xinjie Chen, Zhixin Yao, Zhoufutu Wen, B. Aditya Prakash, Jose Blanchet, Mengdi Wang, Nian Si, Wenhao Huang

entry.summary: FutureX-Pro extends future prediction benchmark to finance, retail, public health, and natural disaster domains. Evaluates agentic LLMs on entry-level prediction tasks in high-stakes verticals.

entry.title: PepEDiff: Zero-Shot Peptide Binder Design via Protein Embedding Diffusion

author.name: Po-Yu Liang, Tobo Duran, Jun Bai

entry.summary: PepEDiff generates peptide binder sequences directly in latent space from protein embeddings without intermediate structure prediction. Uses latent-space exploration to avoid memorizing known sequences.

entry.title: A Lightweight Modular Framework for Constructing Autonomous Agents Driven by Large Language Models: Design, Implementation, and Applications in AgentForge

author.name: Akbar Anbar Jafari, Cagri Ozcinar, Gholamreza Anbarjafari

entry.summary: AgentForge is lightweight open-source Python framework for LLM agents with composable skill abstractions, unified LLM backend interface, and fine-grained input-output contracts.

entry.title: TruthTensor: Evaluating LLMs Human Imitation through Prediction Market Drift and Holistic Reasoning

author.name: Shirin Shahabi, Spencer Graham, Haruna Isah

entry.summary: Proposes TruthTensor, a new LLM evaluation paradigm using live prediction markets to assess models as human-imitation systems in high-entropy environments. Addresses benchmark contamination and distribution shift issues in standard evaluations.

entry.title: Measuring Stability Beyond Accuracy in Small Open-Source Medical Large Language Models for Pediatric Endocrinology

author.name: Vanessa D'Amario, Randy Daniel, Alessandro Zanetti, Dhruv Edamadaka, Nitya Alaparthy, Joshua Tarkoff

entry.summary: Evaluates six small open-source medical LLMs on pediatric endocrinology, assessing stability beyond accuracy through prompt variation effects and self-assessment bias in deterministic and stochastic settings.

entry.title: Semantic Caching and Intent-Driven Context Optimization for Multi-Agent Natural Language to Code Systems

author.name: Harmohit Singh

entry.summary: Production-optimized multi-agent system for natural language to Python code translation achieving 67% semantic cache hit rates and 40-60% token reduction through intent-driven dynamic prompt assembly.

entry.title: Large language models struggle with ethnographic text annotation

author.name: Leonardo S. Goodall, Dor Shilton, Daniel A. Mullins, Harvey Whitehouse

entry.summary: Evaluates 7 SOTA LLMs on annotating 121 ritual features across 567 ethnographic excerpts, finding performance well below reliable automated annotation levels.

entry.title: Efficient Privacy-Preserving Retrieval Augmented Generation with Distance-Preserving Encryption

author.name: Huanyi Ye, Jiale Guo, Ziyao Liu, Kwok-Yan Lam

entry.summary: Proposes a privacy-preserving RAG system using distance-preserving encryption to protect embeddings from reconstruction attacks when using untrusted cloud storage. Addresses practical security concerns for RAG deployment.

entry.title: Training instability in deep learning follows low-dimensional dynamical principles

author.name: Zhipeng Zhang, Zhenjie Yao, Kai Li, Lei Yang

entry.summary: Proposes a unified dynamical perspective characterizing deep learning training stability across four dimensions: optimization, environmental/data, parametric, and learning-signal. Uses controlled perturbation auditing to study training trajectories.

entry.title: The AI Genie Phenomenon and Three Types of AI Chatbot Addiction: Escapist Roleplays, Pseudosocial Companions, and Epistemic Rabbit Holes

author.name: M. Karen Shen, Jessica Huang, Olivia Liang, Ig-Jae Kim, Dongwook Yoon

entry.summary: Analyzes AI chatbot addiction through Reddit data (334 entries), identifying 'AI Genie' phenomenon and three addiction types: escapist roleplays, pseudosocial companions, and epistemic rabbit holes.

entry.title: Hierarchical Long Video Understanding with Audiovisual Entity Cohesion and Agentic Search

author.name: Xinlei Yin, Xiulian Peng, Xiao Li, Zhiwei Xiong, Yan Lu

entry.summary: HAVEN presents a unified framework for long video understanding that addresses information fragmentation through audiovisual entity cohesion and hierarchical video indexing with agentic search. It organizes video content into structured hierarchies spanning global summaries to entity levels.

entry.title: Glance-or-Gaze: Incentivizing LMMs to Adaptively Focus Search via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Hongbo Bai, Yujin Zhou, Yile Wu, Chi-Min Chan, Pengcheng Wen, Kunhao Pan, Sirui Han, Yike Guo

entry.summary: Glance-or-Gaze proposes a fully autonomous framework for visual understanding that shifts from passive perception to active visual planning, introducing a Selective Gaze mechanism for dynamic search decisions.

entry.title: VideoMaMa: Mask-Guided Video Matting via Generative Prior

author.name: Sangbeom Lim, Seoung Wug Oh, Jiahui Huang, Heeji Yoon, Seungryong Kim, Joon-Young Lee

entry.summary: VideoMaMa presents mask-to-matte video conversion using diffusion model priors, achieving zero-shot generalization. Constructs MA-V dataset with 50K real-world video matting annotations.

entry.title: Controlling Underestimation Bias in Constrained Reinforcement Learning for Safe Exploration

author.name: Shiqing Gao, Jiaxin Ding, Luoyi Fu, Xinbing Wang

entry.summary: MICE proposes memory-driven intrinsic cost estimation for safe RL that introduces intrinsic costs to mitigate value function underestimation, inspired by human flashbulb memory of dangerous experiences.

entry.title: Principled Latent Diffusion for Graphs via Laplacian Autoencoders

author.name: Antoine Siraudin, Christopher Morris

entry.summary: Proposes LG-Flow, latent graph diffusion framework using permutation-equivariant autoencoder for lossless graph compression. Addresses key challenge that graph generation requires near-perfect reconstruction.

entry.title: Semantic Differentiation for Tackling Challenges in Watermarking Low-Entropy Constrained Generation Outputs

author.name: Nghia T. Le, Alan Ritter, Kartik Goyal

entry.summary: Proposes SeqMark, a sequence-level watermarking algorithm with semantic differentiation that addresses failure modes of token-level watermarking for constrained generation tasks with low-entropy output spaces.

entry.title: A Component-Based Survey of Interactions between Large Language Models and Multi-Armed Bandits

author.name: Miao Xie, Siguang Chen, Chunli Lv

entry.summary: First survey systematically reviewing bidirectional interactions between LLMs and multi-armed bandits at component level. Shows how MAB helps LLM pre-training/RAG/personalization, and how LLMs enhance MAB arm definition and reward modeling.

entry.title: Bridging the Gap Between Estimated and True Regret Towards Reliable Regret Estimation in Deep Learning based Mechanism Design

author.name: Shuyuan You, Zhiqiang Zhuang, Kewen Wang, Zhe Wang

entry.summary: Reveals that existing deep learning mechanism design methods (RegretNet, etc.) systematically underestimate actual regret by orders of magnitude. Derives lower bounds and proposes improved estimation.

entry.title: Deep Learning Approaches to Quantum Error Mitigation

author.name: Leonardo Placidi, Ifan Williams, Enrico Rinaldi, Daniel Mills, Cristina C\^irstoiu, Vanya Eccles, Ross Duncan

entry.summary: Systematic investigation of deep learning for quantum error mitigation comparing architectures from FCNs to transformers. Attention-based models best on IBM QPU data up to 5 qubits.

entry.title: DoPE: Decoy Oriented Perturbation Encapsulation Human-Readable, AI-Hostile Documents for Academic Integrity

author.name: Ashish Raj Shekhar, Shiven Agarwal, Priyanuj Bordoloi, Yash Shah, Tejas Anvekar, Vivek Gupta

entry.summary: DoPE embeds semantic decoys into PDF/HTML assessments to confuse MLLMs attempting to automatically solve exams, providing both prevention and detection of AI-assisted cheating.

entry.title: Arab Voices: Mapping Standard and Dialectal Arabic Speech Technology

author.name: Peter Sullivan, AbdelRahim Elmadany, Alcides Alcoba Inciarte, Muhammad Abdul-Mageed

entry.summary: Arab Voices provides standardized framework for dialectal Arabic ASR with unified access to 39 test sets and analysis of linguistic 'dialectness' and audio quality.

entry.title: Dr. Assistant: Enhancing Clinical Diagnostic Inquiry via Structured Diagnostic Reasoning Data and Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yue Guo, Fanfu Wang, Jianwei Lv, Xincheng Shi, Yuchen Li, Youya Wang, Yunsheng Zeng, Yujing Liu, Yunhao Qiao, Gen Li, Junfeng Wang, Bo Yuan

entry.summary: Dr. Assistant proposes Clinical Diagnostic Reasoning Data structure and pipeline for training diagnostic models with reasoning and inquiry capabilities using RL.

entry.title: The Stability Trap: Evaluating the Reliability of LLM-Based Instruction Adherence Auditing

author.name: Murtuza N. Shergadwala

entry.summary: Studies reliability of LLM-as-Judge approaches for auditing GenAI instruction adherence in regulated sectors like HR. Introduces Scoped Instruction Decomposition Framework to classify instructions as Objective vs Subjective to isolate instability factors.

entry.title: studentSplat: Your Student Model Learns Single-view 3D Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Yimu Pan, Hongda Mao, Qingshuang Chen, Yelin Kim

entry.summary: studentSplat enables single-view 3D Gaussian splatting scene reconstruction using teacher-student architecture where multi-view teacher provides geometric supervision and extrapolation network completes views.

entry.title: Nip Rumors in the Bud: Retrieval-Guided Topic-Level Adaptation for Test-Time Fake News Video Detection

author.name: Jian Lang, Rongpei Hong, Ting Zhong, Yong Wang, Fan Zhou

entry.summary: RADAR enables test-time adaptation for fake news video detection on unseen topics using entropy selection-based retrieval to guide adaptation with stable, low-entropy reference videos.

entry.title: SDiT: Semantic Region-Adaptive for Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Bowen Lin, Fanjiang Ye, Yihua Liu, Zhenghui Guo, Boyuan Zhang, Weijian Zheng, Yufan Xu, Tiancheng Xing, Yuke Wang, Chengming Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes SDiT, a training-free framework that allocates computation adaptively for Diffusion Transformers based on regional complexity, observing that backgrounds converge faster than edges/textures. Uses semantic-aware clustering and complexity-driven scheduling.

entry.title: Histopath-C: Towards Realistic Domain Shifts for Histopathology Vision-Language Adaptation

author.name: Mehrdad Noori, Gustavo Adolfo Vargas Hakim, David Osowiechi, Fereshteh Shakeri, Ali Bahri, Moslem Yazdanpanah, Sahar Dastani, Ismail Ben Ayed, Christian Desrosiers

entry.summary: Introduces Histopath-C benchmark with realistic synthetic corruptions mimicking real-world distribution shifts in digital histopathology, and proposes LATTE for test-time adaptation under these corruptions.

entry.title: Generalizable and Animatable 3D Full-Head Gaussian Avatar from a Single Image

author.name: Shuling Zhao, Dan Xu

entry.summary: Proposes framework for one-shot 3D full-head animatable avatar reconstruction with Gaussian primitives in UV space, enabling real-time animation and 360° rendering from a single image.

entry.title: Patient-Conditioned Adaptive Offsets for Reliable Diagnosis across Subgroups

author.name: Gelei Xu, Yuying Duan, Jun Xia, Ruining Deng, Wei Jin, Yiyu Shi

entry.summary: Introduces HyperAdapt for patient-conditioned adaptation in medical diagnosis, arguing against suppressing sensitive attributes and instead incorporating patient context for subgroup-aware predictions.

entry.title: Deep Learning for Semantic Segmentation of 3D Ultrasound Data

author.name: Chenyu Liu, Marco Cecotti, Harikrishnan Vijayakumar, Patrick Robinson, James Barson, Mihai Caleap

entry.summary: Proposes a 3D U-Net framework for semantic segmentation using novel solid-state 3D ultrasound sensors (Calyo Pulse) for autonomous vehicles, offering an alternative to LiDAR in harsh conditions. First work exploring learning-based perception with this sensing modality.

entry.title: Learning Fine-Grained Correspondence with Cross-Perspective Perception for Open-Vocabulary 6D Object Pose Estimation

author.name: Yu Qin, Shimeng Fan, Fan Yang, Zixuan Xue, Zijie Mai, Wenrui Chen, Kailun Yang, Zhiyong Li

entry.summary: Proposes FiCoP for open-vocabulary 6D pose estimation using patch-level correspondence instead of global matching. Addresses ambiguity from background distractors in open-world robotics scenarios.

entry.title: Likelihood-Separable Diffusion Inference for Multi-Image MRI Super-Resolution

author.name: Samuel W. Remedios, Zhangxing Bian, Shuwen Wei, Aaron Carass, Jerry L. Prince, Blake E. Dewey

entry.summary: Generalizes diffusion-based inverse problem solvers for multi-image super-resolution MRI by extending single-image methods. Shows multi-slice combination improves over single-slice approaches.

entry.title: Interp3D: Correspondence-aware Interpolation for Generative Textured 3D Morphing

author.name: Xiaolu Liu, Yicong Li, Qiyuan He, Jiayin Zhu, Wei Ji, Angela Yao, Jianke Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes Interp3D for textured 3D morphing with correspondence-aware interpolation preserving geometric consistency and texture alignment during transitions between 3D assets.

entry.title: LLM-VLM Fusion Framework for Autonomous Maritime Port Inspection using a Heterogeneous UAV-USV System

author.name: Muhayy Ud Din, Waseem Akram, Ahsan B. Bakht, Irfan Hussain

entry.summary: Introduces framework combining LLMs and VLMs for autonomous maritime port inspection using cooperative UAV-USV systems. Replaces state-machine planners with LLM-driven symbolic planning.

entry.title: Deep learning as program synthesis

author.name: Zach Furman

entry.summary: Proposes that deep learning succeeds because it performs tractable program synthesis, searching for short programs explaining data. Synthesizes ideas from multiple research communities.

entry.title: DSAEval: Evaluating Data Science Agents on a Wide Range of Real-World Data Science Problems

author.name: Maojun Sun, Yifei Xie, Yue Wu, Ruijian Han, Binyan Jiang, Defeng Sun, Yancheng Yuan, Jian Huang

entry.summary: Introduces DSAEval, a benchmark of 641 real-world data science problems across 285 datasets, featuring multimodal perception, multi-query interactions, and verifiable evaluation for assessing LLM-based data science agents.

entry.title: Plan, Verify and Fill: A Structured Parallel Decoding Approach for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Miao Li, Hanyang Jiang, Sikai Chen, Hengyu Fu, Yuhang Cai, Baihe Huang, Tinghan Ye, Xuanzhou Chen, Pascal Van Hentenryck

entry.summary: Plan-Verify-Fill is training-free parallel decoding for diffusion language models using hierarchical skeleton construction with semantic anchors and verification-based stopping.

entry.title: Do MLLMs See What We See? Analyzing Visualization Literacy Barriers in AI Systems

author.name: Mengli (Dawn), Duan (Sissi), Yuhe (Sissi), Jiang, Matthew Varona, Carolina Nobre

entry.summary: First systematic analysis of visualization literacy barriers in MLLMs using reVLAT benchmark. Identifies machine-specific failure modes showing models struggle with color-intensive and segment-based visualizations.

entry.title: Fairness or Fluency? An Investigation into Language Bias of Pairwise LLM-as-a-Judge

author.name: Xiaolin Zhou, Zheng Luo, Yicheng Gao, Qixuan Chen, Xiyang Hu, Yue Zhao, Ruishan Liu

entry.summary: Studies language bias in pairwise LLM-as-judge evaluations, examining both same-language performance disparities and cross-language preferences. Finds systematic biases affecting fairness.

entry.title: Mitigating Cultural Bias in LLMs via Multi-Agent Cultural Debate

author.name: Qian Tan, Lei Jiang, Yuting Zeng, Shuoyang Ding, Xiaohua Xu

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-Agent Vote (MAV) framework for mitigating cultural bias in LLMs through multi-agent debate, introducing CEBiasBench Chinese-English bilingual benchmark.

entry.title: Recursive Meta-Distillation: An Axiomatic Framework for Iterative Knowledge Refinement

author.name: Aaron R. Flouro, Shawn P. Chadwick

entry.summary: Introduces axiomatic framework for recursive meta-distillation, formalizing iterative knowledge distillation as sequence of probability-distribution operators. Proves existence of non-trivial operator families satisfying structural axioms.

entry.title: Don't Start Over: A Cost-Effective Framework for Migrating Personalized Prompts Between LLMs

author.name: Ziyi Zhao, Chongming Gao, Yang Zhang, Haoyan Liu, Weinan Gan, Huifeng Guo, Yong Liu, Fuli Feng

entry.summary: PUMA enables efficient migration of personalized soft prompts between model versions without full retraining, achieving up to 98% cost reduction. Uses parameter-efficient adapters and group-based user selection.

entry.title: Pardon? Evaluating Conversational Repair in Large Audio-Language Models

author.name: Shuanghong Huang, Jinlei Xu, Youchao Zhou, Yanghao Zhou, Xuan Zhao, Chong Feng, Wenxuan Zhang

entry.summary: Evaluates Large Audio-Language Models on conversational repair, distinguishing between answerable and unanswerable audio inputs using semantic-acoustic masking protocol.

entry.title: Automatic Prompt Optimization for Dataset-Level Feature Discovery

author.name: Adrian Cosma, Oleg Szehr, David Kletz, Alessandro Antonucci, Olivier Pelletier

entry.summary: Multi-agent prompt optimization framework for dataset-level feature discovery, where agents propose definitions, extract values, and evaluate quality using downstream performance feedback.

entry.title: From Spurious to Causal: Low-rank Orthogonal Subspace Intervention for Generalizable Face Forgery Detection

author.name: Chi Wang, Xinjue Hu, Boyu Wang, Ziwen He, Zhangjie Fu

entry.summary: Addresses face forgery detection generalization through low-rank orthogonal subspace intervention to remove spurious correlations without identifying specific confounders.

entry.title: DIAMOND-SSS: Diffusion-Augmented Multi-View Optimization for Data-efficient SubSurface Scattering

author.name: Guillermo Figueroa-Araneda, Iris Diana Jimenez, Florian Hofherr, Manny Ko, Hector Andrade-Loarca, Daniel Cremers

entry.summary: DIAMOND-SSS achieves high-fidelity translucent material reconstruction (SSS) from as few as 10 images using fine-tuned diffusion models for novel-view synthesis and relighting.

entry.title: VIRTUE: Versatile Video Retrieval Through Unified Embeddings

author.name: Shaunak Halbe, Bhagyashree Puranik, Jayakrishnan Unnikrishnan, Kushan Thakkar, Vimal Bhat, Toufiq Parag

entry.summary: VIRTUE unifies corpus-level retrieval, moment localization, and composed multimodal queries in MLLM-based video retrieval using contrastive learning.

entry.title: DIS2: Disentanglement Meets Distillation with Classwise Attention for Robust Remote Sensing Segmentation under Missing Modalities

author.name: Nhi Kieu, Kien Nguyen, Arnold Wiliem, Clinton Fookes, Sridha Sridharan

entry.summary: Introduces DIS2 framework combining disentanglement and distillation with classwise attention for robust remote sensing segmentation when modalities are missing. Addresses heterogeneity and scale variation unique to RS data.

entry.title: MVGD-Net: A Novel Motion-aware Video Glass Surface Detection Network

author.name: Yiwei Lu, Hao Huang, Tao Yan

entry.summary: Proposes MVGD-Net for video glass surface detection based on observation that reflected objects appear to move slower than objects at same spatial plane, creating motion inconsistency revealing glass presence.

entry.title: Fine-Grained Zero-Shot Composed Image Retrieval with Complementary Visual-Semantic Integration

author.name: Yongcong Ye, Kai Zhang, Yanghai Zhang, Enhong Chen, Longfei Li, Jun Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes fine-grained zero-shot composed image retrieval method integrating complementary visual-semantic information, addressing limitations of existing methods in capturing fine-grained changes.

entry.title: Accurate Simulation Pipeline for Passive Single-Photon Imaging

author.name: Aleksi Suonsivu, Lauri Salmela, Leevi Uosukainen, Edoardo Peretti, Radu Ciprian Bilcu, Giacomo Boracchi

entry.summary: Presents comprehensive SPAD simulation pipeline validated with multiple commercial sensors. Addresses data scarcity limiting SPAD-specific algorithm development and learning-based solutions.

entry.title: TIDE: A Trace-Informed Depth-First Exploration for Planning with Temporally Extended Goals

author.name: Yuliia Suprun, Khen Elimelech, Lydia E. Kavraki, Moshe Y. Vardi

entry.summary: TIDE decomposes temporal planning problems into subgoals using trace information for depth-first exploration, providing informed heuristics for LTLf task planning.

entry.title: Actionable Advice from Reviews via Mixture of LoRA Experts: A Two-LLM Pipeline for Issue Extraction and Business Recommendations

author.name: Kartikey Singh Bhandari, Manav Ganesh, Yashwant Viswanathan, Archit Agrawal, Dhruv Kumar, Pratik Narang

entry.summary: Two-LLM framework for review-to-action generation using Mixture of LoRA experts. Issue model extracts problems, Advice model generates fixes with specialized adapters and gating.

entry.title: SpatialBench-UC: Uncertainty-Aware Evaluation of Spatial Prompt Following in Text-to-Image Generation

author.name: Amine Rostane

entry.summary: SpatialBench-UC is uncertainty-aware benchmark for spatial relations in text-to-image with 200 prompts in counterfactual pairs. Treats evaluation as selective prediction with risk-coverage tradeoff.

entry.title: LifeAgentBench: A Multi-dimensional Benchmark and Agent for Personal Health Assistants in Digital Health

author.name: Ye Tian, Zihao Wang, Onat Gungor, Xiaoran Fan, Tajana Rosing

entry.summary: Presents LifeAgentBench, a large-scale benchmark with 22,573 questions for evaluating LLM health assistants on long-horizon, cross-dimensional lifestyle reasoning across multiple users.

entry.title: Neural Isomorphic Fields: A Transformer-based Algebraic Numerical Embedding

author.name: Hamidreza Sadeghi, Saeedeh Momtazi, Reza Safabakhsh

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Isomorphic Fields - fixed-length number embeddings preserving algebraic operations (addition, multiplication, comparison) within rational numbers field.

entry.title: Aligning Agentic World Models via Knowledgeable Experience Learning

author.name: Baochang Ren, Yunzhi Yao, Rui Sun, Shuofei Qiao, Ningyu Zhang, Huajun Chen

entry.summary: Addresses physical hallucinations in LLM agents where plans are logically sound but physically unexecutable. Proposes knowledgeable experience learning to align agentic world models without costly retraining.

entry.title: Diffusion In Diffusion: Breaking the Autoregressive Bottleneck in Block Diffusion Models

author.name: Linrui Ma, Yufei Cui, Kai Han, Yunhe Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Diffusion in Diffusion, a draft-then-refine framework addressing irreversibility and myopia in block diffusion language models. Uses small-block drafting followed by global bidirectional refinement.

entry.title: Confident Rankings with Fewer Items: Adaptive LLM Evaluation with Continuous Scores

author.name: Esma Balk{\i}r, Alice Pernthaller, Marco Basaldella, Jos\'e Hern\'andez-Orallo, Nigel Collier

entry.summary: Extends IRT-based adaptive testing to continuous bounded scores (ROUGE, BLEU, LLM-as-Judge) for more efficient LLM evaluation, introducing uncertainty-aware ranking with adaptive stopping criteria.

entry.title: DermaBench: A Clinician-Annotated Benchmark Dataset for Dermatology Visual Question Answering and Reasoning

author.name: Abdurrahim Yilmaz, Ozan Erdem, Ece Gokyayla, Ayda Acar, Burc Bugra Dagtas, Dilara Ilhan Erdil, Gulsum Gencoglan, Burak Temelkuran

entry.summary: DermaBench introduces a clinician-annotated dermatology VQA benchmark built on diverse skin images, enabling evaluation of visual understanding, reasoning, and clinical description generation capabilities.

entry.title: MixFlow: Mixture-Conditioned Flow Matching for Out-of-Distribution Generalization

author.name: Andrea Rubbi, Amir Akbarnejad, Mohammad Vali Sanian, Aryan Yazdan Parast, Hesam Asadollahzadeh, Arian Amani, Naveed Akhtar, Sarah Cooper, Andrew Bassett, Pietro Li\`o, Lassi Paavolainen, Sattar Vakili, Mo Lotfollahi

entry.summary: MixFlow introduces a conditional flow-matching framework with mixture-conditioned base distribution for improved out-of-distribution generalization in conditional generation.

entry.title: Learning to Factorize and Adapt: A Versatile Approach Toward Universal Spatio-Temporal Foundation Models

author.name: Siru Zhong, Junjie Qiu, Yangyu Wu, Yiqiu Liu, Yuanpeng He, Zhongwen Rao, Bin Yang, Chenjuan Guo, Hao Xu, Yuxuan Liang

entry.summary: FactoST-v2 presents enhanced factorized spatio-temporal foundation model decoupling universal temporal learning from domain-specific spatial adaptation, enabling full weight transfer.

entry.title: Distribution Shift Is Key to Learning Invariant Prediction

author.name: Hong Zheng, Fei Teng

entry.summary: Investigates why ERM sometimes outperforms OOD-specific methods, finding that distribution shift across training domains is key. Larger shift leads to better invariant prediction learning even with ERM.

entry.title: Fisher-Informed Parameterwise Aggregation for Federated Learning with Heterogeneous Data

author.name: Zhipeng Chang, Ting He, Wenrui Hao

entry.summary: Proposes Fisher-Informed Parameterwise Aggregation (FIPA) for federated learning, replacing client-level scalar weights with parameter-specific Fisher Information Matrix weights for true parameter-level scaling.

entry.title: De-Anonymization at Scale via Tournament-Style Attribution

author.name: Lirui Zhang, Huishuai Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes De-Anonymization at Scale (DAS) method using LLMs for authorship attribution among tens of thousands of candidates via tournament-style sequential selection, demonstrating privacy risks in settings like peer review.

entry.title: Confidence over Time: Confidence Calibration with Temporal Logic for Large Language Model Reasoning

author.name: Zhenjiang Mao, Anirudhh Venkat, Artem Bisliouk, Akshat Kothiyal, Sindhura Kumbakonam Subramanian, Saithej Singhu, Ivan Ruchkin

entry.summary: Uses Signal Temporal Logic (STL) to characterize stepwise confidence signals in LLM multi-step reasoning. Discovers temporal formulas distinguishing confident correct from confident wrong answers.

entry.title: Group-Invariant Unsupervised Skill Discovery: Symmetry-aware Skill Representations for Generalizable Behavior

author.name: Junwoo Chang, Joseph Park, Roberto Horowitz, Jongmin Lee, Jongeun Choi

entry.summary: Introduces GISD (Group-Invariant Skill Discovery) framework embedding group structure into unsupervised skill discovery. Proves optimal solution requires equivariant policy and invariant scoring function.

entry.title: Beyond Known Facts: Generating Unseen Temporal Knowledge to Address Data Contamination in LLM Evaluation

author.name: Arthur Amalvy, Hen-Hsen Huang

entry.summary: Addresses data contamination in temporal knowledge graph extraction by generating unseen temporal facts for evaluation, avoiding overlap with LLM pretraining data.

entry.title: GerAV: Towards New Heights in German Authorship Verification using Fine-Tuned LLMs on a New Benchmark

author.name: Lotta Kiefer, Christoph Leiter, Sotaro Takeshita, Elena Schmidt, Steffen Eger

entry.summary: GerAV is a comprehensive German authorship verification benchmark with 600k+ labeled pairs from Twitter and Reddit, enabling controlled analysis of domain and text length effects.

entry.title: RAGExplorer: A Visual Analytics System for the Comparative Diagnosis of RAG Systems

author.name: Haoyu Tian, Yingchaojie Feng, Zhen Wen, Haoxuan Li, Minfeng Zhu, Wei Chen

entry.summary: RAGExplorer provides visual analytics for systematic comparison and diagnosis of RAG configurations, enabling macro-to-micro analysis of how different components (embedding models, retrieval algorithms) affect performance.

entry.title: Digital FAST: An AI-Driven Multimodal Framework for Rapid and Early Stroke Screening

author.name: Ngoc-Khai Hoang, Thi-Nhu-Mai Nguyen, Huy-Hieu Pham

entry.summary: Digital FAST framework for stroke screening combining facial landmark dynamics (Transformer), speech mel spectrograms (Audio Spectrogram Transformer), and upper-body pose analysis.

entry.title: Inverse Rendering for High-Genus 3D Surface Meshes from Multi-view Images with Persistent Homology Priors

author.name: Xiang Gao, Xinmu Wang, Yuanpeng Liu, Yue Wang, Junqi Huang, Wei Chen, Xianfeng Gu

entry.summary: Uses persistent homology priors (tunnel/handle loops) as topological constraints for inverse rendering of high-genus 3D surfaces from multi-view images.

entry.title: A Hierarchical Benchmark of Foundation Models for Dermatology

author.name: Furkan Yuceyalcin, Abdurrahim Yilmaz, Burak Temelkuran

entry.summary: Evaluates embeddings from ten foundation models for hierarchical skin lesion classification on DERM12345 dataset, addressing the limitation of current benchmarks that reduce diagnosis to binary classification.

entry.title: Video Individual Counting and Tracking from Moving Drones: A Benchmark and Methods

author.name: Yaowu Fan, Jia Wan, Tao Han, Andy J. Ma, Antoni B. Chan

entry.summary: Introduces MovingDroneCrowd++, the largest video-level dataset for dense crowd counting and tracking from moving drones, covering diverse conditions with varying altitudes, angles, and illumination.

entry.title: Moaw: Unleashing Motion Awareness for Video Diffusion Models

author.name: Tianqi Zhang, Ziyi Wang, Wenzhao Zheng, Weiliang Chen, Yuanhui Huang, Zhengyang Huang, Jie Zhou, Jiwen Lu

entry.summary: Proposes Moaw framework to unleash motion awareness in video diffusion models through supervised training for dense tracking, then leverages this for motion transfer applications.

entry.title: CSGaussian: Progressive Rate-Distortion Compression and Segmentation for 3D Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Yu-Jen Tseng, Chia-Hao Kao, Jing-Zhong Chen, Alessandro Gnutti, Shao-Yuan Lo, Yen-Yu Lin, Wen-Hsiao Peng

entry.summary: Presents CSGaussian, first unified framework for rate-distortion-optimized compression and segmentation of 3D Gaussian Splatting using implicit neural representation-based hyperprior.

entry.title: AsyncBEV: Cross-modal Flow Alignment in Asynchronous 3D Object Detection

author.name: Shiming Wang, Holger Caesar, Liangliang Nan, Julian F. P. Kooij

entry.summary: Proposes AsyncBEV, a trainable lightweight module to improve robustness of 3D BEV object detection against sensor asynchrony caused by different frequencies, latency, or hardware failures.

entry.title: Leveraging Transformer Decoder for Automotive Radar Object Detection

author.name: Changxu Zhang, Zhaoze Wang, Tai Fei, Christopher Grimm, Yi Jin, Claas Tebruegge, Ernst Warsitz, Markus Gardill

entry.summary: Presents Transformer-based 3D radar object detection using novel Pyramid Token Fusion module to convert feature pyramids into scale-aware token sequences. Eliminates dense proposal generation and heuristic post-processing.

entry.title: Equivariant Learning for Unsupervised Image Dehazing

author.name: Zhang Wen, Jiangwei Xie, Dongdong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes EID, an unsupervised image dehazing framework exploiting symmetry through equivariance constraints. Recovers clear images from hazy observations without paired training data using adversarial learning.

entry.title: Progressive self-supervised blind-spot denoising method for LDCT denoising

author.name: Yichao Liu, Yueyang Teng, Junwen Guo

entry.summary: Proposes progressive self-supervised blind-spot denoising for low-dose CT using step-wise mechanism enforcing conditional independence and Gaussian noise regularization to prevent overfitting.

entry.title: DALD-PCAC: Density-Adaptive Learning Descriptor for Point Cloud Lossless Attribute Compression

author.name: Chunyang Fu, Ge Li, Wei Gao, Shiqi Wang, Zhu Li, Shan Liu

entry.summary: Develops DALD-PCAC for lossless point cloud attribute compression using Density-Adaptive Learning Descriptor with permutation-invariant Transformer for context modeling across varying densities.

entry.title: Contact-Aware Neural Dynamics

author.name: Changwei Jing, Jai Krishna Bandi, Jianglong Ye, Yan Duan, Pieter Abbeel, Xiaolong Wang, Sha Yi

entry.summary: Contact-Aware Neural Dynamics learns to align simulator dynamics with real-world contact using tactile information. Treats simulator as prior and refines with neural model.

entry.title: Hindsight Preference Replay Improves Preference-Conditioned Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jonaid Shianifar, Michael Schukat, Karl Mason

entry.summary: Introduces Hindsight Preference Replay for multi-objective RL, a simple augmentation that relabels stored transitions with alternative preferences to densify supervision across preference space.

entry.title: Proc3D: Procedural 3D Generation and Parametric Editing of 3D Shapes with Large Language Models

author.name: Fadlullah Raji, Stefano Petrangeli, Matheus Gadelha, Yu Shen, Uttaran Bhattacharya, Gang Wu

entry.summary: Proc3D generates editable 3D models using procedural compact graphs that encode algorithmic rules, enabling real-time LLM-driven modifications through exposed parameters.

entry.title: SciHorizon-GENE: Benchmarking LLM for Life Sciences Inference from Gene Knowledge to Functional Understanding

author.name: Xiaohan Huang, Meng Xiao, Chuan Qin, Qingqing Long, Jinmiao Chen, Yuanchun Zhou, Hengshu Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces SciHorizon-GENE, a large-scale gene-centric benchmark with 540K+ questions covering 190K+ human genes for evaluating LLM reasoning from gene knowledge to functional understanding.

entry.title: CauScientist: Teaching LLMs to Respect Data for Causal Discovery

author.name: Bo Peng, Sirui Chen, Lei Xu, Chaochao Lu

entry.summary: Proposes CauScientist, a framework combining LLMs as hypothesis generators with statistical verification for causal discovery. Uses hybrid initialization and error memory to prevent repeated mistakes.

entry.title: Legal experts disagree with rationale extraction techniques for explaining ECtHR case outcome classification

author.name: Mahammad Namazov, Tom\'a\v{s} Koref, Ivan Habernal

entry.summary: Evaluates rationale extraction techniques for explaining European Court of Human Rights case predictions, finding that legal experts significantly disagree with automated explanations.

entry.title: Bridging the Knowledge-Action Gap by Evaluating LLMs in Dynamic Dental Clinical Scenarios

author.name: Hongyang Ma, Tiantian Gu, Huaiyuan Sun, Huilin Zhu, Yongxin Wang, Jie Li, Wubin Sun, Zeliang Lian, Yinghong Zhou, Yi Gao, Shirui Wang, Zhihui Tang

entry.summary: SCMPE benchmark evaluates LLMs in dynamic dental clinical scenarios, revealing that models perform well on static tasks but struggle with multi-turn patient interactions.

entry.title: Now You See Me, Now You Don't: A Unified Framework for Expression Consistent Anonymization in Talking Head Videos

author.name: Anil Egin, Andrea Tangherloni, Antitza Dantcheva

entry.summary: Anon-NET de-identifies facial videos using diffusion-based inpainting with expression transfer, preserving age, gender, race, pose and expression while enabling downstream analysis like expression recognition.

entry.title: AVIR: Adaptive Visual In-Document Retrieval for Efficient Multi-Page Document Question Answering

author.name: Zongmin Li, Yachuan Li, Lei Kang, Dimosthenis Karatzas, Wenkang Ma

entry.summary: AVIR framework for multi-page document VQA using adaptive visual retrieval with score-based clustering to select relevant pages, addressing attention effectiveness in long documents.

entry.title: Learning Stochastic Bridges for Video Object Removal via Video-to-Video Translation

author.name: Zijie Lou, Xiangwei Feng, Jiaxin Wang, Xiaochao Qu, Luoqi Liu, Ting Liu

entry.summary: Reformulates video object removal as video-to-video translation via stochastic bridge model establishing direct path from source to target rather than noise-initialized generation.

entry.title: On the Role of Rotation Equivariance in Monocular 3D Human Pose Estimation

author.name: Pavlo Melnyk, Cuong Le, Urs Waldmann, Per-Erik Forss\'en, Bastian Wandt

entry.summary: Investigates rotation equivariance in monocular 3D human pose estimation, finding common lifting models fail on rotated inputs. Proposes rotation-equivariant lifting approach reducing data requirements.

entry.title: DeepRAHT: Learning Predictive RAHT for Point Cloud Attribute Compression

author.name: Chunyang Fu, Tai Qin, Shiqi Wang, Zhu Li

entry.summary: Proposes DeepRAHT, end-to-end RAHT framework for lossy point cloud attribute compression based on sparse tensors with learning-based prediction model and variable-rate coding.

entry.title: A Mind Cannot Be Smeared Across Time

author.name: Michael Timothy Bennett

entry.summary: Argues that machine consciousness depends on when computations occur, not just what is computed. Proves formally that existential temporal realization doesn't preserve conjunction - systems can have all 'ingredients' of experience across time without ever instantiating unified experience.

entry.title: A self-evolving multi-role collaborative framework with fine-grained difficulty guidance for innovative mathematical problem generation

author.name: Yifei Sun, Yongan Li, A. K. Qin, Sicheng Hou, Tamas Pflanzner

entry.summary: Multi-role collaborative framework for generating innovative math problems with fine-grained difficulty control. Uses sampler, generator, evaluator, state machine, and memory components.

entry.title: Beyond Human Annotation: Recent Advances in Data Generation Methods for Document Intelligence

author.name: Dehao Ying, Fengchang Yu, Haihua Chen, Changjiang Jiang, Yurong Li, Wei Lu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey establishing first technical map for data generation in Document Intelligence, organizing methods by data/label availability into four paradigms.

entry.title: Large Language Model for OWL Proofs

author.name: Hui Yang, Jiaoyan Chen, Uli Sattler

entry.summary: Develops framework for LLM proof generation in OWL ontologies with automated dataset construction and evaluation across extraction, simplification, and explanation tasks.

entry.title: How Clinicians Think and What AI Can Learn From It

author.name: Dipayan Sengupta, Saumya Panda

entry.summary: Argues clinical AI should model ordinal, non-compensatory decision-making using fast-and-frugal heuristics rather than cardinal optimization. Provides normative rationale for lexicographic clinical reasoning.

entry.title: Logic-Guided Multistage Inference for Explainable Multidefendant Judgment Prediction

author.name: Xu Zhang, Qinghua Wang, Mengyang Zhao, Fang Wang, Cunquan Qu

entry.summary: Logic-guided framework for multidefendant judgment prediction using oriented masking to clarify defendant roles and comparative data construction for culpability distinction.

entry.title: ChatAD: Reasoning-Enhanced Time-Series Anomaly Detection with Multi-Turn Instruction Evolution

author.name: Hui Sun, Chang Xu, Haonan Xie, Hao Li, Yuhao Huang, Chuheng Zhang, Ming Jin, Xiaoguang Liu, Gang Wang, Jiang Bian

entry.summary: Presents ChatAD, a multi-agent system for LLM-driven time-series anomaly detection with multi-turn reasoning capabilities. Introduces TSEvol algorithm, TSEData-20K dataset, and LLADBench benchmark for evaluation.

entry.title: Look-Ahead-Bench: a Standardized Benchmark of Look-ahead Bias in Point-in-Time LLMs for Finance

author.name: Mostapha Benhenda (LAGA)

entry.summary: Introduces Look-Ahead-Bench for measuring temporal look-ahead bias in Point-in-Time LLMs for finance. Evaluates Llama 3.1 and DeepSeek 3.2 in practical financial workflows to distinguish prediction from memorization.

entry.title: Large Language Model Agent for User-friendly Chemical Process Simulations

author.name: Jingkang Liang, Niklas Groll, G\"urkan Sin

entry.summary: Integrates LLM agent with AVEVA Process Simulation via Model Context Protocol, enabling natural language interaction with rigorous chemical process simulations.

entry.title: Generating metamers of human scene understanding

author.name: Ritik Raina, Abe Leite, Alexandros Graikos, Seoyoung Ahn, Dimitris Samaras, Gregory J. Zelinsky

entry.summary: Introduces MetamerGen, a latent diffusion model that generates image metamers matching human scene understanding by combining peripheral gist information with foveated fixation data. Creates a novel dual-stream representation for foveated image synthesis.

entry.title: PASTA: A Scalable Framework for Multi-Policy AI Compliance Evaluation

author.name: Yu Yang, Ig-Jae Kim, Dongwook Yoon

entry.summary: PASTA provides scalable multi-policy AI compliance evaluation with comprehensive model-card format, policy normalization, and LLM-powered pairwise evaluation engine generating compliance heatmaps.

entry.title: Utilizing Metadata for Better Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Raquib Bin Yousuf, Shengzhe Xu, Mandar Sharma, Andrew Neeser, Chris Latimer, Naren Ramakrishnan

entry.summary: Systematic study of metadata-aware retrieval strategies for RAG, comparing metadata-as-text, dual-encoder unified embedding, and other approaches on structured corpora like regulatory filings.

entry.title: Acting Flatterers via LLMs Sycophancy: Combating Clickbait with LLMs Opposing-Stance Reasoning

author.name: Chaowei Zhang, Xiansheng Luo, Zewei Zhang, Yi Zhu, Jipeng Qiang, Longwei Wang

entry.summary: SORG framework leverages LLM sycophancy behavior to generate contrastive reasoning from opposing perspectives for clickbait detection, turning a typical flaw into a feature.

entry.title: Constraint-Aware Neurosymbolic Uncertainty Quantification with Bayesian Deep Learning for Scientific Discovery

author.name: Shahnawaz Alam, Mohammed Mudassir Uddin, Mohammed Kaif Pasha

entry.summary: Introduces CANUF, a framework unifying Bayesian deep learning with differentiable symbolic reasoning for uncertainty quantification that respects domain constraints. Includes automated constraint extraction from scientific literature.

entry.title: Distilling Time Series Foundation Models for Efficient Forecasting

author.name: Yuqi Li, Kuiye Ding, Chuanguang Yang, Szu-Yu Chen, Yingli Tian

entry.summary: Presents DistilTS, the first distillation framework specifically designed for time series foundation models, addressing task difficulty discrepancy across forecasting horizons.

entry.title: PASs-MoE: Mitigating Misaligned Co-drift among Router and Experts via Pathway Activation Subspaces for Continual Learning

author.name: Zhiyan Hou, Haiyun Guo, Haokai Ma, Yandu Sun, Yonghui Yang, Jinqiao Wang

entry.summary: Introduces PASs-MoE to address 'Misaligned Co-drift' in LoRA-based Mixture-of-Experts for continual instruction tuning of MLLMs. Proposes pathway activation subspaces to maintain expert specialization and reduce forgetting.

entry.title: LLM-as-RNN: A Recurrent Language Model for Memory Updates and Sequence Prediction

author.name: Yuxing Lu, J. Ben Tamo, Weichen Zhao, Nan Sun, Yishan Zhong, Wenqi Shi, Jinzhuo Wang, May D. Wang

entry.summary: Proposes LLM-as-RNN, an inference-only framework turning frozen LLMs into recurrent predictors via natural-language memory states that update through feedback-driven text rewrites.

entry.title: The Hidden Toll of Social Media News: Causal Effects on Psychosocial Wellbeing

author.name: Olivia Pal, Agam Goyal, Eshwar Chandrasekharan, Koustuv Saha

entry.summary: Large-scale causal study on BlueSky (26M posts, 45M comments) examining psychosocial effects of news engagement. Shows trade-offs: increased anxiety/depression but decreased loneliness.

entry.title: Vulnerability of LLMs' Belief Systems? LLMs Belief Resistance Check Through Strategic Persuasive Conversation Interventions

author.name: Fan Huang, Haewoon Kwak, Jisun An

entry.summary: Systematic evaluation of LLM susceptibility to persuasion under SMCR framework across five models and three domains. Finds smaller models more susceptible, meta-cognition prompting has limited effect.

entry.title: Attention-space Contrastive Guidance for Efficient Hallucination Mitigation in LVLMs

author.name: Yujin Jo, Sangyoon Bae, Taesup Kim

entry.summary: Proposes ACG (Attention-space Contrastive Guidance), a single-pass mechanism for hallucination mitigation in LVLMs that constructs vision-language and language-only attention paths simultaneously.

entry.title: Insight: Interpretable Semantic Hierarchies in Vision-Language Encoders

author.name: Kai Wittenmayer, Sukrut Rao, Amin Parchami-Araghi, Bernt Schiele, Jonas Fischer

entry.summary: Insight proposes a language-aligned concept foundation model that provides fine-grained, human-interpretable concepts spatially grounded in images using hierarchical sparse autoencoders.

entry.title: torch-sla: Differentiable Sparse Linear Algebra with Adjoint Solvers and Sparse Tensor Parallelism for PyTorch

author.name: Mingyuan Chi

entry.summary: torch-sla provides GPU-accelerated, scalable, differentiable sparse linear algebra for PyTorch with adjoint-based differentiation, achieving 400M DOF linear solve on 3 GPUs.

entry.title: LLMOrbit: A Circular Taxonomy of Large Language Models -From Scaling Walls to Agentic AI Systems

author.name: Badri N. Patro, Vijay S. Agneeswaran

entry.summary: LLMOrbit provides a comprehensive circular taxonomy of LLMs from 2019-2025, examining 50+ models across 8 dimensions and identifying critical crises in data scarcity, cost growth, and energy consumption.

entry.title: Zero-shot adaptable task planning for autonomous construction robots: a comparative study of lightweight single and multi-AI agent systems

author.name: Hossein Naderi, Alireza Shojaei, Lifu Huang, Philip Agee, Kereshmeh Afsari, Abiola Akanmu

entry.summary: Explores foundation models for construction robot task planning, showing a four-agent team using lightweight open-source LLMs/VLMs outperforms GPT-4o on construction tasks.

entry.title: Verifying Physics-Informed Neural Network Fidelity using Classical Fisher Information from Differentiable Dynamical System

author.name: Josafat Ribeiro Leal Filho, Ant\^onio Augusto Fr\"ohlich

entry.summary: Proposes using classical Fisher information from differentiable dynamical systems to verify how well Physics-Informed Neural Networks capture complete system behavior beyond trajectory prediction.

entry.title: Shapelets-Enriched Selective Forecasting using Time Series Foundation Models

author.name: Shivani Tomar, Seshu Tirupathi, Elizabeth Daly, Ivana Dusparic

entry.summary: Proposes selective forecasting framework for time series foundation models using shapelets to identify critical segments where predictions may be unreliable.

entry.title: Why Loss Re-weighting Works If You Stop Early: Training Dynamics of Unconstrained Features

author.name: Yize Zhao, Christos Thrampoulidis

entry.summary: Analyzes why loss reweighting helps early in training but not at convergence in overparameterized DNNs, using a small-scale model to show vanilla ERM preferentially learns majority classes first.

entry.title: Orthogonium : A Unified, Efficient Library of Orthogonal and 1-Lipschitz Building Blocks

author.name: Thibaut Boissin (IRIT-MISFIT), Franck Mamalet (ANITI, IMT), Valentin Lafargue (ANITI, IMT), Mathieu Serrurier (IRIT-MISFIT)

entry.summary: Introduces Orthogonium, a unified PyTorch library for orthogonal and 1-Lipschitz layers supporting standard convolution features (strides, dilation, grouping) while maintaining mathematical guarantees.

entry.title: Mixture of Distributions Matters: Dynamic Sparse Attention for Efficient Video Diffusion Transformers

author.name: Yuxi Liu, Yipeng Hu, Zekun Zhang, Kunze Jiang, Kun Yuan

entry.summary: Introduces MOD-DiT, a sampling-free dynamic sparse attention method for video diffusion transformers that models attention sparsity as mixture of distributions, improving efficiency while maintaining generation quality.

entry.title: OFA-MAS: One-for-All Multi-Agent System Topology Design based on Mixture-of-Experts Graph Generative Models

author.name: Shiyuan Li, Yixin Liu, Yu Zheng, Mei Li, Quoc Viet Hung Nguyen, Shirui Pan

entry.summary: Proposes OFA-TAD, a one-for-all framework using Mixture-of-Experts graph generative models to design multi-agent system topologies that generalize across task domains. Addresses poor cross-domain generalization of existing MAS topology methods.

entry.title: Recurrent Confidence Chain: Temporal-Aware Uncertainty Quantification in Large Language Models

author.name: Zhenjiang Mao, Anirudhh Venkat

entry.summary: Proposes Recurrent Confidence Chain for temporal-aware uncertainty quantification in LLM reasoning, addressing issue of inflated overall confidence when early steps have low confidence.

entry.title: Towards Token-Level Text Anomaly Detection

author.name: Yang Cao, Bicheng Yu, Sikun Yang, Ming Liu, Yujiu Yang

entry.summary: Introduces token-level anomaly detection paradigm for text, enabling fine-grained localization of anomalies within documents. Creates three benchmark datasets for spam, reviews, and grammar errors.

entry.title: SecureSplit: Mitigating Backdoor Attacks in Split Learning

author.name: Zhihao Dou, Dongfei Cui, Weida Wang, Anjun Gao, Yueyang Quan, Mengyao Ma, Viet Vo, Guangdong Bai, Zhuqing Liu, Minghong Fang

entry.summary: Introduces SecureSplit defense against backdoor attacks in Split Learning using dimensionality transformation and adaptive majority-based filtering to separate benign from poisoned embeddings.

entry.title: PPA-Plan: Proactive Pitfall Avoidance for Reliable Planning in Long-Context LLM Reasoning

author.name: Byeongjin Kim, Gyuwan Kim, Seo Yeon Park

entry.summary: Proposes PPA-Plan, a proactive planning strategy for long-context LLM reasoning that prevents failures before plan generation by identifying potential logical pitfalls.

entry.title: CoReflect: Conversational Evaluation via Co-Evolutionary Simulation and Reflective Rubric Refinement

author.name: Yunzhe Li, Richie Yueqi Feng, Tianxin Wei, Chin-Chia Hsu

entry.summary: CoReflect unifies dialogue simulation and evaluation through iterative refinement, using a conversation planner and reflective analyzer to adaptively generate and assess multi-turn dialogues.

entry.title: Injecting Knowledge from Social Science Journals to Improve Indonesian Cultural Understanding by LLMs

author.name: Adimulya Kartiyasa, Bao Gia Cao, Boyang Li
