entry.summary: Injects Indonesian cultural knowledge from local social science journals into LLMs using RAG with LLM-generated hypothetical document queries.

entry.title: OptiSQL: Executable SQL Generation from Optical TokensOptiSQL: Executable SQL Generation from Optical Tokens

author.name: Sifan Li, Hongkai Chen, Yujun Cai, Liyang Chen, Qingwen Ye, Yiwei Wang

entry.summary: OptiSQL generates executable SQL directly from table images using optical tokens, achieving competitive performance with significantly reduced token overhead.

entry.title: Lightweight Prompt Biasing for Contextualized End-to-End ASR Systems

author.name: Bo Ren, Yu Shi, Jinyu Li

entry.summary: Introduces prompt-based biasing for end-to-end ASR to improve rare/domain-specific entity recognition using a unified multitask framework with entity filtering. Achieves 30.7% relative Entity WER reduction.

entry.title: Open Vocabulary Panoptic Segmentation With Retrieval Augmentation

author.name: Nafis Sadeq, Qingfeng Liu, Mostafa El-Khamy

entry.summary: RetCLIP improves open vocabulary panoptic segmentation by constructing a masked segment feature database from image-text pairs and using retrieval augmentation at inference to improve unseen class performance.

entry.title: SemAlign: Language Guided Semi-supervised Domain Generalization

author.name: Muditha Fernando, Kajhanan Kailainathan, Krishnakanth Nagaratnam, Isuranga Udaravi Bandara Senavirathne, Ranga Rodrigo

entry.summary: SemAlign addresses semi-supervised domain generalization by aligning features with Vision-Language Model embeddings to promote domain-invariance, emphasizing data utilization over pseudo-labeling accuracy.

entry.title: Structural Graph Neural Networks with Anatomical Priors for Explainable Chest X-ray Diagnosis

author.name: Khaled Berkani

entry.summary: Structural GNN framework for chest X-ray diagnosis using anatomical priors with custom spatial propagation modeling relative positions as part of reasoning.

entry.title: RCDN: Real-Centered Detection Network for Robust Face Forgery Identification

author.name: Wyatt McCurdy, Xin Zhang, Yuqi Song, Min Gao

entry.summary: RCDN anchors representation space around real face features for robust cross-domain face forgery detection using frequency-spatial CNN with Xception backbone.

entry.title: Concepts from Representations: Post-hoc Concept Bottleneck Models via Sparse Decomposition of Visual Representations

author.name: Shizhan Gong, Xiaofan Zhang, Qi Dou

entry.summary: Presents PCBM-ReD, a method to retrofit interpretability onto pretrained models by automatically extracting visual concepts through sparse decomposition, creating post-hoc concept bottleneck models without labor-intensive concept definitions.

entry.title: DCAC: Dynamic Class-Aware Cache Creates Stronger Out-of-Distribution Detectors

author.name: Yanqi Wu, Qichao Chen, Runhe Lai, Xinhua Lu, Jia-Xin Zhuang, Zhilin Zhao, Wei-Shi Zheng, Ruixuan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes DCAC, a training-free test-time calibration module for OOD detection that maintains class-specific caches to collect high-entropy samples and calibrate predictions, exploiting that OOD samples share visual similarity.

entry.title: KaoLRM: Repurposing Pre-trained Large Reconstruction Models for Parametric 3D Face Reconstruction

author.name: Qingtian Zhu, Xu Cao, Zhixiang Wang, Yinqiang Zheng, Takafumi Taketomi

entry.summary: Proposes KaoLRM to re-purpose Large Reconstruction Models for parametric 3D face reconstruction by incorporating FLAME-based 2D Gaussian Splatting into LRM's rendering pipeline.

entry.title: Spatial-VLN: Zero-Shot Vision-and-Language Navigation With Explicit Spatial Perception and Exploration

author.name: Lu Yue, Yue Fan, Shiwei Lian, Yu Zhao, Jiaxin Yu, Liang Xie, Feitian Zhang

entry.summary: Presents Spatial-VLN framework for zero-shot vision-and-language navigation with spatial perception enhancement module integrating panoramic filtering with door and region experts.

entry.title: Seeing Isn't Always Believing: Analysis of Grad-CAM Faithfulness and Localization Reliability in Lung Cancer CT Classification

author.name: Teerapong Panboonyuen

entry.summary: Critically investigates Grad-CAM faithfulness for lung cancer CT classification across five architectures, finding model-dependent variations in interpretability and questioning reliability of heatmap explanations.

entry.title: QASA: Quality-Guided K-Adaptive Slot Attention for Unsupervised Object-Centric Learning

author.name: Tianran Ouyang, Xingping Dong, Jing Zhang, Mang Ye, Jun Chen, Bo Du

entry.summary: Proposes QASA for unsupervised object-centric learning with quality-guided K-adaptive slot attention that explicitly constrains slot-binding quality and avoids conflicting optimization goals.

entry.title: CLIP-Guided Adaptable Self-Supervised Learning for Human-Centric Visual Tasks

author.name: Mingshuang Luo, Ruibing Hou, Bo Chao, Hong Chang, Zimo Liu, Yaowei Wang, Shiguang Shan

entry.summary: Proposes CLASP, using CLIP to generate multi-level semantic pseudo-labels for unsupervised pre-training in human-centric visual tasks, achieving good performance across diverse downstream tasks.

entry.title: ObjectVisA-120: Object-based Visual Attention Prediction in Interactive Street-crossing Environments

author.name: Igor Vozniak, Philipp Mueller, Nils Lipp, Janis Sprenger, Konstantin Poddubnyy, Davit Hovhannisyan, Christian Mueller, Andreas Bulling, Philipp Slusallek

entry.summary: Presents ObjectVisA-120, a 120-participant VR dataset for object-based visual attention prediction in street-crossing scenarios with complete state-space object representation.

entry.title: ConvMambaNet: A Hybrid CNN-Mamba State Space Architecture for Accurate and Real-Time EEG Seizure Detection

author.name: Md. Nishan Khan, Kazi Shahriar Sanjid, Md. Tanzim Hossain, Asib Mostakim Fony, Istiak Ahmed, M. Monir Uddin

entry.summary: Introduces ConvMambaNet, a hybrid architecture combining CNNs with Mamba State Space Models for EEG seizure detection, achieving 99% accuracy on CHB-MIT dataset. Demonstrates effective integration of spatial and long-range temporal dynamics for medical time-series analysis.

entry.title: Analyzing VLM-Based Approaches for Anomaly Classification and Segmentation

author.name: Mohit Kakda, Mirudula Shri Muthukumaran, Uttapreksha Patel, Lawrence Swaminathan Xavier Prince

entry.summary: Systematic analysis of CLIP-based approaches for anomaly classification and segmentation, investigating sliding window, multi-stage feature alignment, and vision-language adapter paradigms on industrial defect detection.

entry.title: ParkingTwin: Training-Free Streaming 3D Reconstruction for Parking-Lot Digital Twins

author.name: Xinhao Liu, Yu Wang, Xiansheng Guo, Gordon Owusu Boateng, Yu Cao, Haonan Si, Xingchen Guo, Nirwan Ansari

entry.summary: Proposes ParkingTwin, a training-free lightweight system for online streaming 3D reconstruction of parking lots using OpenStreetMap priors for geometry construction. Addresses edge-side constraints for automated valet parking.

entry.title: PMCE: Probabilistic Multi-Granularity Semantics with Caption-Guided Enhancement for Few-Shot Learning

author.name: Jiaying Wu, Can Gao, Jinglu Hu, Hui Li, Xiaofeng Cao, Jingcai Guo

entry.summary: Presents PMCE for few-shot learning using probabilistic multi-granularity semantics with CLIP-based knowledge bank and caption-guided enhancement for both support and query representations.

entry.title: Bridging Modalities: Joint Synthesis and Registration Framework for Aligning Diffusion MRI with T1-Weighted Images

author.name: Xiaofan Wang, Junyi Wang, Yuqian Chen, Lauren J. O' Donnell, Fan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes unsupervised framework for dMRI-T1w registration transforming multimodal registration into unimodal task through image synthesis, reducing cross-modal complexity.

entry.title: Learning Legged MPC with Smooth Neural Surrogates

author.name: Samuel A. Moore, Easop Lee, Boyuan Chen

entry.summary: Proposes smooth neural surrogates for MPC in legged robotics, addressing stiff transitions, non-physical nonsmoothness, and non-Gaussian errors from contact events using heavy-tailed loss.

entry.title: Against "If Anyone Builds It Everyone Dies"

author.name: Bentham's Bulldog

entry.summary: Bentham's Bulldog rebuts Yudkowsky and Soares' book arguing that instrumental convergence doesn't necessarily lead to human extinction, using evolution and human psychology as counterexamples.

entry.title: AdaFRUGAL: Adaptive Memory-Efficient Training with Dynamic Control

author.name: Quang-Hung Bui, Anh Son Ta

entry.summary: Introduces AdaFRUGAL, which automates hyperparameter tuning for memory-efficient LLM training through adaptive subspace ratio decay and loss-aware update scheduling.

entry.title: SynQP: A Framework and Metrics for Evaluating the Quality and Privacy Risk of Synthetic Data

author.name: Bing Hu, Yixin Li, Asma Bahamyirou, Helen Chen

entry.summary: SynQP framework for benchmarking synthetic data privacy using simulated sensitive data, proposing new identity disclosure risk metric accounting for ML probabilistic nature.

entry.title: Soft Shadow Diffusion (SSD): Physics-inspired Learning for 3D Computational Periscopy

author.name: Fadlullah Raji, John Murray-Bruce

entry.summary: Soft Shadow Diffusion enables 3D non-line-of-sight reconstruction from ordinary photographs of shadows cast on visible walls using physics-inspired diffusion models.

entry.title: Primate-like perceptual decision making emerges through deep recurrent reinforcement learning

author.name: Nathan J. Wispinski, Scott A. Stone, Anthony Singhal, Patrick M. Pilarski, Craig S. Chapman

entry.summary: Shows that deep recurrent neural networks trained via reinforcement learning on perceptual discrimination tasks develop primate-like decision making abilities including speed-accuracy tradeoffs and flexible mind-changing.

entry.title: Beyond Accuracy: Characterizing Code Comprehension Capabilities in (Large) Language Models

author.name: Felix M\"achtle, Jan-Niclas Serr, Nils Loose, Thomas Eisenbarth

entry.summary: Introduces diagnostic framework for characterizing LLM code comprehension through binary input-output consistency tasks, finding model performance doesn't align with human-centric complexity metrics.

entry.title: Can LLMs Compress (and Decompress)? Evaluating Code Understanding and Execution via Invertibility

author.name: Nickil Maveli, Antonio Vergari, Shay B. Cohen

entry.summary: Presents RoundTripCodeEval (RTCE) benchmark with four code execution tasks testing round-trip consistency (encoding/decoding bijection fidelity). Evaluates Code-LLMs on maintaining consistent reasoning across forward and backward execution.

entry.title: Style Transfer as Bias Mitigation: Diffusion Models for Synthetic Mental Health Text for Arabic

author.name: Saad Mankarious, Aya Zirikly

entry.summary: Proposes a diffusion-based approach for synthetic text generation framing bias mitigation as style transfer, using male-to-female style transfer to augment underrepresented content in Arabic mental health corpus.

entry.title: AGGC: Adaptive Group Gradient Clipping for Stabilizing Large Language Model Training

author.name: Zhiyuan Li, Yuan Wu, Yi Chang

entry.summary: AGGC proposes adaptive group-wise gradient clipping for LLM training that partitions parameters by functional type and regulates each using EMA-based adaptive intervals.

entry.title: Learning Longitudinal Health Representations from EHR and Wearable Data

author.name: Yuanyun Zhang, Han Zhou, Li Feng, Yilin Hong, Shi Li

entry.summary: Proposes multimodal foundation model jointly representing EHR and wearable data as continuous time latent process. Uses modality-specific encoders with shared temporal backbone and cross-modal objectives.

entry.title: Structured Insight from Unstructured Data: Large Language Models for SDOH-Driven Diabetes Risk Prediction

author.name: Sasha Ronaghi, Prerit Choudhary, David H Rehkopf, Bryant Lin

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to extract SDOH information from unstructured patient life stories and evaluates predictive value for diabetes control assessment.

entry.title: When Rules Fall Short: Agent-Driven Discovery of Emerging Content Issues in Short Video Platforms

author.name: Chenghui Yu, Hongwei Wang, Junwen Chen, Zixuan Wang, Bingfeng Deng, Zhuolin Hao, Hongyu Xiong, Yang Song

entry.summary: Multimodal LLM agent system for automatically discovering emerging content issues on short-video platforms using two-stage clustering and policy generation from video clusters.

entry.title: Decoder Gradient Shields: A Family of Provable and High-Fidelity Methods Against Gradient-Based Box-Free Watermark Removal

author.name: Haonan An, Guang Hua, Wei Du, Hangcheng Cao, Yihang Tao, Guowen Xu, Susanto Rahardja, Yuguang Fang

entry.summary: Decoder Gradient Shields defends against gradient-based watermark removal attacks by protecting the decoder in box-free watermarking systems from backpropagation exploitation.

entry.title: DiffusionQC: Artifact Detection in Histopathology via Diffusion Model

author.name: Zhenzhen Wang, Zhongliang Zhou, Zhuoyu Wen, Jeong Hwan Kook, John B Wojcik, John Kang

entry.summary: DiffusionQC detects artifacts in histopathology images as outliers using diffusion models trained only on clean images, without requiring artifact annotations.

entry.title: Deep Feature Deformation Weights

author.name: Richard Liu, Itai Lang, Rana Hanocka

entry.summary: Proposes combining semantic priors from data-driven methods with precise control of traditional handle-based mesh deformation by mapping deep features to deformation weights.

entry.title: An Efficient and Explainable KAN Framework forWireless Radiation Field Prediction

author.name: Jingzhou Shen, Xuyu Wang

entry.summary: Presents KAN architecture with transformer modules for wireless radiation field prediction, learning comprehensive ray representations rather than individual voxels. Improves performance across realistic and synthetic scenes.

entry.title: Multi-agent DRL-based Lane Change Decision Model for Cooperative Planning in Mixed Traffic

author.name: Zeyu Mu, Shangtong Zhang, B. Brian Park

entry.summary: Hybrid multi-agent lane change decision model using CNN-QMIX to increase CAV participation in cooperative platooning. Addresses sparse CAV distribution challenges in early deployment.

entry.title: Empowering All-in-Loop Health Management of Spacecraft Power System in the Mega-Constellation Era via Human-AI Collaboration

author.name: Yi Di, Zhibin Zhao, Fujin Wang, Xue Liu, Jiafeng Tang, Jiaxin Ren, Zhi Zhai, Xuefeng Chen

entry.summary: SpaceHMchat is human-AI collaboration framework for spacecraft power system health management, addressing exponential growth in satellite mega-constellations.

entry.title: Compass-Embedding v4: Robust Contrastive Learning for Multilingual E-commerce Embeddings

author.name: Pakorn Ueareeworakul, Shuman Liu, Jinghao Feng, Ling Hu, Zhantang Shi, Chengqi Sun, Liang Yao, Panyi Ouyang, Haibo Zhang, Anxiang Zeng

entry.summary: Presents Compass-Embedding v4, a multilingual embedding framework for Southeast Asian e-commerce with Class-Aware Masking to handle false negatives in large-batch contrastive training.

entry.title: Hardware-Aware Reformulation of Convolutions for Efficient Execution on Specialized AI Hardware: A Case Study on NVIDIA Tensor Cores

author.name: Ganesh Bikshandi

entry.summary: Presents hardware-aware reformulation of CNN computations using rewrite rules to satisfy Tensor Core alignment requirements post-training without modifying network weights.

entry.title: Telling Human and Machine Handwriting Apart

author.name: Luis A. Leiva, Moises Diaz, Nuwan T. Attygalle, Miguel A. Ferrer, Rejean Plamondon

entry.summary: Studies distinguishing human from AI-generated handwriting using shallow RNN trained on ten datasets reproduced by seven synthesizers including GANs, Transformers, and Diffusion models. Achieves 98.3% AUC.

entry.title: Enhancing LLM-Based Data Annotation with Error Decomposition

author.name: Zhen Xu, Vedant Khatri, Yijun Dai, Xiner Liu, Siyan Li, Xuanming Zhang, Renzhe Yu

entry.summary: Proposes diagnostic evaluation paradigm for LLM data annotation that separates task-inherent ambiguity from model error through error decomposition and human-in-the-loop steps.

entry.title: GazeFormer-MoE: Context-Aware Gaze Estimation via CLIP and MoE Transformer

author.name: Xinyuan Zhao, Xianrui Chen, Ahmad Chaddad

entry.summary: GazeFormer-MoE achieves SOTA gaze estimation using CLIP features with learnable prototype banks and Mixture of Experts, showing up to 64% relative improvement.

entry.title: Benchmarking Concept-Spilling Across Languages in LLMs

author.name: Ilia Badanin, Daniil Dzenhaliou, Imanol Schlag

entry.summary: Presents framework for evaluating multilingual semantic robustness by measuring 'language spilling' - when LLMs generating in non-English languages exhibit interference from dominant language representations.

entry.title: Fisher-Orthogonal Projected Natural Gradient Descent for Continual Learning

author.name: Ishir Garg, Neel Kolhe, Andy Peng, Rohan Gopalam

entry.summary: Proposes FOPNG optimizer enforcing Fisher-orthogonal constraints on parameter updates for continual learning, unifying natural gradient descent with orthogonal methods in information-geometric framework.

entry.title: KOCO-BENCH: Can Large Language Models Leverage Domain Knowledge in Software Development?

author.name: Xue Jiang, Jiaru Qian, Xianjie Shi, Chenjie Li, Hao Zhu, Ziyu Wang, Jielun Zhang, Zheyu Zhao, Kechi Zhang, Jia Li, Wenpin Jiao, Zhi Jin, Ge Li, Yihong Dong

entry.summary: Presents KOCO-BENCH, a benchmark for evaluating LLM domain specialization in software development with 6 domains, 11 frameworks, and 25 projects. Includes explicit knowledge corpora for developing specialization methods.

entry.title: Neural Organ Transplantation (NOT): Checkpoint-Based Modular Adaptation for Transformer Models

author.name: Ahmad Al-Zuraiqi

entry.summary: Introduces Neural Organ Transplantation (NOT), enabling trained transformer layers to function as reusable checkpoint files transplantable into compatible models. Tested on GPT-2, TinyLlama, and GPT-OSS.

entry.title: Does Privacy Always Harm Fairness? Data-Dependent Trade-offs via Chernoff Information Neural Estimation

author.name: Arjun Nichani (Richard), Hsiang Hsu (Richard), Chun-Fu (Richard), Chen, Haewon Jeong

entry.summary: Analyzes privacy-fairness-accuracy trade-offs using Chernoff Information neural estimation. Shows relationship is data-dependent with three distinct behavioral regimes.

entry.title: IF-GEO: Conflict-Aware Instruction Fusion for Multi-Query Generative Engine Optimization

author.name: Heyang Zhou (School of Cyber Science and Technology, University of Science and Technology of China), JiaJia Chen (Institute of Dataspace, Hefei Comprehensive National Science Center), Xiaolu Chen (School of Cyber Science and Technology, University of Science and Technology of China), Jie Bao (School of Cyber Science and Technology, University of Science and Technology of China), Zhen Chen (School of Cyber Science and Technology, University of Science and Technology of China), Yong Liao (School of Cyber Science and Technology, University of Science and Technology of China)

entry.summary: IF-GEO addresses Generative Engine Optimization for documents facing diverse queries with conflicting revision requirements, proposing a diverge-then-converge framework that synthesizes optimal global revisions.

entry.title: Riemannian Liquid Spatio-Temporal Graph Network

author.name: Liangsi Lu, Jingchao Wang, Zhaorong Dai, Hanqian Liu, Yang Shi

entry.summary: RLSTG introduces Riemannian Liquid Spatio-Temporal Graph Networks that unify continuous-time liquid dynamics with Riemannian manifold geometry for modeling graph evolution.

entry.title: KAGE-Bench: Fast Known-Axis Visual Generalization Evaluation for Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Egor Cherepanov, Daniil Zelezetsky, Alexey K. Kovalev, Aleksandr I. Panov

entry.summary: KAGE-Bench introduces a JAX-native 2D platformer benchmark that factorizes visual axes to enable systematic analysis of visual generalization in pixel-based RL agents.

entry.title: Optimal L2 Regularization in High-dimensional Continual Linear Regression

author.name: Gilad Karpel, Edward Moroshko, Ran Levinstein, Ron Meir, Daniel Soudry, Itay Evron

entry.summary: Derives closed-form generalization loss for overparameterized continual linear regression with L2 regularization. Proves optimal regularization scales as T/ln(T) with number of tasks.

entry.title: A Two-Stage GPU Kernel Tuner Combining Semantic Refactoring and Search-Based Optimization

author.name: Qiuyi Qu, Yicheng Sui, Yufei Sun, Rui Chen, Xiaofei Zhang, Yuzhi Zhang, Haofeng Wang, Ge Lan, Ning Zhang

entry.summary: Two-stage GPU kernel tuner combining LLM-agent semantic refactoring with search-based parameter optimization for HPC and large model inference.

entry.title: The Role of Prosodic and Lexical Cues in Turn-Taking with Self-Supervised Speech Representations

author.name: Sam OConnor Russell, Delphine Charuau, Naomi Harte

entry.summary: Uses vocoder-based approach to cleanly separate prosodic and lexical cues for analyzing turn-taking models, finding either can support turn-taking independently.

entry.title: LTV-YOLO: A Lightweight Thermal Object Detector for Young Pedestrians in Adverse Conditions

author.name: Abdullah Jirjees, Ryan Myers, Muhammad Haris Ikram, Mohamed H. Zaki

entry.summary: LTV-YOLO is a lightweight thermal detector based on YOLO11 for detecting young pedestrians (children, adolescents) in low light and adverse weather using LWIR cameras.

entry.title: A Training-Free Guess What Vision Language Model from Snippets to Open-Vocabulary Object Detection

author.name: Guiying Zhu, Bowen Yang, Yin Zhuang, Tong Zhang, Guanqun Wang, Zhihao Che, He Chen, Lianlin Li

entry.summary: GW-VLM proposes training-free open vocabulary object detection using Multi-Scale Visual Language Searching with Contextual Concept Prompts to engage pre-trained VLMs.

entry.title: SMc2f: Robust Scenario Mining for Robotic Autonomy from Coarse to Fine

author.name: Yifei Chen, Ross Greer

entry.summary: SMc2f framework for mining safety-critical scenarios from autonomous vehicle logs using LLMs for natural language queries with coarse-to-fine retrieval.

entry.title: Fusing in 3D: Free-Viewpoint Fusion Rendering with a 3D Infrared-Visible Scene Representation

author.name: Chao Yang, Deshui Miao, Chao Tian, Guoqing Zhu, Yameng Gu, Zhenyu He

entry.summary: Proposes IVGF framework for infrared-visible fusion using 3D Gaussian Splatting with cross-modal adjustment module to handle modality conflicts and enable free-viewpoint fused image rendering.

entry.title: GTPred: Benchmarking MLLMs for Interpretable Geo-localization and Time-of-capture Prediction

author.name: Jinnao Li, Zijian Chen, Tingzhu Chen, Changbo Wang

entry.summary: Introduces GTPred benchmark for geo-temporal prediction with MLLMs, comprising 370 images spanning 120 years with evaluation of joint geographic and temporal inference from visual evidence.

entry.title: ASBA: A-line State Space Model and B-line Attention for Sparse Optical Doppler Tomography Reconstruction

author.name: Zhenghong Li, Wensheng Cheng, Congwu Du, Yingtian Pan, Zhaozheng Yin, Haibin Ling

entry.summary: Introduces ASBA network for sparse optical Doppler tomography reconstruction using A-line State Space Model and B-line Attention to handle flow and background signals differently.

entry.title: Multimodal Feedback for Handheld Tool Guidance: Combining Wrist-Based Haptics with Augmented Reality

author.name: Yue Yang, Christoph Leuze, Brian Hargreaves, Bruce Daniel, Fred M Baik

entry.summary: Investigates combining vibrotactile wrist feedback with optical see-through AR for handheld surgical tool guidance. Formative study with surgeons guides cue design for multimodal feedback.

entry.title: PRISM: Learning Design Knowledge from Data for Stylistic Design Improvement

author.name: Huaxiaoyue Wang, Sunav Choudhary, Franck Dernoncourt, Yu Shen, Stefano Petrangeli

entry.summary: PRISM leverages design data collections to learn domain-specific style principles and guide VLM-based stylistic improvements in graphic design. Addresses misalignment between VLM pretrained knowledge and specific design domains.

entry.title: Human-AI Collaborative Inductive Thematic Analysis: AI Guided Analysis and Human Interpretive Authority

author.name: Matthew Nyaaba, Min SungEun, Mary Abiswin Apam, Kwame Owoahene Acheampong, Emmanuel Dwamena, Xiaoming Zhai

entry.summary: HACITA framework examines how researchers interact with ITA-GPT for inductive thematic analysis. Studies how AI assistance affects interpretive authority in qualitative research.

entry.title: SCRIPTMIND: Crime Script Inference and Cognitive Evaluation for LLM-based Social Engineering Scam Detection System

author.name: Heedou Kim, Changsik Kim, Sanghwa Shin, Jaewoo Kang

entry.summary: Introduces ScriptMind, an LLM-based framework for detecting social engineering scams using crime script inference and cognitive simulation. Built and evaluated on 571 Korean phone scam cases generating 22,712 structured instances.

entry.title: CSyMR: Benchmarking Compositional Symbolic Muisc Reasoning With MIR Tool Integration

author.name: Boyang Wang, Yash Vishe, Xin Xu, Zachary Novack, Julian McAuley, Junda Wu

entry.summary: Introduces CSyMR-Bench, a benchmark for compositional symbolic music reasoning requiring integration of multiple analyses, along with a tool-augmented agent using music21 library.

entry.title: Bielik 11B v3: Multilingual Large Language Model for European Languages

author.name: Krzysztof Ociepa, {\L}ukasz Flis, Remigiusz Kinas, Krzysztof Wr\'obel, Adrian Gwo\'zdziej

entry.summary: Presents Bielik 11B v3, a state-of-the-art Polish language model scaled from Mistral 7B with four-stage training pipeline including continuous pre-training, SFT, DPO, and reinforcement learning.

entry.title: Towards AGI A Pragmatic Approach Towards Self Evolving Agent

author.name: Indrajit Kar, Sammy Zonunpuia, Zonunfeli Ralte

entry.summary: Proposes hierarchical self-evolving multi-agent framework integrating Base LLM, operational SLM, Code-Gen LLM, and Teacher-LLM for continuous capability expansion through curriculum learning and genetic algorithms.

entry.title: HALO: Semantic-Aware Distributed LLM Inference in Lossy Edge Network

author.name: Peirong Zheng, Wenchao Xu, Haozhao Wang, Jinyu Chen, Xuemin Shen

entry.summary: HALO enables distributed LLM inference across edge devices in unreliable networks by strategically allocating less critical neuron groups to unstable devices. Addresses synchronization challenges in edge deployment.

entry.title: RobotDesignGPT: Automated Robot Design Synthesis using Vision Language Models

author.name: Nitish Sontakke, K. Niranjan Kumar, Sehoon Ha

entry.summary: RobotDesignGPT leverages vision-language models to automate robot design synthesis from simple user prompts, generating initial designs that can be iteratively refined.

entry.title: Conditional Random Fields for Interactive Refinement of Histopathological Predictions

author.name: Tiffanie Godelaine, Maxime Zanella, Karim El Khoury, Sa\"id Mahmoudi, Beno\^it Macq, Christophe De Vleeschouwer

entry.summary: HistoCRF adapts Conditional Random Fields for histopathology, refining VLM zero-shot predictions with novel pairwise potentials promoting label diversity and leveraging expert annotations without training.

entry.title: Do Neural Codecs Generalize? A Controlled Study Across Unseen Languages and Non-Speech Tasks

author.name: Shih-Heng Wang, Jiatong Shi, Jinchuan Tian, Haibin Wu, Shinji Watanabe

entry.summary: Controlled study of neural audio codec generalization to unseen languages and non-speech tasks (environmental sounds, music, animal vocalizations) using strictly controlled configurations.

entry.title: Conversational Context Classification: A Representation Engineering Approach

author.name: Jonathan Pan

entry.summary: Uses Representation Engineering with One-Class SVM to identify subspaces within LLM internal states representing specific conversational contexts for out-of-context detection.

entry.title: From Prompts to Pavement: LMMs-based Agentic Behavior-Tree Generation Framework for Autonomous Vehicles

author.name: Omar Y. Goba, Ahmed Y. Gado, Catherine M. Elias, Ahmed Hussein

entry.summary: Proposes an agentic framework using LLMs and vision models to dynamically generate and adapt behavior trees for autonomous vehicles, using chain-of-symbols prompting and in-context learning.

entry.title: SLAP: Scalable Language-Audio Pretraining with Variable-Duration Audio and Multi-Objective Training

author.name: Xinhao Mei, Gael Le Lan, Haohe Liu, Zhaoheng Ni, Varun Nagaraja, Yang Liu, Yangyang Shi, Vikas Chandra

entry.summary: Introduces SLAP (Scalable Language-Audio Pretraining) addressing limitations of CLAP models including small training data, fixed duration constraints, and global-only representation learning.

entry.title: Left-Right Symmetry Breaking in CLIP-style Vision-Language Models Trained on Synthetic Spatial-Relation Data

author.name: Takaki Yamamoto, Chihiro Noguchi, Toshihiro Tanizawa

entry.summary: Uses controlled 1D image-text testbed to probe how left-right spatial understanding emerges in CLIP-style models, finding label diversity more important than layout diversity for learning relations.

entry.title: RubRIX: Rubric-Driven Risk Mitigation in Caregiver-AI Interactions

author.name: Drishti Goel, Jeongah Lee, Qiuyue Joy Zhong, Violeta J. Rodriguez, Daniel S. Brown, Ravi Karkar, Dong Whi Yoo, Koustuv Saha

entry.summary: Introduces RubRIX, a clinician-validated framework for evaluating risks in LLM caregiving responses based on Elements of an Ethic of Care theory. Defines five risk dimensions including Inattention, Bias, and Epistemic Overreach.

entry.title: MOSLD-Bench: Multilingual Open-Set Learning and Discovery Benchmark for Text Categorization

author.name: Adriana-Valentina Costache, Daria-Nicoleta Dragomir, Silviu-Florin Gheorghe, Eduard Poesina, Paul Irofti, Radu Tudor Ionescu

entry.summary: Introduces MOSLD-Bench, the first multilingual open-set learning and discovery benchmark for text categorization with 960K samples across 12 languages.

entry.title: End-to-End Reverse Screening Identifies Protein Targets of Small Molecules Using HelixFold3

author.name: Shengjie Xu, Xianbin Ye, Mengran Zhu, Xiaonan Zhang, Shanzhuo Zhang, Xiaomin Fang

entry.summary: Presents end-to-end reverse screening strategy using HelixFold3 (AlphaFold3-like) for identifying protein targets of small molecules in drug discovery.

entry.title: Towards robust long-context understanding of large language model via active recap learning

author.name: Chenyu Hui

entry.summary: Active Recap Learning (ARL) enhances LLM long-context understanding by enabling models to revisit and summarize earlier content through targeted sequence construction during pretraining and retrospective summarization at inference.

entry.title: Stream-Voice-Anon: Enhancing Utility of Real-Time Speaker Anonymization via Neural Audio Codec and Language Models

author.name: Nikita Kuzmin, Songting Liu, Kong Aik Lee, Eng Siong Chng

entry.summary: Stream-Voice-Anon adapts causal LM-based neural audio codec architectures for streaming speaker anonymization, integrating privacy protection techniques for real-time voice applications.

entry.title: Generalizing Abstention for Noise-Robust Learning in Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Wesam Moustafa, Hossam Elsafty, Helen Schneider, Lorenz Sparrenberg, Rafet Sifa

entry.summary: Introduces a universal abstention framework that enhances noise-robustness of loss functions in medical image segmentation, extending the abstention mechanism beyond classification.

entry.title: POCI-Diff: Position Objects Consistently and Interactively with 3D-Layout Guided Diffusion

author.name: Andrea Rigo, Luca Stornaiuolo, Weijie Wang, Mauro Martino, Bruno Lepri, Nicu Sebe

entry.summary: POCI-Diff proposes a diffusion-based approach for text-to-image generation with consistent 3D layout control and editing, binding individual text descriptions to specific 3D bounding boxes.

entry.title: Opportunities in AI/ML for the Rubin LSST Dark Energy Science Collaboration

author.name: LSST Dark Energy Science Collaboration, Eric Aubourg, Camille Avestruz, Matthew R. Becker, Biswajit Biswas, Rahul Biswas, Boris Bolliet, Adam S. Bolton, Clecio R. Bom, Rapha\"el Bonnet-Guerrini, Alexandre Boucaud, Jean-Eric Campagne, Chihway Chang, Aleksandra \'Ciprijanovi\'c, Johann Cohen-Tanugi, Michael W. Coughlin, John Franklin Crenshaw, Juan C. Cuevas-Tello, Juan de Vicente, Seth W. Digel, Steven Dillmann, Mariano Javier de Le\'on Dominguez Romero, Alex Drlica-Wagner, Sydney Erickson, Alexander T. Gagliano, Christos Georgiou, Aritra Ghosh, Matthew Grayling, Kirill A. Grishin, Alan Heavens, Lindsay R. House, Mustapha Ishak, Wassim Kabalan, Arun Kannawadi, Fran\c{c}ois Lanusse, C. Danielle Leonard, Pierre-Fran\c{c}ois L\'eget, Michelle Lochner, Yao-Yuan Mao, Peter Melchior, Grant Merz, Martin Millon, Anais M\"oller, Gautham Narayan, Yuuki Omori, Hiranya Peiris, Laurence Perreault-Levasseur, Andr\'es A. Plazas Malag\'on, Nesar Ramachandra, Benjamin Remy, C\'ecile Roucelle, Jaime Ruiz-Zapatero, Stefan Schuldt, Ignacio Sevilla-Noarbe, Ved G. Shah, Tjitske Starkenburg, Stephen Thorp, Laura Toribio San Cipriano, Tilman Tr\"oster, Roberto Trotta, Padma Venkatraman, Amanda Wasserman, Tim White, Justine Zeghal, Tianqing Zhang, Yuanyuan Zhang

entry.summary: Large DESC collaboration paper outlining AI/ML opportunities and challenges for Rubin Observatory dark energy science, covering photometric redshifts, transients, weak lensing, and cosmological inference.

entry.title: A Multimodal Data Processing Pipeline for MIMIC-IV Dataset

author.name: Farzana Islam Adiba, Varsha Danduri, Fahmida Liza Piya, Ali Abbasi, Mehak Gupta, Rahmatollah Beheshti

entry.summary: Presents a comprehensive multimodal data processing pipeline for MIMIC-IV medical records, supporting structured data, clinical notes, waveforms, and imaging data with customizable preprocessing.

entry.title: Suspicious Alignment of SGD: A Fine-Grained Step Size Condition Analysis

author.name: Shenyang Deng, Boyao Liao, Zhuoli Ouyang, Tianyu Pang, Minhak Song, Yaoqing Yang

entry.summary: Analyzes 'suspicious alignment' in SGD where gradient alignment with dominant Hessian subspace increases but provides ineffective loss reduction, giving fine-grained step size conditions.

entry.title: LB-MCTS: Synergizing Large Language Models and Bayesian Optimization for Efficient CASH

author.name: Beicheng Xu, Weitong Qian, Lingching Tung, Yupeng Lu, Bin Cui

entry.summary: Proposes LB-MCTS combining LLMs and Bayesian Optimization within Monte Carlo Tree Search for Combined Algorithm Selection and Hyperparameter tuning (CASH). Uses Selective Tuning Memory for maximizing LLM reasoning.

entry.title: Multi-Objective Hierarchical Optimization with Large Language Models

author.name: Andrej Schwanke, Lyubomir Ivanov, David Salinas, Frank Hutter, Arber Zela

entry.summary: Proposes a hierarchical search strategy using LLMs as surrogate models and candidate samplers for multi-objective optimization, adaptively partitioning input space into hyperrectangular regions with composite scoring.

entry.title: PAC-Private Responses with Adversarial Composition

author.name: Xiaochen Zhu, Mayuri Sridhar, Srinivas Devadas

entry.summary: Proposes PAC-private responses that provide instance-based privacy guarantees for ML model outputs by controlling mutual information, with novel composition theorems for adaptive queries.

entry.title: SpaRRTa: A Synthetic Benchmark for Evaluating Spatial Intelligence in Visual Foundation Models

author.name: Turhan Can Kargin, Wojciech Jasi\'nski, Adam Pardyl, Bartosz Zieli\'nski, Marcin Przewi\k{e}\'zlikowski

entry.summary: Introduces SpaRRTa benchmark for evaluating spatial reasoning capabilities of Visual Foundation Models, assessing relative position identification rather than precise metric predictions.

entry.title: Adversarial Drift-Aware Predictive Transfer: Toward Durable Clinical AI

author.name: Xin Xiong, Zijian Guo, Haobo Zhu, Chuan Hong, Jordan W Smoller, Tianxi Cai, Molei Liu

entry.summary: Introduces ADAPT framework for clinical AI that constructs uncertainty sets of plausible future models to optimize worst-case performance against temporal drift from evolving populations and systemic shocks.

entry.title: Beyond Visual Realism: Toward Reliable Financial Time Series Generation

author.name: Fan Zhang, Jiabin Luo, Zheng Zhang, Shuanghong Huang, Zhipeng Liu, Yu Chen

entry.summary: Introduces SFAG (Stylized Facts Alignment GAN) for generating realistic financial time series by converting stylized facts into differentiable constraints. Addresses failure of standard GANs under trading backtests due to neglected asymmetry and tail events.

entry.title: Sample Complexity of Average-Reward Q-Learning: From Single-agent to Federated Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yuchen Jiao, Jiin Woo, Gen Li, Gauri Joshi, Yuejie Chi

entry.summary: Studies Q-learning sample complexity for average-reward MDPs in both single-agent and federated settings. Shows carefully parameterized Q-learning achieves near-optimal sample complexity.

entry.title: Efficient Coordination with the System-Level Shared State: An Embodied-AI Native Modular Framework

author.name: Yixuan Deng, Tongrun Wu, Donghao Wu, Zeyu Wei, Jiayuan Wang, Zhenglong Sun, Yuqing Tang, Xiaoqiang Ji

entry.summary: Presents ANCHOR, a modular framework for embodied AI making decoupling and robustness explicit system primitives through Canonical Records and feedback-oriented coordination.

entry.title: An Empirical Analysis of Fine-Tuning Large Language Models on Bioinformatics Literature: PRSGPT and BioStarsGPT

author.name: Muhammad Muneeb, David B. Ascher

entry.summary: Presents reproducible pipeline for fine-tuning LLMs on bioinformatics data, demonstrated through PRSGPT (polygenic risk scores) and BioStarsGPT (forum discussions). Nine-step pipeline with quality control.

entry.title: RAC: Retrieval-Augmented Clarification for Faithful Conversational Search

author.name: Ahmed Rayane Kebir, Vincent Guigue, Lynda Said Lhadj, Laure Soulier

entry.summary: Introduces RAC (Retrieval-Augmented Clarification) for generating corpus-faithful clarification questions in conversational search. Uses contrastive decoding to encourage evidence-based questions.

entry.title: Tolerance Principle and Small Language Model Learning

author.name: Adam E. Friedman, Stevan Harnad, Rushen Shi

entry.summary: Tests Yang's Tolerance Principle on BabyBERTa to understand minimal training data needed for grammar rule generalization. Explores intersection of cognitive linguistics theory and transformer learning.

entry.title: Comparing Without Saying: A Dataset and Benchmark for Implicit Comparative Opinion Mining from Same-User Reviews

author.name: Thanh-Lam T. Nguyen, Ngoc-Quang Le, Quoc-Trung Phu, Thi-Phuong Le, Ngoc-Huyen Pham, Phuong-Nguyen Nguyen, Hoang-Quynh Le

entry.summary: SUDO dataset enables implicit comparative opinion mining from same-user reviews, where preferences are inferred across separate reviews without explicit comparative language.

entry.title: On Temperature-Constrained Non-Deterministic Machine Translation: Potential and Evaluation

author.name: Weichuan Wang, Mingyang Liu, Linqi Song, Chen Ma

entry.summary: Identifies temperature-constrained non-deterministic MT as distinct phenomenon, showing it has potential for addressing multi-modality issues but introduces new evaluation challenges.

entry.title: NewsRECON: News article REtrieval for image CONtextualization

author.name: Jonathan Tonglet, Iryna Gurevych, Tinne Tuytelaars, Marie-Francine Moens

entry.summary: NewsRECON addresses image contextualization when reverse image search fails by linking images to news articles using bi-encoders and cross-encoders to infer date and location from article metadata. Leverages 90K+ articles for retrieval.

entry.title: PointSLAM++: Robust Dense Neural Gaussian Point Cloud-based SLAM

author.name: Xu Wang, Boyao Han, Xiaojun Chen, Ying Liu, Ruihui Li

entry.summary: PointSLAM++ improves RGB-D SLAM using hierarchical neural Gaussian representation and progressive pose optimization to handle depth sensor noise and maintain structural consistency.

entry.title: RemoteVAR: Autoregressive Visual Modeling for Remote Sensing Change Detection

author.name: Yilmaz Korkmaz, Vishal M. Patel

entry.summary: RemoteVAR applies visual autoregressive models to remote sensing change detection with cross-attention conditioning on bi-temporal features and specialized autoregressive training strategy.

entry.title: Deep learning-based neurodevelopmental assessment in preterm infants

author.name: Lexin Ren, Jiamiao Lu, Weichuan Zhang, Benqing Wu, Tuo Wang, Yi Liao, Jiapan Guo, Changming Sun, Liang Guo

entry.summary: Hierarchical Dense Attention Network for preterm infant brain MRI segmentation addressing isointense appearance challenge between white and gray matter.

entry.title: Toward Real-World High-Precision Image Matting and Segmentation

author.name: Haipeng Zhou, Zhaohu Xing, Hongqiu Wang, Jun Ma, Ping Li, Lei Zhu

entry.summary: FCLM addresses high-precision matting/segmentation generalization to real-world scenarios using Depth-Aware Distillation to handle synthetic-to-real domain gap.

entry.title: FlowIID: Single-Step Intrinsic Image Decomposition via Latent Flow Matching

author.name: Mithlesh Singla, Seema Kumari, Shanmuganathan Raman

entry.summary: Introduces FlowIID for intrinsic image decomposition using latent flow matching, enabling single-step inference to separate albedo and shading components with a parameter-efficient architecture.

entry.title: Utilizing the Score of Data Distribution for Hyperspectral Anomaly Detection

author.name: Jiahui Sheng, Yidan Shi, Shu Xiang, Xiaorun Li, Shuhan Chen

entry.summary: Proposes ScoreAD for hyperspectral anomaly detection using score-based generative models, leveraging the time-dependent gradient field of data distribution based on the hyperspectral manifold hypothesis.

entry.title: SkeFi: Cross-Modal Knowledge Transfer for Wireless Skeleton-Based Action Recognition

author.name: Shunyu Huang, Yunjiao Zhou, Jianfei Yang

entry.summary: Proposes SkeFi for skeleton-based action recognition using wireless sensors (LiDAR/mmWave), addressing cross-modal knowledge transfer from RGB to handle insufficient wireless training data and noisier skeletal keypoints.

entry.title: Towards Unbiased Source-Free Object Detection via Vision Foundation Models

author.name: Zhi Cai, Yingjie Gao, Yanan Zhang, Xinzhu Ma, Di Huang

entry.summary: Proposes DSOD for source-free object detection using VFMs to mitigate source bias through Unified Feature Injection with domain-aware adaptive weighting.

entry.title: GazeD: Context-Aware Diffusion for Accurate 3D Gaze Estimation

author.name: Riccardo Catalini, Davide Di Nucci, Guido Borghi, Davide Davoli, Lorenzo Garattoni, Giampiero Francesca, Yuki Kawana, Roberto Vezzani

entry.summary: Introduces GazeD for 3D gaze estimation using diffusion models conditioned on 2D context, representing gaze as an additional body joint for joint denoising with pose estimation.

entry.title: StyMam: A Mamba-Based Generator for Artistic Style Transfer

author.name: Zhou Hong, Rongsheng Hu, Yicheng Di, Xiaolong Xu, Ning Dong, Yihua Shao, Run Ling, Yun Wang, Juqin Wang, Zhanjie Zhang, Ao Ma

entry.summary: Proposes StyMam, a Mamba-based generator for artistic style transfer that jointly captures local and global dependencies to reduce artifacts compared to GAN/CNN and improve speed over diffusion methods.

entry.title: Rethinking Skip Connections: Additive U-Net for Robust and Interpretable Denoising

author.name: Vikram R Lakkavalli

entry.summary: Proposes Additive U-Net replacing concatenative skip connections with gated additive connections using learnable scalars for explicit control over encoder contributions and interpretable information flow.

entry.title: Real-Time 4D Radar Perception for Robust Human Detection in Harsh Enclosed Environments

author.name: Zhenan Liu, Yaodong Cui, Amir Khajepour, George Shaker

entry.summary: Presents methodology for generating controlled dust conditions and a new 4D mmWave radar dataset for human detection in harsh enclosed environments like mines and tunnels. Develops threshold-based noise filtering framework.

entry.title: Curriculum-Based Strategies for Efficient Cross-Domain Action Recognition

author.name: Emily Kim, Allen Wu, Jessica Hodgins

entry.summary: Examines curriculum-based training strategies for cross-view action recognition from ground to aerial views. Shows fine-tuning on synthetic aerial data followed by real ground data works best.

entry.title: Event-based Heterogeneous Information Processing for Online Vision-based Obstacle Detection and Localization

author.name: Reza Ahmadvand, Sarah Safura Sharif, Yaser Mike Banad

entry.summary: Introduces a hybrid neural network framework combining ANNs and SNNs for robotic obstacle detection, using a dual-pathway approach where ANNs handle static features and SNNs process event-based data in real-time. Avoids domain conversion overhead.

entry.title: Language-Based Swarm Perception: Decentralized Person Re-Identification via Natural Language Descriptions

author.name: Miquel Kegeleirs, Lorenzo Garattoni, Gianpiero Francesca, Mauro Birattari

entry.summary: Decentralized person re-identification in robot swarms using natural language descriptions from VLMs instead of visual embeddings. Enables human-readable, interpretable clustering.

entry.title: LogicEnvGen: Task-Logic Driven Generation of Diverse Simulated Environments for Embodied AI

author.name: Jianan Wang, Siyang Zhang, Bin Li, Juan Chen, Jingtao Qi, Zhuo Zhang, Chen Qian

entry.summary: LogicEnvGen uses LLMs to generate logically diverse simulated environments as test cases for embodied AI agents, focusing on testing perspective rather than just visual realism.

entry.title: Stability and Accuracy Trade-offs in Statistical Estimation

author.name: Abhinav Chakraborty, Yuetian Luo, Rina Foygel Barber

entry.summary: Studies trade-offs between algorithmic stability and accuracy in statistical estimation, addressing potential cost of stability for meaningful learning.

entry.title: MLSN #18: Adversarial Diffusion, Activation Oracles, Weird Generalization

author.name: Alice Blair

entry.summary: ML safety newsletter covering diffusion LLMs for adversarial attack generation (more effective than autoregressive), activation oracles, and weird generalization patterns.

entry.title: A Multi-Agent System for Generating Actionable Business Advice

author.name: Kartikey Singh Bhandari, Tanish Jain, Archit Agrawal, Dhruv Kumar, Praveen Kumar, Pratik Narang

entry.summary: Multi-agent LLM framework transforms customer reviews into actionable business advice through clustering, advice generation, iterative evaluation, and feasibility ranking.

entry.title: Mining Citywide Dengue Spread Patterns in Singapore Through Hotspot Dynamics from Open Web Data

author.name: Liping Huang, Gaoxi Xiao, Stefan Ma, Hechang Chen, Shisong Tang, Flora Salim

entry.summary: Framework mining latent transmission links between urban regions for dengue spread prediction using publicly available case data. Models how hotspot formation in one area influences neighbors.

entry.title: RAG: A Random-Forest-Based Generative Design Framework for Uncertainty-Aware Design of Metamaterials with Complex Functional Response Requirements

author.name: Bolin Chen, Dex Doksoo Lee, Wei "Wayne'' Chen, Wei Chen

entry.summary: Random-forest-based generative framework for metamaterial design with complex functional responses. Handles uncertainty from non-existence/non-uniqueness of solutions.

entry.title: PREFAB: PREFerence-based Affective Modeling for Low-Budget Self-Annotation

author.name: Jaeyoung Moon, Youjin Choi, Yucheon Park, David Melhart, Georgios N. Yannakakis, Kyung-Joong Kim

entry.summary: Introduces PREFAB, a low-budget self-annotation method for affective computing that targets inflection regions rather than full annotation, using preference learning to detect relative emotional changes.

entry.title: Discrete Semantic States and Hamiltonian Dynamics in LLM Embedding Spaces

author.name: Timo Aukusti Laine

entry.summary: Investigates LLM embedding space structure using Hamiltonian formalism and linear algebra, motivated by observations of discrete semantic states and quantum mechanical analogies.

entry.title: Attesting Model Lineage by Consisted Knowledge Evolution with Fine-Tuning Trajectory

author.name: Zhuoyi Shang, Jiasen Li, Pengzhen Chen, Yanwei Liu, Xiaoyan Gu, Weiping Wang

entry.summary: Addresses model lineage attestation by verifying consistent knowledge evolution through fine-tuning trajectories. Tackles security concerns around unauthorized model redistribution and false provenance claims in open-weight models.

entry.title: \textit{FocaLogic}: Logic-Based Interpretation of Visual Model Decisions

author.name: Chenchen Zhao, Muxi Chen, Qiang Xu

entry.summary: FocaLogic is model-agnostic framework interpreting visual model decisions through logic-based representations, identifying minimal visual regions decisive for predictions with quantitative metrics.

entry.title: Where It Moves, It Matters: Referring Surgical Instrument Segmentation via Motion

author.name: Meng Wei, Kun Yuan, Shi Li, Yue Zhou, Long Bai, Nassir Navab, Hongliang Ren, Hong Joo Lee, Tom Vercauteren, Nicolas Padoy

entry.summary: SurgRef introduces motion-guided referring segmentation for surgical instruments, grounding free-form language in instrument motion rather than static visual cues.

entry.title: Improved Bug Localization with AI Agents Leveraging Hypothesis and Dynamic Cognition

author.name: Asif Mohammed Samir, Mohammad Masudur Rahman

entry.summary: Presents CogniGent, an AI agent for bug localization that uses hypothesis-driven causal reasoning during code exploration with dynamic context management to address limitations of existing LLM approaches.

entry.title: A Shared Geometry of Difficulty in Multilingual Language Models

author.name: Stefano Civelli, Pietro Bernardelle, Nicol\`o Brunello, Gianluca Demartini

entry.summary: Studies multilingual geometry of problem-difficulty in LLMs, finding difficulty signals at shallow and deep layers exhibit different cross-lingual transfer properties.

entry.title: Stop Taking Tokenizers for Granted: They Are Core Design Decisions in Large Language Models

author.name: Sawsan Alqahtani, Mir Tafseer Nayeem, Md Tahmid Rahman Laskar, Tasnim Mohiuddin, M Saiful Bari

entry.summary: Position paper arguing tokenization should be treated as a core modeling decision rather than preprocessing step. Calls for context-aware tokenizer-model co-design with standardized evaluation.

entry.title: Organ-Aware Attention Improves CT Triage and Classification

author.name: Lavsen Dahal, Yubraj Bhandari, Geoffrey D. Rubin, Joseph Y. Lo

entry.summary: Proposes ORAS (Organ-Aware Attention) for CT triage using anatomical priors. Establishes new supervised SOTA on CT-RATE and RADCHEST-CT benchmarks, outperforming VLM linear probes.

entry.title: The Orchestration of Multi-Agent Systems: Architectures, Protocols, and Enterprise Adoption

author.name: Apoorva Adimulam, Rajesh Gupta, Sumit Kumar

entry.summary: Presents unified architectural framework for multi-agent system orchestration, detailing Model Context Protocol for tool access and Agent2Agent protocol for inter-agent communication.

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware Gradient Signal-to-Noise Data Selection for Instruction Tuning

author.name: Zhihang Yuan, Chengyu Yue, Long Huang, Litu Ou, Lei Shi

entry.summary: Proposes GRADFILTERING, an uncertainty-aware data selection framework for instruction tuning using GPT-2 proxy with LoRA ensemble and Gradient Signal-to-Noise Ratio metric.

entry.title: IPEC: Test-Time Incremental Prototype Enhancement Classifier for Few-Shot Learning

author.name: Wenwen Liao, Hang Ruan, Jianbo Yu, Xiaofeng Yang, Qingchao Jiang, Xuefeng Yan

entry.summary: IPEC proposes a test-time method for few-shot learning that incrementally enhances prototypes using high-confidence query samples from previous batches.

entry.title: Physics-Constrained Denoising Autoencoders for Data-Scarce Wildfire UAV Sensing

author.name: Abdelrahman Ramadan, Zahra Dorbeigi Namaghi, Emily Taylor, Lucas Edwards, Xan Giuliani, David S. McLagan, Sidney Givigi, Melissa Greeff

entry.summary: PC²DAE proposes physics-constrained denoising autoencoders for wildfire UAV sensing, embedding physical constraints directly into architecture to address data scarcity from limited flight campaigns.

entry.title: From Relative Entropy to Minimax: A Unified Framework for Coverage in MDPs

author.name: Xihe Gu, Urbashi Mitra, Tara Javidi

entry.summary: Proposes unified framework for coverage objectives in reward-free MDPs using weighted parameterized family that unifies divergence-based, weighted average, and minimax coverage approaches.

entry.title: Ordered Local Momentum for Asynchronous Distributed Learning under Arbitrary Delays

author.name: Chang-Wei Shi, Shi-Shang Wang, Wu-Jun Li

entry.summary: Proposes OrLoMo (Ordered Local Momentum) for asynchronous distributed learning with local updates, enabling MSGD in heterogeneous clusters with arbitrary delays.

entry.title: Disagreement as Data: Reasoning Trace Analytics in Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Elham Tajik, Conrad Borchers, Bahar Shahrokhian, Sebastian Simon, Ali Keramati, Sonika Pal, Sreecharan Sankaranarayanan

entry.summary: Proposes using LLM reasoning traces from multi-agent systems as process data for qualitative analysis, using cosine similarity to detect and interpret agent disagreements.

entry.title: Typhoon ASR Real-time: FastConformer-Transducer for Thai Automatic Speech Recognition

author.name: Warit Sirichotedumrong, Adisai Na-Thalang, Potsawee Manakul, Pittawat Taveekitworachai, Sittipong Sripaisarnmongkol, Kunat Pipatanakul

entry.summary: Typhoon ASR Real-time is a 115M parameter FastConformer-Transducer for low-latency Thai speech recognition, achieving 45x cost reduction vs Whisper Large-v3 with comparable accuracy.

entry.title: From Pixels to Purchase: Building and Evaluating a Taxonomy-Decoupled Visual Search Engine for Home Goods E-commerce

author.name: Cheng Lyu, Jingyue Zhang, Ryan Maunu, Mengwei Li, Vinny DeGenova, Yuanli Pei

entry.summary: Taxonomy-decoupled visual search for e-commerce using classification-free region proposals and LLM-as-Judge evaluation framework for nuanced similarity assessment.

entry.title: Language-Guided and Motion-Aware Gait Representation for Generalizable Recognition

author.name: Zhengxian Wu, Chuanrui Zhang, Shenao Jiang, Hangrui Xu, Zirui Liao, Luyuan Zhang, Huaqiu Li, Peng Jiao, Haoqian Wang

entry.summary: LMGait uses language guidance and motion-aware features for gait recognition, addressing overfitting to static noise like clothing while capturing dynamic motion regions.

entry.title: Task-Driven Prompt Learning: A Joint Framework for Multi-modal Cloud Removal and Segmentation

author.name: Zaiyan Zhang, Jie Li, Shaowei Shi, Qiangqiang Yuan

entry.summary: TDP-CR joint framework for cloud removal and land-cover segmentation using Prompt-Guided Fusion with learnable degradation prompts encoding cloud thickness and uncertainty.

entry.title: Class-Partitioned VQ-VAE and Latent Flow Matching for Point Cloud Scene Generation

author.name: Dasith de Silva Edirimuni, Ajmal Saeed Mian

entry.summary: Introduces Class-Partitioned VQ-VAE with class-labeled codebook vectors and latent flow matching for 3D point cloud scene generation, addressing the problem of decoding latents into correct class objects.

entry.title: SSPFormer: Self-Supervised Pretrained Transformer for MRI Images

author.name: Jingkai Li, Xiaoze Tian, Yuhang Shen, Jia Wang, Dianjie Lu, Guijuan Zhang, Zhuoran Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes SSPFormer, a self-supervised pretrained transformer for MRI images using inverse frequency projection masking to prioritize high-frequency anatomical region reconstruction.

entry.title: GridNet-HD: A High-Resolution Multi-Modal Dataset for LiDAR-Image Fusion on Power Line Infrastructure

author.name: Antoine Carreaud, Shanci Li, Malo De Lacour, Digre Frinde, Jan Skaloud, Adrien Gressin

entry.summary: Presents GridNet-HD, a multi-modal dataset for 3D semantic segmentation of power line infrastructure with 7,694 images, 2.5B LiDAR points, and 11 classes showing +5.55 mIoU gain from fusion.

entry.title: Not all Blends are Equal: The BLEMORE Dataset of Blended Emotion Expressions with Relative Salience Annotations

author.name: Tim Lachmann, Alexandra Israelsson, Christina Tornberg, Teimuraz Saghinadze, Michal Balazia, Philipp M\"uller, Petri Laukka

entry.summary: Introduces BLEMORE, a dataset for multimodal blended emotion recognition with relative salience annotations, addressing the limitation that current approaches cannot assess salience within emotion blends.

entry.title: A Lightweight Model-Driven 4D Radar Framework for Pervasive Human Detection in Harsh Conditions

author.name: Zhenan Liu, Amir Khajepour, George Shaker

entry.summary: Presents a fully model-driven 4D radar perception framework for real-time human detection on embedded edge hardware in visibility-degraded industrial environments. Uses radar as sole perception modality without deep learning.

entry.title: A Constraint Programming Model for the Super-Agile Earth Observation Satellite Imaging Scheduling Problem

author.name: Margarida Caleiras, Samuel Moniz, Paulo Nascimento

entry.summary: Presents first exact Constraint Programming model for super-agile Earth observation satellite imaging scheduling, accounting for variable observation durations and multiple imaging directions.

entry.title: Medication counseling with large language models: balancing flexibility and rigidity

author.name: Joar Sabel, Mattias Wingren, Andreas Lundell, S\"oren Andersson, Sara Rosenberg, Susanne H\"agglund, Linda Estman, Malin Andtfolk

entry.summary: Explores using LLMs for medication counseling in pharmacy contexts, emphasizing the tension between flexible natural conversation and the need for rigid accuracy in safety-critical domains.

entry.title: Geometric Attention: A Regime-Explicit Operator Semantics for Transformer Attention

author.name: Luis Rosario Freytes

entry.summary: Proposes Geometric Attention (GA) framework specifying attention layers through carrier, evidence-kernel rule, probe family, and anchor/update rule for regime-explicit operator semantics.

entry.title: Enhanced Diagnostic Performance via Large-Resolution Inference Optimization for Pathology Foundation Models

author.name: Mengxuan Hu, Zihan Guan, John Kang, Sheng Li, Zhongliang Zhou

entry.summary: Space and time efficient inference strategy for pathology foundation models on whole-slide images using spatially-aware attention sparsification and non-informative token filtering.

entry.title: Ontology-aligned structuring and reuse of multimodal materials data and workflows towards automatic reproduction

author.name: Sepideh Baghaee Ravari, Abril Azocar Guzman, Sarath Menon, Stefan Sandfeld, Tilmann Hickel, Markus Stricker

entry.summary: Introduces ontology-driven framework using LLMs for automated extraction of computational workflows from scientific literature, demonstrated on DFT-based stacking fault energy calculations.

entry.title: An Evolutionary Framework for Automatic Optimization Benchmark Generation via Large Language Models

author.name: Yuhiro Ono, Tomohiro Harada, Yukiya Miura

entry.summary: Proposes LLM-EBG framework using LLMs as evolutionary operators to automatically generate optimization benchmark problems that better reflect real-world problem diversity.

entry.title: Online Continual Learning for Time Series: a Natural Score-driven Approach

author.name: Edoardo Urettini, Daniele Atzeni, Ioanna-Yvonni Tsaknaki, Antonio Carta

entry.summary: Reframes neural network optimization as parameter filtering, showing natural gradient descent is a score-driven method, and proves online continual learning converges to an exponentially weighted moving average.

entry.title: Unsupervised Video Class-Incremental Learning via Deep Embedded Clustering Management

author.name: Nattapong Kurpukdee, Adrian G. Bors

entry.summary: Proposes deep embedded clustering management for unsupervised video class-incremental learning, progressively building clusters from video features without requiring labels or task boundaries.

entry.title: Domain-Adaptation through Synthetic Data: Fine-Tuning Large Language Models for German Law

author.name: Ali Hamza Bashir, Muhammad Rehan Khalid, Kostadin Cvejoski, Jana Birr, Jule Berghaus, Armin Berger, Sandra Halscheidt, Christian Temath, Rafet Sifa, David Berghaus

entry.summary: Presents synthetic data generation approach for adapting LLMs to German legal QA, producing high-quality question-answer pairs from authoritative statutes using automated filtering.

entry.title: jBOT: Semantic Jet Representation Clustering Emerges from Self-Distillation

author.name: Ho Fung Tsoi, Dylan Rankin

entry.summary: jBOT introduces self-distillation pre-training for jet data from CERN LHC, combining particle-level and jet-level distillation, showing emergent semantic class clustering in representation space.

entry.title: Beyond Softmax and Entropy: Improving Convergence Guarantees of Policy Gradients by f-SoftArgmax Parameterization with Coupled Regularization

author.name: Safwan Labbi, Daniil Tiapkin, Paul Mangold, Eric Moulines

entry.summary: Proposes f-SoftArgmax policy parameterization with coupled regularization as alternative to softmax for policy gradients. Shows improved convergence via Polyak-Lojasiewicz inequality satisfaction.

entry.title: RegCheck: A tool for automating comparisons between study registrations and papers

author.name: Jamie Cummins, Beth Clarke, Ian Hussey, Malte Elson

entry.summary: RegCheck is an LLM-assisted tool for comparing study registrations with final papers, helping verify research integrity across scientific disciplines.

entry.title: IMSAHLO: Integrating Multi-Scale Attention and Hybrid Loss Optimization Framework for Robust Neuronal Brain Cell Segmentation

author.name: Ujjwal Jain, Oshin Misra, Roshni Chakraborty, Mahua Bhattacharya

entry.summary: IMSAHLO framework for neuronal cell segmentation in fluorescence microscopy using Multi-Scale Dense Blocks and hybrid loss optimization to handle densely packed cells and class imbalance.

entry.title: Learning Language-Driven Sequence-Level Modal-Invariant Representations for Video-Based Visible-Infrared Person Re-Identification

author.name: Xiaomei Yang, Xizhan Gao, Antai Liu, Kang Wei, Fa Zhu, Guang Feng, Xiaofeng Qu, Sijie Niu

entry.summary: LSMRL uses CLIP language prompts to guide modal-invariant representation learning for video-based visible-infrared person re-identification with cross-modal interaction.

entry.title: Face-Voice Association with Inductive Bias for Maximum Class Separation

author.name: Marta Moscati, Oleksandr Kats, Mubashir Noman, Muhammad Zaigham Zaheer, Yufang Hou, Markus Schedl, Shah Nawaz

entry.summary: Develops face-voice association method imposing maximum class separation as inductive bias for multimodal speaker representations, adapting recent classification advances to cross-modal learning.

entry.title: Abstract Argumentation with Subargument Relations

author.name: Beishui Liao

entry.summary: Extends Dung's abstract argumentation framework with explicit subargument relations to capture structural dependencies from structured argumentation formalisms.

entry.title: Reasoning While Recommending: Entropy-Guided Latent Reasoning in Generative Re-ranking Models

author.name: Changshuo Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces EGLR, a recommendation model that combines reinforcement learning with a latent reasoning mechanism to adapt to dynamic entropy changes during list generation. The approach shows reduced entropy in model decision-making for re-ranking tasks.

entry.title: Remapping and navigation of an embedding space via error minimization: a fundamental organizational principle of cognition in natural and artificial systems

author.name: Benedikt Hartl, L\'eo Pio-Lopez, Chris Fields, Michael Levin

entry.summary: Proposes that cognition in natural and synthetic systems can be understood through embedding space remapping and navigation, connecting AI to biological systems through shared computational principles.

entry.title: Toward Youth-Centered Privacy-by-Design in Smart Devices: A Systematic Review

author.name: Molly Campbell, Mohamad Sheikho Al Jasem, Ajay Kumar Shrestha

entry.summary: Systematic review of privacy-by-design frameworks for AI-enabled smart devices targeting youth, analyzing 122 papers across technical, policy, and educational approaches.

entry.title: A Confidence-Variance Theory for Pseudo-Label Selection in Semi-Supervised Learning

author.name: Jinshi Liu, Pan Liu

entry.summary: Introduces a Confidence-Variance (CoVar) theory framework for pseudo-label selection in semi-supervised learning that combines maximum confidence with residual-class variance. Addresses the problem of overconfident deep networks discarding informative low-confidence samples near decision boundaries.

entry.title: Early Linguistic Pattern of Anxiety from Social Media Using Interpretable Linguistic Features: A Multi-Faceted Validation Study with Author-Disjoint Evaluation

author.name: Arnab Das Utsa

entry.summary: Presents transparent social media anxiety detection using interpretable linguistic features with rigorous evaluation including keyword masking, feature ablation, and author-disjoint splits.

entry.title: Robust Verification of Concurrent Stochastic Games

author.name: Angel Y. He, David Parker

entry.summary: Introduces robust concurrent stochastic games and interval CSGs capturing epistemic uncertainty about transition probabilities, with theoretical foundations and algorithms for robust verification.

entry.title: A Two-Stage Globally-Diverse Adversarial Attack for Vision-Language Pre-training Models

author.name: Wutao Chen, Huaqin Zou, Chen Wan, Lifeng Huang

entry.summary: 2S-GDA two-stage globally-diverse attack framework for vision-language pre-training models using textual perturbations via candidate expansion and visual perturbations via multi-scale resizing.

entry.title: The Expert Validation Framework (EVF): Enabling Domain Expert Control in AI Engineering

author.name: Lucas Gren, Felix Dobslaw

entry.summary: Expert Validation Framework places domain experts at center of GenAI system development with structured specification, testing, validation and monitoring processes.

entry.title: Adversarial Defense in Vision-Language Models: An Overview

author.name: Xiaowei Fu, Lei Zhang

entry.summary: Provides comprehensive overview of adversarial defense methods for Vision-Language Models including training-time defense, test-time adaptation, and training-free approaches. Analyzes tradeoffs in each paradigm.

entry.title: Harmonizing the Arabic Audio Space with Data Scheduling

author.name: Hunzalah Hassan Bhatti, Firoj Alam, Shammur Absar Chowdhury

entry.summary: First systematic study of multi-task instruction tuning for Arabic audio LLMs, introducing Task-Progressive Curriculum and Aligner-Based Diverse Sampling strategies. Also introduces AraMega-SSum dataset for Arabic speech summarization.

entry.title: Augmenting Question Answering with A Hybrid RAG Approach

author.name: Tianyi Yang, Nashrah Haque, Vaishnave Jonnalagadda, Yuya Jeremy Ong, Zhehui Chen, Yanzhao Wu, Lei Yu, Divyesh Jadav, Wenqi Wei

entry.summary: Introduces SSRAG (Structured-Semantic RAG), a hybrid architecture combining query augmentation, agentic routing, and vector-graph retrieval with context unification for improved QA accuracy.

entry.title: Cognition spaces: natural, artificial, and hybrid

author.name: Ricard Sol\'e, Luis F Seoane, Jordi Pla-Mauri, Michael Timothy Bennett, Michael E. Hochberg, Michael Levin

entry.summary: Proposes cognition space framework for comparing cognitive processes across natural, artificial, and hybrid systems using organizational and informational dimensions rather than substrate-dependent definitions.

entry.title: AdaNODEs: Test Time Adaptation for Time Series Forecasting Using Neural ODEs

author.name: Ting Dang, Soumyajit Chatterjee, Hong Jia, Yu Wu, Flora Salim, Fahim Kawsar

entry.summary: Presents AdaNODEs, a test-time adaptation method for time series forecasting using Neural ODEs with novel loss function for handling distribution shifts in temporal data.

entry.title: ArchAgent: Scalable Legacy Software Architecture Recovery with LLMs

author.name: Rusheng Pan, Bingcheng Mao, Tianyi Ma, Zhenhua Ling

entry.summary: Presents ArchAgent, a scalable agent-based framework combining static analysis, adaptive code segmentation, and LLM synthesis for recovering software architecture from large legacy codebases.

entry.title: Analysis of Long Range Dependency Understanding in State Space Models

author.name: Srividya Ravikumar, Abhinav Anand, Shweta Verma, Mira Mezini

entry.summary: Presents the first systematic kernel interpretability study of S4D state-space models on vulnerability detection. Shows S4D kernels can behave as different filter types depending on architecture, affecting long-range modeling.

entry.title: Incorporating Q&A Nuggets into Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Laura Dietz, Bryan Li, Gabrielle Liu, Jia-Huei Ju, Eugene Yang, Dawn Lawrie, William Walden, James Mayfield

entry.summary: Presents Crucible, a Nugget-Augmented Generation system for RAG that constructs Q&A nugget banks from documents while preserving citation provenance throughout generation.

entry.title: Reasoning with Pixel-level Precision: QVLM Architecture and SQuID Dataset for Quantitative Geospatial Analytics

author.name: Peter A. Massih, Eric Cosatto

entry.summary: Introduces SQuID benchmark (2,000 satellite image QA pairs) for quantitative spatial reasoning and proposes QVLM architecture addressing VLM limitations in pixel-level precision for counting and measurements.

entry.title: Quadratic Upper Bound for Boosting Robustness

author.name: Euijin You, Hyang-Won Lee

entry.summary: Develops quadratic upper bound (QUB) loss function for fast adversarial training, improving robustness through smoothed loss landscape. Shows significant improvements when applied to existing FAT methods.

entry.title: vLinear: A Powerful Linear Model for Multivariate Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Wenzhen Yue, Ruohao Guo, Ji Shi, Zihan Hao, Shiyu Hu, Xianghua Ying

entry.summary: vLinear introduces a lightweight linear-based multivariate time series forecaster with O(N) complexity using a learnable vector for multivariate correlations, achieving up to 5x inference speedups over attention-based methods.

entry.title: Asymmetric regularization mechanism for GAN training with Variational Inequalities

author.name: Spyridon C. Giagtzoglou, Mark H. M. Winands, Barbara Franci

entry.summary: Proposes an asymmetric regularization mechanism for GAN training based on Tikhonov regularization and zero-centered gradient penalty, achieving last-iterate linear convergence under smoothness conditions.

entry.title: DAME: Duration-Aware Matryoshka Embedding for Duration-Robust Speaker Verification

author.name: Youngmoon Jung, Joon-Young Yang, Ju-ho Kim, Jaeyoung Roh, Chang Woo Han, Hoon-Young Cho

entry.summary: DAME proposes Duration-Aware Matryoshka Embeddings for speaker verification that builds nested hierarchies of sub-embeddings aligned to utterance durations, addressing short-utterance challenges.

entry.title: Decoder-Free Supervoxel GNN for Accurate Brain-Tumor Localization in Multi-Modal MRI

author.name: Andrea Protani, Marc Molina Van Den Bosch, Lorenzo Giusti, Heloisa Barbosa Da Silva, Paolo Cacace, Albert Sund Aillet, Miguel Angel Gonzalez Ballester, Friedhelm Hummel, Luigi Serio

entry.summary: SVGFormer introduces a decoder-free pipeline for brain tumor localization using supervoxel graph neural networks, concentrating learnable parameters on feature encoding rather than spatial reconstruction.

entry.title: LLM Augmented Intervenable Multimodal Adaptor for Post-operative Complication Prediction in Lung Cancer Surgery

author.name: Shubham Pandey, Bhavin Jawade, Srirangaraj Setlur, Venu Govindaraju, Kenneth Seastedt

entry.summary: MIRACLE presents a multimodal architecture for predicting post-operative complications in lung cancer surgery by fusing clinical and radiological data with interventional interpretability.

entry.title: Human Values in a Single Sentence: Moral Presence, Hierarchies, and Transformer Ensembles on the Schwartz Continuum

author.name: V\'ictor Yeste, Paolo Rosso

entry.summary: Studies sentence-level detection of 19 Schwartz values in text, finding moral presence is learnable (F1≈0.74) and comparing hierarchical vs. direct multi-label approaches.

entry.title: Global Optimization By Gradient from Hierarchical Score-Matching Spaces

author.name: Ming Li

entry.summary: Claims to achieve global optimization via gradient using hierarchical score matching, unifying constrained optimization problems through score-based optimization.

entry.title: Task-tailored Pre-processing: Fair Downstream Supervised Learning

author.name: Jinwon Sohn, Guang Lin, Qifan Song

entry.summary: Studies task-tailored fair pre-processing that explicitly considers downstream supervised learning when constructing fairness-aware transformations of input data.

entry.title: Data-centric Prompt Tuning for Dynamic Graphs

author.name: Yufei Peng, Cheng Yang, Zhengjie Fan, Chuan Shi

entry.summary: Proposes data-centric prompt tuning for dynamic graphs that modifies graph structure rather than being coupled to specific model architectures.

entry.title: Federated Learning Under Temporal Drift -- Mitigating Catastrophic Forgetting via Experience Replay

author.name: Sahasra Kokkula, Daniel David, Aaditya Baruah

entry.summary: Demonstrates FedAvg suffers catastrophic forgetting under temporal drift (74% to 28% accuracy). Shows simple client-side experience replay with 50-sample buffer restores performance to 78-82%.

entry.title: Federated Joint Learning for Domain and Class Generalization

author.name: Haoran Xu, Jiaze Li, Jianzhong Ju, Zhenbo Luo

entry.summary: Proposes FedDCG for federated learning with CLIP that addresses both class and domain generalization through domain grouping strategy and aggregation of class-generalized networks.

entry.title: A Mixture of Experts Vision Transformer for High-Fidelity Surface Code Decoding

author.name: Hoang Viet Nguyen, Manh Hung Nguyen, Hoang Ta, Van Khu Vu, Yeow Meng Chee

entry.summary: Proposes mixture of experts vision transformer for quantum surface code decoding, achieving high-fidelity error correction with improved computational efficiency.

entry.title: Polychronous Wave Computing: Timing-Native Address Selection in Spiking Networks

author.name: Natalila G. Berloff

entry.summary: Introduces Polychronous Wave Computing (PWC), a timing-native address-selection primitive for neuromorphic computing that maps spike latencies directly to output routes without digitization. Uses programmable interferometer for parallel template correlation.

entry.title: The Tag is the Signal: URL-Agnostic Credibility Scoring for Messages on Telegram

author.name: Yipeng Wang, Huy Gia Han Vu, Mohit Singhal

entry.summary: Proposes TAG2CRED pipeline for credibility scoring of Telegram messages without relying on URLs. Uses tag-based approach covering themes, claims, and calls to action for short, URL-sparse posts.

entry.title: HiT: History-Injection Transformers for Onboard Continuous Flood Change Detection

author.name: Daniel Kyselica, Jon\'a\v{s} Herec, Oliver Kutis, Rado Pito\v{n}\'ak

entry.summary: Proposes History Injection mechanism (HiT) for Transformers enabling onboard satellite flood detection with 99% reduced memory storage while maintaining detection accuracy.

entry.title: Auditory Brain Passage Retrieval: Cross-Sensory EEG Training for Neural Information Retrieval

author.name: Niall McGuire, Yashar Moshfeghi

entry.summary: First systematic investigation of auditory EEG for Brain Passage Retrieval, enabling direct neural-to-passage retrieval for voice interfaces. Evaluates cross-sensory training combining visual and auditory EEG.

entry.title: Learning to Explain: Supervised Token Attribution from Transformer Attention Patterns

author.name: George Mihaila

entry.summary: Proposes supervised learning approach for token attribution from transformer attention patterns. Trains lightweight model to produce explanations matching human annotations.

entry.title: The Third VoicePrivacy Challenge: Preserving Emotional Expressiveness and Linguistic Content in Voice Anonymization

author.name: Natalia Tomashenko, Xiaoxiao Miao, Pierre Champion, Sarina Meyer, Michele Panariello, Xin Wang, Nicholas Evans, Emmanuel Vincent, Junichi Yamagishi, Massimiliano Todisco

entry.summary: Presents results from third VoicePrivacy Challenge on voice anonymization that preserves linguistic content and emotional state while concealing speaker identity. Describes 6 baselines and participant innovations.

entry.title: PEARL: Self-Evolving Assistant for Time Management with Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Bingxuan Li, Jeonghwan Kim, Cheng Qian, Xiusi Chen, Eitan Anzenberg, Niran Kundapur, Heng Ji

entry.summary: Introduces CalConflictBench, a benchmark for testing LLM agents on calendar conflict resolution tasks. The system uses RL to help agents learn user preferences progressively through sequential feedback. Practical application for productivity automation.

entry.title: Who Does This Name Remind You of? Nationality Prediction via Large Language Model Associative Memory

author.name: Keito Inoshita

entry.summary: LAMA framework uses LLM associative memory to predict nationality by recalling famous individuals with the same name rather than direct reasoning. Novel knowledge elicitation approach.

entry.title: Truth with a Twist: The Rhetoric of Persuasion in Professional vs. Community-Authored Fact-Checks

author.name: Olesya Razuvayevskaya, Kalina Bontcheva

entry.summary: First large-scale comparison of persuasion techniques in community-written (Community Notes) versus professionally-written fact-checks. Finds no evidence that community debunks rely more on subjective wording than professional fact-checks, challenging prior assumptions.

entry.title: Confident Learning for Object Detection under Model Constraints

author.name: Yingda Yu, Jiaqi Xuan, Shuhui Shi, Xuanyu Teng, Shuyang Xu, Guanchao Tong

entry.summary: Model-Driven Data Correction (MDDC) framework for agricultural weed detection that iteratively diagnoses and corrects data quality issues through automated error analysis and train-fix-retrain pipeline.
