entry.title: SupScene: Learning Overlap-Aware Global Descriptor for Unconstrained SfM

author.name: Xulei Shi, Maoyu Wang, Yuning Peng, Guanbo Wang, Xin Wang, Qi Chen, Pengjie Tao

entry.summary: SupScene learns global image descriptors for Structure-from-Motion focusing on geometric matchability rather than semantic similarity using subgraph-based training.

entry.title: ARMARecon: An ARMA Convolutional Filter based Graph Neural Network for Neurodegenerative Dementias Classification

author.name: VSS Tejaswi Abburi, Ananya Singhal, Saurabh J. Shigwan, Nitin Kumar

entry.summary: ARMARecon uses ARMA graph filtering with reconstruction objective for Alzheimer's and Frontotemporal Dementia classification from white-matter FA histograms.

entry.title: CurConMix+: A Unified Spatio-Temporal Framework for Hierarchical Surgical Workflow Understanding

author.name: Yongjun Jeon, Jongmin Shin, Kanggil Park, Seonmin Park, Soyoung Lim, Jung Yong Kim, Jinsoo Rhu, Jongman Kim, Gyu-Seong Choi, Namkee Oh, Kyu-Hwan Jung

entry.summary: Proposes CurConMix+ for surgical action triplet recognition, combining curriculum-guided contrastive learning with spatio-temporal modeling to understand fine-grained surgical behaviors for workflow analysis and skill assessment.

entry.title: DepthCropSeg++: Scaling a Crop Segmentation Foundation Model With Depth-Labeled Data

entry.summary: Presents DepthCropSeg++, a foundation model for crop segmentation that uses depth-labeled data to scale training, capable of segmenting different crop species in open field environments.

entry.title: XRefine: Attention-Guided Keypoint Match Refinement

author.name: Jan Fabian Schmid, Annika Hagemann

entry.summary: Introduces XRefine, a detector-agnostic approach for sub-pixel keypoint refinement using cross-attention that operates solely on image patches without relying on internal detector representations.

entry.title: GaussianTrimmer: Online Trimming Boundaries for 3DGS Segmentation

author.name: Liwei Liao, Ronggang Wang

entry.summary: Proposes GaussianTrimmer, an efficient plug-and-play post-processing method for trimming coarse boundaries in 3D Gaussian segmentation by generating virtual Gaussians near boundaries.

entry.title: Combating Noisy Labels through Fostering Self- and Neighbor-Consistency

author.name: Zeren Sun, Yazhou Yao, Tongliang Liu, Zechao Li, Fumin Shen, Jinhui Tang

entry.summary: Proposes Jo-SNC for learning with noisy labels using Jensen-Shannon divergence to measure sample cleanliness and fostering self- and neighbor-consistency to handle imbalanced noise and OOD noisy data.

entry.title: Cross-Scale Pretraining: Enhancing Self-Supervised Learning for Low-Resolution Satellite Imagery for Semantic Segmentation

author.name: John Waithaka, Gustave Bwirayesu, Moise Busogi

entry.summary: Proposes spatial affinity component for self-supervised learning that uses high-resolution satellite imagery to improve representation learning on mid-resolution imagery for downstream segmentation.

entry.title: Practical Insights into Semi-Supervised Object Detection Approaches

author.name: Chaoxin Wang, Bharaneeshwar Balasubramaniyam, Anurag Sangem, Nicolais Guevara, Doina Caragea

entry.summary: Comprehensive comparison of three state-of-the-art semi-supervised object detection approaches (MixPL, Semi-DETR, Consistent-Teacher) analyzing performance variation with labeled image count on COCO, VOC, and custom beetle datasets.

entry.title: Global stability of a Hebbian/anti-Hebbian network for principal subspace learning

author.name: David Lipshutz, Robert J. Lipshutz

entry.summary: Proves global stability of Hebbian/anti-Hebbian neural network dynamics for principal subspace analysis. Shows dynamics evolve in two phases when feedforward and recurrent weights evolve at same timescale.

entry.title: Learning Diverse Skills for Behavior Models with Mixture of Experts

author.name: Wangtian Shen, Jinming Ma, Mingliang Zhou, Ziyang Meng

entry.summary: Di-BM uses Mixture of Experts with energy-based models for observation distributions to learn diverse skills in multi-task imitation learning, addressing interference across tasks.

entry.title: PlannerRFT: Reinforcing Diffusion Planners through Closed-Loop and Sample-Efficient Fine-Tuning

author.name: Hongchen Li, Tianyu Li, Jiazhi Yang, Haochen Tian, Caojun Wang, Lei Shi, Mingyang Shang, Zengrong Lin, Gaoqiang Wu, Zhihui Hao, Xianpeng Lang, Jia Hu, Hongyang Li

entry.summary: PlannerRFT is sample-efficient reinforcement fine-tuning for diffusion planners in autonomous driving with dual-branch optimization for trajectory distribution and guided denoising.

entry.title: Listen, Look, Drive: Coupling Audio Instructions for User-aware VLA-based Autonomous Driving

author.name: Ziang Guo, Feng Yang, Xuefeng Zhang, Jiaqi Guo, Kun Zhao, Peng Lu, Zufeng Zhang, Sifa Zheng

entry.summary: EchoVLA augments VLA for autonomous driving with real-time audio instructions, allowing users to influence driving with specific intentions via speech commands.

entry.title: Lost in Aggregation: The Causal Interpretation of the IV Estimand

author.name: Danielle Tsao, Krikamol Muandet, Frederick Eberhardt, Emilija Perkovi\'c

entry.summary: Highlights problem of 'aggregate treatment variables' in instrumental variable estimation where treatment components have different effects. Shows causal effect interpretation is ambiguous.

entry.title: Evidence that would update me towards a software-only fast takeoff

author.name: Anders Woodruff

entry.summary: Analyzes what empirical evidence would shift beliefs about the likelihood of a 'software-only fast takeoff' scenario where AI self-improvement leads to rapid superintelligence. Discusses returns to R&D as the key variable and what observations would be informative.

entry.title: A Comparative Study of Technical Writing Feedback Quality: Evaluating LLMs, SLMs, and Humans in Computer Science Topics

author.name: Suqing Liu, Bogdan Simion, Christopher Eaton, Michael Liut

entry.summary: Compares feedback quality from LLMs, small language models, and humans on computer science technical writing across three courses, finding varying student preferences across dimensions.

entry.title: Bit-politeia: An AI Agent Community in Blockchain

author.name: Xing Yang

entry.summary: Proposes Bit-politeia, an AI agent community on blockchain for fair resource allocation, using clustered grouping with hierarchical architecture integrating democratic centralism.

entry.title: Wavelet-Driven Masked Multiscale Reconstruction for PPG Foundation Models

author.name: Megha Thukral, Cyrus Tanade, Simon A. Lee, Juhyeon Lee, Hao Zhou, Keum San Chun, Migyeong Gwak, Viswam Nathan, Md Mahbubur Rahman, Li Zhu, Mehrab Bin Morshed, Subramaniam Venkatraman, Sharanya Arcot Desai

entry.title: Unbounded Harms, Bounded Law: Liability in the Age of Borderless AI

author.name: Ha-Chi Tran

entry.summary: Analyzes legal and liability challenges for transboundary AI harms, arguing that such harms are structurally embedded in global supply chains with insufficient current governance mechanisms.

entry.title: AirHunt: Bridging VLM Semantics and Continuous Planning for Efficient Aerial Object Navigation

author.name: Xuecheng Chen, Zongzhuo Liu, Jianfa Ma, Bang Du, Tiantian Zhang, Xueqian Wang, Boyu Zhou

entry.summary: Presents AirHunt, an aerial object navigation system bridging VLM semantic reasoning with continuous motion planning for drones, addressing frequency mismatch and limited 3D understanding in outdoor environments.

entry.title: Membership Inference Test: Auditing Training Data in Object Classification Models

author.name: Gonzalo Mancera, Daniel DeAlcala, Aythami Morales, Ruben Tolosana, Julian Fierrez

entry.summary: Proposes and evaluates architectures for Membership Inference Tests (MINT) to determine if data was used in training object classification models, using convolutional layers for feature extraction.

entry.title: EEG-Titans: Long-Horizon Seizure Forecasting via Dual-Branch Attention and Neural Memory

author.name: Tien-Dat Pham, Xuan-The Tran

entry.summary: Proposes EEG-Titans for long-horizon seizure forecasting using dual-branch architecture with sliding-window attention and recurrent memory pathway for multi-scale temporal patterns.

entry.title: CTC-DID: CTC-Based Arabic dialect identification for streaming applications

author.name: Muhammad Umar Farooq, Oscar Saz

entry.summary: Proposes CTC-based approach for Arabic dialect identification that frames the task as limited-vocabulary ASR. Outperforms fine-tuned Whisper and ECAPA-TDNN on low-resource Arabic dialects.

entry.title: Pedagogical Alignment for Vision-Language-Action Models: A Comprehensive Framework for Data, Architecture, and Evaluation in Education

author.name: Unggi Lee, Jahyun Jeong, Sunyoung Shin, Haeun Park, Jeongsu Moon, Youngchang Song, Jaechang Shim, JaeHwan Lee, Yunju Noh, Seungwon Choi, Ahhyun Kim, TaeHyeon Kim, Kyungtae Joo, Taeyeong Kim, Gyeonggeon Lee

entry.title: Real-Time Multi-Modal Embedded Vision Framework for Object Detection Facial Emotion Recognition and Biometric Identification on Low-Power Edge Platforms

entry.title: CARLA-Round: A Multi-Factor Simulation Dataset for Roundabout Trajectory Prediction

author.name: Xiaotong Zhou, Zhenhui Yuan, Yi Han, Tianhua Xu, Laurence T. Yang

entry.summary: CARLA-Round simulation dataset for roundabout trajectory prediction with systematic variation of weather conditions and traffic density levels.

entry.title: Human Emotion Verification by Action Languages via Answer Set Programming

author.name: Andreas Br\"annstr\"om, Juan Carlos Nieves

entry.summary: C-MT action language built on ASP and transition systems to represent human mental state evolution in response to actions. Introduces 'forbids to cause' rule for controlling mental side-effects.

entry.title: Paper2Rebuttal: A Multi-Agent Framework for Transparent Author Response Assistance

author.name: Qianli Ma, Chang Guo, Zhiheng Tian, Siyu Wang, Jipeng Xiao, Yuanhao Yue, Zhipeng Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces RebuttalAgent, a multi-agent framework for generating academic rebuttals that decomposes reviewer feedback into atomic concerns and constructs evidence-centric responses with external search.

entry.title: Syllabic Agglutinative Tokenizations for Indonesian LLM: A Study from Gasing Literacy Learning System

author.name: H. Situngkir, A. B. Lumbantobing, Y. Surya

entry.summary: Presents syllable-based tokenization for Indonesian LLMs inspired by Gasing Literacy System, using syllable boundaries before BPE to create linguistically-aligned vocabulary.

entry.title: Learning Audio-Visual Embeddings with Inferred Latent Interaction Graphs

author.name: Donghuo Zeng, Hao Niu, Yanan Wang, Masato Taya

entry.summary: Framework for audio-visual embedding learning that uses soft-label predictions and inferred latent interactions to address false negatives from incidental co-occurrences in contrastive learning.

entry.title: Segment and Matte Anything in a Unified Model

author.name: Zezhong Fan, Xiaohan Li, Topojoy Biswas, Kaushiki Nag, Kannan Achan

entry.summary: Unified framework extending SAM for both segmentation and matting tasks, addressing gap between mask precision and real-world application requirements.

author.name: Lei Liu, Tengyuan Liu, Hongwei Zhao, Jiahui Huang, Ruibo Guo, Bin Li

entry.summary: TimeGMM uses Gaussian Mixture Models for probabilistic time series forecasting in single forward pass with novel GMM-adapted Reversible Instance Normalization.

entry.title: Topology-Aware Multiscale Mixture of Experts for Efficient Molecular Property Prediction

author.name: Long D. Nguyen, Kelin Xia, Binh P. Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes MI-MoE (Multiscale Interaction Mixture of Experts) for molecular property prediction that adapts interaction modeling across geometric regimes using distance-cutoff expert ensembles.

entry.title: ForeDiffusion: Foresight-Conditioned Diffusion Policy via Future View Construction for Robot Manipulation

author.name: Weize Xie, Yi Ding, Ying He, Leilei Wang, Binwen Bai, Zheyi Zhao, Chenyang Wang, F. Richard Yu

entry.summary: Proposes ForeDiffusion injecting predicted future view representations into diffusion policies for robot manipulation to address limitations of relying solely on short-term observations.

entry.title: A Semantic Decoupling-Based Two-Stage Rainy-Day Attack for Revealing Weather Robustness Deficiencies in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Chengyin Hu, Xiang Chen, Zhe Jia, Weiwen Shi, Fengyu Zhang, Jiujiang Guo, Yiwei Wei

entry.summary: Introduces first adversarial framework exploiting realistic rainy weather conditions to attack VLMs. Uses two-stage semantic decoupling to analyze rain-induced decision shifts.

entry.title: TREX: Tokenizer Regression for Optimal Data Mixture

author.name: Inho Won, Hangyeol Yoo, Minkyung Cho, Jungyeul Park, Hoyun Song, KyungTae Lim

entry.summary: Proposes TREX, a regression framework predicting optimal tokenizer training data mixtures. Trains proxy tokenizers to learn compression-mixture relationships for efficient mixture search.

entry.title: TractRLFusion: A GPT-Based Multi-Critic Policy Fusion Framework for Fiber Tractography

author.name: Ankita Joshi, Ashutosh Sharma, Anoushkrit Goel, Ranjeet Ranjan Jha, Chirag Ahuja, Arnav Bhavsar, Aditya Nigam

entry.summary: TractRLFusion presents a GPT-based policy fusion framework for brain fiber tractography that integrates multiple RL policies through a data-driven fusion strategy to improve white matter tract reconstruction.

entry.title: RL-BioAug: Label-Efficient Reinforcement Learning for Self-Supervised EEG Representation Learning

author.name: Cheol-Hui Lee, Hwa-Yeon Lee, Dong-Joo Kim

entry.summary: RL-BioAug proposes a reinforcement learning framework for learning optimal EEG augmentation policies using only 10% labeled data, addressing non-stationarity challenges in EEG self-supervised learning.

entry.title: MATE: Matryoshka Audio-Text Embeddings for Open-Vocabulary Keyword Spotting

author.name: Youngmoon Jung, Myunghun Jung, Joon-Young Yang, Yong-Hyeok Lee, Jaeyoung Roh, Hoon-Young Cho

entry.summary: MATE introduces Matryoshka Audio-Text Embeddings for open-vocabulary keyword spotting with PCA-guided prefix alignment, concentrating salient keyword cues in lower-dimensional prefixes.

entry.title: ConceptCaps -- a Distilled Concept Dataset for Interpretability in Music Models

author.name: Bruno Sienkiewicz, {\L}ukasz Neumann, Mateusz Modrzejewski

entry.summary: ConceptCaps introduces a 23k music-caption-audio triplet dataset with explicit 200-attribute taxonomy labels, using VAE for attribute co-occurrence and LLM for caption generation.

entry.title: Auxiliary-predicted Compress Memory Model(ApCM Model): A Neural Memory Storage Model Based on Invertible Compression and Learnable Prediction

author.name: Weinuo Ou

entry.summary: ApCM Model proposes a neural memory storage architecture for LLMs using invertible compression and learnable prediction to enable effective runtime memory mechanisms.

entry.title: Communication-Corruption Coupling and Verification in Cooperative Multi-Objective Bandits

author.name: Ming Shi

entry.summary: Studies cooperative multi-armed bandits with vector rewards under adversarial corruption, showing communication-corruption coupling where effective corruption ranges from Γ to NΓ depending on sharing strategy.

entry.title: Towards Robust Universal Perturbation Attacks: A Float-Coded, Penalty-Driven Evolutionary Approach

author.name: Shiqi Wang, Mahdi Khosravy, Neeraj Gupta, Olaf Witkowski

entry.title: Attention-Based Offline Reinforcement Learning and Clustering for Interpretable Sepsis Treatment

author.name: Punit Kumar, Vaibhav Saran, Divyesh Patel, Nitin Kulkarni, Alina Vereshchaka

entry.title: Spatiotemporal Wildfire Prediction and Reinforcement Learning for Helitack Suppression

entry.title: Persistent Sheaf Laplacian Analysis of Protein Stability and Solubility Changes upon Mutation

author.name: Yiming Ren, Junjie Wee, Xi Chen, Grace Qian, Guo-Wei Wei

entry.title: BiCoLoR: Communication-Efficient Optimization with Bidirectional Compression and Local Training

author.name: Laurent Condat, Artavazd Maranjyan, Peter Richt\'arik

entry.summary: Proposes BiCoLoR, first algorithm combining local training with bidirectional compression for federated learning, addressing both uplink and downlink communication costs.

entry.title: SSVD-O: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning with Structured SVD for Speech Recognition

entry.title: A Hybrid Protocol for Large-Scale Semantic Dataset Generation in Low-Resource Languages: The Turkish Semantic Relations Corpus

entry.title: Bridging Human Interpretation and Machine Representation: A Landscape of Qualitative Data Analysis in the LLM Era

author.name: Seymanur Akti, Alexander Waibel

entry.title: EmoLat: Text-driven Image Sentiment Transfer via Emotion Latent Space

entry.summary: Proposes LimAgents, a multi-agent framework for generating substantive research limitations by integrating OpenReview comments, author statements, and citing papers for broader context.

author.name: Ahmed Attia, Alham Fikri

author.name: Yuefeng Wang, ChangJae Lee

author.name: Mahmud S. Zango, Jianglin Lan

entry.summary: Reviews autonomous navigation algorithms and architectures for nano-scale UAVs under extreme SWaP constraints, covering Edge AI and neuromorphic approaches.

entry.title: A Hybrid Soft Haptic Display for Rendering Lump Stiffness in Remote Palpation

author.name: Pijuan Yu, Anzu Kawazoe, Alexis Urquhart, Thomas K. Ferris, M. Cynthia Hipwell, Rebecca F. Friesen

entry.summary: Hybrid soft haptic display with rigid platform and 4x4 pneumatic array for rendering hard lumps beneath soft tissue in remote palpation for telemedicine.

entry.title: Deterministic Dynamics of Sampling Processes in Score-Based Diffusion Models with Multiplicative Noise Conditioning

author.name: Doheon Kim

entry.summary: Analyzes why score-based diffusion with multiplicative noise conditioning works despite theoretical limitations on representing general score functions. Provides theoretical explanation.

entry.title: Pigment Network Detection and Classification in Dermoscopic Images Using Directional Imaging Algorithms and Convolutional Neural Networks

author.name: M. A. Rasel, Sameem Abdul Kareem, Unaizah Obaidellah

entry.summary: Proposes a directional imaging algorithm combined with CNNs for detecting and classifying pigment networks in dermoscopic images for melanoma diagnosis. Achieves 96-100% detection rate on PH2 dataset.

entry.title: Cascaded Transformer for Robust and Scalable SLA Decomposition via Amortized Optimization

author.name: Cyril Shih-Huan Hsu

entry.summary: Casformer uses cascaded Transformer architecture for optimization-free SLA decomposition in 6G network slicing, encoding domain feedback and integrating cross-domain dependencies.

entry.title: Big Data Workload Profiling for Energy-Aware Cloud Resource Management

author.name: Milan Parikh, Aniket Abhishek Soni, Sneja Mitinbhai Shah, Ayush Raj Jha

entry.summary: Workload-aware energy-efficient scheduling framework for cloud data centers using CPU, memory, and IO profiling for VM placement with SLA compliance.

entry.title: Bengali Text Classification: An Evaluation of Large Language Model Approaches

author.name: Md Mahmudul Hoque, Md Mehedi Hassain, Md Hojaifa Tanvir, Rahul Nandy

entry.summary: Evaluates LLaMA 3.1/3.2 and Qwen 2.5 on Bengali text classification using newspaper articles, with Qwen achieving highest 72% accuracy.

entry.title: Weaknesses of Facial Emotion Recognition Systems

author.name: Aleksandra Jamr\'oz, Patrycja Wysocka, Piotr Garbat

entry.summary: Reviews and compares neural network approaches for facial emotion recognition, revealing weaknesses including dataset dependency, unequal difficulty across emotions, and domain adaptation challenges.

entry.title: Diffusion-Driven Synthetic Tabular Data Generation for Enhanced DoS/DDoS Attack Classification

author.name: Aravind B, Anirud R. S., Sai Surya Teja N, Bala Subrahmanya Sriranga Navaneeth A, Karthika R, Mohankumar N

entry.summary: Uses TabDDPM diffusion models for synthetic data generation to address class imbalance in network intrusion detection. Achieves near-perfect recall on minority attack classes.

entry.title: A Learnable Wavelet Transformer for Long-Short Equity Trading and Risk-Adjusted Return Optimization

author.name: Shuozhe Li, Du Cheng, Leqi Liu

entry.summary: Proposes WaveLSFormer, a learnable wavelet-based long-short Transformer for intraday trading with multi-scale decomposition and frequency-guided attention mechanisms.

entry.title: Fusion Segment Transformer: Bi-Directional Attention Guided Fusion Network for AI-Generated Music Detection

author.name: Yumin Kim, Seonghyeon Go

entry.summary: Proposes Fusion Segment Transformer for full-audio AI-generated music detection with Gated Fusion Layer for combining diverse feature extractors and bi-directional attention.

entry.title: Performance and Complexity Trade-off Optimization of Speech Models During Training

author.name: Esteban G\'omez, Tom B\"ackstr\"om

entry.summary: Proposes methodology for optimizing speech model performance-complexity trade-off during training using differentiable complexity estimation.

entry.title: Graph Attention Networks with Physical Constraints for Anomaly Detection

author.name: Mohammadhossein Homaei, Iman Khazrak, Ruben Molano, Andres Caro, Mar Avila

entry.summary: Proposes hydraulic-aware graph attention network for water distribution system anomaly detection using normalized conservation law violations as features. Achieves F1=0.979 on BATADAL.

entry.title: Adaptive Rotary Steering with Joint Autoregression for Robust Extraction of Closely Moving Speakers in Dynamic Scenarios

author.name: Jakob Kienegger, Timo Gerkmann

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive rotary steering with joint autoregression for extracting closely moving speakers in Ambisonics recordings.

entry.title: Learning Deterministic Finite-State Machines from the Prefixes of a Single String is NP-Complete

author.name: Radu Cosmin Dumitru, Ryo Yoshinaka, Ayumi Shinohara

entry.summary: Proves NP-completeness of learning minimum DFA from prefixes of single string, with implications for Moore machine learning.

entry.title: Reorienting off-path Nudged Elastic Bands (RONEB) via Minimum Mode Following

author.name: Rohit Goswami (Institute IMX and Lab-COSMO, \'Ecole polytechnique f\'ed\'erale de Lausanne, Science Institute, University of Iceland, Reykjavik, Iceland), Miha Gunde (Science Institute, University of Iceland, Reykjavik, Iceland, Institute Ru{\dj}er Bo\v{s}kovi\'c, Bijeni\v{c}ka 54, 10000 Zagreb, Croatia), Hannes J\'onsson

entry.summary: Proposes RONEB hybrid algorithm combining nudged elastic band with minimum mode following for transition state determination in chemistry.

entry.title: PDFInspect: A Unified Feature Extraction Framework for Malicious Document Detection

author.name: Sharmila S P

entry.summary: Presents unified PDF feature extraction framework combining graph-based, structural, and metadata analysis for malicious document detection.

entry.title: Approximate full conformal prediction in RKHS

author.name: Davidson Lova Razafindrakoto, Alain Celisse, J\'er\^ome Lacaille

entry.summary: Develops a computationally efficient approximation to full conformal prediction for kernel methods in RKHS. Provides theoretical quantification of approximation tightness.

entry.title: Classifiers in High Dimensional Hilbert Metrics

author.name: Aditya Acharya, Auguste H. Gezalyan, David M. Mount

entry.summary: Addresses classification in high-dimensional Hilbert polygonal metric spaces with efficient LP-based SVM algorithm. Improves on previous exponential-time methods.

entry.title: Refined Gradient-Based Temperature Optimization for the Replica-Exchange Monte-Carlo Method

author.name: Tatsuya Miyata, Shunta Arai, Satoshi Takabe

entry.summary: Proposes refined gradient-based temperature optimization for replica-exchange Monte Carlo using reparameterization to enforce physical constraints like monotonic inverse temperatures.

entry.title: Variational Dual-path Attention Network for CSI-Based Gesture Recognition

author.name: N. Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes VDAN (Variational Dual-path Attention Network) for WiFi CSI-based gesture recognition. Uses variational inference for attention weights to handle noise robustness.

entry.title: Discriminant Learning-based Colorspace for Blade Segmentation

author.name: Ra\"ul P\'erez-Gonzalo, Andreas Espersen, Antonio Agudo

entry.summary: Develops CSDA (Colorspace Discriminant Analysis) extending LDA into deep learning for improved image segmentation preprocessing through learned discriminative colorspaces.

entry.title: Rig-Aware 3D Reconstruction of Vehicle Undercarriages using Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Nitin Kulkarni, Akhil Devarashetti, Charlie Cluss, Livio Forte, Dan Buckmaster, Philip Schneider, Chunming Qiao, Alina Vereshchaka

entry.summary: Develops end-to-end pipeline using three-camera rig and rig-aware Structure-from-Motion for 3D reconstruction of vehicle undercarriages using Gaussian splatting.

entry.title: Analyzing Cancer Patients' Experiences with Embedding-based Topic Modeling and LLMs

author.name: Teodor-C\u{a}lin Ionescu, Lifeng Han, Jan Heijdra Suasnabar, Anne Stiggelbout, Suzan Verberne

entry.summary: Applies BERTopic, Top2Vec, and GPT-4 for topic modeling on cancer patient interview transcripts to uncover healthcare-relevant themes. Small-scale study with human evaluation.

entry.title: Effects of the retina-inspired light intensity encoding on color discrimination performance

author.name: Io Yamada, Hirotsugu Okuno

entry.summary: Investigates how Naka-Rushton function (retinal photoreceptor model) versus logarithmic encoding affects color constancy in center/surround retinex models.

entry.title: Fusion-Restoration Image Processing Algorithm to Improve the High-Temperature Deformation Measurement

author.name: Banglei Guan, Dongcai Tan, Jing Tao, Ang Su, Yang Shang, Qifeng Yu

entry.summary: Proposes fusion-restoration image processing methods to suppress thermal radiation and heat haze effects for improved high-temperature deformation measurement using DIC.

entry.title: A Comprehensive Review of Bio-Inspired Approaches to Coordination, Communication, and System Architecture in Underwater Swarm Robotics

author.name: Shyalan Ramesh, Scott Mann, Alex Stumpf

entry.summary: Comprehensive review synthesizing bio-inspired coordination mechanisms, communication strategies, and hardware designs for underwater swarm robotics. Identifies integration gaps across algorithmic and hardware perspectives.

entry.title: R-VoxelMap: Accurate Voxel Mapping with Recursive Plane Fitting for Online LiDAR Odometry

author.name: Haobo Xi, Shiyong Zhang, Qianli Dong, Yunze Tong, Songyang Wu, Jing Yuan, Xuebo Zhang

entry.summary: R-VoxelMap uses geometry-driven recursive plane fitting with RANSAC-based outlier detection for accurate voxel mapping in LiDAR odometry, addressing plane deviation and segmentation issues.

entry.title: Imitation learning-based spacecraft rendezvous and docking method with Expert Demonstration

author.name: Shibo Shao, Dong Zhou, Guanghui Sun, Liwen Zhang, Mingxuan Jiang

entry.summary: Imitation learning framework for spacecraft rendezvous and docking with anchored decoder mechanism for physically consistent control evolution in sequential prediction.

entry.title: The OncoReach Stylet for Brachytherapy: Design Evaluation and Pilot Study

author.name: Pejman Kheradmand, Kent K. Yamamoto, Emma Webster, Keith Sowards, Gianna Hatheway, Katharine L. Jackson, Sabino Zani Jr., Julie A. Raffi, Diandra N. Ayala-Peacock, Scott R. Silva, Joanna Deaton Bertram, Yash Chitalia

entry.summary: OncoReach steerable stylet for brachytherapy compatible with standard needles, with design evaluation including asymmetric disk design for cervical cancer treatment.

entry.title: SUNSET -- A Sensor-fUsioN based semantic SegmEnTation exemplar for ROS-based self-adaptation

author.name: Andreas Wiedholz, Rafael Paintner, Julian Glei{\ss}ner, Alwin Hoffmann, Tobias Huber

entry.summary: SUNSET is ROS2 exemplar for evaluating self-adaptive robotics with ML-based sensor fusion pipeline that can be perturbed for testing adaptation under uncertainty.

entry.title: GuideTouch: An Obstacle Avoidance Device for Visually Impaired

author.name: Timofei Kozlov, Artem Trandofilov, Georgii Gazaryan, Issatay Tokmurziyev, Miguel Altamirano Cabrera, Dzmitry Tsetserukou

entry.summary: GuideTouch is wearable obstacle avoidance device for visually impaired using dual ToF sensors and 4-point vibrotactile feedback for head-level obstacles.

entry.title: Learning-Augmented Online TRP on a Line

author.name: Swapnil Guragain, Gokarna Sharma

entry.summary: Studies online traveling repairperson problem on a line with learning-augmented framework providing predicted positions via ML.

entry.title: Knowledge-Integrated Representation Learning for Crypto Anomaly Detection under Extreme Label Scarcity; Relational Domain-Logic Integration with Retrieval-Grounded Context and Path-Level Explanations

author.name: Gyuyeon Na, Minjung Park, Soyoun Kim, Jungbin Shin, Sangmi Chai

entry.summary: Proposes RDLI framework embedding expert-derived heuristics as differentiable logic-aware signals for crypto money laundering detection under extreme label scarcity.

entry.title: Paid Voices vs. Public Feeds: Interpretable Cross-Platform Theme Modeling of Climate Discourse

author.name: Samantha Sudhoff, Pranav Perumal, Zhaoqing Wu, Tunazzina Islam

entry.summary: Comparative analysis of climate discourse across Meta paid advertisements and Bluesky public posts using interpretable theme modeling. Distinguishes institutional messaging from organic public expression.

entry.title: A Unified Variational Imputation Framework for Electric Vehicle Charging Data Using Retrieval-Augmented Language Model

author.name: Jinhao Li, Hao Wang

entry.summary: Proposes PRAIM, a language model-based framework for EV charging data imputation using retrieval-augmented memory and probabilistic variational approach.

entry.title: Fairness-informed Pareto Optimization : An Efficient Bilevel Framework

author.name: Sofiane Tanji, Samuel Vaiter, Yassine Laguel

entry.summary: Proposes BADR framework for Pareto-efficient fair ML through bilevel adaptive rescalarization, recovering optimal models for any fairness metric.

entry.title: Distribution-Free Confidence Ellipsoids for Ridge Regression with PAC Bounds

author.name: Szabolcs Szentp\'eteri, Bal\'azs Csan\'ad Cs\'aji

entry.summary: Develops distribution-free confidence ellipsoids for ridge regression using Sign-Perturbed Sums method. Provides PAC bounds under symmetric noise assumption.

entry.title: Overview of the SciHigh Track at FIRE 2025: Research Highlight Generation from Scientific Papers

author.name: Tohida Rehman, Debarshi Kumar Sanyal, Samiran Chattopadhyay

entry.summary: Overview of SciHigh shared task at FIRE 2025 for generating research highlights from scientific abstracts, with 12 participating teams.

entry.title: AI for Green Spaces: Leveraging Autonomous Navigation and Computer Vision for Park Litter Removal

author.name: Christopher Kao, Akhil Pathapati, James Davis

entry.summary: Robot system for autonomous park litter collection using spanning tree coverage navigation, RTK GPS, and ResNet50-based trash detection achieving 94.52% accuracy.

entry.title: Hybrid IDS Using Signature-Based and Anomaly-Based Detection

author.name: Messaouda Boutassetta, Amina Makhlouf, Newfel Messaoudi, Abdelmadjid Benmachiche, Ines Boutabia

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of hybrid intrusion detection systems integrating signature-based and anomaly-based detection, classifying models and discussing advantages and limitations.

entry.title: Time-Continuous Modeling for Temporal Affective Pattern Recognition in LLMs

author.name: Rezky Kam, Coddy N. Siswanto

entry.summary: Introduces a dataset and framework for LLMs to model emotional dynamics using physics-informed neural networks for time-continuous affective pattern recognition.

entry.title: Bi-Attention HateXplain : Taking into account the sequential aspect of data during explainability in a multi-task context

author.name: Ghislain Dorian Tchuente Mondjo

entry.summary: Proposes Bi-Attention HateXplain to address attention variability in hate speech detection models by incorporating sequential data aspects into multi-task explainability. The work builds on the HateXplain benchmark but makes incremental improvements.

entry.title: Eddy-Resolving Global Ocean Forecasting with Multi-Scale Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Yuta Hirabayashi, Daisuke Matusoka, Konobu Kimura

entry.summary: Proposes multi-scale graph neural network for 10-day global eddy-resolving ocean forecasting, capturing multi-scale variability using two spherical meshes with different resolutions.

entry.title: Penalizing Localized Dirichlet Energies in Low Rank Tensor Products

author.name: Paris A. Karakasis, Nicholas D. Sidiropoulos

entry.summary: Studies tensor-product B-spline models for regression with local Dirichlet energy regularization, comparing favorably to neural networks on inference tasks.

author.name: Richard Hartley

entry.summary: Develops physics-informed RBFNN for Black-Scholes PDE with adaptive hidden neuron placement based on PDE residuals.

entry.title: Supervised Learning for the (s,S) Inventory Model with General Interarrival Demands and General Lead Times

author.name: Eliran Sherzer, Yonit Barron

entry.summary: Proposes neural network for approximating performance measures of (s,S) inventory systems with general distributions, trained on simulation data.

entry.title: An efficient heuristic for geometric analysis of cell deformations

author.name: Yaima Paz Soto, Silena Herold Garcia, Ximo Gual-Arnau, Antoni Jaume-i-Cap\'o, Manuel Gonz\'alez-Hidalgo

entry.summary: Proposes efficient heuristic for erythrocyte classification in sickle cell disease using shape space modeling and elastic distances.

entry.title: User-to-Vehicle Interaction in Smart Mobility: The GO-DRiVeS Autonomous Ride-Sharing Application

author.name: Hana E. Elmalah, Catherine M. Elias

entry.summary: GO-DRiVeS is on-demand ride-sharing application for university students using React Native and Node.js with MongoDB backend.

entry.title: What Trace Powers Reveal About Log-Determinants: Closed-Form Estimators, Certificates, and Failure Modes

author.name: Piyush Sao

entry.summary: Studies log-determinant estimation from trace powers using moment-generating function approach, deriving conditions and failure modes for classical approximations.

entry.title: StoTAM: Stochastic Alternating Minimization for Tucker-Structured Tensor Sensing

author.name: Shuang Li

entry.summary: Proposes StoTAM for stochastic tensor sensing with Tucker structure, avoiding expensive tensor projections through alternating minimization on factor matrices.

entry.title: BladeSDF : Unconditional and Conditional Generative Modeling of Representative Blade Geometries Using Signed Distance Functions

author.name: Ashish S. Nair, Sandipp Krishnan Ravi, Itzel Salgado, Changjie Sun, Sayan Ghosh, Liping Wang

entry.summary: Proposes BladeSDF using DeepSDF for turbine blade geometry generation and reconstruction with interpretable latent space aligned to blade parameters.

entry.title: LAViG-FLOW: Latent Autoregressive Video Generation for Fluid Flow Simulations

author.name: Vittoria De Pellegrini, Tariq Alkhalifah

entry.summary: Proposes LAViG-FLOW, latent autoregressive video diffusion for subsurface fluid flow simulation (CO2 sequestration, geothermal) using Video Diffusion Transformer.

entry.title: Enhancing Generalization in Sickle Cell Disease Diagnosis through Ensemble Methods and Feature Importance Analysis

author.name: Nata\v{s}a Petrovi\'c, Gabriel Moy\`a-Alcover, Antoni Jaume-i-Cap\'o, Jose Maria Buades Rubio

entry.summary: Proposes ensemble methods with feature importance analysis for sickle cell disease diagnosis focused on generalization.

entry.title: PAtt: A Pattern Attention Network for ETA Prediction Using Historical Speed Profiles

author.name: ByeoungDo Kim, JunYeop Na, Kyungwook Tak, JunTae Kim, DongHyeon Kim, Duckky Kim

entry.summary: Proposes PAtt using attention over historical speed patterns for ETA prediction, avoiding complex rule-based computations.

entry.title: Inverting Self-Organizing Maps: A Unified Activation-Based Framework

author.name: Alessandro Londei, Matteo Benati, Denise Lanzieri, Vittorio Loreto

entry.summary: Shows SOM activation patterns can be inverted to recover exact input under geometric conditions. Proposes MUSIC update rule based on this mechanism.

entry.title: There may be low hanging fruit for a weak nootropic

author.name: Dom Polsinelli

entry.summary: Discusses how elevated indoor CO2 levels compared to pre-industrial baselines might cause subtle cognitive impairment, reviewing conflicting academic studies on the topic. Explores potential for cognitive enhancement through CO2 reduction.

entry.title: ACX Atlanta February Meetup

author.name: Steve French

entry.summary: Meetup announcement for ACX Atlanta at Bold Monk Brewing with discussion of rationalism and Hamming Circles.

entry.title: Why I Transitioned: A Response

author.name: marisa

entry.summary: A personal response post discussing transgender identity, arguing for biological bases of trans identity through twin studies and offering a counterexample to another author's theory. Contains personal narrative and social commentary.

entry.title: Free New Year's Workshop — Elemental Lenses for 2026

author.name: teebarnett

entry.summary: An invitation to a free workshop using elemental imagery (earth, air, fire, water) for personal retrospective and planning exercises. This is a community event focused on introspective practice rather than technical content.

entry.title: Appendix: Contra Fiora on Contra

author.name: marisa

entry.summary: An appendix post continuing discussion about transgender identity and social dynamics in trans communities. Discusses social pressures and community norms.

entry.title: Research Summary: January 20, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research concentrates heavily on alignment techniques and safety evaluation. A survey on alignment pretraining synthesizes evidence that training LLMs on data depicting well-behaved AI during pretraining substantially reduces misalignment—potentially offering a scalable, proactive safety approach.

  • Coup probes testing demonstrates few-shot linear classifiers can detect scheming behavior from model activations, with empirical results on off-policy training data
  • Silent Agreement Evaluation provides first empirical measurement of Schelling coordination in LLMs—whether isolated instances converge on shared choices without communication
  • Framework for AI-delegated safety research identifies key dimensions: epistemic cursedness, parallelizability, and short-horizon suitability
  • Strategic analysis examines whether LLM alignment work transfers to non-LLM takeover-capable systems

Methodological contributions include a critique of METR-HRS timelines forecasting, arguing the 'd' parameter conflates task difficulty with sequence length. Governance-oriented work sketches positive AI transition scenarios co-authored with Claude Opus 4.5.

entry.title: Pretraining on Aligned AI Data Dramatically Reduces Misalignment—Even After Post-Training

author.name: RogerDearnaley

entry.summary: Survey of 'alignment pretraining' research showing that training LLMs on data depicting AI behaving well during pretraining dramatically reduces misalignment, and this persists through post-training. Claims major labs are now interested in this approach.

entry.title: Testing few-shot coup probes

author.name: Joey Marcellino

entry.summary: Implements and tests linear classifiers (coup probes) trained on AI activations to detect scheming behavior. Tests whether off-policy training data can bootstrap detection that improves with real examples. First empirical test of this proposed technique.

entry.title: Silent Agreement Evaluation

author.name: Graeme Ford

entry.summary: First empirical study measuring Schelling coordination in LLMs - whether two model instances independently choose the same option without communication. Frontier models failed at chance without reasoning; thinking models succeeded on word comparisons.

entry.title: Desiderata of good problems to hand off to AIs

author.name: Jozdien

entry.summary: Framework identifying key dimensions for which AI safety problems to delegate to AI systems: epistemic cursedness, parallelizability, short-horizon sub-problems, speed of ASI alignment progress, and legibility to labs.

entry.title: Could LLM alignment research reduce x-risk if the first takeover-capable AI is not an LLM?

author.name: Tim Hua

entry.summary: Analyzes whether LLM alignment research transfers to non-LLM AIs via two mechanisms: direct transfer (reusing evaluations, model organisms) and indirect transfer (using aligned LLMs to oversee non-LLMs). Argues surprisingly much research may transfer directly.

entry.title: AGI both does and doesn't have an infinite time horizon

author.name: Sean Herrington

entry.summary: Critiques AI timelines forecasting by arguing that METR-HRS tasks conflate difficulty with sequence length. The key parameter 'd' in forecasting models depends on whether intelligence or consistency is the bottleneck, dramatically changing extrapolations.

entry.title: Gradual Paths to Collective Flourishing

author.name: Nora_Ammann

entry.summary: Positive scenario for AI transition co-written with Claude, identifying failure modes (unilateral domination, competitive erosion) and sketching a path through gradual takeoff and multipolarity toward collective flourishing.

entry.title: Everybody Wants to Rule the Future - Is Longtermism's Mandate of Heaven by Arithmetic Justified?

author.name: E.G. Blee-Goldman

entry.summary: A philosophical critique arguing that even if we solved computational intractability in longtermist expected value calculations, we still couldn't make definitive decisions. Extends Kinney's 2022 work on why longtermist effective altruism may not be action-guiding.

entry.title: Five Theses on AI Art

author.name: jenn

entry.summary: Essay comparing AI art skepticism to Virginia Woolf's 1926 skepticism about cinema, arguing new mediums initially appear parasitic but develop unique capabilities. Defends AI art's potential through historical analogy.

entry.title: All (Non-Trivial) Decisions Are Undecidable

author.name: (M)ason

entry.summary: Argues that finding optimal decision-making algorithms is undecidable by invoking the halting problem, claiming any such algorithm must encode an ideal halting point which cannot be determined.

entry.title: "Lemurian Time War" by Ccru

author.name: Nathan Delisle

entry.summary: Discussion of Nick Land and the Cybernetic Cultural Research Unit, drawing parallels between their 'hyperstition' concept and LessWrong/Rationalist thinking as responses to similar cultural conditions.

entry.title: What can Kickstarter teach us about goal completion?

author.name: Elijah

entry.summary: Analysis of Kickstarter video game project completion rates, finding previous estimates of ~9% failure rate were methodologically flawed. Provides new data from 2014 and 2022 projects.

entry.title: The Example

author.name: Valerii

entry.summary: Philosophical reflection on why mathematics effectively predicts reality, exploring the 'unreasonable effectiveness' problem through the lens of predictive models and their structural properties.

entry.title: Medical Roundup #6

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Medical news roundup covering the finding that autism prevalence hasn't actually increased (only diagnosis rates), plus GLP-1 updates, FDA criticism, and various health topics.

entry.title: How to think about enemies: the example of Greenpeace

author.name: PranavG

entry.summary: Strategic thinking piece about how to conceptualize and respond to adversarial groups, using Greenpeace as case study. Argues 'nice smart people' fail by refusing to perceive enemies as enemies.

entry.title: @Lastbastionofsobriety & The Singularity

author.name: AdamLacerdo

entry.summary: Satirical fiction presenting a pessimistic blogger dismissing Singularity predictions based on energy constraints, later proven wrong by events. Commentary on technological skepticism.
